Liara speed-walked out of the bathroom to tug on her workout clothes, now starting to stretch uncomfortably across her once again ballooning form. Scenarios all played out in her head, but there was really only one conclusion that Liara could reach based on what had happened the last few days.

Miranda was fattening her up.

How or why, she really had no clue. At first Liara assumed that it was karmic revenge and Miranda figured out what happened and wanted revenge, and she would have probably guessed that earlier if her being over the top nice didn't throw her off. If Miranda was secretly getting revenge, she would never have made it so obvious, what with the sudden attitude change and the workout changes Not to mention those damn milkshakes she gave them after jogs, Liara thought, unwilling to admit she may have had a craving for one right about now.

All of that just begged the question; what the hell was Liara going to do about it?

Maybe the answer would come at breakfast time...
112113221222112211.title: Miranda Maximizes her Mates

choices: Getting to the cruise proves difficult given the girl's increasing figures.
They arrive early and Miranda slips off alone to 'fix' the air filtration system
1121132212221122113.content:
Liara shoved herself into a pair of shorts, the spandex having to be hauled up her thighs.

She'd bought them a few weeks ago in expectation of continuous weight loss, after having dropped a hundred and fifty pounds like nothing. The Asari's cheek bones had been visible again, she'd been down to two chins and her waistline had almost existed, no longer fused with her bean bag hips and sausage casing thighs. She'd still been pear shaped but it had been a manageable pear and she'd been in damn good shape, hard, strong muscles having grown in under her fat. In terms of weights she'd never been stronger and if the extra fat layers hadn't been slowing her down, Miranda's training would have made her faster than ever. At last under two hundred pounds, the chubby chasing biotic had been on schedule for getting her old body back within the year.

But as the biotic alien squeezed the shorts up her meaty legs, she didn't feel any muscle at all. Instead, the legs felt lardy, stiff and weak, her flexibility seriously hampered by withered muscle. A pinch on her thighs confirmed it, they'd gone thick powerlifter thighs to those of a couch potato again.

'I'm out of shape again...how?' Liara asked, beginning to walk down stairs and feeling her thighs slap again.

She'd been running...had she? Thinking back, Miranda had blown the whistle earlier and earlier every work out session for the last few days, telling them they were doing it faster and faster. At the time it had seemed that way, the effort seemed the same but now Liara realized she'd been expending the same amount of energy to do less work than before...

It wasn't just that Miranda was fattening her up, successfully, she was doing it faster than possible. Had she found some sort of better drug than Liara had? And what would the Asari do about it? She'd wanted Shepard the size of a house of course, but after the wake up call that she was the fattest asari ever she'd been planning on staying thin her self to take care of her helpless hero lover. All that hard won muscle ton was gone and all those months of gym sessions wasted, she was almost back at square one in terms of physical form although she wasn't as fat...yet.

Liara went down the stairs, remembering the time when they'd been dangerous to traverse and knowing that could come again. She prepared to say something but stopped dead once she got to the kitchen, eyes wide.

Shepard stood naked in the kitchen, six feet of tree trunk thighs, poofy fat rolls and crinkly cellulite ass.Liara's lover had been a beefy, strong three hundred pounds, looking dangerous and tough again but now she was back to being a cream puff with the evaporation of her reclaimed muscle and the regain of at least forty soft pounds. Hearing LIara she turned around, revealing herself to be not naked but wearing a miniscule string bikini her soft body was swallowing, her now sagging breasts pouring out of it.

'Hey blue! Guess what, we're going on vacation!' the replumpening Shepard smiled, showing a chin that had vanished three months ago was back.

'We...we are?' Liara asked, IQ dropping twenty points every second she stared at those soft curves.

'Oh yeah, on an interplanetary cruise liner,' Miranda smiled, the near six hundred pound operative waddling up in a slingshot bikini that a tidal wave of lard poured out of.

She was already sweating from the short waddle, breathing hard through her mouth. Although the age lines had corrected as her overwhelmed nanites decided to focus just on that flaw, she was gaining weight at a lunatic pace still and in horrific shape. Immobility was in her future, she'd gotten so fat she couldn't drive the hover car anymore and now sat in the back. Hell, she'd gotten so fat she'd gotten significantly shorter, dropping from 5'11 to 5'9 due to the pressure on her joints.

Every waddling step of the insanely obese spy's thighs had to fight against a drooping apron of her gut and her head sized hooters looked ready to hit her in the face they bounced so much.

'A cruise? Don't...don't people gain weight on those?' Liara tried asking.

'Oh not this cruise,' Miranda smiled, the obese spy looking like a cat that had fallen into cream, 'this is for the best of the best, the sexiest models and female athletes on the world, with top of the line spas and work out equipment. Why don't you try out this swimsuit I ordered you, just to see how it fits? Shepard, you two should go...show each other a good time while I get breakfast made.'

As the two heavy lovers lumbered off, Miranda took a drink of the hyper addictive weight gain/appetite stimulant/muscle relaxant shake she'd invented and flipped through the brochure, looking at all of the painfully thin models and athletes who'd be there: the terra firma twins, the famous Justicar Samara, so many others....

And she'd save all of them thanks to what she had cooked up...
1121132212221122113.title: Liara arrives at breakfast and finds Miranda tu...

choices: Tali remains unbroken. More for Liara and her lover, at least.
Tali falls to temptation! Someone's gonna need a new suit.
Tali finishes the system in three months...what's the damage?
112113221223.content:
"Shepard, Liara! I got your message and I...got...h-h..."

CLUNK

Liara stopped chewing her cookie long enough to watch the heavy toolkit the Quarian was carrying fall to the ground. A Geth immediately scurried up and picked it up, offering her the handle again.

"You dropped this, Admiral," the Geth stated helpfully.

"Y-yes...thank you..." Tali said, quivering slightly.

"Tali! It's good to see you again!" Shepard said happily, straining as she got to her feet and lumbered over, her every step shaking the floor. "You look great!" Tali looked ready to run, but before she could move Eileen had pulled her into her mountainous flab and wrapped her meaty arms around her to give a mighty bear hug. Whimpering slightly, Tali glanced at Liara, who guiltily scarfed down a cookie. She could only see the Quarian's eyes through that glass dome, but she could glean that the Quarian wasn't pleased with this situation.

"Y-you....too...Shepard..." Tali said weakly as she broke away from the blob of a woman who just tried to smother her.

"We just HAVE to catch up Tali!" Shepard insisted. "Liara stocked the kitchen full of Dextro foods last night, so you can stay for dinner!"

"Yes...very nice," Tali went on, trying to sound delicate. "Mmm...Liara...kitchen?" Without waiting for an answer, Tali turned on her heel and strutted out of the room, leaving both obese ladies and the Geth holding the toolbox confused.

"I will wait outside," the Geth declared, walking back out the door.

"I'll...go get dinner started," Liara said.

"And I'll polish off these cookies!" Shepard declared, licking her plump lips and returning to her massive sofa seating. Liara gave her lover a pat on the thick shoulder before waddling into the kitchen, where Tali was pacing back and forth anxiously, muttering in rapid-fire Quarian.

"So...how's the fleet?" Liara asked sheepishly. Tali stared blankly, looked like she was about to say something, but just ended up gesticulating wildly for a moment before continuing her pacing and mumbling. "I...take it you're a little shocked at...well," Liara suggested, lifting up her belly roll and letting it flop down. "This."

"Oh, is THAT it?" Tali said, sounding quite manic. "Keelah, who would have thought she would be stunned to see her friends are the size of tilgraps? That's perfectly normal!"

"I told you we....uh...put on a few," Liara tried to explain rather pathetically.

"A FEW?" Tali shouted, making Liara worry that Shepard would here. "A FEW? Do the Asari have different numbers then we do? A FEW?"

"Okay fine I downplayed things!" the blubbery Asari said soothingly. "But you don't need to worry, we're both happy like this."

"But Eileen...look at her! She's....aaagh!" Tali ran over to the fridge and smacked her helmet against it, producing the ting of glass ringing.

"Come on Tali, we both saw everything she went through to defeat the Reapers," Liara said soothingly, placing a fat hand on her friend's shoulder. "After everything she did, isn't it fair that she gets to keep this little bit of happiness?" Liara hadn't lost her Shadow Broker charisma as she gained pound after pound, and while threats were more her style, she could weave calming words almost as well. The Quarian took a deep breath, possibly remembering how Eileen had helped to reunite the Geth and the Quarians in peace, and at last relented.

"I...guess so..."

"Then you'll help?" Liara asked eagerly.

"Yes...but the scope of the project is going to have to change." Tali said, straightening herself out. "When I said I'd help install this automated system, I wasn't aware that you two were barely mobile."

"Er, yeah, I should have mentioned that, shouldn't I..."

"Yes you should have," Tali said flatly, bringing up her omni-tool. "In any case, I think I can get this monster set up in...a month's time if I hurry up. That way you can do all the cooking, cleaning, and whatever else you need to do without even leaving your chair."

"Oh, you don't need to rush, Tali..." Liara said sweetly. "You can take your time and stick around for a few months. We really missed having you around."

"Hmmmph....fine...." Tali relented. "But don't think you're going to feed me up like you did with Shepard there. I know how to portion my meals."
112113221223.title: Tali Can't Handle the Flab

11211322123.content:
“Oh shoot,” Liara thought aloud as she looked at her watch, forgetting her previous train of thought. The pizza was done. A timer rang out from the kitchen not a moment later, signalling to the home’s gluttonous residents that it was time for dinner.

Liara heaved her body into motion, leaving the Krogan sized scale behind. After navigating the narrow passages of her own home, she slowly lumbered into the kitchen, eager for her next meal.

From the oven she pulled four super-sized pizzas; two for her, two for Shepard. Liara swung open the fridge and pondered over her options, eventually pulling several large bottles of sugary liquid humans called soda, or was it called pop? “Who really cares what it’s called?” the Asari thought aloud as she opened a bottle and took a heavy swig. It tasted good, and that’s all that mattered to her.

In the living room, over seven hundred some odd pounds of pale flab occupied the larger of the two sofas. Shepard’s legs were spread out to accommodate for her enormous gut, now sporting a third roll with a fourth teasing into existence. Her breasts were barely contained by a large shirt instead of a bra, while her lower half wore no clothes to speak of.

The freckled commander was polishing off her second gallon of ice cream since lunch when a familiar scent caught her attention. Freshly baked dough, sinfully succulent sauce, and delectably greasy cheese. She looked up to see Liara carrying everything out and gave a seductive smile.

“Hungry dear?” the blubbery blue asari asked in a playful tone.

“When aren’t I?” Eileen said back with an ice cream coated smirk. The redheaded mass heaved her bulk forwards as the pizzas were placed on the table before her, ready to dive in.

“Ah ah ah! Not quite yet!” Liara leaned over with a napkin in hand. “You’ve got a little something riiiiiight-” Liara kissed her lover, licking away the melted ice cream from her lips. “-there.”

The two locked eyes for a moment and smiled. Liara tucked a napkin into Shepard’s shirt collar before she leaned in to whisper.


“Dig in piggy.”

A jolt of excitement ran through the commander’s gelatinous body. Name-calling was something Shepard used to do herself, cracking jokes at her own ridiculous size. Now it was a turn-on.

Liara backed away and Shepard spared little time, thrusting her pudgy arms towards the pizzas before her. Slice after slice of greasy perfection was shovelled into Shepard’s greedy maw, occasionally followed by a swig of soda.

Liara lumbered her way towards her own seat before carefully lowering her rear into the fragile furniture. The sagging loveseat ached and groaned as her ass filled the remaining space, taking the load off her overtaxed knees.

“Ahh… much better,” the Asari uttered before raising a slice of pizza to her mouth. As she bit down, her brain was flooded with hormones. The crunch of the crust, the sweetness of the sauce, the soft gooey succulence of the cheese. She was in ecstasy.

Several months ago, if someone were to ask Liara if she’d been gaining weight, she would have panicked, maybe even gone on a diet. If they were to ask the same thing now, Liara’s response would be a simple reply of “probably,” before chowing down on yet another slice of greasy goodness.

Her weight just didn’t seem so important anymore; the enormous asari was much more concerned with what her next meal would be than anything else.

And so, the two continued to eat.

And eat.

And eat some more.

------

What happens next?

1) Shepard and Liara are too engrossed in their meals to hear the furniture creaking beneath.

2) Liara and Shepard slowly forget their manners and become gluttonous slobs.

3) Something else?
11211322123.title: ...it was time to eat!

choices: Time to move to more suitable quarters.
Time for you to decide! What next?
112113221231.content:
While Liara was well aware of the immense weight of her and her lover the day she broke the old scale, it easily faded into the background at the first thought of food, glorious food. Liara had no choice but to think solely about food, really; Shepard had finally gone where Liara wanted her to in the first place and fallen into a cycle of obsessive, unrepentant gluttony, and had dragged her Asari mate down with her. It seemed every waking moment was dedicated to asking the question "what is the tastiest way to fill my belly to the brim", and the two of them had many answers to that little puzzle. This of course meant that they were on an unstoppable course towards getting bigger and bigger, and in time it was just enough to shock the two girls out of their hedonistic blur.

Liara's thoughts turned away from the greasy human delicacy of 'Chinese food' when she felt the ground shift slightly beneath her on her way to the usual sofa she occupied. Worried about some sort of seismic event, she took a ponderous step backwards and inspected the floor. It was indeed enough to give Liara pause when she saw the floorboards bent inwards, an impressive crack where her foot came down earlier.

"Shepard..." Liara huffed through cheeks bulging with fat. "Was the floor always unstable?"

Shepard grunted as she devoured a salad bowl full of greasy, savory noodles, the sauces running down her chins and between her great sagging breasts. Luckily there wasn't a shirt to stain since the pair of them rarely got dressed up in more then bras and tiny shorts these days; Shepard had long ago outgrown the majority of her wardrobe two hundred pounds ago, which didn't help Liara at all when she cleared Shepard's old weight and needed new things to wear as well. Not that it mattered since they only ever stayed in and ate nowadays.

Shrugging, Liara thundered over to her favorite sofa and squeezed her elephantine hips in between the arms of the seat to prepare to devour her own savory meal. There was a "pop" from the chair as her love handles were squeezed into place, and she groaned in relief as the knees long ago sucked into her fat legs found relief in her sitting down. Still breathing heavily, Liara reached a thick, padded hand towards some choice noodle bowl when...

CRASH

The whole room shook as Shepard suddenly dropped, the sofa beneath her enormity finally crying Uncle and cracking so hard it practically fell apart. The arms bounced away as Shepard hit the ground, her obese belly pitching and wobbling like a water balloon from the short sharp stop. The former Commander and scourge of the Reapers flailed her bloated limbs like a turtle stuck on its back as she tried to collect herself.

"L-Liara!" she grunted. "I can't....hufff....get up!"

Liara quickly got to her feet, or rather got to her feet at a slightly faster then incredibly slow pace. One of the arms of her sofa broke and feebly fell to the side unnoticed as Liara's knees cried out in agony from her taking a few steps.

"Shepard...huff...I'm..."

SNAP

Liara yelped as the floor suddenly gave way under another misplaced step, snapping underneath her chubby footstep. Seven hundred or so pounds of blue Asari fell on top of a coffee table filled with Chinese food, throwing greasy noodles and spicy chicken around like a bomb had gone off, utterly annihilating the table, and producing a tremendous bang so loud that it may have woken up the neighbors.

The morbidly obese Asari, taking some time to recover from the shock, found herself propped up on her belly over top of the ruins of the table and their rather impressive takeout dinner, her enormous silk-clad rear end sticking up into the air, dwarfing the size of the table. Her belly was so immense that she could barely touch the floor with her thick fingers, and given her size and position it would be impossible to get footing with her poor, beleaguered legs again. Almost on instinct, Liara strained to reach for a bowl of noodles she could still reach, taking a handful and stuffing it into her greedy little mouth.

"Liara...huff....you okay?" Shepard said at last, also preoccupied with feeding herself at this point.

"Mmph...fine..." Liara grunted. "But...huff....I...think....we might be....getting...*grunt*....too big..."
112113221231.title: Weapons of Mass Destruction

1121132212311.content:
“You wouldn’t believe the number of strings I had to pull for this.”

“Oh I can believe it,” Shepard replied.

As she felt the cargo truck rev into motion, Liara looked back at the old house and gave a slight chuckle. There was a gaping hole where the front door used to be. The old door was far too small for either Liara or Shepard to fit through, and so adjustments had to be made. Surrounding the house was a small army of laborers and worker droids working tirelessly to keep things under wraps. The forklift they used to carry the couple's bulk out of the house drove off for another job.

Liara made quite a few enemies as the Shadow Broker, but more importantly she made many more... ‘friends.’ The Asari made sure to keep a stockpile of favors owed to her for when she finally retired, and she was willing to make full use of them now.

Every bump in the road caused oceans of pale and blue flab to quiver and quake. It was entertaining enough to keep them distracted for a while, though it didn’t take long for time to slow to a crawl. The two waited in silence and watched the skylines of countless mega-cities slowly fade into the horizon. As distance collected, houses became smaller, and yards much wider. Countryside was something Liara had only ever heard of in passing, usually from bits of media here and there, tales of backwards people and strange music, and now she was smack dab in the middle of it. Rolling hills of grain, herds of cows and sheep; it was all positively beautiful.

The two oversized passengers watched the landscape crawl by, until they eventually found themselves bored of that too. Some time later, the silence was finally broken. Not by mouth, but the churning gurgle of Eileen’s stomach. And Liara’s soon after.

The redhead’s chubby face turned to Liara’s, chins jiggling from the simple action.

“... There wouldn’t happen to be any food back here, would there...?”

Liara thought for a moment and sighed.

“I knew I forgot something…”

------

After enough time had passed, towering trees sprouted up around the landscape and obscured their vision. They were now in the thick of the forests. Wildlife provided a new form of entertainment for the two for the time being, with all sorts of birds and animals Liara had never seen before prancing around, doing nature things. Another half hour in and they were met with rocky cliff faces and jarring peaks as they winded up a mountainous pass. The truck slowed as they came to a valley between the mountain peaks. A view of the whole countryside could be seen beneath them, with the tips of skyscrapers just barely in view.

Eileen’s bottomless gut cried out in agony for food, growling and howling for something to eat.

“Don’t worry,” Liara cooed. “It looks like we’re here.”

Curious, the former commander peered out the window, in awe of what she saw…

------

What did Shepard see?

1) A Grandiose Mansion: The two are catered to day in and day out, centered around making life as luxuriously lazy as possible. Focus is placed more heavily on being pampered to no end.

2) An Industrial Facility: A self-sufficient megacomplex wholly centered on feeding their endless appetites.

3) Something Else! You, dear reader, can decide what happens for yourself! (Yay you!)
1121132212311.title: A Long and Foodless Road-trip

11211322123111.content:
After nearly a lifetime spent on spaceships and in spartan, futuristic environments, Eileen was utterly amazed at the splendor unfolding before her as the cargo truck drove up the winding driveway, past the fancy gates that closed behind them. The path took the truck past perfectly maintained hedges, flowering rosebushes in multicolored bloom, elegant and gold statues that glistened in the setting sun, and past one last, multi-tiered fountain that rained water in shifting bright colors before the real star of the show unfolded before them.

A grand, elegant mansion, gleaming white with bronze window frames, green vines crawling up the sides and blossoming with blue and purple, a patio out front surrounded with classical Roman pillars, the steps leading up to it a magnificent shade of gold. A sight so magnificent, Eileen nearly forgot her ravenous hunger at the sight of it. It was so old-fashioned yet so new, it almost seemed unreal. Like the two of them had stepped back in time a hundred years.

"H-how..." Shepard croaked out at last, unable to comprehend the beauty and splendor before her.

"It was left in my possession after the passing of an old business rival," Liara said, a spark of that shadow-dealer mischief still evident behind the flabby jowls and porcine features. "Got a few favors pulled to get it cleaned and spruced up, widened some doorways, reinforcing the furniture, you know the drill."

Propelled onward by her astonishment, Shepard heaved herself out of the van, landing heavily on the elegant stonework underneath. Waddling up to the mansion, she let her mouth hang open in amazement as Liara waddled after her.

"Liara...please tell me they have a pool," Shepard asked all of a sudden.

"I'm sorry?"

"A pool. Like, a fancy swimming pool!" Shepard said, with a bit of hope and a bit of pleading. "With a jacuzzi and everything. I've never gone in one before and...I'd love to try it out."

Liara smiled. "What self-respecting elegant mansion doesn't have a fantastic swimming pool?" The look on her lover's face was enough to make Liara fall in love all over again, and she felt her face flush and a sudden urge to act on that love before...

GUUURGLE

"Goodness!" Liara said, clutching her noisy belly.

"It's in stereo," Shepard giggled as her own belly demanded food at the same time. Turning towards the mansion, she looked at the stairs leading up to the patio with some trepidation. It was a handful at best, but at her size, it might as well be on the top of the nearby mountain. She lifted her foot ponderously to the first step before Liara placed a hand on her shoulder to stop her.

"Oh, no need to exert yourself!" Liara said excitedly. "That's why I have these!" She snapped her fingers, and Shepard gave a small start as a dozen or so of very familiar white robots emerged from the door, two blue circles one on top of the other on their visors.

"LOKI's?" Shepard asked as the drones she was used to seeing fighting with Cerberus and the Blue Suns lined up at attention in front of them. "Where did you get these?"

"Miranda tipped me off to a few old Cerberus arsenals," Liara explained. "I figured you would appreciate the irony." Turning to the LOKIs, Liara cleared her throat and began in an authoritative tone. "Could you please help us climb these stairs?"

"Yes, ma'am!" the robots all chorused, splitting up and immediately rushing to the sides of the two enormous women. Shepard let the robots take her by the arms, with two behind her pushing on her prodigious back-fat, and let them assist her in getting up the stairs. The task still left her a sweaty mess, but with the help of the mechs she didn't feel like she was going to die afterwards.

"Very helpful, aren't they?" Liara said, sweat beads rolling down her round cheeks as she led Shepard inside, the robots obediently following them. "They'll respond to our commands and keep anyone from snooping around."

"This is all so...wow..." Shepard tried to say as the pair walked into a grand foyer. "I never thought that I would be able to live like this...like I had no more worries, or stresses."

"I wanted to make it perfect for you...for us, even," Liara said quietly.

"Liara...with you, it's always going to be perfect."

The love and affection between the two was practically electric, and sadly like before the demands for food sort of killed the moment.

"Well, time to get started!" Shepard said brightly, turning to the LOKI's. "Can we get some food for me and this adorable blueberry?"

"Oh, stop it," Liara giggled, blushing a deep purple.

"What would you like us to get for you, ma'am?" the robots chirped happily.

The two lardy lovers looked at one another, hunger in their eyes.

"Everything!"

---

And thus begun the luxurious, hedonistic lifestyles of Liara and Eileen, pampered to perfection in a sea of lazy luxury. The question is, how long before something of note happens in their little paradise?
11211322123111.title: Casa de Enormous

112113221231111.content:
A delicate song fluttered through the air as songbirds greeted the morning light. The sun peered over the mountain valley and engulfed the land in splendor, granting the grounds of the grandiose mansion her gilded glimmer.

Shepard heard the birds and knew it was morning. Her eyes snuck open to see the beautiful scene unfold in front of her through a grand window that put Versailles to shame. She promptly closed her eyes, shifted her immense weight and buried her head beneath the bed sheets.

The shockwave of movement caused by Shepard’s position shift roused a familiar blue blob awake. Liara rubbed some of the fog from her eyes and looked over to see her lover curled up as best as her body would allow, hiding from the morning’s call. With a soft grunt the asari did her best to match the position, meshing her own flab into the pale sea beside her. Liara draped a lard encased arm over Shepard’s, just managing to reach around the slab of fat coating her partner’s shoulder.

The retired commander hummed in delight at the gesture and poked her head out to see Liara’s loving eyes. A smile as soft and warming as the embrace she now returned.

“Morning sleepyhead.” Liara’s voice was crisp and sweet.

“Hey there blueberry.”

“Catch enough sleep?”

Eileen blushed as she recalled the previous night. Long after Liara returned to bed, Shepard stayed in the dining hall for an extended dessert. By the time she heaved her bulk into bed, Liara was already in a deep sleep.

“A few more minutes wouldn’t hurt,” Shepard answered. She closed her eyes once more.

Liara tightened their doughy embrace and nuzzled the commander’s pillowy bosom. The asari listened to the musical churning of Eileen’s innards going to work. The warm thud of each heartbeat, each heavy gust of breath, and another gurgling roar sound she’d grown accustomed to.

*GRRROOWWLLLLL*

“Hungry already?” Liara teased.

“Hmh, must’ve had a light dinner.”

A “light” dinner for Shepard was comically large for any regular person, but both knew she’d eaten far beyond her fill last night, plus some for the road. Since first arriving just over a month ago, it felt as if they’d never stopped eating. The dining hall was perpetually filled with feasts of all sorts and a cacophony of belches. When the two weren’t gorging themselves into a coma, they could be found lounging about and digesting their meals, or attempting what little love-making their bodies could manage. Shepard and Liara gave the idea of “living large” a whole new definition and ran… err, slowly and laboriously waddled with it.

“Was thinking maybe we could go for a swim later?” Shepard thought aloud. It was one of her favorite features of the mansion, dipping in now and again as a way to take pressure off her overtaxed joints. It was one of the few dwindling ways she could stand upright without LOKI assistance. Yet as the days rolled on, time spent eating slowly seeped into her limited time spent swimming.

“What’s the matter? Don’t want to try out the tennis court?”

“Hardy har, very funny.” Shepard smirked and absentmindedly played with her own blubbery rolls. The two held their embrace and lived in the moment, sinking back into the morning fog.

Until the door opened.

A small army of LOKIs wheeled in a buffet of breakfast foods and sweet treats. Pancakes, waffles, donuts, bacon, danishes, muffins; if it was filled with fats and carbs, there’s a good chance it was there. “Breakfast in bed madams?” one of the bots managed in a monotone voice.

“Of course!”

And so the two got to work, trying hard to cram in as much food in as little time possible.

------

~ Some Time Later ~

“UUURRRRRPPP! Woah, try and beat that one!”

Liara gave a chuckle before craning her neck back. “UUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRPPP!!!” The two giggled uncontrollably for a few minutes before rubbing their swollen stomachs. It was noon now and the duo had yet to leave bed.

“Oooof… I think I might have overdid it.”

“Again?” Liara teased. “Here, let me give you a hand.” The asari reached over and rubbed Eileen’s porcelain porcine stomach. The commander gave a sigh of relief and closed her eyes. A few minutes in, the pain melted away.

“Listen. I really owe you Liara. For everything.”

“Aw come on, this again? Listen dear. Believe me when I say it’s the least I could do. You sacrificed life and limb for the galaxy. None of this would have been possible if it weren’t for my brave…” Liara’s hands moved to Shepard’s love handles. “...strong…” The hands travelled further up to her fatty arms. “...sexy commander.” The hands ended filled with Shepard’s monstrous mammaries before giving her ass a hearty slap. Liara leaned in for a whisper. “Go on...

“...command me.”

------

~ A Little Later Than That ~

It was almost three now. Liara finally decided to take some initiative and get out of bed for a much needed trip to the restroom. With the help of the robot servants, her naked body was lugged out of bed and put on full display.

Her swollen cheeks melded down into her second chin, which swallowed the smaller spares into one mass of silky neck fat. Billowing pillows of fat flooded each flank, long ago having swallowed her elbows and consumed what remained of her shoulders. Her breasts had swollen further. Each one drooped down, large enough to rival most basketballs. Her back was a stack of fat rolls folded on top of one another. The gut in front of her hung down to her dimpled knees, retaining the shape of her old double-belly. Love handles jutted out to give off a pleasing transition from the upper half to the lower.

Said lower half was what really took the cake (literally). Her ass billowed out behind her, each cheek large enough to flood an extra wide office chair with some spillage to spare. Her thighs touched from the knee up, thicker than most trees. A sleeve of fat hung from her calves, draping over her pudgy feet.

Liara T’Soni was fat. Really fat.

With some much needed effort her bulk was carried to the bathroom door, which still had an extra few feet of clearance for her ridiculously wide hips.

The blue blob did her business, thanking the goddess she remembered to upgrade the toilets a couple weeks ago. Up next was a bath to clean up after her “little” lovemaking session. The pool-sized depression was filled with her bubbly bath. Liara just sat back and relaxed as robotic arms went to work, making sure to scrub down every last crevice, no matter how deep it was buried.

Once finished, curiosity reared its way into her head. “Let’s see how much I weigh.” The LOKIs obeyed her command, brought her to the industrial scale and sat her down. The red numbers on the wall climbed before reaching an answer.

[1122]

“Wow…” She looked to the side to see the mirror. Her eyes widened as she was hit with the realization of just how much she’d eaten over the past month. It wasn’t a feeling of disgust, nor was it pride. She was just impressed.

Emerging from the bathroom, Liara found Shepard waiting for her turn. The redheaded lardball was covered from head to toe in sweat from the simple act of getting out of bed. Surrounding her was her own team of LOKIs working hard to keep her knees from caving in.

If Liara was “Really fat,” then oxford needed a new word to describe Shepard.

Starting from the top, her chipmunk cheeks looked like they were always full, and her extra chins hung far and lo. Her arms could be easily mistaken for king-sized pillows, milky white and void of definition. Her breasts hung down, each one larger than many prize winning melons. From the bottom up, her feet had grown some extra pudge and a cuff of fat was developing from her calves. Her thighs and ass weren’t quite as large as her Liara’s furniture-crushing feature, but were well on their way to rivalry.

To finish it all off was her belly. The multi-tiered thing was enormous, hanging down far enough to cover her knees. The feeling of the floor touching her gut was new when she first moved it, but she quickly grew accustomed to it over time. While Liara's gain was a definite pear shape, Shepard seemed to just gain all over. Liara would have to remember to weigh her some time.

“You *pant* uh… *sigh* done in there?”

“Yea, go right ahead dear.” The asari gave a cheeky smirk and pinched her partner as they passed. In the lounge, Liara rested her rear on the extra wide couch, noticing how much space her ass took up. “Won’t be long until I fill the whole thing,” she thought aloud. For now she just leaned back and turned on the TV. A robot was soon by her side with a few boxes of donuts to snack on. This was paradise.

Wait. Did she… hear something?
112113221231111.title: One Month in Paradise

choices: ...I know you're in there!" Jack barked.
...Please open up, it's urgent!" Tali insisted.
1121132212311112.content:
The mansion had been perfect for the morbidly overweight couple, but above all Liara had ensured that she and her lover would be blissfully alone in their little oasis far away from the troubles of the outside world. It was Liara's first criteria when trying to find a new place, and she was so insistent on being left alone that the only deliveries they had came in via fleets of drones, all the better to create her and Shepard's little paradise. All of this meant strangers would not come knocking on the door, which in turn meant that whoever was ringing the bell was a friend.

This was something that Liara had been dreading for a long time.

Shepard and Liara were not avoiding their old friends. They kept in regular contact through emails and phone conversations, and they were close enough that most of them had a general idea that the loving couple had decided not to maintain their figures, so to say. Some of them were confused, some perturbed, but for the most part they were happy for them and didn't make a huge fuss out of it. If anything, the savior of the galaxy deserved to be spared judgement for a couple pounds on her waistline.

"Uh...tell them I'm on the way," Liara ordered one of the LOKI's hesitantly, who tottered off to get the door. "The rest of you...well, help me get dressed."

Liara didn't want to give whoever was out there a heart attack by seeing her naked, though in all honestly seeing her at over half a ton was a close second in that regard. As the LOKI's lifted her meaty limbs and squeezed her into a pair of shorts closer in size to bed-sheets then regular clothing, the blubbery Asari wondered if she should have been honest with the others about how far the two of them were taking this. She couldn't imagine a lot of them taking this news well, but it would have been better then springing all two thousand pounds of Asari and Human blubber on them.

In any case, it couldn't be helped now. As something resembling a shirt was slipped over her massive mammaries in an attempt to contain them, or at least block her sensitive area from view, Liara mumbled the order and began the arduous task of waddling towards the front door. In the time it took the sweating, panting Asari whale to come within earshot, whoever was out there had started banging on the door out of impatience.

"Shepard! Liara!...
1121132212311112.title: Who Can It Be Now?

choices: Gee Halberd how come your mom lets you have two free choices?
11211322123111121.content:
"Open the fuck up, Shepard!" Jack shouted through the door. "I know you're in there!"

"...Jack?" Liara called out, suppressing a bubbling belch as she came lumbering to a stop. "What are you doing here?"

"Is that you Liara? You sound funny..."

"I...uh..."

"Look, if you guys are shy about your weight, I really don't give a fuck. You could be a three hundred pound whale for all I care, just let me in, I gotta talk to Shepard!"

With grim resignation, Liara sent one of the drones to open the front door, as she positioned herself as casually as her corpulent form could manage. The robot obediently began the unlocking mechanism, and as soon as it finished Jack burst into the room, looking just as rebellious and punk as ever, if a little pale and nervous.

"Fucking finally!" Jack snapped impatiently as she turned to face Liara. "Now where's Shep....ard..."

"Um.....hello, Jack."

Jack's eyes widened in slow motion as she took in Liara's form, starting with the bare feet the size of plates, travelling up to the billowing thighs smooshed together at the knee, the billowing hips stretching a pale pink set of shorts across a couch-annihilating butt and an equally impressive rack barely constrained by threads of fabric. Liara nervously shifted her feet, and she could see Jack's eyes tracking her voluminous belly as it swayed gently from side to side, pressing gently on her sucked-in knees. Feeling there was no point now that the cat was out of the bag, the Asari didn't bother to stop a pocket of gas from escaping this time.

"BRAAAAAAAAAP!" she belched, her jowls wobbling from the force of the burp escaping her.

"Liara, was that you? Damn, that one was nice!"

Oh crap...

Liara and Jack both turned in slow motion as Shepard herself emerged onto the scene, squeezing out of the doorway Liara barely cleared herself, openly being helped by the robots and with everything...everything...on full display. Feeling like she was strapped into an out of control Mako careening through a hillside, Liara bit her lip as Shepard reached into a massive bag of pretzels and sloppily scarfed down a handful, sending bits and pieces messily across the floor. Jack's eye was twitching as one of the little cleaning robots they had on staff dutifully scurried in from behind her.

"Jack! I didn't know you were coming!" Shepard said gleefully. "How've you been?"

---

Jack was one of the most powerful biotics in the galaxy, and she knew it. Jack could tear apart massive machines of war in her sleep. She could take down a hundred of the toughest Krogan mercs without breaking a sweat. She could even stare down a Reaper and make them blink. She was the baddest bitch in the galaxy, and there wasn't a single goddamned thing that could ever throw her off her game.

Liara checked the time. It had been at least ten minutes and Jack was still lying in a fetal position across the sofa her two massive crew mates hadn't filled.

"Uh...do you want anything Jack?" Shepard asked delicately, now shoved into a black t-shirt that creaked when she moved.

"N-no," she whimpered. "I....I think I'm okay." Taking a deep breath, Jack sat up straight and opened her eyes, just as Liara had taken a handful of Shepard's pretzels and shoved them into her cheeks like a chipmunk.

*urp*

"...few more seconds."

Jack leaned on her side again, staring off into the distance. Liara, her stomach growling angrily at going so long without a properly sized meal, stewed in guilty silence as her skinnier crewmate sat back up again.

"Okay, so...first of all..." Jack began. "What the actual fuck is this?"

"Well," Liara mumbled. "We did say we wanted to just...cut loose a bit."

"Yes, but...I thought you meant like a few pounds, or at least a dozen!" Jack exclaimed. "Not...how big even are you?"

"One thousand three hundred twenty six," Shepard reported dutifully. "I checked just now." Liara could feel something stirring in her nether regions, though maybe that was just Jack's incredulous rage throwing her out of sorts.

"HOW IS THAT EVEN POSSIBLE?"

"Jack, you said you wanted us to be happy, right?" Shepard said diplomatically, Liara realizing that she was using her legendary charisma to her advantage for the first time in a while.

"Well....yeah..."

"We're happy like this, Jack," Shepard went on, slapping the side of her meaty flanks. "Honest. It's weird, but we like being like this."

Liara could tell by the look on Jack's face that her anger was subsiding. Shepard may have been a war hero better known for her fighting skill, but no one could turn a phrase like she could. Pinching the bridge of her nose, Jack leaned back in the sofa.

"Okay, fine, whatever. My friends are elephants now," Jack grumbled. "I'll deal with this later, but right now I got a bigger problem, and I need your help." For the first time, Jack actually looked rather nervous, as opposed to shell-shocked or angry. "I'm...no longer on the market."

"You aren't?" Shepard grinned. "Who's the lucky guy, or girl?"

"...Oriana."

Shepard and Liara paused in confusion, then their jaws dropped almost as much as Jack's did earlier.

"...Oriana LAWSON?" Liara exclaimed. Jack nodded curtly, turning bright red. Shepard tried so hard not to laugh that her blubber split a seam on her shorts, letting more of her thighs stretch towards the arms of the sofa.

"That's...rather unexpected," Liara mused.

"Tell me about it," Jack said. "But we met a while back, and just...everything sort of clicked for us."

"I'm really happy for you, honest, but that is just too funny," Shepard huffed, out of breath from the mere act of laughing.

"It's also a problem," Jack continued. "And it's why I kinda need your help, Shepard."

A: "Miranda found out and she's pissed at me! Is there something you can do to distract her?"

B: "She told me she prefers her girlfriends on the heftier side, and I'm practically skin and bones! Could you do something to help?"

C: (Free choice)
11211322123111121.title: Jack Is Taken Aback

choices: It's the blubbery blue Liara T'Soni!
A LOKI helper, here to save the day!
112113221231111211.content:
“Distract her? Are we talking about the same Miranda?”

“Shepard makes a good point; Miranda isn’t one to get so easily distracted. But then again...” Liara rubbed her chubby chin as she pondered. Liara’s higher brain functions had slowly gone ignored since starting on her ‘little project’ just a few months ago, making it rather difficult to rekindle her spark of genius. Come to think of it, the only thing she ever seemed concerned with these days—other than Shepard’s growing shape—was food. Food... “By the goddess, I think I’ve got an idea.”

Jack and Shepard looked on in anticipation.

“Eileen?” the Asari asked.

“...Yes?”

“How would you feel about a new housemate?”

A pause in the air allowed her audience to understand just what she meant. Jack’s eyes widened. “You wouldn’t fucking dare…”

Liara looked back with a coy smirk and a lilt in her voice. “Oh… I would~. With your permission of course Shepard.”

The whale of a commander leaned back, causing the reinforced steel within the couch to creak. She thought for a moment, not seeming to understand the full implications of Liara’s statement. It’s been some time since she last saw Miranda, so why not?

“Good idea blue. Might as well make use of all those guest rooms. I'll get to work on an invitation”

What was lost on Shepard gave Jack a mischievous smile, which eventually erupted into cackling laughter. Fucking brilliant. She couldn’t wait to see that ‘perfect bitch’ in a few months’ time.

------

Miranda was always an incredibly busy woman. Rather than retire like most after the reaper wars, her natural drive kept her going, keeping the genetic masterpiece perpetually occupied in some form of mission. After the dissolution of Cerberus, Miranda kept busy by taking on freelance work, picking up odd jobs from whichever rich asshole paid the most. Recently however, things were taking a bit of a turn for the worse.

The last mission she was on went up in flames quite literally. She always had an idea of what molten steel would do to a person, but she wasn’t ready to see it first hand on a hostage rescue. Needless to say, nobody was rescued that day. To add fuel to the fire, Jack was dating her sister.

Jack.

Was dating.

Her sister.

She thought it was an out of season April Fool’s joke when she first heard the rumors. After a bit of digging they turned out to be true. It sent her into a fit of frozen rage. Miranda spent a solid week and a half planning on how to ruin Jack’s pitiful fucking life. She fantasized how sweet it would be to see her cold calculating plans come to fruition. And she would have done it too, if she hadn’t gotten this invite.

Miranda looked the mansion up and down, a soaring whistle escaped her lips. This must be the place. She looked back down at her Omni-tool to double check the message.


RECIPIENT | Miranda Lawson

VER CODE | JBX-850-217-495

SENDER | Eileen Shepard | Former Alliance Commander

Miranda!

Heard you were near Sol and decided to shoot you a quick an invitation to stay with us for a week or so. I understand you still keep busy working these days, so if you come, feel free to leave whenever you need.

I’m sure you’ve heard, but since retiring, Liara and I have gained quite a bit of weight, which is a severe understatement if anything. Aside from that, we’ve also acquired some new real estate, though Liara still has yet to divulge how. You know how she is. So far the place has been a paradise on earth, but I guess you’ll just have to see it for yourself. We have plenty of guest bedrooms on the upstairs wing if you decide to come. Our address is [REDACTED], it's about an hour or so away if you drive in from [REDACTED]. It’s the only house in our little mountain valley. It looks like the kind of place you'd only dream of, so that should help you find us.

In any case, we hope to see you soon!

- Shepard


Yup. Definitely the place. The ornate front door looked big enough to fit two elephants side by side. Strange. Regardless, what mattered right now was seeing her old friends, maybe even enjoy some time to herself for once. Deciding not to think much of it, she stepped towards the doorbell and pressed. The bells rang their ancient song made of deep, droning bongs.

Moments passed.

...

And then a few more.

…

Where the hell were they? As if to answer, she heard a muffled shout from inside. “Just a minute!” Miranda stood idly once more as her patience was tested. Finally with a slow and heavy creaking, the doorway opened. Who was there to greet her?
112113221231111211.title: The Invitation

choices: ...the LOKI mech with Miranda's drink, spiked with Liara's special ingredient.
...Shepard, having finally squeezed into her bathing suit.
...Jack and Orianna? Well, I hope Liara insured the mansion.
1121132212311112113.content:
Miranda's hand drifted to where she would have carried a sidearm at the sight of a helmet with two red circles behind the visor.

"Ugh...years later and these things still make me jumpy," Miranda complained, crossing her arms. "Couldn't you at least change to blue or something?"

"This unit does not have the capacity to alter the coloration of the LED functionality in the sensor repository," the robot chirped diligently. "Might I recommend instead a hue filter to be applied-"

"I was being sarcastic..." Miranda rubbed her temple with one hand.

"Understood," the robot chirped again. "Miss Eileen Shepard is currently in the process of changing. Miss Liara T'Soni is currently in the pool section out back."

"In the process? You make it sound like it's an arduous task for her to get dressed." Miranda chuckled as she strode into the house, pausing to admire the admittedly stunning decor. "You said the pool's out back?"

"Yes, right this way Miss Lawson," the robot cheerily replied, leading her through ornate glass doors and passageways, all of them suspiciously wide and spacious, until the mountain breeze brushed against her cheek as she stepped out into the back area. "Would you perhaps care for a refreshment, Miss Lawson?"

"Now that you mention it, I am rather parched," Miranda admitted. "Perhaps a hard lemonade?" The robot tottered off towards the other end of the pool area complete its mission as Liara looked around the pool area. Her father had an expensive mansion of his own and an elaborate pool out back, but this might have given him a run for his money. The pool itself was massive, big enough to hold an entire house on its own, curved and carved into the decorative marbled surface of the pool area. Miranda stepped forward and dipped her hand into the crystal clear water, gently rippling in the breeze; the water was cool and pleasant to the touch, and invited her to take the plunge and relax. Resisting this urge, Miranda looked up to the decorative palm trees lining the edge of the pool area, arranged above comically large deck chairs alongside the pool (were they meant to be seating for three or more people?), leading her gaze towards a small shack where the LOKI was dutifully preparing drinks at a small station bedecked with food and beverage preparation equipment.

Miranda hated to admit it, but she was impressed. This place had everything she expected, except perhaps a Jacuzzi.

No, wait, there it was, in front of the shack. She didn't see it because of that thing inside of it. What was that anyway?

Miranda's eyes widened as she realized the large shape inside the Jacuzzi wasn't a something...it was a someone. A damned big someone. It was clearly an Asari with her back turned, rippling layers of backfat cascading down her sides, flabby cheeks visible from behind her head, and a large beverage clutched in her thick fingers. Her arms were so meaty that they hung down and brushed the surface of the water...or they would have if this woman wasn't...

Well no wonder Miranda couldn't see the Jacuzzi at first; this Asari seemed to be filling it, pushing the water up to the rim of the Jacuzzi where it spilled out when she slightly shifted her very impressive weight. The Jacuzzi was made for a whole group of people, and she filled it so thoroughly that Miranda probably couldn't fit with her comfortably in there! The ex-Cerberus agent had seen some abnormal people in her time, including a few overweight ones...but this one might have just surpassed them all. And she was using Liara's pool! Where WAS Liara anyway? Unless...

...no, impossible. This had to be someone else. She couldn't have...no, it was utterly inconceivable! This was some obese hog trying to mooch off of Shepard and Liara's possessions! That was the only real answer!

"Who the hell are you?" Miranda demanded, storming up. The immensely obese Asari jumped, or rather wobbled briefly for a moment, turning around and lifting her sunglasses.

"Oh, Miranda?" she said, her voice thick and husky. "I didn't know you arrived yet!"

Miranda stared and stared, looking past the chins arranged in layers below a dainty mouth, past the breasts bigger then her head held in place by a bikini top that could hold a circus underneath it. She...she recognized the eyes...

"So, er," Liara meandered awkwardly. "Shepard DID say we put on a few, right?"

"Define..." Miranda said, tight-lipped. "...a FEW."

"Few....hundred..." the Asari said, guiltily sipping her drink. "Maybe like...ten...hundred?"

"I...Liara....you're filling the Jacuzzi!!!"

Liara wondered to herself if there was anyone from the old team that wouldn't shout at her when the discovered how huge she was. The blubbery Asari certainly wasn't ashamed for her size, but after a while the overreactions did get a bit demoralizing.

Luckily, before Miranda could further overreact (or rather react very appropriately considering what was discovered), the pair were joined by...
1121132212311112113.title: Poolside Reunion

choices: Miranda furiously storms off, determined to stay thin.
Miranda is too hungry to care.
11211322123111121131.content:
'Your lemonade Miss Lawson,' the robot purred as it walked up, handing Miranda a tall, narrow glass of gleaming pink liquid sparkling with ice, complete with a lemon wedge and an umbrella.

'You're the size of a house!' Miranda went on, staring at the mountain of Asari in front of her.

Breasts the size of a short woman just in length and heavier in weight. An always cute face swallowed up by an intertube of fat so heavy her eyes had narrowed. Stack after stack after stack of deeply split fat rolls thick enough for Miranda to lose her arm in up to the elbow.

'I mean, not a house,' Liara tried to shrug, a stunted gesture that sent ripples through her water bed body, 'a shed maybe...'

'Can you even stand up anymore!?' Miranda demanded, the shapely spy unable to turn away from the lard stuffed blue berry.

'Your lemonade Miss Lawson,' the LOKI purred again, louder.

'Well, I can walk if someone helps me up a bit,' Liara admitted bashfully, and Miranda wasn't sure if her former squad mate was horrified of being barely mobile or that she was still able to walk.

'This is intolerable! You used to look like a model a few years ago,' Miranda stammered, the perfect brunette's eyes blinking, 'how did this happen in a few years...'

'Your lemonade miss lawson,' the LOKI insisted again, voice louder.

'Well, Eyeline was injured so much and I spent a lot of time nursing her and after that nether of us felt like exercising and she enjoyed eating so very much,' Liara admitted.

'Your lemonade miss Lawson,' the LOKI insisted, near shrieking.

Miranda wanted to crack the robot's head but her perfect genetics wouldn't let her be rude. She snatched the lemonade and drank it down in one swift gulp, putting it down on the tray with a thud.

'You don't gain a thousand pounds from that!' Miranda yelled at her, shaking her head, 'you just...ughhh...'

Miranda's head was dizzy. She wasn't really certain what she'd been so angry about....

'Well, we started liking the weight we were putting on and wanted to gain more,' the Asari wide load admitted, 'so we started using some supplements...'

'Supplements?' Miranda wheezed, shivering as she felt colder and colder.

'A special recipe...,' the Asari almost paled as she realized that the LOKIs made every beverage, snack and meal with a lacing of the stuff, 'actually now that I think of it, are you feeling okay?'

'I'm a little cold...,' Miranda admitted, shivering despite her tight body suit.

'Why don't you climb in here,' Liara suggested, patting the minimal space her bean bag body didn't take up, 'and warm up.'

The perfect brunette didn't hesitate, unzipping her cat suite and revealing a gloriously pale and slim body, from her hard dancers thighs to her sculpted, bulging pillow buns bulging out of her thong to her chiseled waistline to her full, bouncing DD cup breasts surging in their black lace cups. Her ivory skin was covered in goose pimples and she shivered, lips turning blue as her metabolism faltered.

'I don't have a swim suit,' she shivered, teeth shattering, 'do you mind?'

'Its nothing I haven't seen before,' the Asari said, 'hop on in.'

Miranda plopped in, her shivers slowing as the warm water soaked over her. Forgetting any hesitation she leaned into the bulging Asari's fat rolls, hugging her tight for any residual warmth. A long, loud growl came from her hard belly, so violent it vibrated across Liara's mountainous fat.

'Are you okay?' Liara asked, horribly worried and wondering how'd she break the news to Miranda that her metabolism was now utterly wrecked.

Miranda's perfect faced looked at her, suddenly utterly serious, 'Give me food.'

'Miranda I have to tell you, I think you've been drugged with those supplements,' Liara tried to warn her.
11211322123111121131.title: ...the LOKI mech with Miranda's drink, spik...

choices: ...was still her rational and dignified self. Just hungrier. A lot hungrier...
... fully gave in. She needs food and as much as she could get!
112113221231111211312.content:
"And how am I supposed to focus on that when I'm starving?" To her credit, Miranda's tone was perfectly calm. There was no indication of annoyance or impatience.

And that scared Liara.

Miranda was too calm. The former Cerberus operative was known for her cold demeanor but this was ridiculous. She should be angry, ranting. Utterly outraged but instead her sole intent was on getting food. Liara could have dealt with the rage, she expected it. But this...what had those supplements done to Miranda?

For her part, Miranda knew she should be more concerned. On some level, she knew this was wrong. She need to question Liara, to demand what was going on but found that...it just didn't bother her all that much. The thought of ramming food down her gullet until her midsection ballooned like rising bread simply wasn't nearly as abhorrent as it might have been once upon a time. Again, Miranda knew that such a notion should be raising red flags. But it seemed to silly in the face of the gnawing hunger that was bubbling up insider her but she couldn't completely shake it.

As the internal conflict resolved itself, Miranda...
112113221231111211312.title: Miranda is too hungry to care.

choices: Shepard, at an equally impressive, if smaller, size.
Miranda, already super-sized and hopelessly addicted to eating.
...Jack? Holy hell, what happened to you?!
1121132212311112113122.content:
"Hungry," Miranda said bluntly. "Give me food."

Liara bit her lip, feeling perturbed at the sudden single-mindedness Miranda possessed. Even the tone was unlike her, short and clipped but with the human woman gently stroking the side of Liara's massive flank.

"Gooood morning, my big and beautiful blue sunflower!"

With a particularly cheesy pet name and footsteps that shook the ground, Shepard at last made her appearance outside, dressed in a one-piece of enormous size that held her massive knee-covering belly into a pleasingly round shape. Taking massive, waddling steps towards the Jacuzzi with her improbably thick legs, Shepard reached one of her arms up to her face to lick the pancake syrup still stuck to them from one of her many breakfasts, her bingo wings draping over her engorged chest. Giving a great shuddering gasp of pleasure at the taste, Shepard looked down in surprise at the unexpected guest.

"Miranda! I didn't know you were here!" Shepard said delightedly.

"Shepard! Hungry!"

"Pardon?"

"Hungry!" Miranda declared, standing up and not caring that she was in her underwear in front of her hosts. "Give me food!"

"Uh...the LOKI's can bring you anything you want. Just ask," Liara interjected. Miranda immediately splashed her way out of the pool and ran over to the nearest robot, rattling off an impressive list of entrees as a pair of robots joined the first.

"Well, glad to know she's loosened up a bit," Shepard laughed, idly running her hands up and down her love handles before making one ponderous turn and heading for the pool, giving Liara just a moment to herself to observe her handiwork. Shepard, transformed from an athletic action hero to a bloated pile of blubber, hopelessly addicted to food and loving every second of it, and Miranda, newly hooked on the same substance and excitedly marching towards the same goal.

In retrospect, it was easier when she just fantasized about turning her crushes into the fattest beings in the universe. Not in the sense that it was hard to get them to such a state, but the fact that Liara just couldn't set aside her moral quandaries to do so. It was so nonsensical; she happily sent out orders back in the old days that got people killed, intentionally or not, and she never lost a night's sleep over it, and yet fattening up Shepard and Miranda sent her into an existential crisis? Shepard LIKED getting fat, Liara tried to reason with herself. They made that decision together. And Miranda? Sure, she didn't consent to it, but she wouldn't be upset about it, and this was all to help Jack be together with Ori, right?

Liara gave a heavy, melancholy sigh. Maybe a snack would help lift her spirits.

---

The silver lining to all of this was that Liara's plan did in fact work. After a month in the mansion, Miranda didn't care about Jack dating her sister anymore. Liara even broached the subject, and the same woman who flew into a rage and threatened bloody murder at the mere idea of Jack and Oriana being a couple merely shrugged and asked when the next serving of dinner was coming. Food was in fact the only thing that seemed to occupy Miranda's thoughts nowadays; the week she meant to spend at the mansion stretched on and on and on, and she didn't seem awfully interested in saying goodbye any time soon. That would have meant missing a meal, after all, and no one was doing that nowadays, least of all Liara.

Lumbering her way into the lounge on bloated feet the size of dinner plates, the Asari finished off the oversized sub sandwich she was devouring and readily took a second from the attending robot that wasn't there to help her move. She hadn't stopped eating since waking this morning, though frankly it felt like she hadn't stopped eating for the past few weeks. Watching what was happening to Miranda made her feel guilty, and that feeling bled over into making her feel guilty about what she did to Shepard, and as her moral justifications and excuses failed one after another, she resorted to stuffing her face to try and drown the feeling of guilt with something pleasurable. It only really succeeded in making her balloon ever faster then she already was, and for what was in all likelihood the fattest Asari in recorded history, that was saying something.

Even with the assistance of the robots and a little biotics on the side, it was miraculous that she could still move. Her face was on the verge of being overwhelmed by her perpetually stuffed cheeks and her mass of neck fat, a mass that since swallowing up her excess double chins has since doubled itself and was the only thing keeping her head from sinking into the mass of blubber that consumed her shoulders and upper arms. Her breasts had long since outgrown letters, held up from collapsing down her front by a custom-made shirt that was more of an incredibly oversized bra by the time it arrived, but even they didn't reach out as far as her belly, blooming out in front of her and reaching within inches of brushing along the ground. And her rear end? Well, she crushed the couch long ago, but you couldn't tell because if she sat on the ground, she was still at the same height from when she still used the sofa.

Liara proved that when she gave a great heaving step towards the former location of the couch and plopped herself down, her mass breaking out in a tremendous wobble. Licking her fingers clean from the sandwich she finished, she was only just able to ignore how thick and heavy they felt, like she was wearing several thick protective gloves at a time, or how the fat on her arms was swallowing them whole. In the back of her head, she wondered if she had finally soared past two thousand pounds at last.

"By the....huff...goddess...I'm so....oohhhh...." Liara moaned. "Feed me."

The robots sprung into action, arriving with plates upon plates of delicacies to feed to their master. Obediently opening her mouth, Liara let the robots roughly and forcibly stuff her, too lazy to even lift her arms to do the same action anymore.

As she gorging herself, heavy footfalls and rattling windows told her someone particularly large was approaching, and turning her gaze towards the shadow in the doorway, Liara saw it was...
1121132212311112113122.title: Gorging Away Your Guilty Conscience

11211322123111121131222.content:
Messing with human genetics was fairly commonplace in this era of advancement, but many still saw it as taboo. Perhaps because some were caught up questioning its morality while others asked why only the rich should have access to it, but many feared it would do more harm than good. Miranda Lawson, once the image of genetic perfection, was the lovechild of genius rather than genitalia, bred to be flawless in every way.

Well almost every way.

Either through incompetence or intention, the process of genetic modification left her with an incredibly potent flaw. The serum was designed to introduce slight changes over a long period of time. A new neural pathway here, a tweak of metabolism there, and so on. Whatever natural mechanism designed to resist the serum in some way was completely omitted, meaning one strong dose was enough to re-engineer her into a gluttonous wreck.

“UUUUURRRRRRRR{/ size}RRPPPP!”

Miranda wobbled into the lounge with evidence of her syrupy breakfast still coating her lips. With an idle hand she rubbed her bloated stomach. The same t-shirt and sweatpants Shepard and Liara once wore at her size clung to her burgeoning form which, now stretched and stained from over-use, did nothing to hide her drooping belly. True to her genetics, the weight was distributed in a notably hourglass trend, though her derriere took authority over her impressive mammaries. It took Shepard almost a month to pass the 300 lbs mark, but in only several weeks Miranda looked to be pushing well over a quarter ton.

“H- mph” Liara opened her mouth to say something to her but was cut off by a mouthful of food. “Mir- ohm mhmm” She tried and tried again, but failed each time. Sure the robots had been programmed to stop at the raise of her hand, but lifting her thick appendages seemed like too much effort right now. A few mouthfuls later and she forgot what she was going to say. A few more and she forgot Miranda was even there.

With a few ponderous steps Miranda made her way towards the sofa Jack once occupied, dropping her rear into the distinct Miranda-shaped slump. “Ouf… Still... Hungry…. Ugh... Food... now.” Her voice was dull and lifeless as ever. At her command the LOKI mechs lept into action, delivering a seemingly endless stream of calorie packed platters.

Liara heard Miranda’s voice and was reminded of her presence. With some effort she raised her fat encased hand and put her feast on pause, taking a moment to chew and swallow before speaking. “Miranda…” Miranda grunted, far too occupied to even look up from her feast. “Miranda?” This time she didn’t even acknowledge her. “MIRANDA!!!”

“WHAT?!” the ex-cerberus op shouted, clearly upset to have her meal interrupted.

“... I- I just wanted to say good morning...”

Miranda sat dumbfounded, the inner workings of her mind churned as she tried to process something other than food. “... good morning, Liara.” The smaller woman paused before returning to her meal.

The asari smiled. Since arriving, Miranda hadn’t said so much as a word to either Liara or Miranda, and while it wasn’t a full on conversation, it was enough to make Liara happy. With a flick of her wrist the robots began feeding her once more.

What happens next? You can decide at GoldfishFun.com!

------

Gravitational Assistance: Liara calls in a few more favors. By modifying a few old ship parts, the mansion grounds are enveloped in a low-grav field. Staying mobile just got a little easier!

Gravitational Ass: It's too late for our friend Liara. Her arms have grown too heavy to raise along with the rest of her, even with her biotics!

Something else entirely! That's right! You can decide what happens next, and the sky is the limit!
11211322123111121131222.title: Miranda, already super-sized and hopelessly add...

112113221231111211312221.content:
Moving around was something the growing housemates seldom did nowadays. After all, why waste precious time and energy lugging their tonnage around the mansion grounds when it could be better spent eating? Liara knew this was true in some ways, but also knew the harsh reality of her situation. Once she was no longer able to move, or even so much as lift one of her lard filled arms, there would be no going back. Something needed to change. Perhaps she’d be able to think a little clearer if she wasn’t being forcibly stuffed like a prize winning turkey by a small army of robots.

With a heave and a grunt, she lifted her arm once more, signalling a pause to her unfathomably large feast. She took a few moments to chew and swallow a mouthful of something luxuriously cheesy before pausing to think.

With a clearer mind, she pondered the issue at hand. Just getting out of bed in the morning has become an extensive process taking upwards of half an hour. Sure the most obvious answer would be to lose some weight, but that didn’t seem feasibly possible at this state. Why did fat have to be so damn heavy? Liara wished she could fight against the ever-present shackles of gravity, but alas, you can’t just change something like that.

Wait a moment… Yes you can. Still driven by her spark of genius, she asked her mechanical servants for a comms pad. The mechs dutifully handed her one of her old communication devices, able to reach even the darkest reaches of the galaxy in a moment’s notice.

“Ah, goddess damn this thing…” Navigating the homescreen was fairly easy for literally anyone other than Liara. Her fat encased fingers felt far more like thickly padded gloves rather than the nimble appendages they once were. Doing something as simple as opening her directory was hopelessly impossible. “DAMMIT!” Her patience was being visibly tested at this point, when a small speech bubble was projected in a hologram form before her eyes.

‘[Would you like to enable voice commands?]’

“Yes,” she said with a heavy sigh. “Open directory SBF 03...”

Where will our story take us next?

------------

A Rotund Reunion: An old friend from the Normandy swings by to install the gravity mods. Jaws are guaranteed to drop.

Autonomous Assistance: The ship parts are delivered, modified and installed by drones. Technology sure is great isn’t it?
112113221231111211312221.title: Gravitational Assistance

1121132212311112113122211.content:
Liara was beginning to dread these little reunions. At best, her old friends reacted to her and Shepard's new lifestyle with shock and disbelief. At worst, they fell face first into the hedonistic indulgence alongside them. It was why she got most things done nowadays with a fleet of drones, on top of the obvious limitations of their extreme size. It wasn't shame; Liara was not ashamed of how obscenely massive she was and even found it interesting at times, perhaps even a little...exciting. Maybe it was just that it was exhausting to explain the circumstances of why she and Shepard were hovering around one ton each.

Alas, setting up gravity mods is not a task suited for robot hands. Fluctuations in gravity were nothing to sneeze at, and if something went wrong, someone could go sailing through the air or get pulled through the floor, to say nothing of the possibility of collapsing the whole building. This needed an expert's hand, an expert whom Liara would not enjoy dropping a one ton bombshell on.

‘[Please select a contact.]’

Liara sighed, ordering the communication device to scroll through the names on the list until she spotted the one she needed.

Here we go, she thought to herself...
1121132212311112113122211.title: A Rotund Reunion

11211322123111121131222111.content:
"So in short, you want to set up a low-grav field?" Tali's voice echoed through the communicator.

"Yes, for the mansion me and Shepard are staying at," Liara confirmed. The vague, static holographic shape that resembled Tali seemed to tilt its head curiously. Liara was grateful for this quirk of long-term communication; Tali wouldn't be able to see how huge Liara was. "We're...uh...having trouble moving around."

"Is this something to do with what those tabloids have been saying about you two?" Tali asked.

"No, of course not," Liara said dismissively. "I...wait, what are the tabloids saying exactly?"

"Don't worry about it, I'm sure it's just pointless speculative gossip. You can't really be that much bigger than...hmm, well it doesn't matter. In any case, if you're looking for low-grav generators I have something that may help." There was a transmission of data, and Liara poured over the schematics, somehow managing to scroll through these instructions with her overly-sized hands. Odd.

"I...have to say, I'm impressed," Liara admitted. "This is more solidly constructed then what I had in mind."

"Well it's derived from a new device a lot of us are using in our new homes," Tali explained. "And let me tell you, it's a LOT easier to install artificial gravity gens on a building then on a spaceship."

"When can you come over to complete the installation with all the specifications I asked for?" Liara asked, pushing the question of why the Quarians would need gravity generators in their homes to the back of her mind.

"I can swing by in a few days, we're bringing a few of the old Flotilla ships to an alliance shipyard for some retrofitting into proper vessels."

Liara sighed, letting her exhausted arm flop down onto her side. "I can't even begin to tell you how grateful I am that you're able to make this for us, Tali. I am in your debt."

"Well, make me a nice big dinner when I get there and we'll call it even," Tali chuckled.

-----

"So, Tali said she'd be here any minute, right?" Shepard asked, sitting across from her blob of a girlfriend in the foyer.

Liara nodded mutely, unable to speak through the pair of Loki's guiding a never-ending stream of food into her mouth. Still incredibly anxious about Tali seeing her like this, Liara had done little over the last few days besides eat and sleep, rarely leaving the cushion in the foyer that replaced the old sofa. Not that she needed it, considering how her jelly belly spread across the floor and her thick legs pooled beneath her, to say nothing of the two massive "cushions" in the back she had to rest on. After a couple minutes of this, she finally found the strength to wave off the attending feeder bots.

"Not a moment...too soon..." Liara huffed, completely exhausted. She could feel it by now, that she was days away from losing any semblance of mobility. Frankly it was a miracle she even got this far after growing over a ton, as much of a miracle as the tent-like shirt that managed to cover her modesty. Even Shepard, rapidly closing in on a ton herself, managed to find clothes that were somewhat presentable easier then she had.

On reflection, Shepard just seemed to be taking the extreme weight better then she was, probably because she didn't have a guilty conscience to drown with gluttony. Sure she was massive, threatening to blow the arms off the three seater sofa she squeezed into, but she could still feed herself, and didn't need as much help walking and carrying that girth around, even as her bulging belly bounced on the ground after a good feast.

"I just hope...she's accepting..." Liara continued, trying to catch her breath after the intense gorging.

"Hey, she knew we were getting big," Shepard reminded her. "Sure maybe not an exact number, but we've never LIED to her about what we're doing here. Like you always said, just kick back and enjoy retirement."

Liara smiled slightly. "Yeah...kick back and enjoy..."

The bell rang.

"Oh god she's going to freak out," Liara snapped out of her cool in seconds. "This was a terrible idea, I don't need to move so much that it traumatizes my friends!"

"Someone let her in!" Shepard said to the robots before turning to her big nervous blueberry again.

"You seriously believe that?" Liara asked.

thud...thud...

"I know it babe," Shepard teased. "Just be cool about it, and Tali will be cool. I mean, it's Tali we're talking about."

thud...thud...

"Yeah..." Liara assured herself. "Same old Tali, right?"

thud...thud...

"Same old....Tali...." Shepard trailed off, listening closely. "Do you hear something?"

"I feel something," Liara pondered.

"Whew...." a third tinny Quarian voice echoed out. "Sorry I'm late you two had to-"

Tali audibly gasped at the sight in front of her. Liara, ashamed, looked away at the sound of Tali's voice.

"Keelah...what happened to you two?"

"I can explain, Tali," Liara offered weakly.

"Explain? What's there to explain? This is amazing!"

Liara, surprised, turned to look at Shepard, who had her jaw hanging open in shock. Liara shifted her girth again to look at Tali, and her jaw joined Shepard's on the floor.

The suit design was Tali's. Liara recognized the purple swirls anywhere. It just so happened to color the biggest enviro-suit she had ever seen in her life. The familiar helmet had doubled in width, sinking into a sea of shoulder fat that matched the sleeves of the suit filled like sausage casings, with dents where the elbows were and the thick-three fingered hand sinking into the wrist. Perfectly round breasts bobbed in front of her, dwarfing the size of Tali's helmet and resting inches above a huge double belly, squeezed against the suit's fabric so that a cavernous belly button was visible. Racks of love handles bulged from her sides as they flowed down to her hips and thighs, which despite flaring out to the sides wider then her enormous belly, couldn't block her gigantic rear end from being seen from the front.
