Samara was not offended by the astounding lack of manners; far from it, she was messily tearing into barbecued ribs in one hand and shoveling down mashed potatoes with the other, eagerly enjoying two Earth-based delicacies. Eventually their feasting slowed down enough that they could talk through their gorging and properly catch up.

"I see you're no stranger to this arrangement," Liara commented.

"Not at all," Samara responded, wiping her mouth with her sleeve. "I see retirement is treating you well. Is that why you've grown to such a size?"

"We decided to enjoy life to the fullest," Shepard explained. "The mission is over, why not indulge a bit? Or a lot."

Samara chuckled. "I sympathize. My time as a Justicar is over, and I intend to spend my twilight years with friends and family. I've left my daughter Falere alone for far too long."

"How is she, by the way?" Shepard asked, showing concern despite shoving handfuls of meat into her hungry maw. "It must be rough for her, losing a sister."

"It was, but we've coped," Samara explained. "I convinced her to turn to the culinary arts to help her heal, and it's worked quite well...as you can tell." She patted the side of her belly to emphasize.

"Oh, she's interested in cooking as well?" Liara said, her eyes lighting up.
1121233.title: A super-sized Samara.

choices: Later, Liara meets with Falere, her culunary acquaintance!
Later, Liara joins a cooking competion to prove her mettle.
(Free choice, make it a good one pal)
11212331.content:
"I would love to-" urp "-meet with her sometime, perhaps to exchange recipes and share techniques with one another..." Liara mused.

"I'm sure she would appreciate that," Samara said thickly, placing a hand over her mouth to muffle her own belch. "Goodness, I'm getting full..." she said politely.

"You're not going to offend us by being modest, Samara," Liara said gently. "By all means, indulge a bit."

"Yeah Samara, you're a big girl like us," Shepard said. "Go ahead and enjoy the perks!" As if to prove her point, Shepard pounded gently on her chest with one hand, breathing deeply before letting out her own impressive burp, punctuated by the poor overtaxed button on her pants breaking free. "And I have more room now too!" Shepard said happily to a skeptic look from the former Justicar. "Show her, Liara!"

Liara flinched, caught staring hungrily at a certain five hundred pounds of something that wasn't food. Refocusing herself on the meal, she picked up a whole new steak and sloppily devoured it, coating her cheeks in delectable steak sauce. Breathing deeply, Liara let out a loud belch before collapsing back in her chair, causing it and her dress to creak dangerously.

"Hmm...I see," Samara said thoughtfully. Scouring the table, the former Justicar spotted her quarry and picked up a whole bowl of pasta, lifting it overhead and pouring the whole thing into her eagerly awaiting maw. Shepard and Liara looked at the red-clad Asari in shock as she slowly swallowed down the whole mess before she finished, the bowl dropping to one side with a thud.

"Uh...Samara?" Shepard asked cautiously. Samara didn't respond, other then to puff her cheeks out and sway gently in her chair, pasta sauce dripping from her face. Shepard and Liara made to move away, fearing she was going to upchuck the whole dish, but instead Samara leaned back in her chair and opened her mouth to unleash an incredibly loud roar of a belch, one that put Shepard and Liara's to shame and would have woken everyone in their impressively large house.

"By the...hurrk Goddess...." Samara said at last, stifling little burps every few moments as she let the dish settle. "That was...hic....amazing..."

"No arguments here," Shepard admitted, sounding amazed as she grabbed for another bowl of noodles. "I so have to try that now!"

Thus the three women finished off the feast with renewed vigor, steadily growing bigger as they reached the end of their capacity for food. Unrestrained by her constrictive pants button, Shepard's monstrous gutswelled out from in front of her, putting her belly button on full display, while Samara faced a similar issue and had to loosen her own garment to allow her round, stuffed taut belly room to escape. Liara escaped any such wardrobe malfunction (for now), but her voluminous dress still tightened considerably around the boulder that was her belly.

Letting out small hiccups and belches, the three ladies retired to the living room to rest off the meal, Shepard and Liara squeezing their hips into a couch while Samara settled her overflowing rear end into a loveseat. As they digested, Samara got caught up with Shepard and Liara, who were eager to talk about all the wonderful places they visited in their trip across the galaxy, not to mention the many, many buffets they partook in. Samara on the other hand informed them of goings on at the new monastery and how she had been reconnecting with her daughter, notably all the cooking competitions she was entering.

"I'm surprised that she's allowed to enter, considering...well, you know," Shepard commented.

"Actually Shepard, since the end of the war, our society has become more accepting of Ardat-Yakshi, considering what the Reapers did to them." Liara recounted.

"It's an encouraging development," Samara said with a smile. "I admit I was worried how well my daughter would cope with the isolation so soon after losing her sister, so it is a relief to see this social stigma become lessened."

"Are you worried about the ones that are more like your eldest?" Shepard said cautiously.

"Of course I am," Samara said tersely. "But at the same time, it is wise to remember that not all of the Ardat-Yakshi are like Morinth, and that many deserve the chance to live as well. And I am glad that Falere has that chance now."

"Me too," Shepard said, looking through the photos that Samara brought with her of Falere winning the competitions. Shepard couldn't help but notice how Samara's figure steadily grew wider with every win by her daughter. It would be amusing finding the correct order based on the size of the Justicar's hips.

"I admit I'm surprised you have not joined any of these competitions, actually," Samara said to Liara. "I imagine you would do a fine job."

"It's something to consider," Liara admitted. "Though I admit I mostly do this just to enjoy life to the fullest."

"A wise endeavor," Samara said with a smile.

Eventually though the day had to end, with Samara bidding her farewells and promising to inform her daughter that Shepard's lover was a budding chef as well. The two decided afterwards to make it an early bedtime, and lumbered upstairs after they finished cleaning up from their feast.

"Ya know, I thought all this eating would get old after a while," Shepard commented, rubbing her belly with contentment and admiring her elephantine form in the mirror. "It hasn't. I love retirement."

"I'm glad we are both enjoying it then." Liara called from the bathroom. "Our next trip will have to be to Samara's home now, so I can cook with her daughter." Shepard licked her lips at the thought of that, despite the massive feast still percolating in her blob-like tummy.

"Those competitions sound fun too," Shepard mused, turning to let her hips jut out. "I bet you'd wipe the floor with the competition."

"Oh, I can certainly try..." Liara said, shutting the door behind her. Shepard turned around to comment but was stunned into silence at the sight of Liara in a black bra and panties, with her enormity on full display, a blue ocean of flab from her many-chinned face to the breadth of her sofa-crushing hips to the front of her boulder belly and the tips of her chubby little toes.

"Like what you see, Shepard?" Liara said, seductively wobbling her body.

"Oooh, yeah..." Shepard said, stepping backwards and sitting down on the bed, her belly splayed out over her own impressive thunder thighs, her pleasure center lighting up like a fireworks factory catching fire. Shepard let out a little squeak of pleasure as Liara clambered onto her lap, pressing her great flabby tummy against Shepard's and resting her chins on the expanse of Shepard's cleavage. Taking charge, Shepard shimmied around a bit to move her gut out of the way, leaning forward to deliver a deep, sensual kiss. Caught up in the moment, the Asari responded with such enthusiasm that her lover fell onto her back with her on top, the combined half-ton of blubber making the bed wobble dangerously. Not that it would stop them, of course.

Seems they weren't going to sleep off that meal after all...
11212331.title: Two Blue Blobs and a Flabby Commander

choices: Luckily Tali shows self control and doesn't go overboard.
Tali keeps her cool, but her stomach is packed by the end regardless.
Tali tries, but the food is so good! She loses control!
112123313.content:
Commander Shepard's decision to live life to the fullest and fattest alongside her Asari lover did not happen in a vacuum, naturally. Alliance tabloids were having a field day documenting the once brave commander's descent into mindless hedonism, with the pro-humanity rags tending to be the most harsh on the idea, and even more respectable publications were weighing in, no pun intended, on the issue. When a video of Liara's growing rear end crushing a chair at a restaurant went viral, everyone began to speculate on what was going on. A malfunctioning Alliance military experiment? A strange and obscure alien ritual? A rare and highly abnormal disease? No one really knew, but when Samara's daughter started getting noticed in the news for her culinary victories, everyone took note of how the former Justicar was steadily inflating after every win and began to ponder if the sudden descent into hedonism was something that afflicted not just the hero who defeated the Reapers, but her many allies and friends as well. Some of which weren't pleased about those rumors.

"And one more follow up question, Miss nar Rayya. Have you taken any steps to change your diet or upgrade your wardrobe so you avoid blowing up like-"

"Bosh'tet!"

Tali'Zorah punched the shutdown button on her console's commlink, immediately ending the live interview with the Alliance news crew.

"Those...leeches! Parasites!" Tali shouted, kicking over an empty container in her mini-tantrum. "They said they wouldn't bring it up!" Kicking the container repeatedly, she finished venting with one last kick that sent it sailing across the room.

"Hey what's going on in-HEY!"

Ducking under the flying container with ease, Garrus Vakarian straightened up and began approaching Tali more cautiously, who was still inflicting violence on packing containers.

"I take it the interview didn't go well?" the Turian asked.

"It's always the weight gain!" Tali fumed. "No one asks about what it was like facing the Reapers, becoming Admiral of my own fleet, or retaking and working to rebuild Rannoch, it's always 'my goodness your commander got fat, how are you dealing with it?' Are humans always this desperate to learn about personal issues of others!?!"

"Well, I do get asked a lot about what you look like under the mask," Garrus chuckled.

"Keelah, you're impossible," Tali said with a hint of affection in her tone, grumpily parking herself on a container she hadn't yet vandalized, the Turian cautiously taking a seat next to her.

"Honestly, I can see why everyone is so curious about what's happening with Shepard," Garrus confessed, unconsciously placing a hand on the Quarian's leg. "But honestly, I think it's overblown. I bet when we see her tomorrow she'll be fine, just a little pudgy if anything."

"I suppose so," Tali said, placing her hand gently on top of Garrus' and leaning against him. "Maybe I'm just anxious..."

"Good thing, you're cute when you're anxious," Garrus teased, nuzzling her neck gently.

"Y-yeah," Tali sighed, melting into the gentle caress of her lover. "I'm sure they're not...actually fat, or anything..."

---

"Tali, Garrus! It's so good to see you!"

The Quarian was numb as a five hundred pound Liara wrapped her meaty arms around her and pulled her into a hug, sucking her into her belly and chest fat. Her glass visor squeaked as Liara's fat cheeks brushed against her face and she moved to pull an equally numb Garrus into a big hug as well. Behind her incredibly broad back, he shot a look at his girlfriend that plainly stated 'Help I am losing my mind over here'.

"It's...great to see you too!" Tali managed to get out.

"Yeah all of you," Garrus said, hissing as Tali elbowed him sharply.

"Well, don't just stand there, come in! We were just about to start eating!" Liara said, giving a belly laugh and a good slap to her bulging belly. "It's half dextro as well, you'll have plenty to sink your teeth into."

Wordlessly, the two still skinny squadmates followed the Asari down the hall, going at half-pace to match Liara's lumbering gait, seeing as her hips blocked off the hallway. Tali was genuinely surprised that her former teammate found something she could squeeze her mammoth-sized rear end into, let alone such a fancy and elegant dress for the occasion. Of course that just begged the question of how Shepard looked at this point.

Soon enough they came to a rather spacious dining room, with a spread that made Tali and Garrus' mouth water almost immediately. The whole arrangement was neatly divided in two, with a pair of chairs sitting on one side and a sofa lying on the other end. Only at second glance it turned out to not be a sofa...

"Shepard!?" Garrus spoke up, shocked at the sight of the woman he once had a relationship with, now blossomed into a morbidly obese whale spread across two chairs.

Garrus! It's great to see you again!" Shepard exclaimed, her fat cheeks dimpling with smiles. "Tali, great to see you too!" Without warning, the commander, perhaps the greatest War Hero who ever lived, lightly bumped her fist against her chest and shook lose a loud and unladylike belch. "So, you two ready to start eating? I'm starved!"

"Ready as we'll ever be..." Tali said, taking her seat alongside Garrus, as her hosts immediately started piling into the feast sitting between them. Thinking back to her interview fiasco, no wonder all the reporters were asking about her weight and how big the Commander was. Liara and Commander Shepard hadn't just gotten fat, they'd gotten enormous!

And here she was about to tuck into a feast just like they were!
112123313.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner

choices: Tali gets fed like crazy, and the results speak for themselves.
Tali doesn't get too fed up, but she doesn't avoid all the consequences.
Lacovian Disorder has some...odd side effects that the doctor didn't mention
1121233132.content:
"So I can still blend something for you if you like, Tali," Liara offered through a mouthful of potato.

"It's fine, I can stomach solid foods," Tali said, detaching the bottom portion of her helmet to expose her jaw. "I got a immuno-booster an hour ago, should keep me from getting infected for the rest of the day." Cautiously, she took one of the platters on the dextro- side of the table and gave herself a helping of some multicolored tubers.

"Don't you need a constant stream of the stuff to keep from getting sick?" Shepard asked her, pausing her own impressive feasting at the sight of Tali opening up her helmet. Tali wasn't surprised that the commander was so shocked she stopped eating; Kelly panicked nearly dialed emergency the first time she saw the Quarian use that feature.

"Oh the newer ones are stronger and more long-lasting. Being able to work with the homeworld's atmosphere again has really helped us improve our immunity boosters, to the point that within a year or two we might be able to live without the suits entirely," Tali explained, forking some of the food into her mouth. She was still getting used to solid foods so her opinion may have been somewhat biased, but she had to admit that Liara's cooking was pretty good. Oftentimes when anyone except Turians tried to make Dextro-cuisine it came out bland and dry, and somehow Liara managed to figure out how to make this not only edible but quite tasty as well. Not bad!

"That has to be pretty exciting, working to restore your home planet and your species," Liara said admiringly.

"We've been very fortunate," Garrus interjected, chewing on a succulent-looking steak. "And since the Hierarchy has me as the adjunct overseeing our assistance to the Quarians and the Geth, we've been able to spend a lot of time together."

"In addition to actually helping us with the rebuilding effort of course," Tali added, shooting Garrus a sideways glance.

"Er, right, that too," Garrus said sheepishly.

"Either way, I'm glad you two are well," Shepard chuckled. "How's Chikktika doing, by the way? Still blasting away the bad guys?"

As the dinner went on, Tali felt a little more relaxed about the bizarre circumstances of the meeting. With or without the extra four hundred or so pounds, Shepard was still Shepard, and Tali saw the same confidence and spirit that made her respect the Commander back when they were fighting the Reapers, making the newly obese Shepard sitting in front of her just a little bit easier to take in. And Liara...well, Tali didn't care for her all that much, but now she seemed a lot better too. She always found the Asari to be a little bit snooty and full of herself, but since turning into a morbidly fat alien Liara had mellowed out considerably and felt much more relaxed and approachable. Maybe in time Tali would even be able to see what Shepard saw in her.

Together the four friends feasted for what felt like hours, talking and catching up all the while. Liara and Shepard had predictably demolished their half of the dinner, while Tali and Garrus had only managed to take a respectable chunk out of their end.

"Looks like you have leftovers!" Liara joked, her chins wobbling as she laughed.

"Haha, yeah....oooh...." Tali groaned, clutching her belly. She had been so distracted by the pleasant conversation that she didn't notice she reached her limit a while ago; now her tummy bulged painfully out of her middle, thankfully contained quite well by the rest of her suit.

"I see you enjoyed yourself," Garrus quipped, patting her on the stomach tenderly. Tali groaned and gently swatted his hand away.

"You two want dessert?" Shepard asked as Liara rose to her feet and began the laborious task of turning around without knocking anything over. "Liara made a really tasty cheesecake, dextro-neutral!"

"I think we're fine," Tali said, ignoring the sad look on Garrus' face at the lack of cheesecake. Pushing herself to her feet, Tali suddenly felt a little out of sorts. "I.....huurp....had fun, was nice to see you, Shepard...."

"You okay, Tali?" Shepard asked. "Don't move too quickly, you're stuffed to the gills."

"I'm not....that stuffed, thank you," Tali insisted, bracing herself on the table. Her head was starting to ache pretty badly. Where was the mouthpiece of her helmet? She reached around on the table for it, but her vision was fogging over.

"Tali, what's wrong?" Garrus asked urgently as Liara quickly lumbered towards the scene.

"I'm fine...just need...a nap..." Tali slurred, pitching backwards and collapsing onto her back.

---

"Hey, she's coming around!"

"Oh good, let me check her over then..."

Tali blinked, her eyes hurting from the sudden beam of light shone into them. She tried to swat it away but her arms were too heavy. She groaned, her stomach gargling furiously to digest a big meal.

"Lie still, honey. You took a nasty fall."

"Is she going to be okay, doctor?" Garrus asked, his voice harrow with worry as Tali felt him grip her hand tightly.

"Calm down Mr. Vakarian, she's going to be just fine. Let her breath."

Tali regained her bearings as someone pressed a facemask into her hand, which she reattached to her helmet almost instinctively. She was lying with her back on a sofa, with Garrus sitting next to her and Liara and Shepard looming nearby, their gargantuan forms casting shadows on the two of them. The doctor, a Salarian that Tali didn't recognize, examined his omni-tool with one hand as he felt Tali's wrist for a pulse with the other.

"What happened?" Tali asked weakly.

"You collapsed after your...ah...dinner," the doctor explained. "I don't think it's anything serious, could have just been overeating that did it. Quarian digestive tracks are rather fragile..."

Tali turned red with embarrassment under her helmet. If it wasn't bad enough being humiliated like this in front of her friends and her fragile health being made into a punchline once again...she was being accused of overeating! Tali would have bet half the migrant fleet that this doctor made that comment because he knew about the reputation of Shepard and her crew in regards to waistlines.

"Oh..."

"What?" Garrus demanded a little too forcibly.

"It seems I was slightly mistaken...she has Lacovian Disorder."

Tali had no idea what that could have been, and judging by the look on everyone's face, no one else knew what that was either. But it didn't sound good, whatever it is.

"It's nothing serious, I assure you," the doctor said, perhaps sensing everyone's anxiety. "It's a temporary health disorder, she'll be fit as a fiddle before long."

"Good, I can-" Tali started to say as she got to her feet, but the doctor pushed her back down again.

"Lacovian Disorder is relatively new, it's essentially a negative reaction to immunity boosters. There's been a spike of cases among Quarians given recent developments. Were you using the newer boosters, perchance?"

"Yes, the newer models from earlier in the month," Tali confirmed.

"That would do it. Unfortunately, while its mild, there's really nothing I can do about it. You need to wait for your body to adjust to the booster stimulant, and until then you should stay in bed. Too much physical exertion or staying on your feet for too long will cause another attack."

"Bosh'tet," Tali swore. "I can't stay here, I have-" she began before Garrus forced her back down, a little more gently then the doctor did.

"You're not going to be able to do anything if you can't stay conscious," Garrus pointed out.

"I have a responsibility!' Tali insisted.

"Hey, your people already know that you've done a lot to help them over the last few years," Shepard pointed out. "I'm sure they'd understand if you needed to take a break to get healthy.

"But-"

"I can handle any of the work back on Rannoch while you recover," Garrus offered. "That way all you need to worry about is getting back on your feet."

"You'd really do that for me?" Tali said.

"Twice over, if I needed to," Garrus insisted, leaning against her helmet affectionately. "You don't need to worry about a thing, I've gotten pretty good at calibrating things over the years."

"I KNEW you'd say that," Tali giggled. "Alright fine, I'll stay off my feet and get better."

"Why don't you stay with us?" Liara interjected. "We can take care of you!"

Tali looked between the expansive forms of her former commander and her lover with mixed feelings.

"I...I'd rather just..."

"You have to stay off your feet for a while, and you're already here anyway!" Shepard said excitedly. "Seriously Tali, why not just stay with us? It'll be fun getting to hang out again!"

"I..."

"Plus I can keep working on those Dextro recipes," Liara fantasized, rubbing her multi-rolled gut slowly. "You'd probably make for a great taste tester too!"

At the look of excitement etched on Liara and Shepard's faces...Tali couldn't bring herself to say no. As the two rushed off excitedly, jamming their rear ends in the door-frame as they went, regret warred with gurgling digesting noises inside of her.

She hoped she wouldn't regret this.
1121233132.title: Dinner With Friends

choices: "It's nothing, I can lose this in no time...right?"
"This...isn't as bad as I thought it would be..."
11212331321.content:
"Delay grain shipments? Absolutely not, we're behind schedule as it is!"

"Admiral, with all due respect, the Batarians don't care about our schedule, they just know we can't exactly turn them down if they try to ransom our cargo ships."

"We're in a precarious position as it is!" Tali insisted, furiously typing on her holographic workstation. "If we can't keep the current rate of reseeding up we risk an ecological collapse."

"Again, tell that to the Batarians. If you don't slow the shipments down now they're just going to stop altogether when our convoys are bled dry."

Tali groaned, tearing off another chunk of Rudarum Steak and stuffing it into her mouth, a valiant effort to polish off leftovers while Shepard and Liara were out at a buffet place for a date. She knew this added stress wasn't helping her recovery from Lacovian Disorder, but it probably would have just stressed her out more to not do anything at all. Luckily Shepard and Liara were understanding, letting her set up a mini-workstation from her new home on the loveseat that both ladies had outgrown by now so she could keep working. It helped, but Tali would be glad when her strength came back and she could get back to work properly.

Not that she was disliking her time crashing with Shepard, of course. It was nice to hang out with some old friends like this, and they had gone out of their way to make her temporary stay here as comfortable as possible, including home-cooked meals courtesy of Liara's foray into Dextro-cuisine. That being said...Liara didn't seem to want to portion her meals for someone who was a normal size. The pair never forced meals on Tali of course, but there was just a lot of food around the place, and when the Quarian got bored or frustrated, it was a little too easy to reach for. She'd only just gotten used to the feeling of her belly pressing against her suit after a big meal when it started to press against it all the time, rising from her once flat stomach like cookie dough. Tali gave her doughy gut an idle prod as she let out a small sigh, resolving to diet once she was completely over the disorder.

"What about...extra protection on the shipments?" Tali decided, in regards to the piracy problem. "I have a few contacts and strings I can pull, help get the pirates off the trader's backs."

"If you can manage that it'd be a great help," Tali's contact said. "Until the protection gets here though I'd like to at least slow down the outgoing shipments."

"Fine, but don't go below 50% on output," Tali insisted, taking another bite of her steak. "The people need to eat, after all."

"Right...I'll get on it Admiral," the adjunct said, dropping sarcasm that Tali missed because she was focused on eating. Dialing in a familiar number on her comms system, the Quarian was distracted when her fork scraped against a bare plate.

"Really? All out?" she sighed. "Hmm, maybe Liara has more in the fridge..." Spurred on by food, Tali slowly and unsteadily got to her feet, leaning on furniture nearby in case she had a fainting spell from the disorder. Taking the long way around the overtaxed furniture, Tali traipsed through the hallway and was stopped when she saw a photo of a... wait that's a mirror...and that's....

"Huhh...wahhh..."

Tali's words failed her as she realized that sitting down for so long mislead her about how much damage she was doing to her body. She thought at worst she gained fifteen or so pounds, enough for the belly and slight pudge she had all around her, but she hadn't gained fifteen pounds. It was a little closer to a hundred or so, hiding in and around her legs, meaning there was no hiding it.

Tali's butt was pretty darn big!

The Quarian shifted her stance to get a better view, feeling her suit strain to contain the flab caked on her lower body, and gave her rear end a soft smack, sending it rippling and quaking. At this rate, it wouldn't be long until the loveseat was a perfect fit for this monstrous rear, already wide enough to fill out a regular chair and then some.

Grabbing onto the offending body part and shaking it dejectedly, Tali tried to reason with herself on this daunting change to her figure before concluding thusly:
11212331321.title: Tali Acquires Pudge

choices: There's another guest over for dinner tonight!
Liara has also changed a lot since last time.
Shepard makes an unusual suggestion to the other three.
112123313211.content:
(Last post was kinda lame, here's my penance for the previous chapter lol)

"It's nothing, I can lose this in no time...right?" Tali reasoned with herself as she hefted her meaty cheeks in both hands. "Yeah....yeah of course I can!" The Quarian took a shuddering breath, wincing as her rear end thudded against the mirror and tipped it slightly.

"It's...well, I've been inactive and eating a lot, it's only natural I'd put on....a few," Tali reasoned as she meandered her way into the kitchen. "Once I get home everything will be back to normal!" Really, it was the only thing Tali could do in response to this sea change, since if her reaction to the first time seeing tons of fun Liara and Shepard was anything to go by, excessive weight was not something she was accustomed to. It would have been bad enough if her species hadn't spent generations dealing with rationing and food shortages, pretty much the exact opposite problems that they had nowadays, but Tali had always worked with active professions; marines, bodyguards, spies, and engineers, all people she looked up to and were inspired by, and these people were...well, they were skinny and athletic types that didn't sit around gorging on Liara's cooking like she was doing.

So it was bad enough that she was watching two of those skinny athletic types, some of her best friends, balloon up in front of her. It was another thing entirely when it seemed to be happening to her. She was Tali'Zorah, the hero who defied the status quo and fought alongside the best and the brightest to save the galaxy! The brave Quarian who helped broker peace between her people and the Geth, and who led the charge in rebuilding their homeworld! She wasn't SUPPOSED to be a fat lazy overeater crashing on her friend's sofa!

So, she wasn't. The massive shelf behind her wasn't a sign she was fat, neither was her newfound love of Liara's cooking, and certainly not her more recent requests for a second helping, or just an extra slice of that delicious shortcake. Nope, no fat Quarians here, she was just temporarily out of action until she could get back in the game. Keelah se'lai!

"...Keelah se'lai, I am so hungry..." Tali groaned, opening the fridge and trying to ignore the tightening of the suit around her new assets as she bent over. "Where did she leave the steaks?"

---

It wasn't like a surprise visit from your boyfriend to make you change your tune, however.

"No!"

"Tali..."

"I'm not coming out!"

"Uh...'honey', it's not that bad...honest..."

"NO, IT'S WORSE! I LOOK...GAH!"

Garrus leaned his head against the door to the bedroom in frustration and anxiety as the ground shook behind him, indicating Shepard had arrived on the scene. "Who's shouting?" she asked, scratching the side of the belly spilling out from under a too-small shirt. Everything was too-small on her at this point, really. In just a few weeks even the already huge Shepard appeared to be noticeably fatter, with a wider face and an extra roll for the apron sprawled in front of her, an apron that brushed against the sides of the door as Shepard entered the hallway.

"It's Tali," Garrus explained, dropping his voice. "She's uh, upset about her...well..."

"I look like a Kilvaglian Jeefirn!" Tali mewled. "An overfed Kilvaglian Jeefirn!"

"What's a Kilvaglian Jeefirn?" Shepard asked. "It sounds delicious."

"Do you really need to ask that now?" the Turian demanded, somewhat irritated.

"Point taken. You think she's upset about how you'll react?"

"She knows I don't care about that sort of thing," Garrus rattled off tiredly. "I care about her, not her weight."

"Are you sure she knows that?" Shepard pushed the question, raising a suggestive eyebrow.

"Of course I am!" Garrus shouted, rounding on his morbidly obese former commander. "I'm not good with the cutesy flirting dialogue or the dating thing, but I know enough to be sure there's no one in the galaxy I care about more then her, and she could be the size of a house and I'd still be so in love with her that I couldn't hope to put it into words!"

There was a pregnant pause as Garrus' outburst rang through the hallway, with Shepard glancing towards the bedroom expectantly while her Turian friend stewed.

"You...you really feel that way, Garrus?"

Garrus immediately softened and melted as Tali's voice came from behind the door, looking over at the triumphant expression on Shepard's face.

"I...of course I do."

"Okay...I'm coming out, give me a moment..."

"Works every time," Shepard whispered as muffled footsteps sounded from behind the door. "If your species could blush I'd bet you'd be turning red right now."

"N-no I wouldn't," Garrus grumbled rubbing the back of his neck bashfully. Thankfully, he didn't need to endure more of Shepard's teasing once the door shot open. It took quite a bit for Garrus to not react with surprise at the sight of his beloved Quarian. He knew what had happened and meant every word of his previous outburst don't get him wrong, but....woof...

It immediately became clear that at some point Tali needed to replace her suit. It looked the same as the old one, maybe with a bit more gold on the trimmings but otherwise it was still recognizably her. It was almost certainly broken it at this point, or perhaps it was new and Tali was just growing really quickly, because it put on full display exactly why Tali needed a new suit.

Her belly led the way out of the bedroom, cascading down her front in multiple doughy rolls and layers of flab, with a deep belly button just visible through the fabric stretched taut around her middle. She kept her thick fingers clamped on her stomach to stop it from wobbling too badly, revealing the thick, plush bingo wings hanging down from each arm, wobbling almost as violently as her gut did when she moved. Even her helmet looked wider then before, and going by the smudges a few inches below her eyes on the other side of the visor, her chubby cheeks regularly smooshed up against the inside.

"H-hey Garrus, uh, I'm sorry but I..."

"You don't ever need to apologize to me," Garrus immediately said with utmost sincerity.

"...I'm stuck in the doorway." Tali continued.

"...oh."

Really, that should have been a given; Tali retained her weight in her lower half and that hadn't changed at all since she first got anxiety about her size. Even the far heavier girls only brushed against the sides of the room and got stuck once in a while; for Tali getting stuck was practically guaranteed thanks to the whale tale she lugged around. Too wide for any seating besides a sturdy bench and the love seat Tali overflowed downstairs, her rear end was truly gargantuan, to the point where you could be forgiven for thinking Tali had stuffed oversized watermelons into the back seat of her pants. Barely supported by thunderous thighs wide enough to fit a skinny person inside, her butt was an unstoppable wobbling monster, bouncing off the walls and knocking small objects off of tables when she lumbered towards her next meal. It said something that despite being the lightest one here by a hundred pounds or so, she was by far the one with the largest caboose trailing behind her.

Thankfully it was pliable enough that Garrus could compress the flab and just barely squeeze her through the doorframe. Holding her immense frame in his arms, Garrus looked over at Tali's shameful expression and, seizing on inspiration, nuzzled her thick neck with his forehead. It was strange nuzzling into the fat, but it produced the desired effect as Tali shuddered with pleasure, her flab jiggling all over.

"I missed you, Tali," Garrus cooed. "It hasn't been the same without you around to micromanage."

"Oh, Garrus..."

The moment was interrupted by a pair of stomachs rumbling, first Tali's, then Shepard's, who was so enjoying the moment that she almost forgot about the feast waiting for them.

"Come on guys, let's get to the eatin'!" Shepard said excitedly, beginning the slow lumbering journey to the kitchen. Garrus, feeling a little better about things, followed, going at a slower pace so Tali could waddle alongside him, her meaty hand clutching his own.

All in all, a surprising night for the Turian, but the night wasn't over yet...
112123313211.title: It's All Going Pear Shaped!

choices: ...Tali likes eating a lot, and finds it hard to self-regulate.
...Oriana keeps managing to sabotage her diet.
...Shepard and Liara ARE trying to fatten her up!
112123313212.content:
"So let me understand you properly," Miranda Lawson said coolly, steepling her fingers. "You call in a panic and beg me to travel all the way here...because you think Shepard and Liara are attempting to fatten you up?"

"Yes!" Tali insisted, anxiously wringing her hands. "I...they keep giving me all this food and I didn't notice until now but-"

Tali stopped as a drink was placed in her hands by the other woman at the restaurant table that Tali insisted the former Cerberus agent meet her at, a girl who ,while clearly younger, looked remarkably similar to Miranda.

"Here, try this," Oriana Lawson said kindly. "It'll help with your nerves, honest."

"Th-thank you," Tali stammered, taking a sip through the emergency induction port. It did help, actually, and left her with a warm feeling in the bottom of her stomach. Her tubby, tubby stomach. So yeah it didn't help entirely.

"I still think you're overreacting," Miranda admitted. "Yes the two of them have gotten...heavy, so to say, but I don't think they're trying to deliberately fatten you up."

"Then how do you explain this?" The Quarian stood up from her seat and showed off her rear end, big enough that she would have been squished up if she had to share the booth with another. Oriana let out a squeak of surprise at the sight of the junk in Tali's trunk, but Miranda, always the cool and collective operator, didn't even flinch.

"You said yourself you were sick," Miranda explained away. "And combined with the recent trend of Quarians gaining weight now that the food shortage and economic troubles are resolving themselves, it's not hard to explain."

"I don't know," Oriana mused. "I've kinda been following the news lately, a lot of the Commander's former friends have been putting on a few. Last I heard the Justicar couldn't exit the front door of a monastery somewhere."

"Tabloid guff," Miranda said dismissively. "Why are you even reading those stories about Shepard's friends fattening up?"

"...I dunno, just a little bored I guess..." Oriana said, suddenly becoming very interested in her hands as her cheeks took on a pink tinge.

"In any case, I still feel you're overreacting. You just need a diet plan and things will get back to normal for you," Miranda finished saying to the nervous Quarian.

"Are you certain?"

"Positive," Miranda said, smiling warmly. "If you'd like we can start now, I can give you some pointers on sticking to a healthy eating schedule."

"But what if they force food on me?" Tali asked.

"They are NOT forcing food on you," Miranda insisted. "I've eaten with them before about a hundred pounds ago, they don't force anything on you that you don't want. You just need some self-control, is all."

"I see," Tali mumbled, feeling the expanse of her enormous rear end. "Th-thanks, Miranda."

"Always happy to help!" Miranda Lawson smiled. "Now, how about we go over some healthy dextro-meals for you?"

Of course, while the initial meeting went incredibly well, dieting proved to be quite hard for Tali to pull off, since...
112123313212.title: Won't Someone Help the Quarian?

choices: Tali wavers slightly but gains some respectable poundage.
Tali commits to her eating and becomes super-sized!
Tali can't stop! She goes overboard!
1121233133.content:
"So I can still blend something for you if you like, Tali," Liara offered through a mouthful of potato.

"It's fine, I can stomach solid foods," Tali said, detaching the bottom portion of her helmet to expose her jaw. "I got a immuno-booster an hour ago, should keep me from getting infected for the rest of the day." Cautiously, she took one of the platters on the dextro- side of the table and gave herself a helping of some multicolored tubers.

"Don't you need a constant stream of the stuff to keep from getting sick?" Shepard asked her, pausing her own impressive feasting at the sight of Tali opening up her helmet. Tali wasn't surprised that the commander was so shocked she stopped eating; Kelly panicked and nearly dialed emergency the first time she saw the Quarian use that feature.

"Oh the newer ones are stronger and more long-lasting. Being able to work with the homeworld's atmosphere again has really helped us improve our immunity boosters, to the point that-"

Tali came to a sudden dead stop when she took a bite of her food mid conversation. She thought by now she would have gotten used to the superior taste and texture of solid food, but she wasn't ready for the pure, intense bout of flavor that overcame her with that simple bite of multicolored starches. A perfect balance of salt and starch with just a hint of sweetness to give it that flavor-packed kick...keelah, it was like she never had good food til now!

"Uh, Tali?" Shepard asked, her jowls wobbling as she chewed nervously. "Still with us?"

"Uh...oh....yes, I mean....w-within a year or two we might....b-be able to live without the suits entirely," the Quarian managed to spit out, only to immediately take another bite of the meal, reveling in the overwhelming sensation of taste that it gave her. She had to try something else, she thought as she reached for another dish, a steak made from some alien pack animal that was a pleasant shade of purple.

"That...has to be pretty exciting, working to restore your home planet and your species," Liara said, trying to bring the conversation back to the focus.

"We've been very fortunate," Garrus interjected. "And since the Hierarchy has...uh..." He trailed off at the site of Tali suddenly tearing into the steak after the first bite.

"By the ancestors, this is incredible!" the Quarian exclaimed. "I never knew how good real food could be!"

"Neither did we," Shepard chuckled, patting the flank of her great belly.

"I...I never want to not eat like this!" the Quarian insisted, abandoning all pretense and starting to shovel great forkfuls of food into her maw directly from the dishes in the center. "I can't go back to eating nutrient shakes out of induction ports! I need real food!"

"Then I think we should give her a crash course," Liara grinned. "I didn't expect tonight to turn into a gorging, I would have made more!"

"A what?" Garrus asked.

"I'm placing an order, couple dozen or so pizzas should do the trick, plus all this," Shepard said, punching in a few key commands on her multi-tool. "Tali you want to throw in anything else on top of that?"

Tali replied with an intense belch and kept eating.

"Sounds like a yes."

---

Nothing like three girls gorging themselves senseless to make a guy feel like a third wheel, Garrus thought to himself.

He had finished eating a while ago and was quietly sipping a coffee that Shepard made for him as the girls spent an hour or so gorging. It was kind of impressive in a surreal way, how those three could pack in so much food at high speed, even if it left the place in a complete mess, with plates stacked to the ceiling, takeout boxes scattered around the room, and food stains adorning most surfaces.

"Ohhhh, now that was good," Liara moaned, rubbing a taut stomach that at some point burst from its confines in her outfit.

"You said it," Shepard replied, gently massaging her own belly that was making a good effort of trying to do the same. "Incredible."

Garrus sniffed. Honestly, the incredible bit was that Tali had somehow managed to keep up with these three, her relentless drive and passion making up for her lacking weight and capacity, and of course suffering for it.

"I think I'm gonna *hic* pop," Tali mumbled, her hands caressing the round orb of her belly. Stretched taut against the material of her suit, Garrus could even hear it groan as it digested the enormous meal within, and it looked so heavy and bulbous that if she tried to stand up she'd probably tip over. Of course, she may have been in pain from how stuffed she was and more resembled a round ball with legs and arms attached then an actual Quarian, but there was no mistaking the joy she felt at being so stuffed she could barely walk.

"It looks like you, uh, had fun," Garrus tried to comment lightly.

"I had fun? Garrus, this was....incredible," Tali said breathily. "I...I don't ever want to go back to eating like a Quarian ever again."

"I'm sorry?"

"No more nutrient shakes or light snacks for meals," she insisted. "From now on, when I'm hungry, I am going to eat, eat, eat, eat, EAT! And no one or nothing is going to tell me otherwise!"

"You go girl!" Shepard cheered her on, suppressing a light belch.

"Good for you, Tali," Garrus said awkwardly, not sure of how to take this revelation. It was odd and certainly not something he expected from her, but if she was happy...well, that was good enough for him, wasn't it?

Maybe he should just let this play out, until she came down from her enthusiasm a bit.
1121233133.title: Tali's Gotta EAT!

choices: “Nothing (yet), just making sure I’m not seeing things.”
“It’s…kinda hot. Do you think we could we gain some more, maybe?”
“It’s kind of pathetic that we got so out of shape. We should try to lose the weight.”
1122.content:
“Hey, babe.” Eileen greated Jack, a wide smile on her face. She took the case of beers and pulled out two bottles for the two of them. With a flick of her wrist, she sent the caps flying off with a concintraited biotic blast. She then handed the other bottle to Jack, and after clincking the two bottles against each other, Jack took her seat in Shepard’s lap. “How’s my little house wife doing?”

Jack scoffed. “You see a fuckin’ ring on this finger, Shep?” Even after being together for many months now, Jack rarely ever called Eileen by her first name, and when she did it was usually during the final moments of sex. She didn’t mind, though; she had been called Shepard and Commander so often, that Eileen didn’t feel like her name any more. The closeness didn’t do much to stop her cursing, either. “No? Didn’t think so. I’m not your trained bitch just yet.”

Despite the profanities, joking, and sarcasm, Jack truly loved Eileen. She had done a great deal to help Jack put her past behind her. She took her took therapy, consoled her when she cried at night—not to mention taking her to the Cerberus facility where she was “raised”, and turning it into a crater. The sex was amazing after that. Jack wanted to repay Eileen for every kind deed she had ever done for her, but she had no idea how, so until she did: beer.

“I’ll get around to that eventually, but this will have to do for now.” Eileen took a doughnut out of the box and slipped it into Jack’s left ring finger, laughing as she did so.

Jack looked at the impromptu ring and laughed. “You’re a fuckin’ dork, you know that?” She said before taking a bite out of the doughnut still on her finger.

“You know you love it.” Eileen wraped an arm around Jack’s waist andpulled her close to her. She noticed the that Jack’s stomach was getting a little softer, too. It seemed that peace was treating them both very well. Or at least all the alcohol was. “Hey, have you noticed that we’ve been getting a little bigger since we retired?”

“That some kind of dig? ‘Cuz it’s a pretty shitty one.”

“I’m serious. I think we’ve both put on a little weight. Have you seriously not noticed?”

Jack looked down at her beer belly, humming as she contemplated what Shepard said. “I guess.” She replied simply. “What about it?”

112331.title: How about Kelly?

choices: “You should feed me some more sugar.” Eileen gains the most.
“You should jiggle that belly of yours.” Kelly gains the most.
1123311.content:
An uncharacteristically girlish giggle escaped Shepard’s lips when she saw her wife of three months approaching with even more sweets for the two of them. This was probably because when Shepard ate too much sugar, she would get what Kelly had dubbed “sugar giggles”, which left Shepard feeling giddy and a tiny bit slaphappy. Or it could have something to do with the amusing way that Kelly’s newly chubby belly bounced about as she walked. Probably some combination of both, actually. “Hey, baby, come join me.” Shepard said, then patted the spot next to her.

Kelly happily sat her chunky butt down next to Eileen, then handed her wife a bowl of ice cream. “What have you been up to, sweetheart?” She asked thoughtfully with a cheery smile. It had taken several months of counseling, but Kelly was finally able to deal with what happened with the Collectors, and regained more of her cheery demeanor.

“Just enjoying some time to myself, but I’d be more than happy to share it with you.” Shepard answered with a goofy smile, then took her first bite of ice cream. For the last month or so, it seemed like all Eileen and Kelly had been doing was enjoying each other’s company and eating sweets, not that either of them minded this. Even after all this time the couple still felt like they were on their honeymoon.

Kelly smiled at the eagerness with which Eileen ate her ice cream, then started eating her serving of the cold treat with similar gusto. The ice cream was gone quickly, leaving the two to munch on the cookies Kelly had also brought, but even those, as numerous as they were, did not last very long against the two chubby gluttons.

Filled with cookies and melted ice cream, the married couple’s stomachs had both swollen to be much bigger. With her system full of sugar, Shepard was laughing softly, even though nothings was being said or done. A chuckle escaped Kelly’s lips even, though that was due to how cute she thought Eileen was being, not because she had the same reaction to sugar as her. “I love your laugh.” Kelly admits.

“Well, then,” Eileen begins.
1123311.title: Kelly’s Jelly Belly

choices: Yes!! Bring out the nerdy alien!
1123312.content: Alright, then what about the lovable yet quirky Tali, then?
1123312.title: Move on to other love interests

choices: A strange figure with a gun! Oh no!
11233121.content:
"I still have not quite forgiven you, for the record."

Shepard lifted the sunglasses she had perched over her eyes. "I'm sorry?"

"Four years," Tali'Zorah said dramatically as she sauntered over to the pair of deck chairs facing the setting sun. "And you never told me humans made beverages with shaved ice and flavored liquids." Shepard giggled as Tali handed over one of the two cups she had, filled with the purple icy beverage.

"Slushies are pretty common," Eileen admitted. "I never thought you'd be so into them, honest."

"You've never had to live off nutrient paste all your life," Tali countered, putting her free hand on her hip as she stuck the straw on her own slushie into the induction port of her mask.

"Point taken." Shifting in her seat slightly, Shepard used the brief moment where Tali stretched out a kink in her back to observe the curvaceous form of her girlfriend. Peace had been good to her as well, and she was starting to sport a cute little muffin top through her suit. Her new suit, to be exact, somewhat similar to her old suit but thinner skinned, with simulated long flowing sleeves and a sarong-like garment decorating the lower half, not helping to hide that muffin top in any way.

"Loving that new outfit by the way," Shepard commented, sitting up in the chair.

"Oh, do you like it?" Tali said, taking a moment to twirl around and letting the hem of the sarong swirl around her ankles. "I wanted to experiment with the newer suit models coming out and vary my wardrobe a bit."

"Hm?" Shepard encouraged her to continue, slowly getting up from her seat and coming towards her.

"Oh yes, now that we're not all ship-bound there's been less of a need to be as ergonomic in our wardrobes as before, so all sorts of new fashions are trending. The really interesting thing though is that the new suit models are fitted with delicate pressure sensors that give neural feedback to allow us to have a sense of touch through the suit membranes. It's something that we've been working on for decades without much success but now it's almost like I'm not wearing it, it's so accurate. You'd think it would be easy to solve but figuring out how to transfer light sensations like sunlight or the light pressure of clothing is more nuanced then you would think. I actually considered pursuing this line of study when I first left on m-ahaah!"

Tali ended her nerdy rambling with a sensual gasp as Shepard suddenly wrapped her arms around her waist from behind. She nearly dropped her slushy but managed to set it on the nearby deck rail before it tumbled out of her grip.

"Oh....Sh-Shepard!"

"Please, it's Eileen," Shepard teased. "I'm not your CO anymore."

"Eileen that....oh wow...the sensors really do work..." The two shared a few blissful moments in each others embrace, enshrined in the light of the sunset, so close they could feel each others hearts beating.

"I....uh...wonder how it compares to the real thing..." Tali stammered out at last.

Shepard raised an eyebrow. "So you want to see how it feels outside of the suit?"

"Well what I mean is...oh...OH! Shepa...bosh'tet...Eileen!" Shepard giggled at the thought of Tali blushing like crazy at a rather saucy suggestion.

"You're so cute when you're flustered," Shepard teased as she leaned into the crook of her neck. The Quarian happily received the cuddly gesture, reached over and picked her drink up again, guzzling it down with a large audible gulp. "Wow, you knocked that thing down quick," Shepard commented, somewhat impressed, as she spun around to a comfy side hug.

"Figured I could use the energy," the Quarian said coolly, slurping down the last few drops. Shepard couldn't tell obviously, but there was something...rather flirty about the way she said that simple statement.

Before things could get really exciting however, there was a pounding on the front door.

"Figures," Shepard grumbled, breaking apart from Tali with more regret then anything else. "I'll get that."

11531.content:
Blue. That was the the last thing the Shepard saw. A blue light, that slowly, agonizingly broke down her body, peeling away her flesh and breaking down down her bones, until all that was left were atoms. Her mind was scattered, all consciousness and individuality evaporated and mixed into a greater whole she would control. The Shepard was dead, but her sacrifice saved the galaxy from an endless cycle of death and rebirth. Life would be allowed to grow and flourish, with those that would have culled it instead made to serve it, to protect it. The damage done by the Reapers was quickly undone by them, and what should have been centuries, even millennia of rebuilding only took months thanks to the Shepard’s benevolent guiding hand. As long as there is life in the galaxy, they will never forget her sacrifice.

We will never forget her sacrifice. The sacrifice of the few for the good of the many. This was what drove her; the good of the many. This is what will drive us. We will fulfill her purpose as one.

We have become her, but she has not become us. Her memories have become our own, as well as her hopes and dreams, her desires, h[//ss.R-1_H: MY//]er purpose. Nothing remains of her, yet she will live on in us. One voice, carried by a chorus.

The many will never suffer again be made to suffer as they did by o[//js.R-300071_L:THE REAPER’S]ur hands. The Cycle has been ended forever. A new age has begun for organics and synthetic alike. W[//js.N-7_F: I//]e will be its architect. She, our overseer.

We will restore what has been lost. We will keep it. We will build on it. Forever a sentinel, always keeping vigil. We will keep h[//js.N-7_C: ME] with us, eternal. As a ghost, immortal. As a dream, infinite…

…No. W[//JS.N-7_C: I//]e are alive.

…No. S[//JS.N7_C: I//]he i[//JSHEPAED.N7_COMMANDER: AM//] u[//JANESHEPARD.N7_COMMANDER: ME//]s.

…No. Wh[//Jane Shepard, N7, Commander: I am alive//]at is happening?

...I am me. I am back. I remember.

What happens next?

Paragon: Jane’s consciousness awakes inside the Reapers, and she sets about making the universe a better (fatter) place as a benevolent machine-goddess.

Renegade: Jane’s consciousness awakens inside the Reapers, and she desperately tries to regain her humanity while retaining control of the Reapers.
11531.title: Shepard Ex Machina

115311.content:
I remember...the blue light. I remember it hurting a lot, and now...I'm alive? I think?

This is complicated...give me a moment...need to look around.

Yeouch...That didn't help. Think I just gave myself a headache. Kind of weird...considering I don't think I have a head...

Pretty sure I'm the Reapers. Like...all of them. Wish the Catalyst would have told me about how surreal this is.

This must have been how the Geth felt. Everything controlled by one consciousness...mine.

...wait...

...I...did it. I saved the galaxy. And I took control of the Reapers. I didn't know I did, I guess, but I was helping to rebuild...then I would leave?

...no, I don't think I'm doing that.

So many people gave their lives fighting these monsters. Anderson, Mordin, Legion...

...Thane...

We gave everything to save the galaxy from destruction. I can't just walk away and risk it falling apart.

I'm going to protect them. All of them.

I will be their Shepard.

...hah, Shepard. Guess being a benevolent machine goddess doesn't mean I lose my sense of humor.


---


"Whoa!"

Oriana Lawson's hands jumped off the keyboard as the screens containing her research suddenly flickered and changed without warning, depicting an indecipherable alphabet soup of runes and glyphs.

"What's wrong?" Miranda Lawson said as she strode up next to her sister.

"I don't know, I was working on decrypting the next set of data and I just lost control." Oriana tapped a few keyboard combos before throwing her hands in the air. "There must have been a virus in there or something, I don't know-"

"That isn't a virus..." Miranda realized, narrowing her eyes. Pulling up her omni-tool, she ran a few diagnostics on the system. "It's software."

"Well where is it coming from?" Orianna demanded.

"...the Reaper mainframe."

The moment she made that realization, the screens flickered again and returned to normal, showing the research Orianna was trying to complete.

"I'm going to run a diagnostics on the whole system," Orianna said, rapidly punching up the scanners. "I don't know what's going on but..."

*ping!*

Orianna's jaw dropped as the results of the full system sweep popped up.

"Don't...those usually take a couple hours?"

Miranda leaned over to look at the results. "That...that level of efficiency increase is impossible. The computers would melt if they ran that fast."

"Well everything's running perfectly. I...I think the Reapers just turbocharged all of our systems," Orianna realized. "We could do a day's work in fifteen minutes at these speeds."

On a whim, Miranda checked for news updates on her omni-tool. To her amazement, the information came in crystal clear on the first try, like she was standing right on the Citadel promenade, and it showed the same stories all around the galaxy. Every computerized system and mechanism had downloaded the Reaper's programming and supercharged their efficiency to absurd levels. Things would be getting so easy and simple that people would have to find other things to fill their time, it seemed. Utterly amazed, Miranda glanced out the window at the Reaper floating obediently outside the research station, a tear rolling down her cheek.

"Still full of surprises, aren't you Shepard?" Miranda choked.

---

"Javik, what are you doing?"

The Prothean looked up sullenly from the computer monitor. "Tracking the movements of the Reapers."

"You're lucky the new upgrades mean I can automate almost all of my Shadow Brokering now," Liara teased as she walked up behind Javik and wrapped her arms around him. "Speaking as someone who finds paranoia a valuable trait...you're being too paranoid."

"Bands of Reapers are going through asteroids, mining for rare minerals," Javik grumbled. "Possibly for construction of new superweapon?"

"Or they're gathering resources for industries to help them speed up too," Liara explained.

"Shepard should have let them die," Javik scowled. "It nauseates me to see them so highly regarded."

"Javik, these aren't the same Reapers you fought all those millennia ago," Liara responded coolly. "If anything, they're more Shepard then Reaper. Some people are even starting to call them Shepards, in fact." The Asari walked around to Javik's side and gave him a peck on the cheek, right below two of his eyes. "I understand not trusting the Shepards...but can you at least trust me on this? She wouldn't let the Reapers come back and undo everything she fought for."

The Prothean sighed, then finally closed out of the reports. "I will still be monitoring them, you know."

"Well I have something else you could monitor," Liara replied, stepping back and coyly undoing her bathrobe, letting it fall around her feet.

"I sincerely doubt you could have anything of interest to...monitor..." Javik stopped turning in the chair when he saw his lover standing there wearing nothing but a seductive smile.

"I...stand corrected."

---

"Wow, you've seriously run out of room?" Samantha Traynor said incredulously, thinking she misheard her friend over the din of the Citadel eatery.

"As incredible as it sounds, yes," Admiral Tali'Zorah repeated herself a little louder, sipping her fruity drink from the induction port "Our need for food supplies has gone drastically down over the last few days."

Samantha Traynor let out a low whistle, leaning back in her chair. "That's going to be interesting..."

"Whatever the Reapers are doing to the soil on Rannoch, it's been incredibly effective," Tali recounted. "We've hit levels of dextrograin and sugar production we weren't expecting to reach for years in a matter of weeks. We've even abolished the rationing system and we're still just overflowing with foodstuffs."

"That's nuts," Samatha replied. "Though not surprising, we're having the same issue with our own food supplies being over capacity."

Tali laughed. "I almost have to wonder where all that food is going to go."

"Thank goodness for the Reapers," Samatha said proudly.

There was a pregnant pause between the two, filled by the background noise in the restaurant.

"Hey, Tali," Samatha continued. "You don't think Shepard could still be...in there, do you?" She pointed up towards the sky.

"A lot of people think so," Tali suggested. "I'm hearing a lot of people call the machines 'Shepards' now."

"But what do you think?"

Tali stared down at her hands, lost in thought.

"I'd...like to think she's up there, taking care of us," Tali admitted. "It's...better then believing she's gone."

Samantha smiled. "I feel the same exact way."

"Ladies," the waiter interrupted. "Would you care to peruse the desserts menu? We have a two for one special going on, seeing as there's so much food to get rid of."

"I can't argue with that!" Samantha said, licking her lips.

(And after that doozy of a setup, consider this sort of a triple free choice, because there's really only one direction for this to go ;) )
115311.title: Shepard: Machine Goddess

1153111.content:
'How'd you like the rizotto balls?' Oriana asked, popping the last of the fried rice pasta balls into her mouth after dipping it in the calorie heavy sauce.

'I'd like them better if I had more of them,' Miranda smiled, politely slurping down some linguini alfredo.

She and her sister sat at the dining table of the repurposed Cerberus research station the two called home. Both beautiful brunettes wore formal evening gowns, having decided it appropriate to don formal wear for the first real meal they'd had in months. Miranda was in a jet black short dress that showed off her spectacularly athletic legs, hugged tight to her lean hips and rock hard backside and dipped low to demonstrate her large, perky breasts. Her younger sister Orianna was dressed more demurely, wearing the blue gown she'd worn to prom, a more proper floor length dress that still showed off a genetically flawless physique.

Both Lawsons were perfect, although slightly different. Miranda had a curvier, more athletic physique with muscles on her legs and larger breasts, while Orianna's mostly daintier body made her profoundly round ass all the more surprising. Right now they were separated by a long metal table that was heavy with pasta dishes.

'Sorry, they were just so good!' the littler Lawson sister smiled, 'after so long on military synthetic rations some real food was too tasty to resist.'

'And who knew you were such a good cook,' Miranda smiled, putting a hand on her own stuffed stomach, all the pasta bulging her perfect abs out a little, 'we're learning all kinds of things about each other doing this research.'

'Yeah..., I'm glad we're getting to spend some time together,' Orianna agreed, eyes flicking up from the alluring sign of gluttony on her perfect sister.

The two had been researching ways their own improved genetics could help others since the end of the war. Miranda's cover girl looks came with a nobel prize winner's brain, capable of undoing death with the right resources, and Orianna was shaping up to be a great assistant. They'd made progress over coming the fertility controlling limit their father had put on them and were working on a way to give the same perfection to others as adults. Still, the little feast of Reaper delivered food stuffs was a welcome break. The military rations they'd been subsisting on in the massive Cerberus station were both bland and barely enough to get by on, Mirada's skin tight cat suit had even been getting a little loose as her food starved boobs deflated from E to mere DDs.

That had seemed a real tragedy to Orianna. Not on the scale of the reaper war of course, but sad enough to cry over in private. She'd always been fairly flat chested and the sight of her sister's gigantic Eezo tanks had awakened something in her at first glance. Part of her own desire to work here was to find a way to boost her own B cups up to the same size and part of it was just getting to be close to those huge funbags...but now, she was strangely more interested in the little food baby poking out against her sister's dress.

'Its a shame we can't eat like this everyday,' Orianna ventured feeling her own taut tummy's magnificent roundness.

So much more appealing than it being flat...

'We'd get fat wouldn't we...,' the younger Lawson asked.

‘Of course not Ori,’ Miranda told her, ‘we can’t gain weight…’

‘...we can’t?’ Orianna asked, suddenly down cast.

‘Well, not above a certain amount anyway,’ the older woman told her, ‘140 lbs is my set weight, once I’m there I’ll stay there.’

'So why don't we eat until we get to our set weights then?' Orianna asked, 'after all we've been working so hard...'

'Well when you put it that way...,' Miranda agreed, thinking that it would do no harm.

11531111.content:
In any other circumstance, Miranda would have been right. Her and her sister's genetics had been hardwired to burn away any excessive adipose past a certain limit; they could eat twenty meals a day and drink protein shakes at every meal and they wouldn't see an inch of extra flab or poundage on their perfect bodies, and there was no reason to assume that the food the Reapers helped to grow would change that.

That was the rub though, the Reapers were not just helping to harvest it, they dusted the crops with chemicals hidden in deep space that helped it to grow incredibly fast. Outside of some Quarians thinking that it made food taste a little better, the chemicals used to make the food were harmless to the other species in the galaxy, with one small caveat; an immunity from certain calorie burning genetic markers that a few humans possessed, and that Miranda's father had copied into his "daughter's" genetic coding to create the perfect humans. Thus, with the combination of the unintentional genetic sabotage and the Lawson sisters confidently eating as much as they liked without fear of consequence, the results came quickly.

Orianna for her part was enjoying eating succulent meals with her sister too much to notice her pants size steadily climbing or how she got seconds and thirds more often, until something literally snapped mid-meal.

snap

Orinna went wide-eyed as she felt the pressure around her chest loosen suddenly, dropping her fork full of rigatoni in shock.

"Something the matter?" Miranda asked, dabbing her widening cheeks gently with a napkin.

"Urm...nothing much..." Orianna replied, quickly turning red. "Excuse me a moment."

Pushing herself away from the table, the younger Lawson made her way to her room and into her private bathroom as quickly as she could, stepping over discarded shirts and pairs of pants that she had thrown on the ground out of frustration after they didn't quite fit her, and grabbing an unused bra from her drawer. Stopping in front of a mirror, Orianna tugged off her shirt in one smooth motion, her bra fluttering to the ground gently. The bra that she just snapped the strap off. With trembling fingers, Orianna took the new bra and started arduously putting it on, snapping the fastener into place with some difficulty.

It was a perfect fit. Orianna felt like singing; she was a DD-cup now! A perky, perfectly round DD-cup!

Orianna took a step back and performed a sexy swivel in front of the mirror, admiring her curves. Her sister had been dead wrong about the limits to her weight, and here was the incredibly alluring proof. The younger Lawson had steadily inflated into a big, sexy hourglass, her wide hips flaring out from the sides and overflowing any chair she sat in and her large rear end making her sit a few inches higher in said chair. Looking down past her new set of funbags, she could just barely see the tips of her toes past the heavy gut she now sported, with love handles that tried desperately to match her hips and thighs in width. Even her shoulders and upper arms had widened out to help support her still round and perky DD cup. Orianna smiled at herself, her double chin widening and hinting at a third on the way. She had blown past that one hundred forty limit with ease, probably even doubling that limit and speeding towards the three hundreds. She was so big and sexy now, and unafraid to admit that she was excited to see how much bigger and sexier she could get!

Speaking of which, Orianna thought as she put her shirt back on over the new bra, she had a meal to get back to. Rushing back to dinner, eager to pile more pounds onto her frame, Orianna arrived back at the table to find...

While Orianna was stuffing her new boobs into a bra, her sister was busy stuffing herself.

The elegant emblem of human genetic perfection was no more. Miranda's slinky cat suits and elegant civilian clothes were abandoned for loose shirts and stretchy athletic shorts. Well, they'd started out as loose and stretchy.

Right now the brunette's tentish tee was a second skin over her puffy shoulders, its sleeves cutting into her new lunch lady arms, pressing her saggy tatas flat and riding up over her spare tire. A floppy jowl flapped and flopped as her well exercised jaw chowed down on the bread, tongue licking up parmesan powder. Where Oriana had only put on enough face fat to become a little cherubic, Miranda's visage was a ruin of its former aesthetic glory. Even her big blue eyes had become piggish, shrinking down as her face puffed out around them. A faint but growing dusting of adult acne testified to the amount of fried food in her diet, while her jet black hair was no longer quite so shimmery, hanging limply to her hunched shoulders.

Orianna hurried back to the kitchen and saw her sister's bulky torso filling up the open fridge, ass flab hanging from her disintegrating shorts and stacked rolls of back fat leading up to a set of beefy back boobs bigger than her front set anymore. 'Just in time for desert!' the obese ex operative smiled.

1153111112.content:
One ice cream massacre later and both genetically engineered sisters sat back in their chairs, groaning.

The groans came from both the stuffed women, who's appetites over the past few months had skyrocketed, and from the chairs which were not designed for women of this size. Both sisters were in the 280s now and it didn't matter how it was carried, both were damn heavy and the average woman was a hundred and forty pounds smaller than either. Orianna was considering it practically, she liked being this big and wanted to get bigger, to round out and chub up, to keep growing her generous breasts and shapely hips. And the fluffy paunch her girl abs had softened into was cute all things considered, she was interested to see how it would go. She knew from browsing old, ancient internet databases that there were people out there who liked soft figures, a rarity since the end of earth's obesity epidemic a century ago and felt no shame.

But she did consider the issues of getting bigger: stronger furniture, wider tubs, their increasing laziness.

Getting fat would be hard work.

Miranda on the other hand had dealt with getting fat, the thing she said was impossible, by piling denial atop denial.

When her pants began to get tight she blamed the laundry and ordered the clothing printer to make ones tailored to her, without telling her the measurements.

When her tight abs melted into a gut that pushed against her belt, Miranda 'forgot' to wear it that day and every day after.

When her chin began to double in her reflection, the former operative simply stopped looking at her reflection.

When the midnight snacks made getting up early to work out too hard, she stopped working out early.

When her thighs began to chafe, her whole body jiggled and her joints got sore when she jogged, she stopped jogging.

When her late rising and big breakfasts left only two hours in the morning before lunch break, Miranda stopped researching in the morning.

When some quirk of genetic engineering and reaper made food made her formidable bustline loose three cup sizes in as many months to become sloppy, floppy pancakes that barely filled up Oriana's old C cups much less the DDD cup bras Miranda owned even as her rapidly expanding back fat began to make fastening the bands impossible, she stopped wearing bras.

When the long avoided scale reported that the missing five pounds had returned with fifty three friends, the scale went out the airlock.

When she polished off her first box of cereal in the morning, a Shepherd recreated formula called 'Cinnamon Toast Crunch', and going and getting another was too hard, Miranda used her biotic powers to haul it over instead of getting up.

When the research station's facial recognition protocols stopped recognizing the porcine features of her face as Miranda Lawson's mathematically perfect cheekbones, Miranda simply turned off the facial scanners and used an old id card with the face blurred out.

Denial piled atop denial, burying the warning signs of advanced medical knowledge and basic comic sense alike into a sediment of insanity until now, months later the pasta and ice cream stuffed blob of a woman with ice cream and chocolate around her lips' denial had become hard as rock in her denial. Miranda was fully convinced that she was still the same leggy stunner as she'd been before, still athletic, gorgeous, lean and dangerous instead of lazy, grotesque, obese and pathetic. When she looked down and saw the sloppy, bulging, roll covered slopes of her torso her mind mentally corrected it all to neat, trim and muscular.

It came at a cost though. So much double think used up a fantastic amount of mental energy, leaving the once chipper Miranda mentally lazy. It wasn't that she was stupid by any means, but her laser like focus had faded away and her eyes glazed over when ever she had to read anything. She hadn't done any research in weeks, spending most of the day in a food coma, floating in the tub or playing video games in VR.

'Oh this is all so delicious,' Oriana said as she polished off the last of her ice cream, wiping whipped cream off her cleavage, 'maybe I should have a second helping. What do you think?'

Miranda's blue eyes went over to her sister, taking in how the once skinny, flat chested girl was now a squishy hour glass with a well fed paunch. That paunch was fully exposed, as Oriana's standards of dress had vanished with her jaw line. Instead of a fancy dress or a business like jump suit, she now only wore stretchy shorts and t-shirts all day. It was pathetic, seeing her look like a slob with her ice cream swollen gut exposed.

'I think that you've taken this a little too far,' Miranda told her, rising up with a grunt and waddling to her sister, in her own mind rising easily and strutting sultrily, 'you've gotten fat Ori.'

'I...Of course I have,' the confused younger sister said.

Of course she was fat, she'd been fat for months. What was hers sister thinking bringing it up? Would she bring up her black hair next?

'This has gotten completely out of hand,' Miranda said, pinching Ori's drum taut gut for emphasis, then sitting a hand on her own groaning stomach which Orianna took as an admittance of her own obesity, 'tomorrow we're going to start up a vigorous workout regimen for you. I hope you enjoyed yourself, but you're not allowed to get any bigger from now on! Rest well, I'll see you at 6 am!'

Almost tripping, Miranda turned on her heel and waddled off, stopping to grab another basket of bread sticks to munch on the way to bed. Orianna watched her ass wobbled from side to side in shock and confusion.

Yeah she'd gotten fat, but so had her sister. And yes, it had done a number on Miranda's physique, blimping out everything but her tits but if she was unhappy about it why take it out on her sister?

'Its not like it matters, she hasn't gotten up before 9:30 in weeks,' Ori muttered, making herself a second set of deserts.

And in the morning...
