That was something else!

Miranda was wheezing by the time they got to the squats, once her favorite exercise, one she'd spent long hours doing. Just bending and thrusting had been a thrill, feeling her firm booty bounce and flex...now it filled her with dread she couldn't acknowledge, less she have to admit to herself that she wasn't perfect, wasn't fit, wasn't even healthy, that she was just a fat blob who couldn't even exercise.

'Ready?' Orianna asked as her sister staggered under the next bar.

'Urrrrrrr,' Miranda groaned, mind working harder than her body to not let herself recognize the symptoms of being severely out of shape.

'Squat!' her sister yelled, watching the basketball buns of her sister swallowed her workout panties.

Miranda's perfect squat form had gone the way of her perfect figure. Her drop was lazy, uncoordinated and dangerous to her well being, muscles complaining of over strain immediately and her back bent. Her thighs slapped against each other and against her gut and a great wheeze of air went out of Miranda as she tried to stand back up.

'Come on, you can do it!' Ori yelled at her.

'I...I...I...,' Miranda gasped as seams ripped along her panties.
115311111211.title: I guess now's a good time, Strong Fat Miranda

choices: Miranda gets fitter but Orianna makes sure she continues to bulk up and out...
Orianna tries to sabotage Miranda's efforts. Does she succeed?
Sometime later, the Lawsons receive a message...
Meanwhile, in another part of the galaxy..
1153111112112.content:
"...can!" With a cry of exertion, Miranda's large body came upward. She was totally out of breath, covered in sweat and yet...she had done it.

To most, such a thing was a small victory was easily outweighed by the sheer effort it took. For Miranda, however, she took it as a sign. Well, it was more like that the small part of her mind that was still aware of just how big she truly was and the implications there of. Still though, this seemingly insignificant achievement had stirred something.

She wasn't out of shape. No. Out of practice, sure. But she could work with that. Would work with that, in fact.

This almost subconscious resolve was now coupled with the denials that Miranda built up and became something new. Miranda Lawson was still the perfect woman. This proved it and it would keep proving it. With that little change in desire, Miranda became determined to reinforce the feeling of relief and banish the doubts she hadn't allowed to fully materialize.

"Well...not point...in stopping now..." Miranda wheezed with a huge smile breaking out onto her round face.

All the while Ori watched, not sure how to feel about what she had just witnessed...
1153111112112.title: The start of something...

choices: I should see how other familiar faces are doing in this new world.
I should try and contact some of my old friends.
(Instant Gratification Option: Timeskip a couple months!)
1153113.content:
"Mother, you're back!"

"I told you I'd be visiting more often, didn't I?" Samara chuckled as her daughter ran forward and embraced her.

"You did say you had an important mission," Falere pointed out as they broke apart.

"Relatively speaking. Smugglers are hardly a pressing issue anymore."

"You're not slacking off in your duties, are you mother?" the younger Asari teased. "Imagine the scandal if the legendary Justicar was lazy in her quest for justice!"

The two of them shared a laugh as they entered the front doors of the monastery, still bearing battle damage from the Reaper's invasion of Lesuss. It had been one of the many scars left after what the machines did to the Asari that lived here, but thanks to the Shepard's benevolence, the wounds were slowly healing.

"I am glad to see you are coping well," Samara said kindly.

"I've been keeping busy, mother," Falere responded. "Even with the drones made by the Shepards, there's still a lot of damage to repair, and it feels like the crops and plants we grow are coming in every other day."

"You grew your own food here?" Samara asked.

"Not quite, it was mostly done to help control our urges, but whatever the Shepards did has been making our farmland incredibly potent. We barely need foodstuffs from Thessia anymore, but they're still sending us twice as much as before. It's no wonder half of us are turning to eating to control ourselves!"

"It does feel as though food is more commonplace, doesn't it?"

The two shared a laugh, though more subdued as they approached a rather touchy subject as of late. Sure things were wonderful between them; Falere had opened up to her mother in ways she never would have done back in the old days, and Samara had loosened her devotion to the Justicar code so that she could spend more time being a mother then a galaxy-roaming crimefighter, but there was still a notable elephant in the room, and neither woman was willing to broach the subject.

So Falere smiled and didn't pay any mind to the potbelly bulging out the front of her mother's outfit, tried not to feel how wide she was getting when they embraced, and bit her tongue when her mother smiled at her and her puffy face hinted at a double chin. Likewise, Samara looked the other way when her daughter adjusted the dress tightening around her hips, politely ignored the meatiness of her daughter's arms bulging from the sleeves, and feigned deafness when a slight burp escaped her lips.

"Speaking of which, would you care to join us for dinner?" Falere asked her mother kindly. "We've been working on a rather interesting stew, I believe you may enjoy it."

Samara could feel her stomach rumbling already. "I certainly hope so!"

---

"..and they're considering disciplinary charges against me. Me! Can you believe that?" Jack ranted.

"Oddly enough I can," Kahlee Sanders said coolly, still focused on the experiment fluttering across her console.

"Come on, you know I care about these kids and wouldn't actually hurt them, right?" the biotic weapon turned academy instructor insisted. "You just...gotta knock some sense into 'em sometimes."

"You punched that kid through a glass window."

"So? He's a biotic, he barely even got scratched."

"You know parents don't want their kids punched through windows right?"

"Fuck the parents, I-"

"A-ha!" Kahlee interrupted, pointing out a jar on their shared desk-space. Grumbling, Jack fished around in her pockets for a credit chit and dropped it into the jar with a soft clink.

"You totally baited me there," Jack snarled, though a friendly grin was creeping onto her face.

"And you're buying me lunch because of it," Kahlee responded, patting the belly that hung over her belt.

"I'm gonna need to swear more to buy you lunch," Jack shot back, prodding her friend's love handles gently. "Getting soft after the war, eh?"

"Takes one to know one," Kahlee shot back, gesturing towards Jack's own blooming potbelly. Indignantly, Jack tugged her jacket tighter over her exposed navel and mumbled something about hitting the gym after work. "Seriously though Jack, the war's over, you can't get away with manhandling your students like that anymore," Kahlee continued.

"Habits are kinda hard to break," Jack admitted, gesturing towards her stomach again. "As indicated by..."

"Just try and use a softer hand, okay? I'd hate to see you leave, you've been one of the best instructors the Ascension Project has had."

Jack smirked as she reached over to fish around in a large box of donut holes, popping a few into her mouth at once.

"Not planning on going anywhere just yet, blondie."

---

"...and we'll be able to raise the center section by tomorrow and get the holographs up and running the next day."

"Good, I want this place back in business as soon as possible," Aria T'Loak ordered, strolling into the remains of the Afterlife club for the first time since retaking Omega. The scars of battle were almost wiped away as Batarian and Vorcha laborers milled around, working tirelessly to restore the club to its former glory.

"Actually this would be a good time to add some safety features, miss," the contractor piped in, a pudgy Turian female by the name of Sennea. "I was looking at the old plans, and there were definitely some corners cut when the place was built originally. The ring around the center in particular can't support a lot of weight, for instance."

"I don't plan on keeping shipping containers on it, just the dancers," Aria said.

"Yes but you don't exactly want them to fall, do you? Never know what could happen."

Aria stewed, wanting so very much to be irritated with this Turian, but she couldn't deny she had a point.

"Fine, reinforce the ring and anything else you don't find standard. Just don't go breaking the budget, got it?" This was a lie, as money really wasn't an issue for Aria thanks to the fervor she stirred up when she took back her asteroid, but she had to show some sort of control over this Turian or she'd be building a second Citadel.

"You got it!' Sennea said, giving a salute before heading off to continue the job, her backside gently swaying back and forth. Aria wouldn't have noticed...okay she absolutely would have noticed either way, the girl was pretty cute...if her rear didn't seem to be slightly bigger then the last time she saw it.

In any case, that wasn't why she arrived today. That was waiting for her upstairs. Spotting the entrance to what was once her upstairs lounge, she dismissed her guards with a wave of her hand and strode through, heading up the stairs until she reached her loft. The walls still needed a paint job and the old flooring was still there, scorch marks and bullet holes aplenty, but it still had that amazing view of the club floor, the atmospheric controls set at her preferred temperature, and above all...

"It's perfect..."

Aria ran her hand across the surface of the brand new sofa, sadly not the one she had grown to love so much, but just from the feel of it she knew it would be a worthy successor. She lowered herself into the center like a queen entering her throne, crossing her legs and sitting in her usual pose. Then, after a quick glance to make sure no one was spying through the windows, Aria stretched out and undid her belt buckle, letting the gut she had concealed in a very tight outfit spill onto her lap before spreading out her arms and reclining, gently stroking her exposed belly.

"Ahhh...it's good to be back..."

---

So far, so good. Hey, this machine goddess thing isn't too hard after all.

It's nice to be able to take care of everyone this directly.

Though it's kind of weird to see some people starting to worship me.

So...I wonder what else I can get this Reaper tech to do?
1153113.title: Bigger

11531132.content:
The days when a Reaper appearing in the skies over a planet heralding impending doom were, instead the reformed machines brought a sense of serenity and security. Even as a destroyed landed on the surface of Horizon and promptly set about doing nothing at all, not a single person thought anything of it. The presence of the Shepards had been embraced as a simple fact over the years since the Battle of Earth, a sign to everyone that the dark days of the galaxy were behind them. It was this serenity that left Ashley Williams, and indeed many soldiers like her, in an odd place.

After uniting to fight a single common enemy, the many species and factions in the Milky Way were in no hurry to go back to fighting each other. The Geth and Quarians were peacefully coexisting on Ranoch, while the Krogan kept cool relations with both the Turians and Salarians as they reintegrated into galactic society. Even the Vorcha and Batarians were quieter. All this made for a stable galaxy, and a stable galaxy left little to do for the militaries of the Milky Way. Indeed, with no one to fight, there was no reason to maintain the massive fleets and armies that had been fielded to fight the Reapers, and they were slowly dissolved into much smaller, less bloated, more reasonable military forces. This lead to billions of military personnel, both those drafted to fight the Reapers and those that had made a career of soldiering, being relieved of their duty.

That’s how Ashley found herself back on Horizon, as a part of its colonial militia. She knew the planet and its internal politics well enough from all the time she spent on the planet many years ago, and while the Alliance may have no longer needed her service, her Williams blood kept her from simply quietly retiring from the life of a soldier. Still, though she had been given the job — as a Commander, no less — that didn’t mean there was particularly much of a job to do. Aside from some scheduled patrols to maintain a sense of normalcy and control in the rebuilding colonists, there wasn’t much need for the militia. Of course, that had been the case before, right up until the Collectors attacked, Ashley reminded herself as she looked up at the motionless destroyer. It still hadn’t moved since it landed an hour ago, and it was starting to make Ashley feel a little antsy. If it really was Shepard controlling the Reapers, like so many seemed to believe, then Ashley knew the machines would be filled with noting but good intent, just like the woman herself, however she also knew it was always best to err on the side of caution.

Though she was off duty, and watching the destroyer from a distance, Ashley was just about to go inside and armor up to investigate it when Samantha Traynor exited their prefab home to join her on the balcony, data pad in hand. The retired comms. specialist now ran monitored communications for the militia, and though she never had the hardened physique of combat personal while serving on the Normandy, her figure had grown even softer in the years since she had returned to her homeworld. Yet as Samantha speedily waddled over to her partner, Ashley’s attention was drawn to her distressed expression she wore rather than the oh so alluring way her belly bounced in her uniform.

“Hey, what’s—” Ashley began, but wasn’t allowed to finish her thought, as Samantha forcefully handed the data pad over to her.

“You need to read this.” She said firmly.

Puzzled by the unusual forcefulness from the specialist, Ashley looked down at the screen and did as she was told. Or, she tried to, at least. “Yeah, this just looks like a bunch of squiggles to me, Sam. You’re gonna have to read it to me.” She tried to crack a smile, but it couldn’t hold up in the presence of her partner’s serious demeanor.

“It’s Reaper code,” Samantha explained as she snatched the data pad back, “a new variant of it, as well. That destroyer is broadcasting across the planet.”

“So? Isn’t that just something they do now?” Ashley didn’t really understand why Samantha was making such a big fuss over this, and wished she would just cut to the case. She knew Samantha thought she looked cute when she was confused, but if this was as urgent as she was acting like it was then this was not the time for dramatic pauses.

“Not like this. They’ve been sending data, updates, information we can decrypt and use, but this new code is different. They don’t want just anyone crack it. It’s meant for someone specific. Me.”

“Wait… the Reapers are sending you secret messages? How do you know? Why would they even do that?”

Samantha shook her head. “The Reapers aren’t sending it. The key to crack the code is C1-G5.” When Ashley continued to loom at her in confusion she could tell she needed to elaborate more. “C1 and G5 are positions on a chessboard, and they are very special to me. Only one person knows their significance.”

“Sam, come on, out with it already!”

“My king was on G5, and a bishop moved to C1 putting me into checkmate.” Samantha couldn’t help but chuckle at how ludicrous it all sounded, still not fully believing her conclusion herself. “It was the only time Shepard ever beat me at chess, and the last game we played before…”

Ashley’s mouth hung agape. Did that mean… Jane was still alive? Somehow controlling the Reapers just like people said? “Wh-what did it say…? When you decoded it?”

After typing in some code, Samantha turned the data pad around so Ashley could see the decrypted message on the screen. It was only one word. A question. One that convinced her that this really was a message from Shepard.

“Rematch?”

What does this revelation mean for Shepard and her friends?

Samantha is able to use the code to create a two-way connection, making it possible for Jane’s friends to communicate with her directly!

Unfortunately, they find that the communication is only one way, but at least Shepard can let her friends know that she’s all right, and that she’s still looking out for them.
11531132.title: Schism.

choices: "The Quarians are pretty tech-savvy. Why don't we get Tali in on this?"
"I bet Liara and Javik could make sense of some of this. Let's call them."
"Who do you think would know where to start?" (free choice)
115311323.content:
The realization that Jane might be alive up there dropped like a bombshell. As Samantha took her data pad back to peruse through the code, Ashley staggered backwards, dropping heavily into her chair.. In spite of herself, she laughed through the tears streaming down her cheeks.

"I...I just got over her being gone," Ashley choked, taking a deep gulping breath. "And now here she comes strolling back again, just like she did on Horizon. Damn it, Shepard..."

"Well she's not exactly strolling back," Samantha admitted, turning around more of the code to show her. "Unfortunately like most everything we've been getting from the Reapers it's been a one way street. I don't exactly see how we can communicate with...wait where are you going?"

Without warning, Ashley had all but jumped out of the chair, turning on her heel and heading right out the door. Samantha waddled behind her, already out of breath, and exited the prefab just in time to see Ashley raising her assault rifle in the direction of the landed destroyer.

"Ashley what are you-"

Samantha winced as a burst of automatic fire pierced the calm air, matched by metallic ricochets off the thick outer hull of the landed Reaper vessel. The destroyer shifted in its position but did not otherwise move or react to the wild weapons fire. Samantha on the other hand stomped up and punched Ashley in the shoulder, a move to which the seasoned combat veteran barely flinched.

"Have you gone insane?" Samantha nearly shouted at her. "Firing at a Reaper! You're going to get us killed!"

"Chill, you said Shepard's controlling them," Ashley placated her. "I was just establishing a dialogue."

"By going full Blasto on her?"

Samantha's data pad suddenly blipped, indicating something new had been sent. The communication specialist furrowed her brow and plugged in the decoding variables she used before and looked at the resulting message.

"Well?" Ashley said expectantly.

"...nice shooting, Ash." Samantha turned her data pad around to show her the message. Ashley smirked, patting the side of her rifle proudly.

"Establishing a dialogue," she said with a wink.

---

Shortly after Ashley introduced herself by going Rambo on the Reaper, Samantha's data pad was flooded with new information from the same source as the two personal messages, forcing the two girls back inside to start decoding it. Or rather, forcing Samantha to start decoding it; Ashley on the other hand still had some raw emotions to deal with and had meandered into the kitchen to track down some comfort food and sate her emotional state. By the time Ashley had gotten into the rhythm of the decoding and translating, Ashley had returned to the communication center, two quarts of ice cream stacked on top of one another in her hands while she dug into the top one with a spoon.

"Got you some mint chocolate," Ashley said thickly, passing the bottom quart and a spoon to her partner.

"Thanks." Samantha popped the top off and took a big scoop to start with, her focus entirely on the information streaming in. The chair across from her creaked ever so slightly as Ashley and her hips plopped down into it. "This is pretty intense stuff."

"What's she saying to us?" Ashley asked.

"Well I can glean parts of it." Samantha tapped a few buttons to bring up some diagrams and charts. "Most of what she's sending us right now looks pretty ancient. Prothean tech maybe, but it's definitely tech. I think she wants us to try and build something, and since most of this looks like it functions on the same principles as some of the communications tech I work with, it may be something to help her talk to us directly."

Ashley could feel tears coming on again and stuffed strawberry shortcake ice cream into her mouth to quell it. "Well, what are we waiting for then? Let's put it together and say hi."

"Did you miss the part where I said this is super ancient advanced tech?" Samantha reiterated. "There's no way we can make this thing on out own. I don't even know where to start on this."

Ashley pursed her lips, swirling the melting ice cream idly with her spoon.
115311323.title: I think I get it but here's the next part anyway.

choices: "Hey Jack, I see you brought the booze!"
11531133.content:
The galaxy had known war and conflict for so long that many felt the new peace wouldn't last, even if it was enforced by the Shepards. Yet as impossible a pipe dream as a galaxy without war was, after nearly half a year even the cynical were beginning to feel hopeful about the future. With the Shepards fueling the rebuilding, the major powers at the center of the galaxy had unleashed a golden age of peace and prosperity that spread throughout the known universe, and as those empires rose to new heights, others joined them in that lofty tower. The Krogans went through a cultural revolution that proved there was more to them then being mindless fighters, and the Batarian government was overthrown by a new meritocratic democracy, bringing a semblance of law and order to the farthest flung reaches of Citadel space. Both new empires would join the Citadel alongside the Quarians, whose homeworld had been restored to its former glory thanks to the Shepards, and as the farthest reaches of space were touched by the new peace, it seemed like the Galaxy was heading towards a period of true unity, in a universe that was getting smaller and smaller by the day.

The Shepards were the instruments of the new peace, but they were also the instruments of a new quirk of life in this united galaxy. The machine goddess driving them had a desire to take care of the universe she left behind, sharing the arcane tech of the Reapers with the public, mechanizing hard labor and unpleasant jobs, suppressing criminal elements, and providing the materials to ensure no one lived in poverty or squalid conditions. And perhaps because of the pre-goddess Shepard's own experiences seeing the toll starvation took on people, the Shepards always ensured food was plentiful and that no one would go hungry under her care. Shepard offered the galaxy unlimited abundance and leisure, and the people happily accepted. Sure a few were concerned as people got lazier, their stomachs swelling and their buttons popping off as they lived in this new world, but they soon melted away. After all, what was a couple dozen pounds or so compared to a peaceful, almost utopian galaxy that they all lived in?

In short, the universe may have been getting smaller...but it was also getting bigger.

---

When the war ended and Shepard was declared "missing in action", Ashley Williams was surprised when Shepard's will stated that the apartment on the Citadel would go to her. It was a nice place, but it felt wrong to try to make it her home, so instead she went to Shepard's companions and friends with an idea; every year, on what would have been Shepard's birthday, they would meet at this apartment and throw a fun party in her memory, so as to keep her spirit alive (so to say, Ashley didn't even pretend to understand what Shepard being part of the Reapers meant these days). The others agreed to it readily, and now that today was the big day, Ashley was actually kind of excited to see everyone again, and to see the apartment the center of a great party once again. It'd be just like old times...even though the apartment did feel a lot smaller than before.

The party technically began in less than an hour, but people had already arrived to start filling up the room so Ashley positioned herself near the front to see if she could catch anyone familiar, grazing one of the many dozens of snack trays scattered around the room. She was glad there was only the one entrance; with all the buddha bellies and wide hips in here, you couldn't exactly see through the crowd. Taking a moment to crowd watch, Ashley's eyes darted between all the exposed love handles, torn seams, and double and triple chins adorning the guests as they chatted and snacked with one another. Aside from the occasional alien with weird metabolism, there probably wasn't anyone here who wasn't comfortably obese at this point. Nothing really wrong with that though; Ashley was herself on the larger end of the spectrum, but if the alternative to that was fighting and dying against a bunch of genocidal machines, Williams would wear these chins like badges of honor.

Right before she started to work on the snack platter with both hands, Ashley caught a familiar face coming in and, with a great huff, waddled towards the door to say hello.

121.title: Ashley Williams

1211.content:
Set after ME1 and before ME2.

I’m actually surprised that he hasn’t noticed already, you’ve already put on close to 25 pounds in a span of two months, Williams.” Doctor Chakwas replies while looking at her computer.

“Yeah, I just don’t know how he’ll react though, he’s always into completing missions. You think me being fat would stress him out too much?” Ashley asks while looking down at her body which had expanded in the last two months so much that her fleet-issued outfit was looking extremely snug on her. All in all, her whole body had softened causing her to not exactly look pregnant, instead just that she had gained weight and quite a bit went to her middle. Her stomach had swollen out while her hips, thighs and breasts had each puffed out about equally.

Shepard steps in and inform his crew of some R&R...

“Hey you two, just wanted to inform everyone about the 5-day break we’ll be having starting today as soon as we dock at the Citadel.” he informs them.

“Wow, what brought this decision to fruition?” Chakwas asks.

“Just figured that everybody was deserving of a break, so here it is.” Shepard responds while leaning back against a wall and loosely folding his arms across his chest.

“That’s pretty generous of you, Commander” Ashley speaks up with a smile.

“Yeah, I thought so too.” he replies while waving to them and walking out of the doctor’s quarters.

Due to the gained weight, her armor was starting to be a real pain to get in and out of and she was almost getting to the point of requesting lighter duty. One of the only reasons she hasn’t yet is because she believes that if she does Shepard will think she has let herself go and is becoming lazy, and she doesn’t want anything remotely close to that to go through his mind. While not aware to Ashley being pregnant, he was fully aware, as was the rest of the crew, to her weight gain. He didn’t mind the added weight and truthfully he kind of thought the weight was making her look more beautiful as the days and weight went on. So he chose not to bring it up at all while it didn’t seem to him that she was worried about it.
1211.title: Weird Williams curse.

choices: This path leads to som Liara weight gain.
12111.content:
While Liara makes her way to the diner, Ashley is just leaving it after eating her way to satisfaction with her doubts about whether she should tell Shepard about the weight gain curse her family might have. She finds her way to a bench in front of the Presidium and decides to just relax for a few and observe her surroundings. Unbeknownst to her, her stomach had forced her shirt to become untucked in the front from it’s slight expansion during her recent meal on the Citadel.

“You know, if I keep up at this pace, he’ll just think that I’m getting pregnant.” Ashley tells herself as she pokes her stomach a couple times and pulls down her shirt in vain because it slides back up after she gives up. “That’d be a laugh…” she continues,

she then decides to head out to Flux, the casino area here on the Citadel. While on her way there she passes by the diner again and notices Liara inside with a good amount of food and empty trays in front of her.

“Geez, what is she trying to do?” she wonders but doesn’t stop to ask. “Whatever it is, I’m not getting in the middle of it.” she tells herself and keeps on her way to the Normandy while subconsciously pulling her shirt down slightly.
12111.title: The Citidel R&R.

choices: Two years of depression and stuffing herself pass when Ashley sees Shepard again
Ashley meets someone on Horizon that helps her move on.
Ashley meets someone on Horizon that only reinforces her bad eating habits.
1212.content:
A firm, callused hand gripped Ashley’s pert breast while a muscular arm wrapped around her trim waist from behind. “I love you, Ash…” Shepard had whispered huskily into Ashley’s ear. It was the first and last time Shepard would tell her that. Mere moments later the Normandy was attacked by a massive unknown alien ship that completely decimated the SR-1, and the Commander was killed getting Joker to an escape pod. The reports claimed that the hero of the Citadel died a painless death, killed instantly when thrown against a wall by an explosion, but Ashley knew the truth. The short range communicators in their helmets were still working, and she could hear the frantic gasps for air, followed by screams as Shepard was being cooked alive by the heat of entering the atmosphere of the planet below.

The memory was too painful, so Ashley forced it down by forcing a cupcake down her mouth. It was made with rich chocolate batter, covered with a raspberry buttercream frosting, and topped with a fresh raspberry: absolutely delectable. With the tasty treat devoured, the soldier balled up the wrapper, then threw it into the trash. Swish, three points. Sighing, Ashley stood up from the table in the small prefab she was staying in while stationed on Horizon, and walked over to the locker where she stored her arms and armor. Unlocking it, Ashley her Phoenix X armor and began to put it on, noticing a new snugness to it as she did. “Damn it; i need to lay of the sweets…” Ashley grumbled to herself, but it wasn’t really just the sweets that caused her figure to softened; t was all the comfort eating making her plump up.

Pretty much the only thing Ashley did in her free time was snack on anything that made her feel better. The trash in the corner of the room filled with the wrappers, bags, and boxes of junk food almost faster than she could stay on top of. Potato chips, candy bars, bonbons, pretzels, and of course cupcakes made up her diet, and who could know what she would be having for lunch. It made Ashley sick to think what would happen if she kept eating like this, but to her, so long as it kept her from thinking about Shepard.
1212.title: Comfort eating.

1213.content:
1. Ashley is still feeling guilty over all but turning on her lover. Discovering his preference for larger women presents an opportunity to give him what he has deserved for some time now.

2. Ashley enters into a relationship with an Asari who happens to be an incredibly good cook.......a little too good maybe.

3. Maybe you prefer the recovery weight idea. Just throwing more ideas out there.
1213.title: More options

choices: Go to Shepard first, make amends and get him in on her gain.
Start looking for ways to gain immediately. Maybe get some help?
Before Ash can do anything, she gets a visitor...
12131.content:
To say that Ashley Williams felt miserable was an understatement.

With the Reapers defeated, things that she'd tried to distance herself from were allowed to catch up with her. There were quite of few: the pain her sister had gone through, the devastation of Earth, the sheer loss of life but at the forefront of her mind was John Shepard. Shepard was currently in the hospital, having been found near dead after the final battle. She had it on good word that he'd recover, those cybernetics that Cerberus had used on him truly saved his life. It'd be a while but he'd eventually get back on his feet.

As much as Ashley was glad for that, it reminded her of just how much she messed up their relationship and that she'd missed what they had had. Looking back on it, all the things she said, that she did...it made her sick. She had sounded so paranoid and had been unfair. Every turn she questioned, doubted Shepard. She had even accused him of being a traitor. The memories of that gnawed at her, even now.

Despite that, Shepard had stayed civil and even kind towards her. When that Cerberus A.I. had sent her to Huerta, Shepard always made it his business to come see her. Reconnect with her, bring her a book from her favorite poet. Even when she even pulled a gun on him during the coup, he could have just shot her but instead talked to her. Believed in her.

And she’d given him nothing but betrayal.

‘Well not anymore,’ Ash thought, resolutely.

She was going to make it up to him and she knew just how. After Shepard and her had officially gotten together, Ash had discovered a few magazines that had contained ladies of a...larger variety. Much larger. Naturally, she’d confronted Shepard about it and him, being the honest, upright man that he was, he had come clean. He had stated that it was a preference but that was it and it didn’t change anything between them. Ash had let the matter drop but now it was going to be her ticket to making things right again.

‘If I have to get to size of dreadnought to get my man back then that’s all there is to it!’

But what should she do first?
12131.title: Ash's journey begins...

choices: Days pass, and Ashley is starting to puff up.
A whole month passes, and Ashley sure is loving that food.
Time passes, and both lovers are enjoying some extra rolls.
12132.content:
Ashley let out a long sigh as she crossed the threshold into her house, her sight blinded temporarily by the sunset shining through the windows. Doffing her coat, she tossed it onto the rack and rolled her stiff neck around; whoever said that a desk job was cushy and comfy was a damned liar.

Okay so technically it wasn't a desk job. Running security for the Systems Alliance embassy on Thessia meant she spent a lot of time on location going over patrol details and bodyguard rosters to ensure important diplomats and politicians were protected from anyone with a bright idea, but compared to running around fighting robot squids in space, it was by all accounts more of a desk job if anything else. Still, who would have thought years after the Reaper threat united the galaxy that there would still be nutjobs running around?

"Ashley you're home!" came a voice from the kitchen, along with a clanking series of pots.

"So are you!" Ashley called back, smiling. "I thought you were working late tonight."

"I wanted to surprise you!" the voice called back in a sing-song tone. "Plus I'm meeting with my therapist the day before you're doing the security detail for the Alliance president, so I wouldn't see you for a bit."

"Only a few days," Ashley pointed out, walking into the dining room of her spacious apartment. She turned to face her wall of medals, slightly adjusting one diploma so it would be straight, when a pair of blue arms suddenly wrapped around her waist.

"Yes, but for your species it must feel like an eternity," Aeian T'Goni teased her. "I know it feels like that for me."

Ashley giggled, turning around and locking lips with her lover in a tender embrace. She was right, it did feel like an eternity when she was away from her. In fact, Ashley didn't know how she managed to live before she met Aeian. She met her when she was still at the Huerta Memorial Hospital recovering from PTSD and they managed to make some light conversation, comparing their experiences dealing with their personal trauma and helping one another to cope with the ongoing war. The therapist said that Ashley had been enormously helpful in helping the poor Asari heal, and when she bumped into her on Thessia years later, it felt like she was right. Like Ashley, Aeian had retired from the service and had taken up an administrative position at a medical center, and she had come a long way from her days at the hospital, where she said that Ashley had really helped her recover from her phobia of humans. Needless to say the two reconnected quickly, only to find out they saw one another as more then just friends, and before you could say "embrace eternity", here was the most beautiful Asari in the universe moving into Ashley's apartment.

"Well, do you want to go out tonight?" Ashley said at last, coming up for air from the passionate embrace.

"Actually..." Aeian said cautiously. "I made dinner tonight."

Ashley blinked in surprise. "You cook?"

"Yes...my therapist recommended a course to help me on my bad days," Aeian explained, trotting back into the kitchen. "I specialized in some human courses, figured it would help with my phobias and I thought you might like them!"

"I like Asari cuisine fine, you know."

"Well I'll take that course next!" Aeian laughed. "Go ahead and take a seat, I'll bring out the dish."

Ashley smiled as she pulled up a chair and dropped down heavily, glad to finally be off her feet again. She was actually somewhat excited for this; she hadn't had a home-cooked meal in quite some time. It felt like she was leaving mostly off of restaurants and junk food the past few years; frankly it was a miracle she was still relatively fit. Sure she had a slight bulge to her stomach since she started seeing Aeian, but that was probably because they went out for dinner so often. It hadn't been the first time a relationship had added a few inches to her waistline. Maybe a nice classic meal would be just what the doctor ordered.

Within moments a delicious smell emanated from the kitchen, and Aeian entered the room again, holding a steaming dish in front of her.

"I just tried something simple to start with, a sort of casserole made of noodles, Earth meats, and various cheeses and seasonings for a bit of 'alien flare', as the teacher called it," Aeian explained, scooping a nice serving for her girlfriend. "Might need a little bit more Ginarian thestleroot..." Ashley, always the marine, grabbed her fork and took a healthy bite of the casserole, slowly chewing it as her Asari lover looked on nervously.

"If it's not any good, we can order out..." Aeian suggested.

"Actually, it's pretty great!" Ashley said brightly, greatly enjoying the familiar, savory taste. "Very hearty, reminds me of what my dad would make for us." She took another big bite to prove it. "Might even go 'fer seconds!"

Aeian, her eyes glowing, served herself a portion as well. "If you want to try some more, I made an attempt at baking as well. I made something with chipped chocolate in it."

"I'd love to," Ashley said, repressing a giggle. "I can't wait to try more stuff you make."

The pair of them shared a loving look, then tucked into dinner properly.
12132.title: Option 2

choices: Ashley and Aeian make a BIG decision together!
Ashley and Aeian just get BIG!
121323.content:
Ashley would have never thought she'd be able to re-adjust to civilian life post-Reapers. She was a soldier, descended from a long line of soldiers, practically born and raised to march with rifle in hand into the heat of battle. And yet, this new life of hers, a life that a younger Ashley would have been bored to tears having, was just something she couldn't imagine going without. It was just so blissful, coming home at the end of the day from a job well done and not having to worry about any ongoing war, Reaper or otherwise, not having to worry whether or not she wouldn't come back when she left tomorrow for another day on the field. She almost felt spoiled, and the lazy afternoons spent with Aeian over a home-cooked meal certainly helped.

Aeian in fact fit in so perfectly into the new routine that you'd think she had been here for years. With her loving girlfriend's support, she had made good progress with her therapy, even getting a big promotion at the medical center. Sadly this meant longer hours and a little less time spent together every night, but it gave Ashley the chance to surprise Aeian with a home-cooked meal of her own when her Asari lover came home after a rough day. This ended in predictable disaster since Ashley's culinary experience mostly boiled down to making an MRE edible, but after ordering out Aeian told her how much she appreciated the gesture and promised they could learn to cook together. And they did, finding their mutual interest in the culinary arts to be a wonderful thing to bond over and just strengthened their bond even further.

In short, Ashley loved everything about her life, especially the wonderful woman she dreamed about before waking up every morning. This particular morning, Ashley had a wonderful vision of the two of them together on a beach underneath two setting suns when the actual sunlight stirred her. Yawning, Ashley's first conscious observation was the other side of the bed being empty. It was the weekend so neither of them had work today, though the distant sound of the shower and the steam floating out from under the bathroom door frame hinted at where she was. Her second observation is that it was rather chilly today; shivering slightly, she heaved herself to her feet and shouldered into the steam-heated bathroom, immediately starting to sweat.

"Woof, it's like a sauna in here!" Ashley called out, fanning herself.

"Good morning to you too," Aeian teased from inside the source of the steam, her hair tendrils just visible over the top of the shower wall. "It is rather cold out today though, maybe something warm for breakfast?"

"You can't go wrong with a nice big bowl of porridge on a cold day," Ashley recounted, waving away steam as she made her way to the sink.

"That's the grain mixed with milk and water, right?"

"The very same. Mix it with some sugar and strawberries and a hot cocoa on the side, it's just the thing for a start on a cold day."

"Oh that sounds heavenly," Aeian swooned.

"Tell me about it," Ashley sighed wistfully, rubbing mist of the mirror with the palm of her hand. They talked about food a lot nowadays, and looking at her own reflection, Ashley could sort of see why.

The boy shorts and tank top she slept it were practically skintight and left nothing to the imagination for all the wrong reasons now. A belly that could fill a salad bow perpetually hung over her waist, accompanied by nice thick love handles that flowed down to her flabby thighs. Sighing, Ashley pressed a hand underneath her formerly angular chin, now rounder and a little puffy to match her waistline as the shower turned off, the volume in the room dropping considerably. Sidestepping onto the electronic scale set up in the corner, she stretched her neck slightly so she could just about see the magic numbers.

"Two freakin' forty..." Ashley grumbled. "Hell, I really got fat."

Bare feet padded across the tiled floor and Ashley felt a hand on her shoulder as Aeian looked down at the number too.

"Oh, no. What an utter tragedy," Aeian said dramatically, leaning into her girlfriend so their guts pressed together. "I can't ever imagine what that's like...being so rotund like you are."

The two of them shared a laugh that made them jiggle ever so slightly, treating Ashley to a similar display of adipose on her girlfriend. They shared a gut hanging in front of them, though Aeian's was a bit wider and while she had a towel wrapped around her top, her upper body had clearly swollen a bit from her sudden growth, her thick chin even doubling ever so slightly when she turned her head in the right direction, to say nothing of the twins hanging below it. Ashley had mentioned before that people in love tended to gain weight, and if that was indeed true, this HAD to be true love at this point. It would explain why it didn't seem to bother either of them that they were really starting to balloon.

"Well, I'm going to go bundle up and get started on breakfast," Aeian decided. "Unless you want to take a shower."

"Nah, I showered last night, I think I'm..." Ashley started to say, before she became tongue tied at the sight of Aeian's towels lying on the ground around her legs. "Oh. OH!"

"It's nice and warm in here, too," the Asari grinned. "I'm sure it'll...wake you up."

Oh god, that pushed every button Ashley had. "Really, right now?"

"Well, to be blunt, if this keeps going," Aeian pointed out, hefting one of her love-handles. "I think it'll be a tight squeeze."

Ashley had to be cherry red at this point. For whatever reason, the idea of the shower being too small for their...ahem...purposes was...very interesting. Not that Ashley gave too much thought as she was taken by the hand and led back to the shower.

Blissful. Just blissful. Before descending into ecstasy, as you do, Ashley wondered what life would bring her next.
121323.title: Carefree and Corpulent

1213232.content:
"Sorry, I'm late, had a quick errand to run," Ashley said hurriedly, huffing as she dashed into the kitchen. She paused, taking a deep whiff of the delightful smells filling the kitchen.

Aeian slipped the finger out of her mouth that she used to sample her cooking and turned to give a glowing smile. "You're right on time, actually. Would you like to help with this? The coating for the Kyrinian chops still needs to be made."

"Oh, don't mind if I do!" Ashley quickly made her way to the counter, grabbing a bowl that needed mixing and peppering it with the right ingredients before bashing it to bits with the whisk.

"Careful, you're going to break the bowl," Aeian laughed, walking up behind her girlfriend.

"Oh...sorry..." Ashley let out a nervous laugh. She resumed her pounding with the whisk before her Asari lover wrapped her arms around her, the chub on Aeian arms slightly compressing against her own as she took her hands and demonstrated the correct, gentler movement.

"Nice and easy, like this," Aeian said gently, removing her hands to let Ashley take over. "That's it...you're doing great." Leaving a gentle kiss on the inside of Ashley's neck, Aeian squeezed her a little tighter, swaying on the spot, before returning to the cooking again. The cooking finished up with the usual amount of lessons, kisses, and hugs exchanging between the two, though Ashley seemed somewhat distracted, like she was expecting something, and soon enough another feast was finished, one which the two were eager to sink their teeth into. Lowering themselves into their seats, Aeian dug in with gusto, but faltered when she saw Ashley hadn't taken a bite.

"Something wrong?" Aeian pressed gently.

Ashley let out a choked sigh, staring at her plate with the air of a student hoping the paper she's getting back was a pass. Taking a deep breath, the portly former soldier pushed herself up from her chair, her hand digging through her jacket pocket.

"So...uh...." Ashley started. "I...tried to look up how Asari do this, because I didn't want to be offensive and stuff, but the information was conflicting, and I couldn't get a straight answer, but I wanted it to be special, and...well..."

Aeian stared, not used to seeing her girlfriend quite so disoriented and unsure as she dropped onto her knee. What exactly was she doing?

"I guess if you...well, we can maybe do it your way, that is if you WANT this..." Ashley meandered, taking something out of her pocket and tumbling it over in her hands.

"Are you...talking about a human custom I'm not aware of?" Aeian asked wearily. Ashley swallowed, her nerves steeled from fear-driven courage, and responded with what little vigor she could muster.

"Yes, I am!" Ashley said loudly, holding up the small thing in her hand and opening it up. Inside was a beautiful ring, glistening Turian rhinestone set in gold. "This is how humans...ask to marry one another."

"Ah, yes the down-on-one-knee custom, I'm familiar with-"

Something clicked, and Aeian suddenly realized what was going on in front of her. Her blue face paled in shock as she looked between the ring and her girlfriend, and then, inexplicably, she began to laugh.

"Oh....Ashley, I wish I knew..."

"Knew what?" Ashley asked, looking crestfallen.

"That you got the blue." Aeian, who had done some research of her own, pulled a box out of her pocket and opened it up. "I would have gotten yours in a matching color," she said, tears of joy streaking down her cheeks.

-----

Asari weddings, as it turned out, were nowhere near the lavish affairs that human ceremonies entailed (or maybe they were, because the author can't find anything about how Asari weddings work). Ashley of course didn't mind, she could have been married in the bottom of a garbage dumpster and it would still be the happiest day of her life, but it turned out to be a wonderfully little ceremony all the same. Sure the fact that neither of them could fit into their dress uniforms without a giant potbelly hanging out put a damper on things, but with a cute set of matching dresses they soldiered on, their hands clasped together underneath a sacred tree in a secluded grove, only inhabited by the couple, the priestess, and one guest each to bear witness to the love they shared, as Ashley was told. Her choice may have been a little too obvious, as the young priestess was somewhat flustered to see who Ashley invited.Still, the ceremony was perfect, absolutely everything Ashley could have wanted, sealed with a loving kiss.

"Be one in the eyes of the goddess," the priestess concluded, bowing her head ceremonially. Breaking apart with hands held, the new couple stepped out from underneath the tree to the sound of a high-pitched wail. Aeian had warned Ashley that her childhood friend Sega V'tiari was a touch emotional, but it still surprised her when the tall Asari jumped on them to give a giant hug, openly weeping.

"I'm s-s-so happy for you t-two!" Sega sobbed, squeezing into their fleshy bodies and nuzzling their necks one after the other. "You're just so cute together I can't stand it, aaaaaah!" Breaking off the hug suddenly, Sega ran off in tears of joy, arms over her head, leaving Ashley's guest to hobble up, still recovering from her second near-death experience.

"Congratulations, you two!" Jane Shepard said brightly, her puffy eyes betraying her otherwise stoic expression. "You'll forgive me if I don't jump on you and start shrieking."

"One is quite enough," Aeian laughed as Shepard approached them and pulled them into a hug of her own, one after the other. "I hope you'll be staying for the after-party?"

"Well, the doctors advised me not to, still recovering and all that..."

"So you're going then." Ashley said.

"You know it, sunshine," Shepard smirked.
1213232.title: They Do

choices: Just then Shepard entered the lounge, worried about the drunk Quarian squad mate
Tali takes to binge drinking to deal with her stress, gaining her a beer belly.
Tali thinks of an idea to thank Shepard after a few more rounds.
122.content:
Tali winced at the sound of an empty bottle hitting the floor of the Normandy’s lounge. Now, to anyone else, the sound of glass hitting metal wouldn’t have necessarily been cringe worthy, but after twelve rounds of Turian brandy, things tended to get…intense for the drinker.

“Shhh, you little bosh’tet!” Tali hissed in the direction of the bottle, holding a finger up to her mask. The young Quarian’s day had already been rough enough and she didn’t need any of the bottle’s shit. It was a good thing Garrus was near by, just in case the bottles tried to pull anything.

When the bottle stopped rattling Tali made a move for a new, full bottle, primed for drinking with an “emergency induction port” already in it. Reaching out a three fingered and, Tali starched towards the other end of the bar and began to lean in her seat. When her finger finally wrapped around the bottle, Tali’s body was at full extension and she lost her alcohol hindered balance, causing her to fall onto the floor. At least she managed to keep her drink from spilling.

“Bosh’tet artificial gravity…why are you such a bosh’tet?” Tali complained as she attempted to move into a upright sitting position with little avail. As she rocked herself back and forth, Tali looked a bit like a turtle that had been flipped on its back. After about a minute of struggling she finally gave up and laid still flat on her back.

Why does everything have to happen to me? Tali thought, recollecting on the events of the day. First she was accused of treason,then she found her father dead, she would have been exiled if it weren’t for Shepard, and now she was under attack by gravity.

A warm feeling began to well up in Tali’s belly at the thought of Shepard sticking up for her. How she could ever repay the Commander for that kindness was beyond Tali. Even joining her suit with Shepard seemed sufficient enough. At least Kasumi was kind enough to let Tali have the Lounge to herself while she thought things over…and drink her brains out, but Tali would have managed that on her own without the bar.

Perhaps she’d be able to think of something when she was sober, but that was a problem for a later time. For now, she had another ten rounds to go though before she figured she’d start to feel better. Minimum.

Tali however isn't noticing yet that her suit is slightly tightening around her belly even when she's not drinking as her belly has been getting less toned.

Tali has now added 10 more pounds upon the five that she already gained. This results in her now having a slight potbelly which much of the crew think of as just bloat, but she herself knows why her suit is getting tighter around her growing belly. For some odd reason, her immune system has been gaining strength after her drinking binges had begun.

She walks into the cafeteria, ready to eat some dextro food to start her day since Shepard supplied the Normandy with food items that her and Garrus could eat instead of having them eat nutrient paste all the time.

'What could he possibly want to talk about? He never invites anybody up to his cabin, he just always visits us...' Tali thought.

Tali then gets her food from the cafe and goes back to her quarters with a larger portion than what she got before she started drinking heavily. Once she gets to her quarters, her food is demolished and a bloated Tali is relaxing drinking some Turian beer until she remembers...
