123121212.content:
A Few Hours Earlier

"-and then she spills pink jelly all over the floor! As if being an embarrassment to the class wasn't bad enough!" Miranda finished her story with a flourish.

Miranda and her two cheerleader friends giggled loudly, earning anxious glances from some of the surrounding students trying to use the library for its intended purpose instead of a gossip circle. Even the library manager didn't look away from his computer to give the girls a stern look and tell them to quiet down. Even the teachers knew not to mess around with Lawson and her cronies, two beautiful but brain-dead lackeys who had stuck to her since she first led a chant in support of the Chicago Uni Cerberus'.

"You want to talk about embarrassments, have you seen that Asari waddling around? Laura or whatever?" one of Miranda's ditzy friends said. "What a fat slob, it's like she ate that gum from that candy factory movie or something!"

"I know, right? Barely a year on campus and she's a total pig! And I hear those blue creeps are supposed to be, like, seductive and stuff!" the other ditzy friend piped in. "Yeah, maybe to the bearded lady at the freakshow!"

"You think she'll actually finish Mir? Or will she have a heart attack or eat one of the teachers?" the first friend asked Miranda.

"Oh, I hope not," Miranda said coolly, a sadistic little smile curling her lips. "Not until I'm done with her."

The two ditzy friends tilted their heads in confusion. "What are you gonna do, Mir?" they chorused.

"Well, since this is my last year, I figure I should do my part to leave this school better then when I found it, hmm?" Miranda explained. "And what better way than to teach that alien's parents a lesson?" The two girls stared at her with a lost expression, which was sadly par for the course for the two brain trusts in front of her. "I'm going to make that Asari's parents regret sending her here, and hopefully no one else will be dumb enough to send their alien spawns here either."

Miranda held up a book from the stack gathered in front of her; a diet book for athletes to help build muscle mass and bulk up. Underneath was a recipe book of sorts, a dessert book with plenty of sweet treats and delectable delights within. Underneath that, workout manuals, conveniently focused on anything but cardio and endurance training.

"Such a shame really; the Asari couldn't handle what we humans can learn with ease," Miranda said maliciously. "And the stress turned her into the biggest, fattest blob this planet has ever seen! Maybe next time the aliens will know to stay away, hm?" The two cronies' eyes lit up on the realization of what the plan was.

"Oh Miranda, you're brilliant!"

"What a genius idea! That'll scare all these freakshows away!"

Basking in the glow of empty praise, Miranda looked up at the clock. "Well, after my next class, I'm going to haunt the gym and see if I can track that fatty down. Then...well, you two will see, won't you?"

The three girls stood up, laughing all the way out the door and not paying any attention to the patrons they were disturbing. They had nothing to fear from anyone overhearing their plans. No one was going to take the side of some fatass Asari over the most popular girls on campus.

Or so they thought.

In the far corner of the room, over the edge of an technical manual, a pair of glowing purple eyes narrowed in dislike at the retreating cheerleaders, her face obscured by a containment faceplate and shaded by a purple, ornately decorated headdress. The engineering sophomore was not brave or foolish enough to confront the three right then and there, but she'd been on the receiving end of bullies and bigots like them for too long not to have a reaction, and boy was she having one now. Her four-fingers were clenched around the book so tightly she was leaving indents in the paper, and steam was fogging the inside of her helmet from her heavy, angered breathing.

"Makes your stomach turn, doesn't it?"

The engineering student looked up at the human suddenly hovering over her, a punkish-looking female with black lipstick and a long ponytail, with the sides of her head shaved clean, clad in a rough-worn leather jacket.

"Y-yeah, I'll say," the engineering student agreed. "Can't believe someone would do something like that. Makes me want to...urgh..."

"Yeah, makes me want to 'urgh' too," the punk girl said. She leaned in closer. "So...what are you gonna do about it?"

"I'm sorry?"

"Come on, I can tell that pissed you off as much as it pissed me off," the punk girl said. "What are you gonna do about it?"

The engineering student, far smarter then the airheads Miranda surrounded herself with, caught on quickly, folding her hands together over the book. "Well...what are you going to do about it?"

The punk girl smiled. "Give that Cerberus cheerleader a taste of her own medicine."

"Then we'll need some help," the engineering girl said. "And I think I know just who we need..."

---

"Come on, you can do it, just a couple more!"

Liara wanted to complain about how much agony this was, but she was too out of breath to even speak. Heavy footsteps pounding the treadmill, she was soaked to the bone with sweat, making the regular slap of her stomach against her upper thighs all the more uncomfortable. She felt like a leaking water balloon, her enormous rear end and lumpy breasts bouncing and wobbling around, throwing her off balance with every other step, as Miranda overlooked her workout, casually sipping from a cup of some diet shake. She swung her arms out a little farther then usual, and she felt a seam pop on her workout clothes' sleeve. It was enough to make her cry uncle, and she stepped onto the edges of the treadmill and collapsed onto the floor, her shiny sweat-covered belly sticking out into the air.

"I...I made good time..." Liara gasped between great heaving breaths, feeling a little bit proud of herself. "How...how long..."

"Five minutes," Miranda said, checking her watch. Liara let out a little whimper, pushing herself up to a sitting position. "Hey, perk up, you're doing great! Just need to stay hydrated! I'll grab you a soda."

Liara looked up at Miranda's retreating figure. "I...isn't water...healthier?"

"Oh, not as much as you'd think," Miranda lied coolly. "Besides, a little boost of sweetness is great for a workout."

Liara wasn't sure about that, but she didn't know much about dieting and excersize, obviously, so she shrugged and got back up onto the treadmill. When this was over, Liara thought to herself, she deserved a little reward for this torture.

Right before Liara started on another five minute burst...
123121212.title: It's Like Mean Girls in Space or Something.

choices: ...was about to take an unexpected twist.
1231212122.content:
Around the corner from where Liara was struggling to catch her breath, the engineering student was waiting to make her move. Waiting until Miranda was out of earshot, she strode up to the machines next to the portly Asari.

"Hi, you mind if I work out here?" the student asked kindly. "Trying to work off a couple pounds." She patted the pillow she surreptitiously stuffed into the front of her containment suit to simulate a belly; a little white lie to make this scheme work.

"B-by all means," Liara gasped, waving towards the treadmill. "More use out of it...then I'm getting..." She grabbed a handful of her fat with a forlorn expression, feeling more like an obese slob then usual.

"Hey, ninety percent of people who are in your position give up at this point," the engineering student said encouragingly. "You should be proud of hanging in there and trying to stay fit!" Cheap line, but it worked like a charm on Liara, who hadn't received much in terms of positive encouragement from anyone, and it coming from a fellow chubby student who knew what it was like to try and lose weight certainly helped.

"Th-thanks," Liara said. "Uh...I'm Liara, by the way."

"Tali, nice to meet you," the engineering student said brightly. "You want to keep at it for a few more minutes then grab a bite to eat? I know a nice cafe at the edge of campus, has a really healthy seafood menu."

"That sounds wonderful," Liara said, basking in the glow of a new friendship with her new diet buddy. Catching her second wind, she got back onto the treadmill and started at it again, huffing and puffing as she went.

---

While her scheme to fatten Liara up properly was getting hijacked, Miranda over at the juice bar slaved over what was the most calorie-laden drink to force on the blubbery blue alien. Setting aside her own perfectly healthy smoothie, she went to work at the drink machine, picking and choosing the best, or least healthy, addons for her calorie atom bomb of a drink.

She was so deadset on this task that she was only barely aware of someone behind her getting close to her drink. Turning around sharply, she caught sight of a very familiar leather jacket.

"What are YOU doing here, Jack?"

The punk turned to look at the cheerleader, her hands flying back into her pockets. Grinning, she decided to goad the cheerleader on, giving the little surprise in her drink the chance to dissolve and vanish.

"Oh, it's you," the punk said coolly. "Sorry, I saw that massive ass from across the room and wondered who let the cow in."

The cheerleader scoffed. "That's your best one? Are your insults always this flat?" She emphasized that last word while leaning forward and squeezing her arms together to press her cleavage outwards, a move that the punk almost certainly couldn't pull off. Ouch.

"Basic fuckin' bitch..." Jack muttered, signalling she was backing off, much to the disappointment of the onlookers. The two of them had a rivalry that was pretty legendary on campus, sparked off, if rumors are to be believed, by a romantic tryst that went awry, making their animosity especially juicy to a gossip-hungry campus. It was the highlight of anyone's day to see them go at it like that and a profound disappointment when the shooting stopped early. The show would need to wait though; Jack's plan to avenge the porky Asari...
1231212122.title: The Plan Goes Into Action

12312121223.content:
Jack turned, preparing to do her best to slink off in defeat, when-

SPLASH

The punk yelped as something cold splattered all over her back and neck, dripping down her legs. Shivering, she turned around in fury to see Miranda coyly smiling, the cup with the spiked drink completely empty.

"Whoops," Miranda said in an oily, false sincerity tone. "Sorry, my hand slipped."

The cold shock and the realization of the plan backfiring was the only thing that stopped Jack from screeching like a banshee and knocking the teeth out of the cheerleader's smug little grin right then and there. Seething, she watched Miranda turn on her heel and trounce off past her, and was about to do something stupid when karma decided to make her move.

Feeling smugly superior, Miranda stepped right into the puddle left by the drink and her feet suddenly gave way. Letting out a screech, she pitched forward right over a rack of weights, which collapsed with a series of bangs as she toppled to the ground, finally ending with a sickening...

crack

Miranda looked up from the tangled mess of weights and racks she was caught in, her face turning pale and her eyes widening in terror. Jack dashed over, and saw her leg sticking out an odd angle.

"I...I think it's broken!" Miranda whimpered, tears filling her eyes.

Jack couldn't help but smile. "Whoops."

If Miranda could kill with a glare, that would have done Jack in for good.

---

While that disaster was happening, Tali was busy guiding Liara back to the skinny side with actual diet advice and workout routines, including the nice healthy walk to the cafe, when in the midst of their conversation, karma decided to strike as well, only in favor of the pudgy Asari.

"Excuse me, are you Liara? LIara T'Soni?"

Liara froze, deathly afraid of turning around. She was starting to dread meeting people who already knew her nowadays, because of how much weight she managed to pack on. She'd met a few old friends who knew her from her skinny days, and the way their eyes always traveled to that pooching belly with a look of distaste...well, they didn't feel like friends afterwards, that's for sure.

Then she felt a gentle hand on her shoulder, and turned around instinctively. "Y-yes that's me," she choked out. "Who are-"

Was that a choir of angels singing? Or was that just in her head?

She openly stared at the stranger who said her name, which was fine because she was being stared at as well. Tall and athletic, bright-red hair falling down to her shoulders, freckles decorating her cheeks, and...just the prettiest eyes. Suddenly Miranda and her smoking hot body looked like a barbie doll compared to this...angel. She didn't even reach down to tug her shirt more securely over her bulging belly, she was so smitten.

"H-hi..." the angel said. "Uh...I'm Jane. Jane Shepard."

"Liara T'Soni," Liara squeaked out.

"I was told you were my roommate this semester...I just transferred," Shepard explained, letting out a light giggle that made Liara's heart soar. "I didn't think-"

"Hmm?"

"I...oh..."

Words seem to fail the two of them as they looked into each other's eyes. Tali, standing off to the side, could tell exactly what was going on and stepped back to let the magic happen.

"Could...you...uh, show me around?" Shepard asked at last. "Then...maybe we can get dinner..."

Liara smiled. "I'd...love that..."

Tali almost wanted to let out a little squee as the two walked off, seemingly unaware that they started holding hands. It wasn't exactly what she had in mind, but it'd work to keep the Asari away from the cheerleader that wished her ill. All's well that ends well, right?

As she stood there swaying on the spot, no doubt the affection between the new girl and Liara reminding her of her feelings for her own boyfriend, Jack traipsed up looking especially pleased with herself.

"You will not BELIEVE what happened!" the two girls told each other at the same time.

Liara wouldn't care much about her saviors, or the cheerleader who tried to help her though.

She was in love.

Option A: Liara's lovestruck, and she works hard to lose the weight to look good for her new girlfriend, while her new girlfriend picks up some of her old eating habits and heads in the other direction.

Option B: They say you put on weight when you're in love, and these two are very, very much in love...

Option C: Actually, how is our favorite cheerleader dealing with being benched?
12312121223.title: Karma Strikes

123121212231.content:
"Alright...whew...water break!"

Panting, Liara side-stepped on the treadmill and dismounted, wiping her forehead with the towel around her neck. She leaned against the hand-rail and popped open her water bottle to gulp down a generous helping. Letting out a little gasp of breath when she finished, she looked over to see Tali struggling a bit with the straw on her own bottle.

"Need a hand with that?" she teased.

"N-no, I got it. Stubborn induction port..." Tali at last managed to get the port working and took a live-giving draught of water, head hanging back in relief. "Ooh, I hurt..."

"It's a good hurt though," Liara pointed out, lifting up her workout shirt to air out a bit.

"You're holding up well, then?"

Liara grinned. "I've never been better."

No reason to doubt that, Tali thought to herself. Ever since they became workout buddies (Tali had ditched the pillow she used to give herself a paunch after a while), Liara had been making some great progress. She was still fat of course, probably because her diet of donuts and greasy fast food hadn't changed all that much, but thanks to regular exercise some of that fat seemed to have been replaced with muscle instead. On the surface she hadn't changed all that much, still possessing the same big belly, meaty thighs, and double chin as before, but she definitely carried it better now, moving quicker and losing her breath far less often then before. She wasn't really getting thinner, but she was definitely getting healthier.

Tali wanted to parade the steadily improving Asari in front of that racist cheerleader, but sadly she hadn't really been seen that much since breaking her leg a few weeks back. Probably for the best, she reasoned, to cut out the toxic people and replace them with better ones.

Liara had a jump on that already. Wiping sweat off the bridge of her nose, she opened her eyes and immediately her face lit up in delight.

"Shepard!"

The new girl smiled as she approached the two of them, a tray of smoothies in hand. "Hey there, blueberry," Shepard said sweetly. "Got you and your friend a treat!"

"Oh, thank you!" Tali said as Shepard offered her a purple fruit smoothie. "I owe you one, Shepard."

"You know you two can call me Jane, right?" Shepard laughed. "You make it sound like I'm in the army or something."

"Sorry, Shep-...Jane," Liara said, taking her own blue smoothie. "Force of habit I guess." Shepard laughed, taking her own red smoothie and leaning forward to surprise her girlfriend with a kiss on the cheek.

"S-stop it!" Liara squeaked, breaking into happy giggles. "I'm all s-sweaty!"

"Can't help it, you look good," Shepard teased.

"I look fat," Liara mumbled in response, only to giggle again as Jane jabbed a finger into her fleshy flank. "Like a big tub of goo..."

"Naaaah, you're just plush, like a big stuffed animal," Jane teased. "I could cuddle up next to you and fall asleep."

"Oh m-my..."

As Tali watched the two break out in lovestruck giggles, she couldn't help but notice that Liara wasn't the only 'plush' one in the relationship. Looking at Shepard, only a few weeks in and the freshman fifteen had claimed another victim and then some. Maybe some of Liara's unhealthy eating habits had rubbed of on the new student, because Shepard was looking particularly plump nowadays, her once thin figure dominated by a prominent bulge around her middle and a new width to her hips. She wasn't fat yet, just exceptionally curvy, but seeing how she sucked down her smoothie, probably not the same healthy mix that the two gym buddies had, it was clear that if she wasn't careful those curves might get a little too curvy.

Not that that really mattered to the two girls getting closer and closer as Tali looked on, of course. Even if that initial dumbstruck infatuation had worn off, the two still had a certain spark going on, a spark that was settling into a true and proper relationship. Sure it made Tali feel like a third wheel when they started kissing in front of her and saying cute little nothings, but really the Quarian wasn't too upset. After almost getting duped by that cheerleader and having a rather miserable time at this human university, she deserved this bit of happiness.

And besides, seeing those two go at it made her feel a little...amorous. Watching them kiss and hug each other like that, the cute little pet names, the way they looked at each other, it made her want to do that too...just with...

Goddamn it.

Flipping out her phone, Tali took a deep breath and punched out a text message, one she pined over for months on end since she was partnered with him that one time in Engineering Theory. She hesitated over the send button, wondering she was going to do this...

"Oh, Liara, not in public!"

Damn it.

Sent: Hey, do you want to go get dinner tonight?

She stared at the text for what felt like hours, days on end. Then, a few spinning circles sent her heart fluttering.

Recieved: hmm I have some calibration hw to work on...

Her heart felt like it was about to explode.

Recieved: eh, it can wait. Meet @ front entrance?

"Wonder what she's so happy about?" Liara asked Shepard as she watched Tali suddenly shriek in delight and run out of the gym.
123121212231.title: I Work Out

choices: ...the biggest Asari Jane had ever seen!
1231212122312.content:
It wasn't too long before the relentlessly cold winters of Chicago finally retreated, paving the way for warmer weather. The trees and the flowers began to blossom in earnest as sweaters and mittens were stored in favor of shorts and flip flops, and as the last few piles of dirty snow began to fade away, there was one thing on the mind of most students at U of C.

Spring break.

For two whole weeks the beaches and resorts would be swarmed by reveling college students having one last hurrah before returning to the boring doldrums of pre-final schooling, while other students planned to use the time to chill out and relax, or perhaps catch up on school work they may have missed out on the last few months. Jane and Liara, being excellent students who were a bit too geeky to really get into the hedonistic slams that made up spring break, had other plans.

"I can't believe I've never been to Europe before!" Jane exclaimed as the monorail glided to a smooth stop.

Liara looked up from the data-pad she was reading and raised an eyebrow. "But..you live on this planet?"

"Yeah, in a slum over in Jersey," Jane laughed. "I couldn't afford to go to Nova York, let alone here!"

Liara titled her head, unable to comprehend how humans could let one another live in such conditions, but Jane didn't seem to notice. The pair of them unbuckled and the human leapt from the seat, her belly flopping down over her thighs as she waddled towards the exit doors to the car, Liara waddling close behind. Suitcases in hand, the two made their exit from the train car, herded towards a ticket barrier leading to the glossy, hi-tech city beyond.

"Welcome to Brussels," a bright-orange VI announced as Liara and Jane flashed ID badges to check out. "You two must be together," it said after a moment to run through its limited collection of tinned phrases.

"Oh, we are," Jane said, taking hold of Liara's hand and pulling her closer, their tummies smooshed up against one another. Maybe it was just Liara's imagination, but Jane seemed to be quite fond of pulling off that move lately, ever since her curves finally did what they threatened to do and overtook her formerly skinny body, gifting her with a decent-sized paunch and nice plump legs, not quite as plump as Liara's thighs and butt, but pretty close. In fact, if Liara had to guess, combined with her own slight weight loss, the two probably each weighed close to two thirty or so, hence the comment from the VI about them being together. They were, after all, similarly chubby, even if Jane carried a little extra on her belly and chest, probably somewhere over two hundred or so.

Getting past the barrier, Jane looked over the city scape, excitement etched on her face as she tugged her shirt down to cover her tummy, while Liara quickly checked a map feature on her datapad. "I don't know about you, but I'm starting to get peckish," Jane commented. "Wonder what there is around here to eat?"

"My auntie has dinner prepared for us, actually," Liara reminded her, leading the way down the street. "Her place isn't too far from here."

"Oh yeah, right! Almost forgot," Jane laughed. "I'm surprised you have family here of all places."

It wasn't all that surprising honestly, given her complicated family life. Suedra, as far as she knew, was her mother's only living sister, and the two could not have been more different. She was far younger for starters, closer to Liara's age then her mother's in fact, and an awful lot warmer too, regularly sending letters and correspondence to check up on her as opposed to her own mother calling one time to make sure her grades were up to par before spring break. It didn't shock Liara that the two didn't have a lot of kind words for one another, and had a very distinct memory of a bitter argument the two got into over her, giving her the slightest hope that maybe she could have moved out of her nasty mother's house. That didn't parse out sadly, but her aunt fighting on her behalf was something that stuck with her a long time, even after Suedra got promoted and moved to Earth as a liaison for an Illium-based Asari corporation. Needless to say, when she was sent two tickets to Brussels and an invitation to stay over Spring Break, Liara was more then happy to accept.

"She's gonna be okay with me, right?"

"Sorry?" Liara asked, somewhat lost in her thoughts.

"Your aunt," Jane repeated. "She's not gonna have a problem with us, right?"

"I doubt it, she's married to a human," Liara chuckled.

"Oh, duh," Jane said sheepishly. "Sorry...I was worried that your family wouldn't approve, ya know?"

"You don't need to worry, my auntie loves everyone," Liara reassured her. "Maybe a bit too much sometimes, but you'll get along fine."

"What do you mean by a bit too much?"

"We're here!"

With a spring in her step, Liara bounded up to the fancy brick house flush with the others on either side, a large bright-blue door clashing against the dull red brickwork around it. She knocked twice, and a shuffling sound came from inside.

"Auntie, it's me!" Liara called out happily as Jane caught up to her, a half-step behind. Barely a few seconds afterward, the door swung open.

"Omygosh, Liara!"

"Auntie Suedra!"

Practically squeeing, Liara threw herself forward into a massive hug with...
1231212122312.title: Visiting the Family

choices: Yeah, this was a special occassion, don't worry.
Yeah, but don't expect to have much luck dieting with these two.
Oh honey...I hope you packed sweatpants.
12312121223122.content:
"My goodness, you've grown!" Suedra said as she broke apart from the hug with her niece. "College has been treating you well, I see!"

"Yes it has," Liara admitted, a hand jumping to her pronounced tummy. "Oh, Auntie Suedra, this is my girlfriend, Jane Shepard."

"Ah, you're the one whose dating my beloved niece!" Suedra declared, rounding on Shepard. "I hope you're treating my precious niece like a princess, missy!"

"Uh..." Jane stammered out before the older Asari burst out laughing, the gut hanging a foot past her waist bouncing with delight.

"I'm joking, c'mere you!"

Jane gasped as the heavyset Asari pulled her into a great big hug with her thick arms, giving a tight little squeeze before letting her go. She hadn't expected all this bodacious blue alien all at once, and it left her a bit flustered. 'Auntie Suedra' definitely bore a resemblance to her younger niece, especially in the weight department. Wide and soft, her hips and thighs stuffed into tight summer shorts that left little to the imagination, jiggled at the slightest movement, and her plump face always had a big smile on it, matching the curve of her double chin.

"Well, I can't have you darkening my doorframe all day, come on inside! Ami is just getting dinner finished up, your timing is perfect!" Suedra declared.

Driven by empty stomachs craving a home-cooked meal, the two college kids obeyed, squeezing past the plump aunt as she held the door open for them. Dropping her suitcase next to Liara's at the door, Jane took a moment to breath, catching the faintest hint of cinnamon and pine in the air, and take a look around the house. It was actually quite lively, with abstract paintings in exotic colors mixed with old movie posters from class human and Asari films decorating the walls and alien plants occupying the corners, adding vibrant blues and reds to the room. Jane had been bracing for something stuffy and boring or alien and weird, and much to her surprise, Liara's aunt's house was actually pretty cool. There was even a big screen TV around the corner and what looked like a few game consoles sitting underneath. Score!

Jane made a beeline to the TV and caught sight of a picture hanging prominently on the wall opposite, depicting an Asari and an olive-skinned human woman in a shawl, both wearing shockingly purple dresses and smiling; it took her a second to realize that the Asari was in fact Liara's aunt, looking unhealthily thin but practically glowing in this picture. Was it a wedding photo? Suedra did seem the type to wear an unusual color to her own wedding.

"Come on girls, get it while it's hot!"

Oh yeah, food! Jane detoured back and followed the sounds of Liara squeeing to the kitchen, where...

Holy cow, what a spread!

Jane was dumbstruck by the bounty laid out on the large dining room table over top a fancy purple tablecloth; glazed ham, baked potatoes, a big turkey, steaks, corn on the cob...Shepard hadn't even finished seeing everything occupying the table when the smell hit her, and...had she died and gone to heaven? The roaring of her chubby belly seemed to suggest that, because all of it smelled utterly divine, and it took every ounce of willpower she had not to just dive in and start digging through it.

Tearing her eyes away from the spread, Jane looked over and saw Liara breaking off from a hug with a very fat woman, bigger even then her Asari aunt. Hiking her yoga shorts over the monumental rear end that stuck out the back of her like a shelf, she turned to face Jane and started waddling over, swinging her heavy arms as she went along.

"You must be Jane, Liara's told us all about you!" the woman said brightly, if a little out of breath, as she pulled up a chair for the younger girl. "I'm her other aunt, you can call me Ami."

"Nice to meet you," Jane said politely, taking a seat and finally recognizing her as the other woman in the picture, bloated and fattened almost beyond recognition. Honestly though, if the food she made was as good as it looked and smelled, Jane could absolutely understand how she got that big.

"This looks incredible, Auntie!" Liara said, taking her seat next to her girlfriend and starting to pile her plate full.

"Oh, it was nothing," Ami said, waving a thick hand dismissively. "Just a lil something to welcome you two to our home!"

"Can't remember the last time you came here, of course," Suedra said, passing Shepard a delectable looking ham. "What have you been up to since I last saw you? My sister's not bullying you around anymore, is she?"

Jane would make light conversation when prompted of course, but for the next hour or so she was focused on one thing and one thing only after she had that first taste. It didn't taste as good as it smelled and looked, it was in fact even better then that. The human soon found herself wolfing down meats and cheeses and veggies and all sorts of delectables. Polishing off her second or third helping, she leaned back, rubbing her bloating stomach tenderly.

"Oh man..." she murmured. "This stuff is good."

"Oh, if you like that, try the shepherd's pie," Ami piped in. "I had a similar seasoning, I bet you'll enjoy it too!"

She did, very much so. In fact, she got two helpings. Then a third, then a fourth. Her belly gave a little whine in protest as her pants began to painfully tighten around her waist.

"Mmmm..."

"Oh, Jane, try this!" Suedra insisted, pushing a goulash towards her. "It's a delicacy from where you live, Liara suggested it." Catching a super familiar scent, Jane scooped a generous helping onto her plate.

"This steak is wonderful!" Liara said. "Jane, try a bit, it's so savoury!"

"Jane, you'll like this."

"Jane, try this."

"Wow, Jane, have you tasted this? Here!"

Jane's stomach started to lurch with every successive 'sample' given to her. Reaching down, she realized that at some point the button on her jeans had burst, never to be seen again until Suedra was vacuuming and found it in the corner weeks later. Still she kept sampling, and tasting, and eating, until at last the table was bare, and the four girls reclined lazily, stroking bellies stuffed taut. Liara and Jane were especially affected, looking almost completely spherical around the waist.

"Think...I'm gonna...hic...pop..." Liara wheezed.

"Can't...take much more..." Jane agreed.

"I don't know about you ladies," Suedra piped in. "But I could go for some dessert. How about some blueberry pie?"

Jane moaned in agony. She LOVED blueberry pie. As someone put a thick slice in front of her, bathed in whipped cream. At least, she consoled herself as she reached out for it, every meal here won't be like this, right?
12312121223122.title: Welcoming Feast

123121212231223.content:
It wasn't really anyone's fault. In the end, it was just inevitable.

Liara was so happy to see her aunt, the one person she could call family that cared about her in turn, that her regular workout schedule slipped. Jane had no such workout schedule, but was so enamored by the city and taken in by how nice Liara's family was that she was just as distracted as Liara was from the sheer volume of food they were eating. And Liara's aunts were so happy to meet their niece and her cute girlfriend that they happily overfed the two. Again, it wasn't really their fault; Ami's family were all chefs with big appetites, and Suedra took after her niece, being a chubby child with a sweet tooth who was forced onto a crash diet by her strict elder sister. Ever since they got married and didn't feel the need to keep perfect supermodel thin bodies, eating this much had just become natural to them. Normal, even.

Not so much for the two college girls.

"Goddamn, this level is hard, why can't I just-" *urp*

Jane placed a hand over her mouth, turning slightly pink at the cute little burp that escaped her. Groaning, her bloated belly gargled angrily as it hurried to digest a heavy lunch before a goodbye feast in a couple hours. It was sadly their last day in Brussels, and having seen most of the sights by now, Jane decided she deserved a lazy afternoon spent tackling this unfair adventure game. Fingers working the controls furiously, she slouched down in the big fluffy sofa, occasionally puffing her cheeks out as she stifled more belches and burps. She didn't want to look like a total gross slob when she was staying at her girlfriend's aunt's place, even if they had grown rather close.

Jane had to admit though, grown was the right word. Maybe she could have excused herself as being curvy or voluptuous before now, but after two weeks of excessive feasting, she finally thought to step on the creaky disused bathroom scale in the guest room, and was kind of perturbed at the results.

Two hundred or so could be curvy or heavyset at the very least. Three hundred and five? That's fat.

And knowing that, it was hard not to feel fat. Jane became acutely aware of how far and heavy her belly hung, even when she wasn't stuffed to the gills, and she could feel her ballooning thighs brushing against one another as she walked sluggishly from place to place. Her last trip out a couple days ago had been to pick up some new clothes, and yet her brand new polo left a sliver of her pale stomach out in the cold. Part of that may have just been her breasts (which, much to her delight, had blossomed into full, if flabby, D cups!), but the way the sleeves cut into her arms suggested otherwise. It was impossible to ignore even the small things, like how she took up more space on the couch, almost a whole cushion, or how the bed was starting to feel cramped with Liara beside her, or even just the gentle creaking of her footsteps growing louder. It was like she became a different person in just a few weeks; she certainly wouldn't have recognized the face staring back at her a month ago, now adorned with a thick healthy double chin and puffed cheeks. And Suedra had suggested that they come back over the SUMMER? Yeah, maybe if she wanted to be rolled down the street and onto a flatbed when she went home again!

And then she thought about that shepherd's pie Ami made for her, and her mouth began to water. Luckily before she could get the chance to sneak off and gorge on leftovers, heavy breathing and footsteps echoed from the back room.

"Heeey, Li," Jane called out as Liara came up behind and around the sofa. "Want to double up on this and beat this guy?" Liara didn't response, dropping down on the couch with a heavy thud. Not surprising, considering Liara had not been spared the effects of her Aunt's cooking either; she was back at the weight she was when Jane first met her and then some, her belly spilling out into her lap once again, flanked by wide hips that overflowed one section of the sofa.

"Liara?" Jane asked again. The Asari said nothing, so Jane paused and looked over, seeing her sitting in an old pair of sweatpants, her belly button proudly displayed under a rolled-up shirt. The hands sinking into her puffy arms were trembling, and, much to Shepard's horror, tears were streaking down her fat cheeks. "What's wrong?" Jane pushed, placing a hand on her shoulder. Liara looked up at her at last, her voice scratchy and weak just like her eyes were red and sore.

"I can't go back to UC," she said. "Mother has...cancelled my courses."

Jane looked and felt like she got punched in the stomach hard. Blinking, she stammered out a reply.

"Wh..what?"

"She found a photo on social media, of us at the Atomium sculpture," Liara explained. "She...she's bringing me back home, to be put on a strict diet." She dropped her head into her hands as Jane leapt up, her fury propelling her fat body with surprising speed.

"SHE CAN'T DO THAT!" Jane shouted. "You're a fucking adult, you have RIGHTS!"

Liara shook her head. "I do, but I can only stay if I'm enrolled. She has the finances controlled. She pulls her funding, cancels my scholarship, I get expelled when I can't pay." She let out a wretched sob. "I'm...I'm done for."

"That bitch!"

The two girls were so distraught and emotional that they didn't hear Auntie Suedra approaching, her eyes glowing with biotic energy.

"Auntie Suedra, I-I'm-"

"NOT getting expelled," her aunt continued. "I'm covering your costs, I'll pull every favor on Illium if I have to. I'll be damned if I let that woman rule over you like this!"

"But we're past the middle of the month," Shepard realized with dawning horror. "Billing should have already kicked in, and if the payment's cancelled-"

"I'm expelled outright," Liara concluded sadly. Suedra didn't seem fazed, only more resolute.

"I'm making some calls," she said. "By the Goddess, I'm not letting that witch control your life..."

An Angel Watching Over Me: Liara, somehow, is saved from expulsion! But how?

A Devil At My Back: Benezia's machinations succeed, and Liara is expelled. But she's not going back home without a fight.
123121212231223.title: Oh honey...I hope you packed sweatpants.

choices: Back to Brussels of course! And bring some sweatpants!
Perhaps a more exotic destination instead?
Whoa, Miranda and Aria? I want to hear more about that, please!
1231212122312231.content:
"...can't believe she'd do this to me..." Liara sobbed.

"She's not going to get away with it," Jane insisted, putting her arm around her girlfriend's broad shoulders. "I'll punch her in the nose if she gets close to you." Liara choked back what might have been a laugh, though it was hard to hear over the shouting match that her Aunt was having over the phone behind them.

"See, you don't have anything to worry about," Auntie Ami said as she approached, tugging up her prolific waistband with one hand. "You have family here, we're not going to let her take you away if you don't want to go."

"Th-thanks," Liara murmured as her Aunt squeezed in next to her, making the couch much more cramped and making Jane wonder if it could support all three of them without collapsing. Not helping matters was the slice of cake her Aunt set in front of Liara.

"Here, have something to eat, you'll feel much better. You too Jane, I'm sure you must be upset too." She smiled widely as Liara, even in her intense anxious sadness, eagerly dug in, followed up by her girlfriend. Jane was right, it did feel better to get something in her stomach. Eating made everything feel better.

"...oh? Well, okay then, you have my information, set it up right away," Suedra finished up. "Goodbye." Snapping her phone shut, she turned to the trio on the couch, positively glowing. Liara stared blankly as her aunt clapped a hand on her shoulder. "Liara, you're not going anywhere," Suedra announced. "Your finances are in MY hands now!"

In a move almost as exuberant as Shepard jumping up in rage, Liara propelled herself out from between her fat girlfriend and enormous aunt to leap onto her Auntie with a shriek of relieved joy.

"Ohmygodessthankyouthankyouthankyouthankyouthankyouthankyouthankyou... 34; Liara stuttered out, tears of joy streaming down her fat cheeks again as she wrapped her arms around her.

"By the goddess, don't crush me before I can arrange the payment," Suedra wheezed, the wind knocked out of her.

"Did you managed to get the first payment waived?" Shepard asked, disbelieving.

"I didn't need to! It was already covered!"

This answer just left the two girls confused.

"Maybe your mother made a mistake," Ami suggested.

"No, she definitely cancelled that payment," Liara said. "Someone...must have covered it themselves. But who?"

---

"Now, just so you're sure, there won't be a refund after this point in the semester, Miss T'Soni."

"I understand. Just cancel it."

The timid administrator cowered under the icy gaze of Matriarch Benezia, cold and severe as ever, and no less elegant and refined. It was like dealing with a queen that had a penchant for decapitations.

"Very well, it's done," the wormy little man announced. "I'll..send the notice to enrollment."

"Good. I'll be back to collect my daughter and get her away from this hovel," she sneered. "Good day." Without another word, she stood up and walked out of the office, leaving everyone in the room a little bit more at ease. Except for one person, who just happened to be nearby waiting to ask about a schedule change. Mumbling under his breath, the administrator went to go refill his coffee to sooth his nerves as someone tottered up to the desk, hampered by a stiff cast on her leg, peering over to make sure the wormy man wasn't in sight of the front.

Miranda Lawson smiled, slipping behind the desk and opening up the file the administrator just closed. "Liara T'Soni," she whispered, going over the details of what she just saw, feeling disgusted at the idea of someone else being controlled by their parents.

The Miranda pulling out her fancy platinum credit card was a different Miranda then the one who plotted to humiliate the same alien months ago. Part of that was the freshman fifteen that finally caught her four years later thanks to her broken leg, giving her a pudgy tummy and a plump little chin, to say nothing of the healthy inches added to her flabby butt and hips. It was a devastating injury, insuring she wouldn't be cheer captain for the rest of the year, and no doubt led to the depression eating that gave her the added pounds, but being away from her racist, jerkoff 'friends' on cheer squad helped her to realize how awful she had been to people, many of whom mocked and teased her relentlessly over the injury. The final straw was when her friends even started to bully her over her weight gain, but while others would have broken down and fallen into the hole, Miranda was too good for that. Instead, she swore then and there to be a better person, and while she was nowhere near that point, maybe this favor for someone she had hateful thoughts towards would be a good place to start.

And so, a better, fatter Miranda covered the payment that would have gotten Liara expelled, forwarding the "changed" results to admissions before hobbling off to safety, shutting the office door behind her. She couldn't help but smile at her little misdeed, done in the name of something good for once. After being a superstar student for so long, it felt good to do something a little bad. Technically it was her second, since her human supremacist father wouldn't have liked the girl sitting on a bench outside, waiting for her to finish.

"That look," the sharply-dressed Asari said. "You did something bad, didn't you?"

"Maaaybe," Miranda said teasingly. Her new girlfriend chuckled darkly before pulling her into a deep, sensual kiss, which Miranda responded to with vigor, letting out soft moans as her girlfriend's hand caressed the curve of her stomach.. Breaking apart, the Asari leaned in and whispered something into Miranda's ear that made her blush.

"Don't we have class soon?" Miranda pointed out.

"I thought you were a bad girl," the Asari teased. "Come on, let's have some fun~" The two of them giggled as they made their way, hand in hand, towards the dorms.

"Just make sure you study hard, Miss T'Loak," Miranda said, mocking the tone of their business studies professor.

"Oh, I will," Aria said suggestively. "I have a very good study partner..."

In retrospect, Miranda thought as her door drew tantalizingly close, this beat the hell out of cheer practice.

---

Thus, with a bit of help from someone with a change of heart, Liara was going to stay in college after all! And with Spring Break coming to a close, it's time to look to the future, and what that may entail. The semester is coming to a close, and it's time to plan for the summer! What are our portly freshmen going to get up to on their vacation?
1231212122312231.title: An Angel Watching Over Me

choices: Jane controls herself...Liara and Suedra, not so much.
Jane can't stop herself, even though the Asari moderate their appetites.
It's a feeding frenzy, all these girls are hooked!
12312121223122311.content:
After the scare of Liara getting kicked out was past, finals week was practically smooth sailing for the couple. The classes were pretty easy for Jane, and Liara seemed to be pushing herself in her studies out of spite, reaching for the highest marks she could just to show her mother that she was wrong about her. Soon enough, the school collectively set their proverbial pencils down, and Jane walked away with decent marks and Liara proudly sported 100's and 105's across the board.

Time for a well-deserved break. And this break was what made Jane really nervous. Yes, she did want to see Liara's aunts again, and yes she adored their culinary abilities, but...

"Come oooon, we're gonna be late!" Liara said cheerily, pulling Shepard out the front of campus by the hand. "You're gonna love it, I promise!"

Jane forced a smile, but her eyes drifted to the gentle wobble of her girlfriend's belly...as well as the wobble of her own. It had been a small miracle that they managed to get through finals without getting any heftier, but they only got this hefty because of less than a month spent at her Aunt's place. Give it two months and change, and Jane would be lucky if she was able to be rolled out the front door. Hopefully, this 'surprise' Liara was so excited about involved an exercise bike, or hell just a light jog every once in a while, before she popped like a balloon.

Jane felt her girlfriend tug a little harder on her hand and looked up, surprised to see Suedra already waiting next to a rather fancy skycar, drawing confused and jealous stares from the other students flooding out the campus gates. She gave a friendly wave as Liara dived into her arms for a hug, bring Shepard in with her.

"AUNTIE!" she squealed in delight.

"Lia-whoah!" Suedra said with a start and then a laugh as the two three hundred pound freshman bounced into her. "Great to see you again. How were finals?"

"Piece of cake," Jane reported. Mmm cake, she thought to herself before shaking off the feeling. She wasn't such a fatass that she got distracted by food references that easily. Not yet anyway.

"My professor said I aced most of the material!" Liara said happily.

"Doesn't surprise me in the least," Suedra said proudly, kissing her on the forehead. "Now, I believe we have a tour to plan!"

"Tour?" Jane asked, prompting a confused look from Liara's aunt.

"Oh, right she wanted to surprise you!" Suedra realized, reaching into the pocket of her dress. "Well, with Ami away on business this summer, I thought it'd be fun if we three went on a little trek across the planet, seeing all the sights!"

Jane's mouth dropped open. "Wha....really? A world tour?"

"Isn't it exciting?" Liara said brightly. "We'll be able to really explore your homeworld and see all the different cultures and places!"

Suedra removed three tickets from her pocket, handing one to each of the girls. "These will be our passes; we can go anywhere anytime we want to from now until you two need to get back to UC."

Jane was so shocked and touched by this that she was in tears. Growing up in a poor backwater, she had always wanted to escape from that wretched hovel she called home, to see the world around her or even the galaxy. It was smaller scale then she would have liked, sure, but that didn't matter. She'd finally get to explore the place she called home, and her heart surged with affection for Liara's aunt for getting this together, to say nothing of how she felt towards her little blueberry girl.

"It'll be a summer to remember girls," Suedra said dreamily. "Just imagine...all the exotic cuisine we can sample!"

Jane's blankly happy face faltered ever so slightly.

"...how much are we talking here?" she asked cautiously.

"As much as you want, of course!" Liara said. "I don't know about you, but I want to try EVERYTHING!"

Jane forced a smile again. O-okay, bit of a snag sure, but...she was going to see the world! It was so exciting! And sampling a lot of great food was part of that! She could manage a few cheat days no problem, right?

"Oh, me too!" Suedra said brightly. "Ami made me promise to sample as much as I could for her!"

Jane kept smiling as she was pulled into another hug, hoping that when this was over she wouldn't need to be rolled off the plane.
12312121223122311.title: Girls of Summer

choices: Back to Brussels of course! And bring some sweatpants!
I have a better idea, actually.
