1233.content:
So now Liara is all grown up, well just to make it easier for her to gain weight let us assume that the war against the Reapers is already over before she packs on the 1st pound and ended in Reaper defeat, besides nobody likes the ending of Mass Effect 3.

Moving on to something that will... not... be terrible, there are 2 ways in which you have the option to play this out.

Option 1, Simple Gluttony/overeating. Whether deliberately or not, Liara gets fat the old fashioned way... for the most commonly cited reason, eating too much and being lazy...

Options 2 &3 : Romance. The weight gain in this is definitely deliberate, the only question is. Is Liara making herself fat, or is her lover making her fat?

Pick option 2 for her lover to be a Shepard (Male or Female)

Pick option 3 for her lover to be Javik. The Last Prothean. There's plenty of T'sovik art out there.

If you ask me I lean towards Javik. But I won't stop you from picking Shepard if you want to.
1233.title: ME3

choices: Liara begins indulging in all the finer (read; fattening) things in life.
Liara becomes, well, a bit of an evil genius…
12331.content: During the war, all but some of the Shadow Brokers resources were going into the fight against the Reapers, but now that they were gone, there was much more room for their… frivolous use. Trillions of credits from sources around the galaxy flowed in and out every second… some of it was bound to get lost somewhere along the way, right? After designing a simple VI to skim the feed of a few dozen credits every second. Just over two thousand every minute. Over a hundred thousand every hour. Millions every day. By the end of the year, Liara was a billionaire. The thought of how much she was making… just the thought of it would… well, turn her on. The things she could do with it—the things she was going to do with it, and all from a single program she made in two hours. Were she to actually put some effort into accumulating wealth, there were no limits to what she could do.
12331.title: The Shadow Broker.

choices: A simple plate of pastries! How nice!
Nothing but a puff of smoke! But the smoke...
123311.content:
It comes as no surprise that with the billions upon billions of credits Doctor Liara T'soni had accumulated, comes much finer cuisine, many more amenities, and the best crew, including chefs, money could buy. Liara had picked up on Earth's culinary delights after the end of the war, mostly because she enjoyed much of it Shepard, right before, um, *ahem*, 'embracing eternity.' *wink* Fine steaks, seafood, desserts and wines would always find themselves in the kitchen, and the tummy of the Shadow Broker.

So it also comes as no surprise that said tummy is not the size it used to be.

"Goddess, would you just fasten already?"

Our blue-skinned beauty is just now starting to realize this.

"Oh, you insufferable- It wasn't this hard to clasp this jacket yesterday! Was it?" Liara spoke to no one in particular. "I would say these shrunk in the wash, but I haven't washed this..." What she didn't realize, or, rather, what she didn't WANT to realize, was that her jacket was the same size, and it fit her perfectly; about 10 pounds ago.

Pushing itself out from Liara's torso was a small little pooch of a tummy, snug as a bug in her already skintight suit. It was just big enough, however, that her jacket didn't want to comply. It was her favorite one too.

"Fine, I'll go without it" Liara huffed as she walked out of her closet into her quarters. To say it was a huge bedroom would be underselling it. It was ENOURMOUS! A king sized bed, a huge couch and gigantic, top-of-the-line television, A FRIGGIN' HOT TUB, and those are just the MODEST things in there. Not to mention the small pantry and refridgerator for her 'light snacks', consisting of chips and candy of all sorts, crackers and entire sticks of salami, just to name a few.

Is it really any wonder she has gained weight?

Stepping out of her quarters and into the ops center, Liara noticed her breakfast waiting for her on her desk, like it always was. Her assistant, an Asari named Dahlia, was always punctual when it came to her meals, and she was a nice youngling; only 87 years old. She was a little on the chubby side, though, but Liara figured they could get her on a nice weight loss regimen.

Liara sat herself down at her desk, her small pooch pushing the white and blue outfit to it's limit, unbeknownst to it's owner. Liara sat herself up to her computer monitor, checking the influx of emails from her associates. As she opened up the first one, however, a familiar clicking of footsteps approached her. Looking past the monitor, Liara saw the pudgy form of Dahlia walking towards her, carrying a medium-sized box.

"My apologies, Miss T'soni," she started in her always timid voice, "but I forgot to bring this to you, it just came in this morning, and the courier said it was extremely important."

"You made sure and had it scanned, correct?"

"Of course, Ma'am," Dahlia continued, bowing her head slightly, "negative on explosives, dangerous chemicals, poisons, dangerous creatures and superweapons."

Liara cocked a brow at her assistant.

"A-And, very small lifeforms here to assassinate you!" Dahlia squeaked swiftly. When the Shadow Broker gave her that look, she was telling Dahlia she wasn't on her A-game; she got that look a lot, and learned to fear it.

"Alright," Liara chuckled, amused at her assistant's reaction, "Thank you, Dahlia." Liara smiled as Dahlia bowed her head and turned to leave. Liara's eyes lay planted on the rear of her assistant, the skintight black uniform her staff wore leaving nothing to the imagination. Each cheek seemed to be made of Jell-O, an Earthly delicacy, and every step she took shook and jiggled them like an earthquake was happening.

'I'm going to get her in shape one of these days,' Liara thought to herself, unaware how hypocritical she was being. She pondered on how she was going to get her assistant fit, all the while, the image of her jiggling, plump rear end in her mind. Her daydreaming and scheming were cut short when she remembered the package she was just given. She reached across her desk to pick up the small object, a cuboidal piece of metal, about a cubic foot in size. A small button was on the side, perfectly clean, except for a small smudge. 'My security team already opened it, ' she thought, 'at least I know I won't blow up when I open it.' She pushed her monitor slightly out of the way and set the box down. A tentative blue finger brushed over the button. 'It could still be a bomb, designed to go of when my fingerprint presses the button, but there wasn't any explosives...'

"Well, Goddess be with me." Liara quickly pressed the button, and watched as four triangular flaps lifted up and folded to the side, leaving the contents of the package open to the world. She peered inside, shocked to find it was...
123311.title: Living the High Life

choices: Liara decides against it, it’s too risky!
Liara decides for it, they just look so good!
Liara is tentative, have Dahlia try one first
Liara is all for it, in fact, let Dahlia dig in too!
Liara decides for it, and an evil smirk crosses Dahlia’s lips...
1233111.content:
...some donuts. Just a dozen donuts. Arranged in two perfect rows of six.

“Really?” Liara rolled her eyes so hard, she could swear she heard her retinas snap. “This was what was so urgent?” As frustrating as this was, she was relieved there were no Collectors or face-hugging embryo-implanting arachnids inside. Still though, why was THIS so urgent?

She picked up one of the confections, a donut, as she’d remembered; Shepard had had her try one on a handful of occasions, all of which proved as good as she’d said. This one in particular had a simple chocolate glaze on it, with half being covered in blue sprinkles. Liara eyed the treat suspiciously, looking for any trace signs of poisons or razor blades, even though her security team had already cleared it for her. Just to be safe though...

“Dahlia? Would you come here for a moment?” She called to her assistant, prompting the young Asari to quickly bound back into her Liara’s office, her superior noting how her chest and belly bounced a bit more than she did.

“Yes, Miss T’soni?” Dahlia asked, taking a breathe between words, as she was out of breathe; Liara REALLY needed to get her to work out.

“You said this was cleared for poisons, correct?”

“Yes, ma’am,” Dahlia nodded her head assuredly, “Security ran it against every known poisonous substance on record, both natural and synthetic. Why do you ask?” She cocked her head slightly at this.

Liara gestured to the open box, and Dahlia took a look inside, seeing the 11 sweet torus’ inside.

“...pastries?” Dahlia looked even more confused now.

“Donuts,” Liara corrected, “A Human confection. This was your ‘important package’,” throwing up air quotes with her hands for emphasis.

Dahlia started at the treats for a moment, then back to the Shadow Broker. “Why?”

“I’m not sure, Dahlia, but an unmarked box from an unknown sender with food of questionable origin is going to do nothing but raise suspicion... although,” she eyed the one donut she’d removed from the box, “they do look quite good.” Though she wouldn’t like to admit it, her mouth had been watering for quite awhile, as she had yet to dig into her warm breakfast, and these WOULD make a nice addition...
1233111.title: A simple plate of pastries! How nice!

choices: A fatter Dahlia walks in with another box...
The Asari seem to have gotten fatter... but they don’t notice!
The Asari seem to have gotten fatter... they notice right away!
The Asari seem to have gotten fatter... and they’re eyeing up each others curves
Liara gets a message from the one who sent the donuts!
12331114.content:
“Well... I see no reason for letting these go to waste,” Liara says, a cartoonish line of drool streaming from her mouth, and stars in her eyes, “As long as security isn’t slacking on me.” This thought gives Liara a second for pause. “Dahlia, have medical on standby.”

“Of course, Miss T’soni,” Dahlia says as she pulls out her Omni-Tool.

Liara gives the donut one final once over, before decided on a bite on the sprinkled side. She brings it up to her lips and bites down, preparing for the worst and...

...it’s delicious.

“By the Goddess...” Liara moans through her bite of donut, waves of flavor and joy passing through her. “This may one of the greatest things I’ve ever tasted Dahlia.”

A look of relief passes over the younger Asari as she holsters her Omni-Tool. “I’m glad it’s to your satisfaction, Miss T’soni.”

“Satisfaction is an understatement,” Liara says as she goes for another bite, relishing the flavor even more. It had been awhile since Dahlia had seen such a jubilant expression on the Shadow Broker’s face, she had always been so stoic and collected, given her position, though this side of her superior was a pleasure to see, though, now that the possible threat had subsided, she kinda wanted to try a donut...

As if to answer her prayers, as Liara finished her donut, she offered one to her assistant, a similar chocolate pastry, but with red sprinkles. A look of utter joy passed over Dahlia’s face as she took the chocolatey delight from Liara and took a bite.

Pure. Bliss.

Dahlia could only assume that this feeling was second only to an embrace of eternity, if not, surpassing it. The rest was gone in mere moments as Liara followed suit, finishing off her second donut and reaching for a third. Dahlia was now the one to follow as she reached into the box for a second, but was met by a sharp glare from the Shadow Broker, who Dahlia remembered in that moment was her superior, and her timidity took the reigns once more.

“I-I’m sorry Miss, I uh, mean Shadow Broker, I-I mean ma’am, I-I shouldn’t have assumed, that was totally, uh I mean, completely, uhhh...” The poor Asari looked like she could break down in tears. Luckily for her, Liara was not AS bad as the Yahg who had preceded her, and liked to get a few licks in on her assistant. She chuckled at Dahlia’s reaction and gestures for her to help herself.

Dahlia felt faint. A donut would help.

Some time passed and soon the box was empty, save for a few crumbs and traces of chocolate. Both Asari looked completely content with everything in life, bellies full of heaven. Liara had even completely forgotten about her breakfast, as this had taken precedence over anything else.

“Goddess...” Liara was finally able to mutter.

“I think you’re right, Miss T’soni,” Dahlia added, “she must be the only one who can makes such delectable pieces of pure amazingness.”

“I couldn’t agree more, Dahlia,” Liara said, patting her full tummy, not noticing that it was bigger than it was just an hour ago.

And even... still growing slightly bigger?

Suddenly an alarm rang from Liara’s desk, bringing both Asari back to an alert state.

“Oh no no no no I’ve lost track of time, that’s one of my agents,” Liara fixed everything on her desk and moved the now empty box out of the way. She took a second to compose herself before turning to her assistant “Thank you, Dahlia, you may go now.” Dahlia, understanding she can’t be around during her meetings with clients or agents, turns to take her leave, but the Shadow Broker stops her for a moment.

“Dahlia? Let me know if we receive any more strange packages.”

“Of course, Miss T’soni,” Dahlia replies, before trotting away. Before Liara can answer her call, her eyes can’t help but be drawn to the plump figure of her assistant once more. Dahlia’s ass was nothing short of huge, as Liara had noted many times before, the big blue cheeks of the young Asari testing the limits of the black uniform, but... Liara could have sworn it looked tighter than it did earlier. And her butt didn’t jiggle that much, did it? And... was that a new roll of back fat she saw?

Many questions flooded her mind, but they were all soon drowned out by the incessant ringing from her console. Finally, she answered, and took on her full persona of the Shadow Broker. Though, as she did, she was unaware of the affects that the donuts had placed upon her. Her love handles had softened, her thighs and butt thickened, all around her figured had grown slightly, making everything she wore go from tight to uncomfortably tight, a discomfort she had noted throughout her call, though she had attributed this to her larger than average breakfast. Once this call ended, she’d thought, she’d have to go get some looser clothes...

The next day...
12331114.title: Asari Run on Dunkin’

choices: The mysterious donut gifter makes an appearance.
No donuts arrive, and the girls are desperate for more.
123311141.content:
Liara set aside her breakfast plate, letting off a tiny little belch as she patted the tummy filling out her new jacket. She had to pull a few strings to find one that resembled her old, favorite garment in style, and luckily this one fit...not perfectly, but more then adequately for now. For whatever reason it STILL felt a little snug, and she definitely did not run this through the laundry first. Must have been a size mislabeling, she thought irritably. The seller seemed rather flustered when she asked about the size.

More to the point, she turned her attention to the holographic display of the command structure in front of her, depicting a dozen different Turian officials of high status and prestige. The High Commander of the Seveso Sector had unexpectedly passed away the previous night and the ensuing shake-up was a prime opportunity to get one of her agents into the command structure, and by extension getting a foothold in the Hierarchy that would be incredibly valuable to her ongoing operations. It was a delicate and demanding task, one that needed her full and undivided attention to succeed...

"Miss T'soni?"

"Dahlia, this is important," Liara reprimanded her assistant as she poked her head through the door. "Whatever it is it can wait, I can't have anything distract from this right now."

"...there's another package."

Liara's eyes lit up, and with one flick of the wrist minimized the display.

"Well, bring it here then!" Liara said, perhaps a little hurriedly as her mouth started to water.

Dahlia daintily approached her desk, the familiar package held in her hands. She seemed to be moving somewhat slower today, and Liara couldn't help but notice how tightly her usual dress fit around Dahlia's plump, wobbling hips. Still, despite the caution in her step, there was a clear look of excitement on her somewhat rounder face, and Liara could see why; this box was clearly larger then the last one! Setting it down on the desk, her assistant took a breather and readjusted herself, smoothing out the bunched up fabric squeezed by her plush figure.

Slowly, Liara opened the container like it was a lost ancient treasure; the pastries inside this time were less decorative, looking either plain or powdered. Dahlia looked a bit crestfallen at this, and somewhat confused.

"Don't these usually have holes in them?" she asked. Liara shrugged and, throwing caution to the wind, picked up one of the plain looking pastries and bit down into it. She detected the familiar sugary flavor and then her eyes widened when something delightfully tangy and sweet burst into her mouth. Liara looked down to see the insides of the pastry filled with a white creamy substance.

"By the Goddess, these are even better!" Liara exclaimed, happily taking another bite that smeared the creamy filling onto her lips. "This filling...incredible!"

"M-ma'am, could I...?" Dahlia asked, overwhelming desire overcoming her timidness as her hand drifted towards the box. When Liara gave a nod, too enthralled in her donut to even speak, Dahlia almost squealed in delight as she grabbed a powdered donut and bit into it. Her eyes widened with the same wild delight, and when she took it out of her mouth it left a red stain behind. "This one...has a jelly in it!"

"Save one for me!" Liara chuckled, licking her fingers and reaching for a second helping. The powerful agent acting from the shadows and her confidant and assistant gleefully picked through the donuts like children in a candy store, eliminating each one by one and joyfully exclaiming whatever unique filling their donut happened to have.

Despite the box being larger then the last, Liara reached for another and brushed against the crumbs at the bottom far sooner than expected.

"And I thought....hic...the first one was heavenly..." Dahlia muttered sleepily, licking chocolate filling off of her lips.

"Mmm..." Liara mumbled in agreement, reaching down to undo her belt and relieve the sudden tightness in her gut, knowing Dahlia wouldn't be able to see it behind the desk anyway. The belt popped out as soon as Liara undid the clasp, leaving a bulging, round belly to hang out over her lap, a belly button just barely visible underneath the bottom hem of her jacket. Rolling her shoulders, Liara blushed as the top half of her outfit loosened with the movement, the zipper being forced down and showing off more of her cleavage then she would have liked.

Dahlia blushed at the sight and made to get up, revealing diamonds of blue flesh along her sides where the buttons of her dress were straining to contain her...or rather, failing to contain her.

snap, snap!

Dahlia turned several shades of purple as two of the overtaxed buttons snapped and fell to the ground with a loud clatter, her overstuffed gut pooching forward into the new space opened up by her dress. Not willing to comment on the obvious wardrobe malfunctions, Liara cleared her throat and pulled up the list of Turian commanders again.

"Y-you can go now Dahlia," Liara announced dutifully, not making eye contact with her. Dahlia bowed, equally determined not to make eye contact and waddled out of the room, her shapely rear end somehow even more shapely then before. There was a slight rip as a gap of fabric opened up across the younger Asari's hindquarters before she shimmied out, resolving to herself to finally update her wardrobe.

Something felt off. Liara couldn't put her finger on it, but something was wrong about this whole situation. She knew the two of them were out of shape but...out of shape to the point of causing wardrobe malfunctions like this? It seemed impossible...it HAD to be impossible. There had to be a rational explanation for this. Liara looked inside the empty box, scrutinizing every inch of it but coming up short; the thing was entirely unmarked, nothing off or out of place besides the cream filling that leaked into the bottom. That delicious...heavenly...delectable...filling. Liara leaned in, debating whether or not she could push her face close enough to lick the inner surface clean.

"By the Goddess, get a hold of yourself!" Liara said aloud, shaking her head. Resolutely knocking the box aside and turning to her charts with renewed purpose, or maybe just out of spite, the information broker stubbornly put those ideas out of her head. They were just donuts, probably a simple gift from a client who wanted to remain anonymous, and she was just a little overweight. There's nothing sinister going on. You're just being paranoid. "I need a vacation," Liara spoke aloud again. "I'm starting to see things everywhere." She gave her holographic projections a forceful push, not noticing the new wobble her biceps had.

The next day however, as Liara waddled ("WALKED! I'm WALKING! Not waddling!" she insisted to herself) into her office again, there was something different...
123311141.title: Delicious Donuts for Doughy Days

12331115.content:
"Well, I don't see the harm in it," Liara mused, licking her lips thoughtfully. "I've heard good things about these pastries, perhaps they were sent by someone who considers them more of a delicacy. Ah well..."

She gracefully took a bite from the donut in her hand, chewing thoughtfully.

"Mmm....not bad. Quite sweet." Polishing off the donut in a couple bites, Liara paused at Dahlia's chubby form squirming slightly. "Is something the matter?"

"N-no ma'am, I...just have work to catch up on," Dahlia stammered.

"Well don't let me stop you," Liara said, turning back to her keyboard and picking up another donut with her other hand.

"Of course, ma'am," Dahlia said, giving a little bow and, when she turned around, gave a triumphant smirk as she strode out the door. Quietly shutting the office door behind her and sealing it, the security personal at the terminal nearby gave her a look.

"What are you smirking about?" she asked suspiciously. The tough Asari never quiet trusted her younger counterpart, and she was about to find out why.

"Hmm...must take a few more seconds..." Dahlia mused. The security guard opened her mouth to demand an explanation, but instead yawned, her eyes instantly drooping.

"Wha...wow, I got tired all of a sudden," the guard slurred, swaying on the spot.

"That'd be the anesthetic introduced into the staff's water supply," Dahlia said brightly, projecting the confidence that was shockingly absent before now. "Should be kicking in for the rest of you around the same time."

"You....little..." The guard made to unsheathe her sidearm, but her legs gave out from under her and she toppled forward. Dahlia managed to catch the guard in her arms as a series of loud thumps told her that the rest of the staff Liara had on hand had gone the same way. Setting the guard cautiously on the ground so her now ex-boss wouldn't catch on, Dahlia stepped across the body and over to her work station, retrieving a hidden omni-tool from her desk and slipping it onto her arm. Powering it up, the omni-tool projected a silhouetted humanoid figure, heavily distorted and hidden by fields of static.

"The job is finished?" the figure asked, his or her voice equally distorted and warped.

"In a few minutes, Liara T'Soni will be no more." Or perhaps a lot more, she thought to herself with a sadistic sense of glee.

"Good work, another target down. The payment has been transferred."

The figure vanished as the channel closed, leaving Dahlia to make her hasty exit, slipping out a side door and merging into a crowd of workers coming home from the daily grind. She almost wished she could stay to watch the fireworks. It was unbecoming to make things personal, but after enduring Liara's constant jabs at her waistline she couldn't help but indulge in a little payback, if only via the method of execution.

"Enjoy those donuts," she said to herself quietly. "They'll be your last."

Turning the corner, the crowd of workers merged with a second crowd, and Dahlia vanished from sight.

---

The empty box landed in the garbage dispenser with a loud thump as Liara licked her fingers clean. Not quite the best donuts she'd sampled before, but they were a tasty treat nonetheless, and just the pick-me-up she needed to get through the day. She refocused on the investigation into the Volus assassination plot she was trying to bust wide open when she suddenly felt nauseous, her stomach giving a lurch in response.

"Ugh....urp!" Liara winced as a slight burp escaped her lips. "Perhaps they were a little too sweet." Getting up slightly from her chair, she reached over to grab a water bottle out of the mini fridge on the far edge of her workspace. Taking a sip, she didn't notice the arms of her chair brushing against her hips for the first time as she fully sat back down. "That's better...hrmm..." Tugging her shirt down over her small belly, she dove right back into her work, too engaged to notice her shirt immediately pop back up to reveal her belly button. Taking another sip of water, she filled her cheeks with air and exhaled to fight the weird feeling in her stomach, not noticing her cheeks hadn't fully deflated.

"Should have saved some for later," Liara admitted. "Ah well, power on through it I suppose." Doubling down on her report, she delved deeper into an incident on a Turian shipyard connected to the victims. Hunting for a certain file that would crack the case wide open, she lifted slightly out of her chair, then unconsciously sat back down when she felt the arms of her seat brushing against her broadening hips. Frantic typing and computer blips hid the sound of straining fabric and fasteners until at last her quarry was found.

"Lynchpin of the entire operation, and the password to secure it is his birthday," Liara chuckled, rolling her eyes. She quickly retrieved the file in question to a physical data chit plugged into her system which she reached over to unplug. "Easy as....what?"

Her hand stopped short of the data chit by inches. Mildly annoyed, Liara squeezed herself against the desk and tried to reach, barely brushing her fingertips on the device.

"Ugh, I told her this desk was too big," Liara mumbled, looking down to see what she was hitting against. "I'll need t-"

Liara's voiced dropped and her eyes widened in shock as she looked down, realizing it wasn't the desk that was stopping her from reaching across it. Her shirt had ridden up entirely, revealing not a pot belly but a massive gut spilling over into her lap. She pressed her finger into it in shock, finding it to be very, very real.

Something underneath her snapped. She turned her head and gasped in shock as she watched her hips flaring out beneath her, distorting and cracking the polymer arms of the chair.

"What...what's happening?" Liara's hands flew to her hips this time, and she looked in horror as her fingers began to thicken and bulge before her eyes. She thought back to when she licked them clean earlier.

"The donuts!"

Liara tried to stand up, but her rear end was wedged tightly into the arms of her seat at this point. She slammed a meaty hand into her silent alarm underneath the desk. No response. Swearing, she tried to extract herself from the chair, the struggle popping her belt buckle off and sending it flying across the room; the front of her trousers split open and her gut split into two rolls and plopped down over her thighs. Her shirt had been reduced to serving as a bra for her swelling, sagging chest, and it was already starting to split apart at the seams.

Another loud snap, and the chair arm came off in Liara's pudgy hand. Her fat thighs sprung out to their full width as the Asari overbalanced and fell over, hitting the ground with an enormous 'smack' sound. Thoroughly winded, she tried to sit up but was immediately blocked by the immense stomach making a beeline for her knees.

At last, though, the initial shock of fattening up at an extreme rate wore off, and Liara was able to think clearly. Whatever was going on, it was caused by the substance put into those donuts. It had to be. Meaning there was one hope left; the Antidote. A gift from Miranda Lawson after she retired from her own espionage work, the Antidote was a universal panacea, able to counteract even the most incurable toxins or poisons, and with her staff most likely eliminated, it was her only hope.

Taking a deep breath, Liara rolled over onto her knees before the adipose on her legs swallowed them. Getting up to a standing position, she felt her feet burst free from her fashionable shoes and spread across the floor, followed by the seat of her pants splitting apart and joining the remains of her footwear. Taking heavy, plodding steps towards the array of potted plants, she pressed a thick finger to an innocuous spot on the side, hoping her hands weren't too fat for this.

"Remember the old days..." Liara huffed, feeling her multiple chins weighing her lips down. "...when you could just slap...omni-gel on everything?"

The potted plant dinged as the pass phrase was accepted, the inside opening up to reveal a small plastic bottle of neon green pills. She grabbed onto it in desperation, trying to unscrew the cap. To her horror, it slipped from her meaty grip, bouncing onto the floor
.
"No!" she yelled, desperately bending over to try and reach in, her flexibility in the same shape as her shoes and pants at this point. Her knees were crying out in agony. It wouldn't be long before they couldn't support her growing bulk anymore.

"Not....going out....like...this....!" Liara huffed, straining to reach the bottle on the floor as she reached her breaking point. Her hope began to drain away as her stamina did, she could feel herself starting to tip over...

BANG! BANG!

Liara gasped. The door! Someone was banging at the door, trying to open it up! Did the alarm finally reach someone? She tried to call out to unlock the door with another voice command, but sparks began flying from the sides as the hinges were shot or blasted off. The door slammed to the ground as Liara's savior jumped over the threshold.
12331115.title: Eliminating the Competition

choices: Wait...I'm not supposed to be like this!
I've been putting on quite a bit of weight since the war ended, haven't I?
Why am I concerned now? I've ALWAYS been fat.
1233112.content:
Liara waited apprehensively as the box slowly and methodically opened up, the top intricately folding in on itself in a mechanical pattern. Thinking back, it felt rather light in her hands considering how intricate and complicated this box was designed. Maybe the box itself was the gift? Now that the Geth were on friendly terms with the rest of the galaxy, they were putting out devices that acted like this. Maybe this was intended to be a bribe or a payment from someone who owed her, and she racked her brain to think of who that could be.

Liara T'Soni...our Sisters give you a taste of what could have been.

"What the hell?"

Liara's eyes darted around the room, methodically searching for anything suspect. That voice...it sounded like it came from inside her head. Making sure her sidearm was loaded and ready, Liara looked suspiciously at the mechanical box as it stopped its opening process. Whoever said that...it had to come from this thing. What exactly did it mean by "a taste of what could have been"? And who were the sisters? Liara came up with a few options on the spot, but the wording was too vague to really pin that name down. Choosing to investigate further, Liara leaned over and looked into the interior of the strange box. It looked oddly empty. She cautiously pushed the box with one slender finger into a better light, when-

*BANG*

Liara yelped as a plume of thick, gray-blue smoke erupted from the box, flooding her eyes and nostrils with the stinging cloud. Choking, she waved her flabby arms wildly to disperse the smoke, swearing up a storm.

"Miss T'soni, is something wrong?" Dahlia asked as she strode into the room, hips swaying gently as she pushed a cart in front of her.

"I'm f-fine, no thanks to my security team," Liara coughed, batting away the last of the smoke as it dissipated. "I thought you said they checked this!"

"They did, it didn't do anything particularly odd, just opened up and closed again," Dahlia confirmed.

"Well if another one comes, let me know. I'll deal with whoever is sending them after breakfast." Liara's knees started to ache, so she dropped into her seat with a heavy thud as Dahlia began collecting the multitude of plates decorating her desk, swapping them out with platters full of deep fried and battered delicacies. The smell alone was heavenly; even Dahlia couldn't contain herself as she stared at all the plates hungrily.

"You're not sneaking some of my food, are you?" Liara asked pointedly.

"W-WHAT?" Dahlia almost shouted. "M-miss T'soni, I swear-!"

"Relax, I'm only teasing," Liara chuckled. "You can go now, see you at lunch Dahlia." Liara eyed her assistant as she quickly waddled from the room, nearly catching her hips on the door frame, and as the door slid shut, the Shadow Broker could hear the telltale sound of someone taking a large bite out of something and chewing happily. It was a good thing she was a fine assistant, because Liara knew almost from the day she hired her that the girl had a monstrous sweet tooth and was absolutely stealing any morsel she could. That ambition and determination made her quite reliable, even as she went from slightly tubby to comfortably obese in a remarkably short time, nearly doubling in size and bursting out of that black skintight outfit on a weekly basis.

Not that Liara could complain, given she had an equally ravenous taste for sweets. Licking her lips excitedly, the Shadow Broker undid the bottom buttons on her jacket to make room, letting her enormous double-rolled gut spill out onto her lap, before tucking into the massive spread before her. Squeezing apart the arms of the chair, the Shadow Broker attacked the food before her with glee, crumbs and morsels escaping and falling down her thick cheeks and chins. Wiping across her lips with the back of her hand...Liara had the strangest feeling. Like...something wasn't normal.

Getting up from her desk (easier said then done, given how much she had to squeeze to escape the vice-like grip of the chair arms on her hips, Liara took an exceedingly rare break from eating and waddled into her quarters again to check the mirror on her dresser. She checked every inch of her appearance, from her makeup on her round face to her pants struggling to contain a butt that was outgrowing chairs. Cautiously lifting up her belly with both hands and letting it fall back to her thighs with a soft *plop*, Liara turned on her heel, popping her hips out to extreme effect and snapping a seam in her overtaxed undergarments.

Liara reflected for a moment and thought...

12332.title: Romance: Shepard

choices: “Liara, I’m partially to blame for your weight.”
“I’m actually rather enjoying your new body.”
*Cosmic Reset* Another version of this scenario.
123322.content:
Two figures lay intertwined within a plush apartment set in a tower over the Silversun Strip. Arms and legs were tangled together as the two held each other close, and the covers were tossed and kicked aside, both savoring the cool air drifting across their glistening sweat soaked bodies. One was the blue-skinned Liara T’Soni, and curled up beside her was the pale-skinned and red-headed Serah Shepard, a Spectre and the hero of the galaxy after breaking the eon long cycle of growth and extermination by the Reapers. Liara still thought back to when she was forced to leave Serah during the final push towards the Conduit and the strange mix of fear and joy when there was no contact with after the Commander was able fire the Crucible and stop the Reaper attacks. She also thought of how she nearly wept with relief when crews sent to the Citadel to find any possible survivors came across Shepard still stubbornly clinging to life; albeit barely. Since then Liara had stayed with her love through Serah’s lengthy recuperation from the injuries sustained through the Battle of Earth and beyond. Once recovered, the two had spent a great deal of time together, reveling in the relative peace that had come to the galaxy and the chance to relax. The Normandy and its crew – including the gallant Commander – were still regularly called into action, but this happened far less often than before, and Liara had been spending less time overseeing the information network as the Shadow Broker – thanks in large part to Feron and some upgrades made to Glyph – both of which resulted in Serah and Liara having quite a bit more free time than either were used to.

This brought the Asari’s wandering mind back to the present: her body pressed tight up against her heroic lover, who wore naught but a contented smile as she dozed after another marathon lovemaking session with Liara. Beneath her arm, Liara could feel Serah’s breathing, slow and deep. Liara could also feel how her body was showing further results from her less active lifestyle that didn’t often rely on military rations. Before, she was trim and slender, but now sported a small but noticeable layer of fat across her whole body, the softness conforming slightly to the trim and firm frame of Serah. The Asari wasn’t exactly too sure about her weight, but Shepard oddly enough certainly didn’t seem to mind at all though. As she thought of this, an idea that had come to her before and dismissed just as repeatedly returned yet again: a cautious wonder that maybe the great Commander Shepard actually maybe preferred a little meat on her lover. Remembering the feelings of Serah fondling Liara’s slightly more fleshy breasts, and her hand snaking about to grope the meatier blue ass behind sent a pleasant shiver down the Asari’s spine.

Liara was too distracted with her thoughts till “Couldn’t sleep?” came sleepily from right next to her before a pair of soft, full, and pouty lips were pressed against her own lips, breaking her line of thought again.

As the kiss broke, Shepard scooted back just a short distance, as she tenderly caressed Liara’s head crests.

“Sorry, Serah, did I wake you?” a familiar heat creeping into her cheeks.

Shepard gave a slight nod of the head in response, “It’s no trouble, but what’s up?” moving her head down to Liara’s cheek.

A sigh escaped Liara before she went ahead and blurted it out, “I’ve been thinking about a lot of things, but I keep coming back to my weight.” To illustrate, she reached down and gripped what she could of her belly.

“Yes about that,” Serah said, a blush coloring her cheeks as well as the last traces of sleep were dispelled, “I’ve been meaning to talk to you about that, but I’ve been having some trouble finding how to admit it. Since you brought it up though...”

Liara’s mouth went dry and her mind whirled with possibilities, all of them various shades of bad news, as Shepard struggled to come up with the right words. The Commander had almost never been caught tongue tied, so Liara could only assume that it must be something really terrible for this to happen.

“Liara…the truth is…” as she run her fingers down Liara’s spine, the Asari felt a familiar tingle spreading from the touch, a sign that her human lover was using her a tiny amount of her biotics, something both had started doing to stimulate each other, which only further confused Liara.

Eventually Serah seemed to figure how she was going to say what was on her mind, and that proved to not quite be what Liara’s panicked mind had been expecting at the moment.

12332222.title: lay back and watch liara grow

choices: The pampering continues, and Liara gets quite lazy.
The pampering continues, and Liara can't get enough of Prothean cuisine.
(Free choice, in case you want another scenario for T'sovik)
12333.content:
"Alright, we'll get your paperwork all sorted out and you'll be discharged, Miss T'soni," the Asari doctor said brightly as he scrolled through the data on her omni-tool.

"Thank the Goddess," Liara muttered, albeit gratefully considering she would at last escape this dreary hospital. She couldn't imagine how it must have been for Shepard to spend months in a hospital bed with her innards barely held together, after the Crucible explosion. Liara had only been here for a week and she was starting to feel a bit stir-crazy.

"Now, you'll need to stay off your feet and leave the cast-shielding on for a month or so until your legs are fully repaired," the doctor explained, gesturing towards the hard-light constructs functioning as casts for her mangled legs. "I assume you have transportation home?"

"Yes she does."

The doctor gave a start as the Prothean spoke up, revealing himself after entering the room stoically and patiently waiting behind her.

"Javik!" Liara pushed herself off the bed, wincing slightly. The doctor stood there, shocked at the sight of the legendary alien species as he walked up to her bedside, resting their foreheads against one another in a show of affection. "Have things been busy?" Liara asked as they broke apart.

"Yes, I've hunted down the individual responsible for the shuttle accident and inflicted vengeance upon him," Javik reported. "His suffering was legendary and it can be assured he will not make that mistake again."

There was a deadly silence as the doctor turned pale. Javik's stoic expression cracked into a slight smile.

"I'm kidding."

Liara giggled as the poor doctor breathed a sigh of relief. At long last, the Prothean had developed a sense of humor, albeit a dark one.

"Right, I'll...go get you discharged. And find the wheelchair..." the doctor said, hastily making her exit.

"Thank you, by the way," Liara said as her giggling came to an end.

Javik looked puzzled. "What did I do?"

"Reminded me of how much I missed you."

Javik, deeply touched, reached out to take her hand as she held it out. The Prothean wasn't one to wear his feelings on his shoulder, but the remarkable gentleness of his hand in hers betrayed his feelings. He might as well have been singing love songs on the roof of the hospital.

"And....you're sure there won't be any lasting damage?" Javik asked wearily.

"None so long as I stay off my feet for a while. I'll be back to sitting behind my desk in no time."

"Ah, so this is the stage of 'pampering' then."

Liara raised an eyebrow, looking puzzled.

"The 'pampering'," Javik explained. "I was speaking with the wild human Jack, and she insisted that while you are recovering I should and I quote, 'pamper' you. Setting you in a comfortable position, preparing you meals, activities to that effect."

"Of course she said that," Liara chuckled. "So you're actually going to cook for me then?"

"You would be surprised," Javik said. "Now that my service as an Avatar of Vengeance is unnecessary I've found I had plenty of free time to devote to such recreational activities. In addition, I figured you would appreciate sampling some Prothean cuisine I have knowledge of."

Liara's eyes lit up at the idea of sampling what the ancient Protheans would have eaten. Ever the enthusiast of the ancient culture, Liara's only familiarity with their diets was archeological evidence suggesting their bodies had a higher then average metabolism and needed extra calories to function. Years ago she would have laughed it off if someone suggested she'd be eating what the Protheans ate millennia ago, and yet here she was, being told that's exactly what she'd be doing.

Javik once again cracked a smile. "I figured you would enjoy that."

---

Liara stirred as the light from a Thessian sunrise touched her face. Her legs felt heavy and numb, the light-casts keeping them securely in place as she slept. Cracking open her eyes, she saw the empty spot on the bed where Javik had been.

Pushing herself up to a reclining postion, Liara stretched out her sore back muscles, still recovering from the stiff hospital bed and the first night back on her more comfortable mattress. As the tantalizing thought of a day spent doing absolutely nothing stretched out before her, she caught scent of something on the air. Something delicious.

"Good morning, Liara," Javik announced, shouldering the door open with a tray in his hands.

"Good...morning," the Asari responded, trying to stifle a giggle at the sight of Javik in, of all things, a cooking apron and a chef's hat. She couldn't fault him for being dedicated, that's for sure.

"This is my first attempt at the Prothean cooking," Javik explained as he set the tray down. "I had to improvise as a few spices seem to have gone extinct since the last cycle, but I think I've recreated it as best as possible.

"Well it smells delicious," Liara complimented, looking over the meal. It seemed to resemble the human delicacy of pancakes but visibly thicker, speckled blue and layered like a cake with a red butter-like substance melted on top. Liara took up the silverware and cut herself a piece, eyes widening as the flavor hit her. "Incredible! I want to say it's sweet but...there's a body to it I haven't experienced before, like nothing I've ever tasted. Amazing!"

Javik smiled slightly. "It's one of the simpler dishes I admit, but it has a kick to it that a lot of cuisine from this era lacked. If you'd like, I can make some extra."

"Mmmf...yeth, PLEATHE!" Liara said through a massive mouthful, her cheeks bulging as she nearly reduced the Prothean dish to half. As Javik gave her a quick peck on the side of her face before leaving to make some more, a nagging voice in the back of Liara's head warned her of the dangers of no physical activity combined with a heavy Prothean diet, only to be quickly drowned out by the voice of the Prothean enthusiast screaming in excitement.

This was going to be the opportunity of a lifetime for her, she wasn't going to let fears about a couple pounds spoil that for her.
12333.title: Accidents Happen, You Have to Learn to Accept That

choices: "This food is totally worth getting flabby for."
"Heh...I bet me being bigger means I can eat more."
123332.content:
It had been pouring rain for five days now, a downpour that brought on a rather unpleasant chill and a biting breeze. It was the kind of day that made you want to cuddle up in a blanket and watch a fun movie, and Liara was doing just that. Sure that was what she mostly did anyway thanks to her legs, but the bad weather made cuddling up even more pleasing, especially now that she had someone else to cuddle with. Leaning against Javik's chest as they reclined on the sofa, Liara let out a soft sigh as the last scene of the movie (Citadel, a fairly popular dramatization of Commander Shepard's fight against the rogue Spectre Saren) played and the credits began to roll.

"Interesting..." Javik said thoughtfully. "That was your first mission with Commander Shepard?"

"Mhmm," Liara said soothingly. "Give or take a few details."

"Yes, they seemed to think the Reaper indoctrinating him had been a spaceship," Javik said coolly. "Not to mention they had an...unusual take on your relationship with the Commander."

"I'm sorry if that was awkward," Liara said, remembering the uncomfortable shuffle the two of them shared when the scene featuring a rather charged encounter between Shepard's character and Liara's flashed on screen. It wasn't a surprise of course, the Asari had always been up front about the relationship she had with Commander Shepard, and how after she came back from the dead they just couldn't rekindle that spark and they both moved on. Still, it didn't exactly make seeing a dramatization of herself 'embracing eternity' with her ex any less awkward.

"It was not," Javik confirmed, putting her at ease. "She was poorly cast anyway."

"She was? I thought the actors did well. The man playing Mr. Moreau even confined himself to a wheelchair for the part."

"True..." he said, taking her hand in his. "But I do not believe there is a soul alive who could match your radiance and set the stars alight as you can."

Liara's face immediately flushed at the amorous comment. "That...is so cheesy," she giggled.

"You do not appreciate my...waxing of the poetic, as humans call it?" He drew in closer, and she could practically feel his slow powerful heartbeat.

"Let me put it this way..." Liara said, drawing the Prothean closer and locking lips in a deep, passionate kiss. Javik responded in turn, careful to avoid bumping into Liara's damaged legs, still held in place by the cast shielding. They would be coming off soon though, and frankly she could not wait to be free of them and really "show" her beloved how deeply she appreciated everything he had done for her.

It felt like hours had passed before they finally broke apart; Liara's stomach seemed to think so as it growled at the pair of them.

"Dinner time," Liara announced.

"So it is," Javik confirmed. "Are you perhaps feeling adventurous?"

"You tell me," Liara responded, playfully stroking the side of his face.

"Then I have just the thing." Leaving her with a peck on the cheek, Javik stood up from the couch and strode into the kitchen, which sprang to life upon his entry. Stretching out her neck, Liara untangled herself from the blanket, now that she was plenty warm, and lay sprawled out on the couch, wondering what delectable awaited her. Of all the pampering and affection she got, by far the Prothean-made meals were some of the best parts. And of course now that she wasn't wrapped in a blanket that was starting to become apparent.

Liara frowned slightly, reaching down to caress the side of her stomach pooching out from under her shirt. She had expected to become a little out of shape considering she couldn't exactly go for a walk to shed some pounds, but maybe not quite this soon. Far from just a belly, Liara was starting to gain a not-insignificant layer of fat on herself, rounding out some of her bony features and making her comfy clothes for lounging around something of a tight fit. It was prominent on her belly of course, and to a lesser extent her chest, which had started to visibly strain the buttons on some of her shirts. She didn't even want to think about how her legs or rear looked after being sat on 24/7 for the same amount of time.

As the smells from the kitchen began to arrive in full force, already making Liara drool in anticipation, she spared one last thought for her burgeoning pudge...

1242.content:
19th January, 2185
The Collector base has been destroyed, my ties to Cerberus are cut, and Orianna is secure. My father still searches for the both of us, but I've made sure that he will be on a wild goose chase for a year and a half. Who did he think he was, to make me perfect? He had no idea of the expectation I'd be held to. If only there was a way I could spite him; put a big, glaring splotch on his legacy. For now, I am left to be a vigilante with Shepard and the rest of her crew. It will suffice until I find a new purpose.

Miranda Lawson sat up from the desk in her quarters and went to join Shepard on the bridge. She was up on the command platform, studying the map of the galaxy.

"So, what are we to do next, Commander?" Miranda asked, standing at Shepard's side.

Shepard sighed and brushed her red hair to the side. "Right now, just a few distress signals, a job on Illium, and a few Alliance fetch assignments."

"I suggest that we complete minor work for now, allow the team some easy work while they recover from Omega 4." Miranda said, "Then, later, we can look at bigger ops."

"Sounds fine to me." Shepard said, setting coordinates for the ship. "We'll check out a wreck in the Traverse. Get Thane ready, then grab your gear."

"Right away." Miranda said and strutted back into the elevator.
---------------
A short while later, the team's shuttle was getting close to the planet's surface. Miranda had the briefing information.

"It appears that this ship was owned by a private party, as it lacks any kind of insignia or marking." She read off of her datapad.

"It is strange to see an unaffiliated vessel this deep in the Traverse." Thane commented. "This system is thick with Blood Pack mercenaries."

"That'll be the problem, the Blood Pack are already looting the wreckage." Miranda said, examining the scans.

"We'll need to get as close as possible to the crash, to minimize any damage to the remains." Shepard said, "We're coming in, weapons out!"

The shuttle door opened and the team dropped straight into the hot zone, dropping countless Vorcha and Krogan fighting their way to the wreck. There were a few cases of palladium scattered outside the remains, along with some credits and a few blueprints. Once inside, they searched for the security room to find a log of events leading up to the crash. They found a recording of a conversation logged in the QEC records. The speakers said,

"We've almost reached our destination, sir." The first voice said, "We have avoided the Blood Pack thus far."

"Make sure that you do, Captain." The second warned, "You won't get a second chance."

Miranda's eyes lit with surprise. "That's my father's voice!"

"Was he onboard?" Shepard asked.

"No, all of the casualties were identified, he must have been the one transmitting." Thane concluded.

"Let's keep listening." Shepard said.

"I know sir, we won't disappoint." The captain returned. "You'll get what you need."

"I know that my faith was not misplaced." He paused for a moment. "My daughter has made me wary of betrayal."

"You have a daughter, sir?"

"Two, actually. I never married, however. They were grown in a lab."

"Genetic engineering, eh?"

"Precisely. I bred them to be perfect, in intelligence, endurance, and appearance."

"You wanted them to have the looks to get by in life?"

"That, in addition to their other factors. I can't stand a fat woman, so I gave them great bodies and put healthy habits into their brains."

Miranda crossed her arms. "Judging bastard." She mumbled.

"I'll see you when we get the goods, sir."

"Good, Lawson out." The recording ended.

The team salvaged what items were left and returned to the Normandy. Miranda sat in her quarters playing that one sentence over and over again in her head. I can't stand a fat woman, I cant stand a fat woman... That's it! She thought, He wanted me to be physically perfect. If he hates fat, that means I love it. That's how I'll become imperfect.

She decided to get help from someone, of course, she wouldn't tell them what she was actually doing. That person was,
1242.title: A Distress Signal

choices: Miranda wants Shepard for moral support.
Miranda wants Shepard to take a more active role…
12421.content:
There was no one in the galaxy that Miranda trusted more than Shepard. She’d already helped her in the past with her sister without even asking any questions, so if she was going to get anyone’s help with this, it was Shelard. Miranda spent the next several hours coming up with a foolproof explanation for why she wanted to gain weight. It was actually something she was very proud of. Not that it mattered in the end.

“So what you’re telling me is,” Shepard started once Miranda gave her fantastic excuse. “you want to get fat to spite your father?”

“How’d you—”

“I was there.” So it wasn’t entirely foolproof. What is?

“Right…” Miranda cleared her throat and looked towards Shelard’s models, feeling too embarrassed to look her in the eyes. I knew this was a bad idea. I should always trust my instincts.

“I’ll do it.”

Miranda snapped her attention back to Sheparad. “You will? Why?”

Shepard shrugged, not feeling all too sure of the reason herself. “I don’t know, because we’re friends? Do I really need any more reason than that?”

The little half smile Shepard gave her pulled at Miranda’s heart strings, and made her want to kick herself. Of course Shepard would help her. When has she ever not helped her? “Thank you, Shepard. You have no idea how much this means to mean.”

Another shrug, but this time Shepard’s cheeks are tinted red. “Yeah, well…you’re welcome.” A moment of silence follows. “So how exactly do you want me to help you with this?”
12421.title: Shepard

124212.content:
"My father, the creep, out in fail safes to keep my thin,' Miranda explains, 'first two are biological: I've got a fast metabolism and fat burning nanites in my blood. The last will activate as soon as I get a pound over 125. Mordins working on some pills to help me with those two. I need your assistance on the psychological aspects.'

'People always say I should have been a therapist instead of a commando,' the red headed N7 agent said, noting with glee that Miranda had turned to lean against the wall railing of her office, full heart shaped rear pressing against her catsuit.

'Ive a deep revulsion to over eating and fatty foods in general,' Miranda explained, 'I get sick if I get full and can barely swallow fatty, sweet or greasy food. I'll need you to help me get over that. It will involve ....some sexual, intimate things.'

'Oh really?' Asked Shepard, who'd been mentally undressing her curvy XO the whole time, 'Like what?'

'Rubbing my erogenous zones whilst I eat, massaging my stomach, hand feeding me, probably making me orgasm,' the Cerberus operative explained.

'Miranda, I didn't think you swung that way,' Shepard noted.

'Im not gay!' Miranda huffed, 'I just ...need someone I can trust to help me and that person is you. I know you're bisexual, and while you may enjoy this now with luck I'll soon be looking a lot less attractive.'

' Trust me, I'll be enjoying it through out...,' smiled the commander.

1243.content:
When embarrassed faced with embarrassment, there are a number of different reactions that people can have. Some people may start to cry, while others will put on a smile and attempt to brush it off.

Jack has one response and one response only. Three guesses, first two don’t count.

“CEREBERUS BITCH!!!” she cried, kicking a worthless piece of scrap metal that dared to lay on the floor of her industrial hidey-hole. “RIP HER SKIN OFF HER PERFECT GODDAMN BODY AND MAKE HER FUCKIN’ EAT IT!!” The entire lower deck was being lit up in the violent blue of biotic powers flaring up. Pipes started to rattle with a nervous apprehension as the engineering team took refuge to the upper levels, not wanting to be around to offer a lightning rod for Jack’s rage. “SHOVE THE GODDAMN COLLECTOR BASE UP HER STUPID FUCKIN’ ASS IF SHE THINKS SHE CAN GET AWAY WITH THIS SHIT!!”

Not but ten minutes earlier, Jack had come up late to grab a dinner tray and take it back down to the hold before anyone tried to talk to her. Just as she stepped into the elevator, she heard a group snickering while reciting some familiar words.

“My soul buuuuuuuurns with a fire of darkness,” said a voice in a deep, facetious tone, barely able to hold back sniggering.
“Keep reading, it gets even better!” That was Miranda! How did she get her poetry?!
“Alright, alright, ahem, ‘quenched only in the pain of loneliness, I hold my breath waiting’, pffffft…” A crowd of voices broke out laughing. Jack exited the elevator, and turned to see a group of crew members reading of a datapad, all while Miranda stood back smirking.
“You wouldn't believe how easy this was to find, and there’s tons more we it came from,” said Miranda, “I guess Little Miss Psycho is a bit more whiny than we thought.”
The group’s laughing was cut short as the clatter of Jack’s tray hitting the floor alerted them of her presence. Jack ran to the elevator faster than you could blink, and felt rage pulsing in her veins as she reached the bottom floor of the Normandy. No one seemed to immediately realize the beast that had awakened, although some said that thought they saw tears in her eye.

---

“SQUEEZE YOU INTO A LITTLE BALL AND PUNT YOU INTO A SUN AND CHOP YOU INTO PIECES AND FEED YOU TO VORCHA AND TAKE YOUR STUPID PERFECT LITTLE FATASS DUMBSHIT-” Suddenly, she stopped dead in her tracks, the room going silent. The sadistic gleam of vengeance-filled revelation painted itself across her face. Fatass, she liked that term with Miranda. Something about the ‘perfect human’ turning into some lardass pig. Something about the destruction of the ‘perfect body’ that she valued so highly. Sounded like a personal punishment for a personal crime. Rage and tears left her mind, only vengeance remained. She wasn’t quite sure how she was going to do this, but she was more positive that it had to be done.
1243.title: Mass Effect Rising: Revengance

choices: Go spike Miranda's food, and watch the chaos unfold!
Maybe test it out on someone else first...
12431.content:
How exactly would she turn Miranda into a giant fatass? Jack's first thought was to walk up to her officer, tie her up, and feed her until Cheerleader was a balloon, but that would no doubt get her in trouble with the Commander. A chill ran up her spine as she thought of what kinda of punishment Shepard would think of in return. Shep had bit of a karma obsession, and Jack knew getting caught would not be worth it. Maybe she could hire a bunch of mercs to kidnap Miranda and do it all for her. But even with an in, Miranda was hard to get to, only alternating between at her desk or going out on combat mission in a most binary way. Why couldn't she just have a pill to spike her drink with to turn Princess Cerby into a blob? No scientist would be crazy enough to help her besides a madman.

         "Mordin!" she cried out, smacking her fist into her palm. Time to find the coot and see if he was down of a little experiment. She ran out of her hold and punched the deck button on the elevator.

         Once on the right floor, she barged at the elevator and made a beeline for the salarian's lab. Opening the door, she saw the good doctor pacing back and forth, mumbling to himself.

         "Perhaps convert to secondary processor? No, nerve connection not sufficient...." he muttered, clearly deep in thought, "Aide in digestion? Nononono, supplements passable....."

         "Eh.... What up doc?" Jack offered awkwardly, disrupting his thought process, "What'cha, uh, working on?"

         "Oh, Subject Zero, surprising," he responded at a breakneck pace, "Attempting to modify human appendix to offer alternative function to remove vestigial status. Sidework. Do you require assistance?"

         "Uh yeah actually, got a little..... uh..... project," Jack felt the words stumble out her mouth. How would she get him to go along with her scheme? "I got a little idea for a nice prank, y'know."

         "Target; Miranda? Questionable 'niceness' involved...." Mordin said, giving Jack a stern look, "Heard of poetry incident. Incorrect of her, payback expected. However, possible Shepard reaction to counter-action, unpleasant...."

         "Bitch deserves to get ejected into a supernova!!" Jack snapped back, "All I want to for you to cook something up to fatten her up for me!"

         Mordin paused, contemplating Jack's idea, his frown melting into a catlike smile.

         "Concept harmless enough, reversible, heart disease from adipose build up easy enough to avoid. Medication difficult to track back...." he paused for a moment longer. "Alright, will pursue operation! Interesting challenge, simpler than organ rewiring.... Return in after hours for product."

         "Hey, thanks doc!" she shouted with almost childish glee, "I guess I owe yah one!"

         She left with a beaming smile on her face, and Mordin began to work.

         Hours later, once everyone went to bed, Jack returned to pick up her tools of revenge. Mordin looked up from his desk when she opened the door, a content smile on his face.

         "Rousing success! Lab results in green!" he said with glee, indicating a pillbox and a bag of powder, "Two components synthesized, necessitating two prong attack. Component one; appetite stimulant. Three effects; increases appetite, converts 95% of calories to fat, and supplements nutrition. 'Junk' food can be eaten constantly, lacking nutrients filled in an replaced. Subject remains perfectly at health. Component two; caloric increaser. Contains contains high amounts of calories, when coupled with component one, almost instantly creates adipose. Additionally, compatible with dextro protien, increase of, ahem, quarian troubles."

         "Okay, lemme get this straight," Jack said, "Pill increases hunger, and lets you get whatever you want without keeling over, just turns food to fat, and the fairydust makes you straight up fat. Give pill, and spike with powder..."

         "Exactly!" Mordin exclaimed, "Simple to use, makes it look somewhat natural. Little to trace. Fun experiment!"

         "Alright, you did good, doc," Jack said, scooping up her newfound toys, "Thanks a bundle, ya quack!"

         She left the lab, and descended the elevator to return to her quarters underneath engineering. Nothing stood in the way of her revenge against Miranda... Time to put her plans into action.
12431.title: Accomplice Acquired!

124311.content:
The amount of names in Jack’s shit list could fill a phone book, but Miranda had managed to jump all the way to the number one spot, while no one else on the Normandy even breached her top twenty-five, she now had a great method for getting revenge. After removing a single dose of the powder, Jack hid the rest of the stash away in a random compartment in her little hide-y hole in engineering for later use.



So, the ex-con headed up a floor to the crew deck, where she waited for Miranda’s cup to go unattended. When she saw a still full mug of coffee, she stealthily sprinkled the powder into it, and waited for Miranda to return. When Miranda came back she took a sip from the mug. “heh drink up bitch” Fortunately, Mordin was right about it working fast, as Miranda’s figure slowly began to creep outward before Jack could blink.



The new weight appearing on her body from the ingestion of the condensed calorie dust or whatever exactly it was Mordin had gave her, the majority of the weight was too lazy to move up, as it all seemed to go to Miranda’s lower half. A very small belly began to protrude outward, fighting for space against Miranda’s shirt and belt, while her thighs slightly thickened, and her rump became even more plush. Even with a more then generous portion going to her lower half, some still went upward, softening her perfectly sculpted face, and plumping up her large bust.



Though Jack had never been good at telling weight, she guessed that Miranda had put on 10 pounds over the course of five minutes from a teaspoon of the powder alone.



Oddly enough, even after absentmindedly patting her belly when her growth was done, Miranda didn’t seem to notice the new weight. Jack smiled and stifled a giggle knowing her plan was going to work perfectly “I will teach you a lesson you won’t ever forget, you soon to be fatty”.



When Miranda was done, she stood up and walked away to place her utensils away, when she walked jack noticed an almost imperceptible jiggle to Mirandas rear “heh, this will be even more fun than I thought it would”



Jack figured to avoid suspicion she should wait and only use the powder once every few days, to avoid suspicion and to draw out the enjoyment from the cheerleaders suffering.



2 day’s past since the initial dose of powder was given and Jack decided now was the time to make the perfect cheerleaders body a little less perfect. Jack waited in the crew deck till she saw Miranda order herself a meal and a drink, Jack could swear the meal looked larger than what Miranda normally ordered. She planned to cause a distraction to get Miranda away from her food so she could spike it again and just as Miranda was about to take a bite she sprung her distraction, she caused Miranda to get an urgent alert on her omni tool, Miranda obviously annoyed by this began to mutter angrily, however she didn’t have a choice and left her food to go deal with the message. As soon as Miranda was out of sight Jack got up and walked over to the food on the table, she put a teaspoon of the powder into the food and a teaspoon into the drink, she then mixed it with an evil grin across her face and casually walked back over to where she was sitting before, to watch the cheerleader begin to fatten.



Miranda walked back in with an angry look on her perfect face. She sat down and began to eat with the perfect poise and grace that she always had, lifting the unknown calorific catastrophe into her mouth, Jack face lit up when she saw the effects starting to take place, she began to take a video as she saw Miranda eat, her white outfit slowly pushed outwards containing Miranda’s new inch of fat that encompassed her growing lower half “That’s right fatty keep eating it up, soon there will be enough of your ‘perfect’ cheerleader body to get stuck in doorways”. Jack continued to watch Miranda eat she smiled every time she pulled her outfit to make it more comfortable.



When Miranda had finished Jack’s, eyes went wide when she looked at Miranda’s waist and saw a muffin top. “A muffin top!” she thought to herself “The perfect woman has a fucking muffin top!” She almost squealed with delight when she saw it. By jacks guess Miranda had put on another 20 pounds or so, however this time Miranda did notice the change, she wasn’t stupid after all. Miranda stood up quickly causing her newly formed flesh to jiggle, giving a gasp of surprise as she stood, and it was there that Jack got her first good view of the damage. Miranda’s face had softened, giving her slightly chubby cheeks and the hint of a double chin on her face, her neck looked thicker, her bust which had already been sizeable, had grown noticeably and her breasts usual perkiness had started to give way to a slight sag, her stomach had gone from the slight layer of fat that it was a few days ago, and become a full band of fat flesh spilling over her belt on all sides, however it was Miranda’s butt and thighs which was the main focus of the newly formed fat, her legs and ass had lost some of their tone, giving way to softness. Miranda obviously confused and worried by this quickly walked to the doorway, red faced with embarrassment, tugging at her clothes trying to hide her new weight.



Jack watched as walked out, her new fat ass jiggling as she walked through the door way. Jack howled with laughter as the doors closed behind Miranda “HAHA if this keeps up she will be too fat for those doors! A couple more sessions and then maybe I can write a poem about Miranda! Maybe I’ll call it, ‘Mega muffintop’ she would love that! Still 30 pounds total is a long way, I think 300 pounds added to your frame will make a nice additon” Jack continued to smile to herself for the next few days, occasionally catching glimpses of Miranda going to and from her daily routines her new muffin top jiggling as she walked, “well she’s much easier to spot now” jack remarked to herself.

Another few day’s past before jack decided to laden up Miranda’s food with the powder again she would still only use 2 teaspoons of the powder, she wanted to draw out Miranda’s suffering as long as possible. Miranda stomped off loudly grumbling to herself about ridiculous times to message her. What’s happened to me!” Miranda screamed. She stood up, slower than she normally did and with a lot more jiggling than should be there on the ‘perfect human’. Jack got the perfect view of Miranda ‘the lard arse’ Lawson’s new frame as Miranda frantically tried to push the fat back into her body, Jack guessed that she must of put on a good 70 pounds from this binge. Jack was glad to see the full extent of her work, Miranda had definitely got a pear shape now. Miranda’s jacket flapped open exposing her gut, which now hung slightly from her frame with her soft pale flesh jiggling as she moved to close her jacket, Jack noticed her fingers and hands had grown thicker giving her the beginnings of sausage fingers. Miranda’s new double chin jiggled and swayed from her face as she continued to try and push away her fat.
