While Jack was wandering around the mess hall finding test subjects for her "prank", Kenneth Donnelly and Gabriella Daniels were scouring around the engine room looking for parts.

"This is ridiculous," Kenneth grumbled, collecting armfuls of tubing. "Our filter systems work fine, they don't need to be upgraded!"

"Cleaner air and water isn't going to kill you, Kenneth," Gabriella reminded him. "Besides, can you really blame a Quarian for wanting the air and water on the ship to be disease free? If Tali's going off fighting the Collectors we can't keep giving her fevers."

"I'm still doing this under protest," Kenneth complained, heading into Jack's section of the ship to get some loose piping he knew was located there. "I'm an engineer, I work on the engines! If I want to work on filtration I'd be a...filtrationeer or something..."

"Just hurry and find the things we need, okay?" Gabriella said in an annoyed tone. "I have all the equipment I need but...Kenneth, did you see the purifiers anywhere?"

"The what?"

"Purifiers, remember we got them on Illium? Mixes into water and air and removes all pollutants and disease carrying microbes?"

Kenneth trailed off, wracking his brain to remember where he left them. As he got up from next to Jack's sleeping spot, he spotted a little hiding spot, one that would have been blocked from view if he looked in from around the corner. Digging his way through the small pile of junk, Kenneth spotted a large bag filled with blue powder.

"Got it!" Kenneth called out, stuffing the baggie into his stack of objects. "Jack was hiding it back here, and I'd rather not find out why."

"Fair enough," Gabriella said with a shrug. "Hurry up, we gotta get that powder into the filter before it cycles again."

"I'm coming, I'm coming!" The two engineers gathered all their things and made their way to the elevator, just as Jack was passing the other way at a brisk pace.

"Hey Jack, can you not hide-" Kenneth began, but was cut off when Jack flipped him the bird and kept walking. Rolling his eyes, he and Gabriella entered the elevator just as Jack turned the corner.

"AAAAGH!"

Jack picked up a crate with her biotic powers and smashed it into the wall to vent her frustrations. She was so close...SO CLOSE...to getting back at that goddamned cheerleader, and she went and put Mordin's pill in the wrong goddamned plate!

It was a small comfort that Garrus spotted the pill before he ate, since Jack didn't want to fatten up another crew member, but it still meant Miranda got a fresh plate and took it to her quarters to be safe, citing concerns about "someone's medication being in the food", meaning the oh so perfect cheerleader wouldn't risk eating in public for the next week, if she was lucky!

Jack continued to vent her frustrations by beating the crap out of more storage crates until she was burned out, her mind left to stew on all the things she'd do to that stupid Cerberus flunkie when she got the chance. Left utterly exhausted by her explosion of rage, Jack closed her eyes and fell asleep dreaming of vengeance...

***

As the day shift on the Normandy took over, Jack at last stirred from her sleep, her stomach growling at her for subsistence. Rubbing the sleep out of her eyes, Jack got unsteadily to her feet, rubbing a sore spot in her neck from falling asleep propped against a wall. Jack wondered if she could sneak those pills into Miranda's breakfast as she went for the elevator before she heard the unwelcome sound of Gabriella Daniels coming up behind her.

"Hey, Jack, you got a minute?"

Jack spun around to tell her to fuck off, but was stunned into silence at the sight of the engineer, who seemed to have grown a prominent belly since Jack flipped her friend the bird last night! Jack's eyes flickered from the gut hanging in front of her to Gabriella's plush hips and plump thighs, not unlike what Shepard grew when Jack tested her powder the previous night. Daniels didn't seem to notice and kept on going like nothing was wrong.

"Hey, Kenneth said you were hiding his things last night," she explained.

"Wh-what things?" Jack asked, shocked into politeness at the sight of the now portly engineer.

"We had a purifier compound we needed to introduce into the air and water filters, Kenneth said he found it in your stash," Daniels suggested accusingly.

"Ah...it was a blue powder in a bag wasn't it?" Jack said, though she was pretty sure she knew the answer.

"Yeah, it's the stuff we circulated into the air and water," Daniels said, lifting a bottle of water to her lips. As she took a long swill of water, Jack opened her mouth to speak but was again stunned to silence as the engineer began to grow in front of her eyes, her growing gut pushing her shirt up and her big butt straining the confines of her pants. Watching Gabriella's thighs puff up, Jack couldn't help but guess that the water had pushed her to fifty pounds above her old weight, maybe even more. "Ahh," Daniels sighed, smacking her lips in satisfaction before turning back to Jack expectantly, her face wider then before and joined by a new double chin.

"Er, yeah," Jack said, easily putting two and two together at this point and not willing to broadcast the little mix-up. "Sorry about that..."

Daniels looked at Jack suspiciously, not used to her caving so fast on an argument but deciding to go with the flow. "Just try not to do anything weird with the equipment, okay? I get that Kenneth can be an ass sometimes, but don't hurt the rest of the crew just to get to him, okay?" Seemingly satisfied, Daniels waddled back towards the engine compartment to leave Jack to stew in her thoughts.

So apparently the powder had gotten into the filter system, and the water was going to fatten everyone up. Even the food cooked with water from the Normandy's water supply would be effected like Shepard's coffee was.

"I'm in so much shit right now," Jack said forlornly, only for her stomach to growl angrily at her. It was then she realized that Shepard and Daniels didn't notice that they had fattened up from Mordin's powder and ran to a nearby coolant tank, polished so that she could see a reflection in it.

She didn't recognize the girl staring back at her for a moment. For starters, she had tits; not large ones mind you, but she was no longer flat-chested, and she definitely wasn't flat-stomached either. Looking down, Jack grabbed a handful of belly fat and shook it gently, letting her flab wobble like jell-o across her legs and lower body.

"Why the hell am I fat now!?" Jack snapped at her reflection. "I didn't even drink the powder! Did Mordin freakin' make it airborne!?" Storming towards the elevator, trying to ignore her heavier footfalls, Jack tried to plan out her next move, idly weighing her belly in her hands.
1243122.title: That's Not Filtered Water!

choices: "Cure is simple, will have anti-compound created in a moment."
"Complication; anti-compound more difficult to create. Might take time...""
"Reverse engineer a cure for what?" Shepard says as she arrives on the scene.
12431221.content:
"Alright Jack, focus here," Jack said aloud as the elevator descended, hyping herself out of a total and complete panic. "You're not losing your head, you're just...porky." Forlornly, she took her belly in both hands and wobbled it, feeling the shake echo through her and down to her thick thighs. "Really porky, maybe. But you can fix this.." The door slid open suddenly and Jack immediately dropped what she was doing, her belly falling back against her legs with a soft plop.

"Jack, you're up early!" Tali remarked as she entered the elevator, a brand new belly wobbling in front of her too. Jack bit her lip slightly, trying not to betray the Quarian's new size to her just yet. It looked like she had squeezed her thighs and belly into that suit of hers and it was just barely holding on. In any other situation Jack would have been laughing her ass off at the impossible sight of a fat Quarian.

"Ah, couldn't sleep," Jack responded, trying to sound casual

"Keelah, tell me about it," she said, moving next to Jack as the doors slid shut again. "Feels like the temperature on the ship is too high, but the regulators are all functioning. Maybe I'm getting a slight fever..."

"Maybe you should see the doctor," Jack said tersely, trying to tune out the sound of Tali's suit creaking from the strain of holding in a lot of Quarian blubber.

"Not a bad idea," Tali remarked. "Though Chakwas' last treatment just gave me a stomach ache. Maybe the Salarian knows something that can help..." Jack's eyes lit up at those words. Mordin, of course! Who else to go to for helping to get rid of the fattening issue but the guy who made them in the first place? Maybe if she was lucky he wouldn't even tell Shepard about the whole thing.

The elevator came to a stop and Jack and Tali departed together. It took every ounce of willpower to keep going like nothing was wrong, though; since last night, everyone had gotten fatter. All across the bridge, the Cerberus dogs who milled about sported big bellies at the very least, with some already forced to waddle at a glacial pace between their stations. Nearly everyone seemed to be eating or drinking something, meaning of course that a lot of people were growing fatter before Jack's eyes, with no one other then her seeming to notice. Jack tried not to stare, but let out a grunt of pain as a small plastic button hit her in the cheek.

"Urp...sorry Jack," Kelly Chambers said through a mouthful of what looked like a chili dog, holding up her pants with her free hand. Muttering something noncommittal and breezing by her, Jack noted Kelly was easily one of the biggest crew members on deck, her belly already blooming into rolls and a thick second chin appearing on her face, to say nothing of the ass big enough to pop off pants buttons. And considering a lot of people were currently closer to her size then Jack's, a paranoid thought crept through her mind that when the realization broke that everyone was turning into a lardass, everyone would also notice how comparatively tiny Jack was compared to everyone else. She wanted to fix this, but she didn't want to get caught either, meaning she'd have to do something drastic to blend in...

Stepping off to the side so she wouldn't be seen, Jack took a look around and spotted a bottle filled with a fizzy drink in a thermos of some sort left unattended on an open wall panel, no doubt a mechanic's abandoned pick me up. Regretting every life choice she made that led up to this moment, Jack took the thermos and guzzled it down. Feeling herself blow up like Daniels did was a surreal experience, from the new strain on her clothes to just the feeling of being far heavier then normal. From the heft of her boulder belly, she had to guess that she was probably around Kelly's size, maybe a little more. Setting the empty thermos back where she found it, Jack ponderously turned around and made her way towards Mordin's lab at a waddling pace, hoping that creaking sound wasn't the floor underneath her.

"This is so..urp...dumb," Jack said aloud, realizing that the fat accumulating around her face was starting to deepen the tone of her voice. Keeping her hands around her gut to stop it from wobbling so much, Jack finished the ponderous journey to the lab, where Mordin was working on some sort of gun. Surprisingly enough, he was still as thin as ever.

"No, thermal resonance compound too unstable, will never be effective in combat situation," he mumbled. "Perhaps coupled with an effective coolant delivery system will be more feasible as weaponized substance...hypothesis states this is unlikely."

"Mordin!" Jack shouted. The good doctor looked up, smiling despite Jack growing into a land whale since the last time they spoke.

"Subject Zero, expected visit!" he said at a breakneck pace. "Judging by rapid collection of adipose on crew, harmless attempt at tomfoolery has been extended to other members of crew. Vindictive comeback over poetry incident, perhaps."

"What, no!" Jack hissed, eyes darting from side to side to make sure no one was listening. "Someone else put that powder in the filter system, not me!"

"Ah, hypothesis was mistaken," Mordin said, sounding pleased. "Was forming negative impression of you based on incident. Good to know Subject Zero merely careless and not malevolent. Still, desirable outcome that high calorie compound ineffective on Salarian physiology. Otherwise too preoccupied with growing into morbid obesity to do research." Mordin inhaled, leaving Jack room to breath at last. "Terrible outcome."

"Right, but you can fix this, right? Reverse engineer a cure?"

"Yes, understandable not to turn others and self into immobile collections of fatty tissue before collector mission is finished," Mordin pondered. "Compound must be purged from filtration systems."
12431221.title: A Growing Problem

choices: Jack heads to the lab to check the progress of Mordin's cure.
Jack heads to the cafeteria. Three guesses why,
Jack doesn't get anywhere; the lift breaks!
124312212.content:
"What do you mean it might take time?" Jack demanded, her jowls shaking. "Look at how fat this stuff made the crew already! The Normandy's gonna fall out of the sky if this keeps going!"

"Highly unlikely, more probable outcome is increased weight ruptures hull."

"MORDIN!"

The Salarian smiled and walked over to his chemical workstation. "No need to panic, have already planned for this outcome. Have told Commander Shepard white lie about Juniperian Flu outbreak, convinced her to dock for a week at nearby colony. That way any risk caused by excessive body weight will be avoided. Timed it so that closest planet would have plenty of food available, as well as materials and fabrics for new wardrobes. Should alleviate supply concerns."

Jack crossed her arms, unused to the feeling of breasts pressing against them. "Alright, so you planned this out. How long do I need to sit around and get fat before you can reverse all of this? A day?"

...One Week Later...

"Uuuugh..."

Jack stirred from her sleep as her stomach demanded sustenance with some rather intense hunger pangs. A jumbo-sized box of candy slipped from her fingers, joining the dozens already littering the floor as she began to move herself off of the bed. She was surprised that her rest was satisfactory considering that she had to sleep sitting up...mostly because her old bed was entirely too small for her and just about the right size for her new posterior.

Grunting, the Cerebus hating biotic shoved hard, propelling herself off the bench and nearly losing her balance as her grand, many rolled gut flopped heavily onto her lower legs. Swearing under her breath, she ponderously made her way to the corridor outside, crushing candy boxes and takeout containers under her ham-sized feet as her hips bumped into the walls and sent her whole body into a jiggling frenzy, powerful enough to force up a pocket of gas.

"BUUUURP."

"Woo, nice one Jack," Tali complimented as she lumbered into the hallway a few doors down. Or rather, tried to lumber, but immediately got stuck at the hips. Backing out, she turned her bulk sideways and lifted up her belly, managing to squeeze it through before dropping it down again and going to join her massively obese compatriot.

"And I didn't drop my shake!" the Quarian said, revealing a large drink container almost as big as one of Jack's thighs. As she sucked down on the fattening shake through a straw, Jack couldn't help but feel bad for her. As the crew rocketed into higher ranges of obesity and clothing became an issue, it was often simpler just to go without it to some degree, like how Jack was wearing just an extremely taxed pair of shorts and a wrap top to cover her decency. Tali on the other hand couldn't take that shortcut and had to keep ordering bigger suits over the last few days; making it look like the old Tali had massively inflated her classic outfit. That being said, it looked pretty good for a suit that needed to fit a half-ton Quarian, just as intricately designed with space to store belly, butt, and thighs galore. Even the helmet looked to be twice as wide, making Jack genuinely curious how her face had filled out under there. Last time Jack looked in the mirror, her own face was dominated by garantuan chipmunk cheeks and sinking into the ring of fat that made up her neck and multiple chins. Maybe Tali had the same look to her?

Jack obviously had plenty of time to think about this stuff, since she was so slow nowadays. The two girls, collectively weighing a ton, took slow ponderous steps, their outfits creaking in agony and threatening to split at any moment, or at least Jack's was. Even the lift groaned under their weight as Tali struggled to press the floor button with her fat fingers. Jack hoped that the weight limit on this thing was high.
124312212.title: Thar She Blows

choices: Mordin! He has the cure! But does Jack even still want it?
Miranda! The fattest of the crew! At least Jack’s plan sort of worked…
Shepard! She knows Jack’s bed is too small, and invites her to stay in her room.
1243122122.content:
The ride up in the lift felt even slower than usual, though Jack couldn’t tell if it was actually going slower because of the combined weight of her and Tali, or if it only felt slower due to their massive bodies being crammed into a small space together. Either way, when the doors opened up to the crew deck she wasted no time and hustled out, which is to say she lumbered out of the elevator at a slightly faster pace than was typical for her now, which was still slower than what her normal waking speed used to be. Once she created some space between herself and the half ton of waddling Quarian blubber Jack was freed from the feeling of claustrophobia and refocused her mind to the task at hand. Which was…?

Jack wracked her brain trying to remember. Didn’t she want to talk to Mordin about something? She couldn’t imagine what that could be. Besides, if she wanted to talk to the Salarian why did she go to the crew deck instead of the lab where he could always be found? Maybe she wanted to pick a fight with Miranda, but that seemed like too much trouble for her now. It must have been food she had come for. Yes, that made sense, she was always so hungry, she must have wanted to come fill her empty belly. Why else would she have bothered getting up?

Swinging one meaty leg around the other Jack slowly shuffled her way into the mess hall, where the rest of the crew was already helping themselves to a healthy breakfast. The blubbery biotic couldn’t help but wonder to herself how they all remained so oblivious to their weights as she pilled a tray high with greasy strips of bacon, plump breakfast sausages and crispy hash browns. Surely they all had to know they were growing, at least on some level, otherwise why would they keep getting themselves bigger clothes? They also had to have noticed that everyone around them was getting bigger as well, didn’t they? Yet despite what had to be some subconscious acknowledgment of their growth, there was otherwise no real manifestation of that knowledge in their conscious behavior. It must have been some quality of the powder and pills that kept them all clueless, Jack reasoned, and the reason she herself was aware of her weight was because she knew about the powder and pills.

With one hand precariously balancing her heavy tray, Jack grabbed her lowest belly roll with her other hand and lifted it, pulling her gut up and onto one of the cafeteria tables so she’d have room to sit down. As she lowered her weight down onto her seat, the metal bench bent under her weight, almost far enough to touch the floor, however her mind was too focused on her meal to notice the affects her weight had on her environment. Now seated she rested the tray atop her gut, using the multi-rolled mass instead of the actually table, and began shoving potatoes into her greedy maw with her spoon. A soft moan escaped her with the crispy, ketchup soaked hash browns touched her tongue. If she had to eat a shit ton of food at every meal to keep her belly quiet, at least it tasted good. It must have just been her imagination, but she could have sworn the food in the mess actually tasted better since the powder and pills got into the air and water.

Jack soon got into the rhythm of eating, downing close to a pound of meat and potatoes a minute as she lost herself to her gluttony. The taste of the food passing over her tongue and sensation of it filling her belly up were her sole focus. Her single minded desire to eat was almost enough to keep her from noticing someone approaching out of the corner of her eye. Turning her head, she saw…
1243122122.title: Jack heads to the cafeteria. Three guesses why.

choices: Jack stays cool and lets Mordin use the cure. All good things, I suppose...
Jack loses her cool and tries to stop Mordin. She can't let this end!
Someone overhears the conversation and steps in. Oh crap.
12431221221.content:
The only thing more absurd at this point than no one seeing how big they were getting was no one noticing how small the Salarian scientist was compared to everyone else. Still his usual skinny self, Jack caught sight of him weaving his way delicately around bulging hips and bellies pouring into the walkway from other crew-members peaking at that half-ton mark like Jack was. Dodging past Kelly Chambers falling off a collapsed chair and literally rolling towards him like a flabby, belching boulder, Mordin finally reached Jack and prodded her in her neck flab to get her attention.

"Mrrph!" Jack grunted, flecks of hash brown spewing from her mouth as she flinched. "Whatchuwant?" Smiling, Mordin pulled out a test tube filled with a solid green, viscous liquid.

"Excellent news! Managed to isolate the lipid multiplication compound and neutralize its long term effects!" Mordin announced proudly. Jack's heart leapt in her flabby chest as she put two and two together.

"Is that.....hufff....burrrp....cure?" Jack grunted, returning to her meal quickly after such an agonizingly long wait to let her speak.

"Yes! Upon introduction to doctored water supply will seek out and neutralize multiplying compounds still present, spreading to afflicted hosts shortly thereafter and shutting down its effects." Mordin inhaled deeply. "Process will take less than a day, at current projections."

Jack almost wanted to sing she was so happy to hear that. She tried to tell Mordin to hurry and put it in the water right away, but her stomach roaring distracted her. She hurriedly moved to stuff herself with more potatoes and sausage, kneading the expanse of her stomach to sooth its urges. It was a last meal of sorts; after all, Jack wanted nothing more then to get rid of this fat, this ugly, misshapen, lumpy...bulging...wobbly...endearing...exciting....sexy...

Wait what? No, that's...no way, Jack thought to herself. She was a half-ton whale, this wasn't hot or exciting to her! Angrily, she stuffed more of her meal into her mouth, letting out a little moan of pleasure as her belly was sated. What...what did Mordin want with her? Could it maybe wait until after breakfast? Because...this was good. So good.

"...so good," Jack moaned out loud, dropping her fork entirely and eating with her bare hands. "I...I want more..."

"Hmm, was worried about this side effect," Mordin mused. "Must apply cure immediately."

As Jack licked her greasy fingers clean, she watched the Salarian pointedly turn on his heel and begin his escape to go and fix this. No...was this fixing it? Because this...this was really really good. And she wanted more...much more...

Jack's eyes widened with panic as she suddenly lumbered out of the chair, her belly flopping hard onto her crotch and knocking loose a bellowing belch that successfully drew the Salarian's attention.

"Yes Did Subject Zero need something?" Mordin asked as he turned around, distracted by the noise. If Jack wanted to stop him from leaving, this would be the only chance to lumber over and try something. Jack's mouth went dry and she sweat like a pig as she pondered her options, her belly slowly digesting the food and dropping pounds onto her ridiculously obese frame. She could almost feel herself swelling larger every second she stood there, and for the first time...it felt heavenly.

Did she really want this to end now?
12431221221.title: Eureka!

choices: Miranda has gone too long without punishment. Time to get her plan back on track
the powder and pills aren’t enough. She has more fattening demands for Mordin.
it’s not enough for just her and Miranda to grow. She’s going to make everyone.
124312212212.content:
“No,” Jack decided, “it can’t end yet.”

Everything happened so quickly after that. Mind racing as panic took over, Jack closed the distance between herself and Mordin with a speed one would think impossible for a woman so corpulent. Acting solely on instinct, any higher thought function abandoning her in the moment, she grabbed the Salarian’s scrawny arm and squeezed it with all the strength she had left in her long unused muscles, forcing him to drop the cure onto the floor. It landed with a clink, the glass unbroken and the stopped still keeping the contents inside the vial. There was a brief moment silence moment of silence as Mordin and Jack stared each other down.

“Vial still intact.” Mordin was calm and composed as ever, even while a half ton psychotic biotic was crushing his arm in her iron grip. “Not too late to—”

CRUNCH

With a decisive stomp Jack had crushed the vial with her boot, and ground it under her heel for good measure. Mordin exhaled sharply through his nose. “Unfortunate. Ingredients rare; expensive. Will take some time to synthesize more.”

Grabbing his other arm just as tight, Jack pulled Mordin into her flabby front so that she was right in his face and he could feel the heat of her anger radiating off of her. “You’re… not going to make more…” The sudden bursts of movement left Jack both sweat and out of breath, forcing her to pant heavily as she spoke. “The only thing you’re… going to make more of is the powder and pills…”

Under normal circumstances Mordin would not take kindly to being threatened, but this was a different. Jack wasn’t thinking, so she couldn’t realize it, but she was holding all the cards. Not only could use her biotics to tear him apart if he tried to retaliate, or dominant him with her sheer physical presence if her refused to make more of the pills and powder, but she could also drag him down with her if she revealed the situation to anyone else. There were too many variables if he was implicated in the fattening of the crew for him to risk it. So, with Jack both figuratively and literally twisting his arm, he had no choice but to give in to her demands.

“Very well. Will recreate substance meant for harmless prank. Will take an hour at most.”

With her demands seemingly being met, Jack cautiously let her prisoner go, but remained ready to grab him again if he tried to make a run for it. “Good. And don’t you even think about—”

Mordin held up his hand. “Please. Further intimidation not required.”

Without another word, Mordin turned and weaved his way through the crowded cafeteria to get back to his lab. As he left, it suddenly hit Jack that she had just very blatantly manhandled and threatened someone in said crowded cafeteria. Her panic returned and she looked around, fully expecting everyone to be staring at her… only to see that no one had so much as looked up from their meals. Much to Jack’s relief, they were so enthralled with filling their demanding guts that they were just as oblivious to the altercation as they were to their skyrocketing weights. With the crisis averted, the adrenaline faded, and Jack felt even heavy than she really was. She shuffled back to her pile of food, diving back into her meal to regain her strength. She would go to Mordin’s lab to collect after breakfast; right now, she needed to eat. After all that time she wasted waiting for the cure, curbing her appetite, she was now free, and she could finally fully enjoy it.

Breakfast went on for so long, it blended into lunch, and lunch went on so long it became dinner, which itself became three desserts. Jack spent so long eating that the day cycle was almost over by the time she finally made her way to Mordin’s lab, but that whole time she had been thinking. Thinking that…
124312212212.title: Jack Attack.

choices: Yes, had to keep up the facade and sabotage Miranda's food.
NO, she couldn't get any fatter!
124312213.content:
Jack was horrified to see Shepard waddling in the lab hell of a lot fatter since she last saw her. She had her hands underneath the front of her 3 rolled belly to walk easier and prevent it from wobbling to much; though she didn't even seem to be aware of any of this. Shepard's breasts somehow retained their perkiness despite blocking her view of anything beneath them, including her gigantic sized belly. Jack doubted Shepard's thighs would never be separate again, even if she were to split her feet apart, as they touched down to the knees, and looked like they were pushing against each other. Shepard ponderously put on foot in front of the other, fighting to push one thigh past her other fat-filled thigh, then stopped in front of the pair and looked expectantly at Jack

Jack's eyes widened in surprise and quickly replied, "Oh! Uhhh just feeling sick, right Mordin?" The scientist nodded quickly, just as surprised as Jack. She wondered how it was possible for Shepard to gain what looked like 400 pounds so quickly before realizing the powder she accidentally put in Shepard's drink. Jack became much more concerned about this powder. She wondered how fat everyone was going to get, how fat was she going to get?

"Are you okay Jack? I hope it's not that flu Mordin told me about?," Shepard spoke with concern. Mordin stepped in. "Jack is merely feeling queasy, recommend a lightweight diet, her stomach can only handle small meals."

"That's too bad Jack. Think you can still join me and Miranda in the cafeteria later?" Shepard asked as she sucked on a straw which was connected to a large chocolate smoothie that was tucked between her breasts. Shepard was standing right in front of Jack so she was privy to the sensation of her belly rapidly expanding, seemingly reaching out towards her before making contact with Jack's own chubby belly. Shepard's much larger stomach spreading across Jack's plump torso. Jack didn't want to give herself away so she allowed the stomach fat to cover her own. Shepard let go of the straw with a pop and let out a satisfied 'ahhh', "Tali's also going to be there," she added.
124312213.title: Shepard walks-err waddles in

choices: Not so fast, this isn't going to be so easy
12433.content:
Miranda Lawson. Cerberus bitch extraordinaire. So sure of herself, never admitting weakness or defeat. "Perfect."

Miranda Lawson. Overconfident. Self-absorbed. Not as clever as she thinks...

Jack pondered carefully the nature of her rival. Miranda was certainly clever, but she'd never had to worry about half the shit Jack had been through. Jack's experiences had hardened her and made her strong, but they'd also taught her a lot more about the nature of people than Miranda could ever have hoped to learn from her high-stakes power plays. Miranda had written her off as dumb muscle, only fit to throw onto the front lines. Powerful sure, but not a serious threat to someone of her "intelligence."

Jack smiled. "Let's see how much of a master manipulator you are when you haven't got every guy falling over himself to get a look at your ass. We'll see who's the whiny one when you start having to lift a finger to get people to do things for you."

It was perfect. Miranda's famous curves made curvier. That catsuit she wore might be sexy now, but it would serve to advertise every added pound.

As for her method of fattening the femme fatale, her approach would be elegant and discreet. She'd feed her a fuckton of food of course. All the while playing to her vanity and love for control. Yes this would require spending more time in her presence than would be ideal, and yes this would even require playing nice, but it would be worth it. Outsmarting Miranda this way would be more satisfying than even splattering her against a wall would be, if only by a little.

Jack made her way to the mess hall. The mess sergeant was nowhere to be seen, probably off fixing something or slacking off just as likely. She'd have to see if there was anything around she could prepare without much difficulty. She opened up the fridge to find a chocolate cheesecake with caramel drizzled over the top. Clearly Rupert was having fun with those new ingredients Shepard had picked up. She knew the cheerleader had only finished lunch an hour or so ago, so a full meal was probably out of the question, but it's amazing what can be construed as a "snack."

She poured out a cup of coffee that was mostly cream and sugar and placed it on a serving tray along with two generously sized slices of cheesecake each on their own plate. One was a bit bigger than the other, she was curious to see which one Miss Bubble Butt would pick. She poured herself a cup of black coffee, for appearances' sake.

The walk to Miranda's office was only a few steps. The bitch probably doesn't get much exercise going to the mess hall and back, and it shows. She was soft. And Jack was going to make her softer. 12512.content:
It had been one hell of a ride for the crew of the Normandy. Between all the abductions and Collector attacks and suicide missions, it was a welcome relief when the base was finally blown to bits and they could all put this chapter behind them. There was still work to do of course given the coming threat of the Reapers, but that didn't mean the crew didn't deserve a break from all the action and peril. Thus when Shepard put a skeleton crew on and sent everyone away for some R+R before the next assignment, it was a welcome relief. While she and Garrus stayed behind, no doubt to perform some "calibrations" on the nearly empty ship, the other crew members all went to see their families and friends to spend a nice week or so together before reuniting for the next mission.

The lone exception to this was of course Jack, whose idea of relaxation was to track down a tiny cell of Cerberus grunts and level the place. It was a lot of fun, but the ruckus attracted the attention of the local militia, and she was only saved from another long jail sentence, or perhaps worse, thanks to the intervention of an old ally.

"Thanks again for pulling my ass out of the fire back on Jiro, by the way," Jack said to her companion.

"No trouble at all," Liara replied with a knowing smile. "I was owed a couple of favors, saving one of Shepard's friends is well worth the cost."

"Can I get you two anything to drink?" the waitress asked the two ladies politely.

"Hmmm...I'll have the White Akantha tonight," Liara decided.

"Uh, same thing," Jack said quickly, not making heads or tales of the drinks menu. The waitress shot her a suspicious look before obediently trundling off. Jack couldn't blame her; she put on a nice shirt for this place but Jack still looked a little out of place in a fancy sunlit restaurant on the nicer side of Illium. A little too punk rock for all these stuffy blue aliens.

"I would think that after the Collector mission you'd be taking a break," the Asari information broker said coolly.

"Compared to those bugs, turning Cerberus goons into hamburger is a break," Jack laughed, drawing more annoyed gazes that prompted her to lower her voice somewhat. "Besides, now that the Pragia facility is a hole in the ground, I have nothing else to do, unless I want to spend the next few weeks trolling for a good lay."

"I see," Liara replied, her tone rather impenetrable. "I imagine after a while though even tearing through Cerberus facilities may get a little boring, however."

"Yeah, no shit," Jack grumbled. "But what the hell else is there?"

"Well if you are in need of something to do, I may have...an option," the Asari mused, a slight smile forming on her lips as the waitress arrived with the drinks.

"If it's helping you deal with some dirty laundry or whatever information brokers do, I'm not interested," Jack said coolly, giving her wine glass a suspicious look.

"Actually it's an experiment of sorts," Liara explained. "One of my colleagues is running a study on how to enhance the power level of biotics, independent of increased focus or implants to help augment powers and abilities."

"You have my attention," Jack said, sipping her drink with a rather puzzled expression.

"Well, to be blunt," Liara said, choosing her words carefully. "She wishes to study the effect of...excessive adipose tissue on biotic energy."

Jack was never one for an education, so it took a moment for those words to process. When they did, she nearly choked on her drink.

"Excessive adipose...you mean, like, fat tissue?"

"Yes," the Asari said bluntly.

"Fuck off."

"Actually it's not as ludicrous as it sounds," Liara said defensively. "Asari with health defects that cause them to be a little heavyset can sometimes push their biotics a bit further, my friend is only pushing it to its logical conclusion."

"So what, your friend wants to fatten me up and see if I throw shit harder?" Jack said. "Yeah, no thanks."

"If it doesn't amount to anything I'll help you get back to normal, I promise," Liara pleaded. "And if it does...well, just imagine the possibilities that it could have for you. Not even a human bred to perfection could hope to match your power, to say nothing of the Cerberus agents you're so fond of assaulting." The Asari may have sounded desperate and hopeless, but she was far from it. She really wanted Jack to be in on this project, and if there was anything that could convince Jack to come along, it was the idea of beating up on Cerberus and potentially being better then Miranda Lawson at something. And that one-two punch caused Jack's expression to soften considerably.

"...and if it doesn't work you'll help to fix it?" Jack asked cautiously.

---

"Jack Zero, so nice to meet you!" the overenthusiastic Quarian in the red, stripey suit said, violently shaking her hand.

"Nice to meet you too. And uh, it's just Jack."

"Right, Jack, sorry!" the Quarian said, rubbing her wrists awkwardly. "It's just...wow I've heard so much about you, I'm excited to meet you at last! Wow! I'm Mana'Vafin vas Needir, by the way!"

"Cool," Jack said noncommittally.

"Hehe, I've never been called cool before!" Mana squealed giddily. "So, you've been briefed on the experiment, I have your biometrics...right! I'll get the first meal!"

"And I thought Tali was a dweeb," Jack muttered to Liara as the little Quarian dashed off into the corner of her lab.

"She's just excitable, real sweet when you get to know her," Liara said encouragingly. "You're doing a really nice thing for her too, thank you."

"Well, so long as it makes me a better biotic then Miranda," Jack shrugged. "I think it will be worth the...what the actual shit?"

"I'm sorry?" Mana asked, struggling to lift up a salad bowl full of some sort of mashed potato dish. It looked tasty, but it was huge! A tubby varren could have curled up in the bowl if it wanted to!

"You're not making me eat all that, are you?" Jack said, biting her lip as she slowly lowered herself into a seat.

"Oh of course not!"

Jack breathed a sigh of relief.

"There's a drink to go with it!"

Jack shot a look at Liara that was a desperate cry for help as the Quarian dropped the bowl in front of her with a heavy thud as she produced a massive cup with a thick looking beverage. Subject Zero resolved to herself that she would never again be bored turning Cerberus troopers into hamburger ever again, if she survived this.
12512.title: The Power of Chub!

125121.content:
Maybe it was because she was so used to Mordin and Chakwas, but Jack was pleasantly surprised by the time spent with Mana'Vafin actually being sort of fun, when she wasn't gorging herself on protein-heavy foods of course. Obviously Jack had an issue with being a lab rat given her past, but the time spent with Mana felt less like a crazy mad scientist performing an experiment and more like moving in with a new roommate that occasionally took measurements. Sure she put restrictions on how much physical activity she could do and regulated her diet, but otherwise the pair of them just did whatever they wanted in Mana's Illium-based laboratory/apartment.

And Mana had come prepared to entertain a guest long term. She absolutely stocked up on every movie and tv-show that Jack could watch, from the new Blasto flicks to the classic human films from the twentieth century. Jack barely even heard of any of these movies, let alone saw them, and she had to admit they were a blast, and when the movies got stale Mana broke out an extensive collection of games, from the video to the board variety, none of which Jack had even heard of, growing up the way she did. All of which, she later found out, was an attempt by the Quarian experimenter to make her feel comfortable being tested on, since she knew about her particular history involving being a test subject. Swelling with affection at the idea that someone, practically a stranger, cared enough about her feelings to make her comfortable, it didn't take long before Mana had gone from a strange, odd Quarian with a strange and odd idea to someone that Jack could consider a friend, maybe even a best friend.

The downside, admittedly, was the experiment itself. Not the testing, which Mana was making as comfortable and unobtrusive as possible, but rather the relentless stuffing. Mana had been especially eager to get to proving her theories about biotic power, and was relentless in keeping Jack full, gifting her with snacks and thick beverages when she wasn't stuffing herself full of specially made bulking foods. It wasn't enough to make Jack feel resentful towards her new friend, but it was irksome at times.

"Morning Jack!" Mana chirped from outside the door to her room as Jack's alarm clock went off, rousing her from sleep. "It's a testing day, how are you feeling?"

"Like I'm retaining butter," Jack grumbled sleepily, tossing the sheets off of her bed and forcing the shy Quarian to turn away with a small 'eep!', since she slept naked. Getting hurriedly dressed, she winced at the feeling of tightness in the sleeves of her shirt, and the feeling of a small breeze on the bottom of her belly no matter how far she pulled it down. Mana's meals had done their job quite well, and because of them Jack had put on a good fifty pounds of blubber, caked all around her body and protruding from her middle reaching the point where she could begin to feel the weight taking its toll. Everything was a tighter fit on her, she had started feeling heavier and bulkier walking from place to place, and perhaps more alarmingly, she wasn't as averse to Mana's stuffing sessions as she used to be. In fact, sometimes she started to like them.

Jack put those thoughts out of her mind as she walked, or at least tried not to waddle, behind Mana as she led her into the laboratory segment of her house. Going through all the motions, lifting this object with her head, touching this sensor with a charge, yadda yadda, Jack got bored enough to begin thinking of blasting apart some Cerberus agents. Slightly smiling, her focus slipped and Mana shrieked as a heavy weight suddenly flew across the room, crashing into the wall.

"Crap, sorry!" Jack shouted. "Are you-"

"YES!" Mana shouted. "I KNEW IT, I KNEW THIS THEORY HELD WATER!" The Quarian practically bounced as she showed Jack a graph on her omni-tool.

"Pretty picture," Jack commented sarcastically.

"Look, you fluctuated the dampener ME field on your implant chip by 0.2% with that burst of biotic energy that threw the weight! And that increase is in line with the eezo average that you're emitting across all levels!"

"Uh..."

Jack flinched as Mana grabbed onto Jack's fleshier arms and looked her dead in the eyes.

"You surpassed the limits of your implant!" Mana practically screamed. "You're getting more powerful thanks to your excess weight! It's exactly as I said it was, adipose tissue enhances the output of biotics! I finally have the proof I need!"

Jack was stunned to silence. Looking at her hands in amazement, she let loose a little biotic energy to make her hands glow with power. Maybe it was just because Mana put the idea in her head...but she actually did feel more powerful. Almost like when Shepard finally upgraded her implant to the higher level, back before they beat the Collectors. She couldn't believe it, fat actually DID make her more powerful!

And she liked feeling powerful. She liked it a lot.

"Now it's time for phase two!" Mana announced, rummaging through her equipment. "We keep going and see if there is an upper limit to how much power can be gained by, well, gaining. I'd love to know that idea out as well, but I can understand if you want to back out now, since you probably-"

"Back out? Fuck that!" Jack said, making Mana even more excitable about her experiments. "Let's see how badass I can get with this crazy idea!"
125121.title: Powering Up...

"You've probably just been eating too much." The doctor suggested.

"That's just it. I haven't been eating much for the past two days since I've been focusing on finding my quarry. And yet, I'm still gaining weight." Samara explained.

"Hm. That is odd." The doctor replied, rubbing her chin. "Why don't you come over here and step on this scale?"

Samara nodded and walked over to the scale. She removed her boots and stepped on. After a few seconds, the readout showed "152 Ibs."

"I was 140 three days ago." Samara said while putting her boots back on. "And as I've said, I've haven't been eating as much, so why am I gaining weight?"

"Let me take a blood sample and run some tests. That might yield some answers." Dr. Chakwas replied.

Samara agreed and, grabbing a needle, Dr. Chakwas took the blood sample from Samara's arm.

"I'll run those tests. It shouldn't take more then a few hours, a day at most. I'll contact you when I have results."

Samara nodded and walked out of the medical bay. She placed a hand on her stomach and sighed. She then went to...

125312112.content:
Samara gracefully strode onto the command deck of the Normandy, trying to over-correct her posture so her gut wouldn't stick out too far, not helped by her midriff-revealing outfit sadly enough. Fortunately no one else on the bridge seemed very much interested in Samara and her rather delicate position, outside of Kelly Chambers giving her a curious glance before quickly turning back to her console as Miranda Lawson approached her with data-pad in hand, no doubt going over some Cerberus intel. The Asari Justicar gave the operative a polite nod as she walked by, and couldn't help but notice that Lawson seemed a bit on edge. Almost....strained. Samara started glancing downward towards her supposedly perfect figure before an offhand sigh demanded her attention.

Yuki Shepard leaned on the railing overlooking the galaxy map, manipulating the projection with one hand in between twirling a strand of her black hair around her finger, a large indicator of her incredible boredom at her current task. Samara was endlessly puzzled by a paragon such as her not dedicating herself fully to even the most menial tasks, but then again a lot of things about the Commander endlessly puzzled her. She was an able commander and a decorated hero, but loved to sketch and tinker with electronics, she worked with human supremacists and criminals yet treated everyone regardless of race with the utmost respect, and she was one of the best fighters she had ever known yet preferred to resolve battles with words rather then violence. Above all, Samara decided, she was an enigma, but even so the Justicar felt she knew her well enough, perhaps even enough to call her a friend, that even after the Justicar gently turned down the Commander's advances...there was still just a hint of yearning.

At the moment though, that feeling just made her hyper-aware of the extra twelve pounds she carried on her, Samara realized as she tried to suck her gut in.

"Something the matter, Sam?"

Samara looked up at Yuki, mildly perturbed that she was still using that pet name for her.

"I didn't mean to intrude on you, Shepard..."

"By all means, I'm begging someone to intrude on me," Shepard groaned. "Prospecting for palladium is such a drag."

"We do need it for the ship's armor," Samara pointed out.

"Ugh, why do you always have to be right," Shepard complained jokingly, stretching out her back. "Seriously though, you do look like something's troubling you. What's up?"

Samara paused, unable to shake the feeling that the commander was trying to flirt with her again. Well if she was, Samara reasoned, it didn't mean she wasn't being sincere. She knew her well enough to tell otherwise, if anything.

"Merely some health concerns," Samara said delicately.

"Oh, you're not still aching from that sniper shot you took on the last mission are you?" Shepard said. "Mordin said the Blue Suns may have been using some experimental ammo. Even Grunt was feeling weird after tanking one of those shots."

"No, nothing like that," Samara said reassuringly. "It's...well, I seem to have put on some weight."

Samara tried not to wince as Shepard's eyes shot towards her protruding potbelly. Something seemed to flicker behind her eyes before looking away with a polite smile.

"It's not really that noticeable," Shepard insisted. "Maybe the mess hall's been putting something weird in the food. It has been a little hearty the last few days."

"I hadn't noticed," Samara said coolly. "The doctor is running some tests to make sure nothing is wrong, naturally."

"That's just what I was going to suggest, actually," the Commander said. "I'm sure it's nothing to worry about. Everyone gets bloated once in a while, right Miranda?"

Samara looked over in time to see Miranda snap up from her conversation with Kelly Chambers, her face turning slightly pink as her hand drifted towards her belt.

"Er...y-yes of course..." she replied shakily. "Nothing at all to worry about!"

Her uncertainty about the situation somewhat soothed, Samara quietly excused herself to return to her chambers. Taking her usual position looking out to the stars, she put the stomach resting gently on her waist out of mind, beginning her meditations.

---

"Ugh...why must this be so difficult..."

Samara grunted as she tried to tug her uniform on over her prominent paunch, her controlled emotions slipping somewhat due to her frustration. Since her talk with Shepard, she'd been spending the last few days in meditation and fasting in the hopes that her bloating would go down, and now suddenly her clothes weren't fitting.

Fasting hadn't made her lose the weight; the weight was coming anyway. Clearly something was not normal.

With a feat of impressive strength, Samara finally managed to pull her outfit all the way on, snapping the straps closed. Her reflection in the window glass was....not that impressive. The pot-belly had swollen in size, slightly larger and becoming part of a ring of flab that wound its way around her hips; a love handle, the humans liked to call it. Revolting was the word she would prefer to use.

At the very least, the results of the blood work would be in today. Then she could find out whatever was afflicting her and that would be the end of this embarrassment.

---

"Congratulations, your blood work is perfectly fine," Chakwas announced proudly.

The Justicar fixed her with a steely look, somewhere between deep concern and irritation.

"And...the other tests?"

"As far as medicine is concerned, Samara, you're a perfectly healthy specimen," the doctor confirmed, handing her the results of the test as she went to clean up her equipment for the next patient. "Aside from...well..."

"Something must have been missed then," Samara declared sharply. "There's no other reason this can-"

"Outside of a poor diet?" Chakwas interjected.

Samara, glaring, decided to wordlessly remove herself from the situation. The human doctor was clearly not going to be any help in finding out what was wrong with her. Perhaps another expert was needed. The Salarian seemed knowledgeable about medical happenings and genetic defects.

Before she could implore Mordin for answers, in her haste to exit the doctor's office on the ship, Samara nearly walked right into...
