‘Let me run a diagnostic,’ the doctor said, taking a minor blood sample and examining it, ‘oh, this is interesting. Your nanites are...damaged.’

‘Damaged how?’ the not quite perfect woman asked, ‘can’t you fix them?’

‘Oh no, its stemming from your biotic implant. It appears to be altering the polarity of the nanites, any nanites exposed to your elemental zero field will be reprogrammed to not burn extra fat. Well have to test more but it might have come from those special rounds the Blue Suns were using last mission might have reacted badly with your implant.’

Miranda looked at her horribly unfit body, swallowing, ‘what are my options?’

‘Well the first option is a strenuous exercise program and a strict diet should see a weight loss of one pound per week,’ Chakwas said, ‘although it will be difficult, you are very out of shape.’

Memories of long days at a desk with a bag of candy in one drawer and chips in the other, with dessert breaks after every meal came to Miranda. The perfect woman had let herself go and knew that forcing herself back into shape would require a lot of sweat and effort. Sweat and effort she wasn’t sure she could make...although the thought of being so awfully unperfect was intolerable. Being let on fire wasn’t quite as bad.

‘And is there a second option?’ Miranda asked.

‘Invest in larger uniforms,’ Chakwas smiled, ‘because without a serious life change you’ll only keep getting bigger.’

Grabbing her hoody, the chubby operative stormed out, big hips sashaying.
1253121121.title: Miranda Lawson, looking deeply embarassed about...

choices: "Maybe we should check what's up with Jack first."
12531211212.content:
Miranda, much like the Asari Justicar, had the same reaction to Dr. Chakwas' prescription of diet and exercise to reign in their waistlines.

Namely that the advice was largely bunk.

Yes, Miranda had snacked a little recently, but snacked enough to gain so much weight in such a short time? That wasn't just unlikely, that was physically impossible. Even if her nanites were working improperly and not doing their job, that still wouldn't cause her to gain so much. Miranda would have to have been hooked up to a tank full of heavy protein nutritional paste to consume calories long enough to grow a gut this size, and while she may have been snacking extra lately, she certainly wasn't doing THAT.

So just as Samara rejected that advice in favor of a second opinion, Miranda took the same action, pausing in surprise when she once again encountered the Asari talking to Mordin in his lab.

"Lawson?" Samara asked, tightening her grip on the front of her outfit, lest more of herself spill out.

"Samara!" Lawson said in response, tugging her hoodie a little further down her rather wide hips.

"What are YOU doing here?" they both said at the same time.

"Hmm, most likely hypothesis...seeking answers for sudden collection of adipose tissue on figures, after finding answer from medical doctor on staff unhelpful," Mordin pondered in his usual rapid tone of voice. Both girls blushed furiously at being called out on their actions in such a blunt manner, though Samara, ever the stoic, decided to press onward.

"Well...do you have any suggestions, then?"

"Several...though many disproven upon new knowledge gained of similar infliction upon Miss Lawson. Flawless genetic code rules out gene deficiency, diseases known to cause symptoms of bloating non-transferable to humans, environmental hazards unlikely considering Lawson did not frequent locations on Illium you did."

Mordin sniffed before laying out his conclusion.

"Hypothesis uncertain, but affliction may possibly be linked to biotic field."

"The doctor did say my nanites were being affected by the element zero in my field," Miranda said.

"Yes, but I don't have nanites," Samara pointed out. "And if it was machine based, Shepard would have figured it out a week ago. You know how she is with her...tinkering."

"Point taken," Miranda grumbled. "But can you fix it, Mordin?"

"Hard to fix when you don't know what the problem is!" the scientist Salarian said brightly. "Will need more research, calling in a few experts on biotics. Might be wise to limit calorie consumption as well."

"That's what I have been doing the last few days," Samara said glumly.

"I have experimental nutrient paste on hand, quite filling, bland tasting, but zero calories and unhealthy substances. Tested for human and Asari consumption, should allow you to remain functional while consuming as few extra calories as permitted."

The girls groaned, not looking forward to the coming days. But at the very least, the bland paste was better then the exercise neither of them needed. Samara could meditate while Lawson buried herself in paperwork and soon this embarrassment would be behind them.

---

Knock knock

"Samara?"

"No, it's me Shepard."

"Go away!" Miranda Lawson snapped, sinking down in her chair further. "I need to talk to Samara!"

"But why can't I come in?" Shepard pleaded through the door to Miranda's office, which hadn't been opened in the last week or so. "If something is wrong I can help, honest!"

"I'm sure you can, but Samara...well, it's a delicate matter!" Miranda mumbled.

"Well...fine, but I'm checking back in an hour. Making sure you're not doing anything kinky." Miranda swore she heard a giggle as the Commander made her leave. What the Illusive Man saw in her, she would never know.

More importantly, another pair of footsteps approached. Miranda could tell they were the right person this time...more weight to them.

"M-Miranda?" Samara said through the door, quietly.

"Come in."

The door swung open and Samara sauntered in, trying to look dignified even as the towel wrapped around her middle swished against the door frame. Miranda, for her part, sat low in her chair, draped in what looked like one of her bed sheets. There was a moment of silence between the two until the door closed behind the Justicar.

"The paste isn't working, is it?" Samara said bluntly.

"....no...."

"Then I shall drop the pretense."

Or more specifically, dropped the towel around her waist. And it became clear immediately why she needed it; she had entirely outgrown her original outfit. The red top was long gone, with her dignity preserved by a bra straining to hold larger then expected cup sizes and a pair of stretchy leggings, already splitting down the sides. Her potbelly had blossomed into a full-blown gut, bloated and drooping over her widening waste, with love-handles surrounding her widening flanks. Her toned form had long ago vanished under layers and layers of fat; even her legs had started to swell with adipose, and her arms were starting to droop with blubber that swallowed up her musculature. Even her smooth, well-defined face had grown a pair of jowls and cheeks to round it out.

Miranda let out a deep sigh as she tugged off the sheet covering her form. The Cerberus operative had finally given up on her old outfit and just worked in her bra and panties, which even now strained to contain all of her new girth. Her bulging belly was racing towards her knees across her lap, and thickening thighs gave it a nice platform to lie across. Her athletic perfect form was a distant memory at this point, and as she scratched under her neck, her extra chin wobbled slightly from the movement.

"I uh...fell asleep in the chair. Woke up, and I was....stuck." Miranda revealed. Indeed, as Samara turned to look, Miranda's famous rump had gone from comfortably perching in the chair to dramatically overflowing it, her flab pushing against the arms and holding her tightly.

"I think we've both become obese at this point. At least two hundred, each," Miranda calculated. "This needs to end, now before we become unable to move. I should have went to Mordin immediately when my suit no longer fit."

"I think if it's getting this serious, Shepard needs to be informed," Samara reasoned.

"-gaah, how do you work this thing..."

The two obese ladies looked at Miranda's intercom system with mild surprise.

"Grunt? What are you doing on the comms system?"

"Calling you about a problem. Jack's not leaving her cave thing."

"She's not leaving her room?" Miranda asked, raising an eyebrow.

"Yeah, the Quarian's gettin' upset with her because she can't get to the wiring in there. Think you can do somethin about it before she starts a fight? Head's still hurting from that last battle."

Samara and Miranda exchanged a look. Could it be..?
12531211212.title: Biotic Babes Burst their Breeches

125312112123.content:
A bit of uncharacteristic indecision hit Lawson.

She hated the psychotic biotic Jack for a lot of things. Being a back talking shit head, having her head shaved, all of those awful punk rock tattoos, being technically right about Cerberus, being unconventionally attractive in a way that Lawson couldn't help but find appealing. The thought of seeing the spiteful subject zero with chubby legs, two chins and a big flabby ass was impossibly attractive to her...in a couple ways, one she didn't want to admit.

However, it was a long way down to the storage area where Jack lurked. Both because the once athletic Miranda, who'd had an olympian's body along with her super model curves, was pathetically out of shape and because the now bottom heavy brunette would have to be seen out and about. She'd been proud, perhaps overly so, of her perfect figure, still flawless in her upper thirties and had flaunted it in a skin tight, cleavage bearing cat suit for a reason. That everyone would see she'd become an obese chubbette with hips in the upper forties and chafing thighs and a second chin...it would be mortifying.

And she realized with a tingle, slightly arousing.

'I...let's check on Jack,' she told Samara, 'she'll probably need some help getting used to...being like this. Just let me get some clothes on first.'

Miranda tried to stand up, a basic movement any human over the age of 1 should be able to do, but her ass was still caught fully in her chair. The pear shaped cerberus operative struggled, rocking back and forth but going nowhere. She was wedged tight and her muscles were too weak to move herself up.

'A little help,' she asked Samara in a small voice.

The blubbery Justicar was less help than would be thought. Samara had once been one of the most muscular Asari ever seen, statuesque figure and chiseled face free of fat and full of muscle, but that was at an end. Weeks of attempting to meditate her increasing bulge away had only made the fat multiply and her muscle vanish, she was just as awkwardly heavy and out of shape as Miranda, even though she'd tended towards apple instead of pear shaped.She'd lifted nothing heavier than one of Mordin's rationbars...or tastier snacks that she'd rewarded herself with every night. And even those were far lighter than two hundred pounds of genetically perfect pudge wedged cork tight into space age polymer.

Fat bunched up on the Asari's arms and sweat broke out on Miranda's fore head as they tried to pull the brunette human out. They went nowhere of course, both were so out of shape that they'd forgotten the old axiom of lifting with their legs and not their backs. Samara had to stop pulling and put a hand to her pained back, which had begun screaming at her as her F cup azure giants flopped in their deeply too small bra.

'Let's use biotics,' Miranda panted, 'I'll pull myself up and you pull down the chair.'

Neither woman had exercised their biotic powers beyond drawing a snack across the room for that time either. Powers strong enough to crush a tank had atrophied at the same rate as their running speed, it took both of them pushing their biotic power to the max until Miranda popped like a cork out of the chair and slammed gut first into her desk. She whined in pain, her enormous ass hanging out with a red ring from the chair's arms around her milk pale, cellulite studded, stretchmark striated derriere.

Miranda had gone from super fit hour glass to a pear made out of marshmallow cream. Eighty pounds of adipose translated to a nine inch gain to her hip measurements, blowing up each firm sphere into a deflated basketball that wobbled and wiggled with every small movement. Clothing it proved difficult to say the least, especially as the spy’s closet was full of size four cat suits, skimpy cocktail dresses, workout gear and lingerie and she was about twelve sizes too big for any of it.

The spy was lucky that she had a large men’s work shirt that a one off fling had left behind and the elation of finding something that sort of fit masked the embarassment of her stomach bouncing up and down as she walked to the closet. She was double lucky due to her cup size not going up even a hair, although her rapid accumulation of back fat and chest fat had made the DD eezo tanks fade quite a bit compared to the rest of her, so while the buttons over her gut were gaping mightily, the ones over her breasts were actually slack.

Covering her ass was harder, she had to settle for a pair of spandex workout shorts stretched to complete transparency over her hippo hips and elephant ass. Meaty thighs mushroomed out of the sausage casing legs and the spy’s graceful calves were now clumsy cankles. Her stylish heeled boots wouldn’t fit up her legs, she had to settle for a pair of flip flops worn humiliatingly with socks.

‘Do you mind if I borrow this?’ Samara asked, holding up the hoody, ‘my uh...top isn’t up to it.’

Indeed, the Justicar’s blueberry Fs looked a deep breath away from popping out of her overloaded bra. And beneath them her beach ball gut sagged down to cover her sex, purple stretch marks covering her pale blue skin. She squeezed into the hoody, her unmatched belly and massive boobs stretching the black fabric out until the two terra firma twins emblazoned on it were just as wide as the two she hulks filling up Miranda’s office.

Walking out of the operative’s office took more gut than raiding the collectors’ base. All activity stopped as the two bloated beauties waddled out, thighs’ chafing and bellies bouncing. Eyes stuck to Miranda’s swaying ass, every dot of cellulite visible through her transparent shorts, and to Samara’s tits which threatened to hit her in the face as audible pops and rips sounded from her breaking bra.

The two waddled through the ship’s second deck, face’s reddening as everyone realized what these two paragons of feminine might had been reduced to. Snorts and giggles broke out as soon as they got into the elevator, of course they’d avoided the stairs.

The elevator ride was long and uncomfortable. Its mirror polished surface showed their blimped out forms from every angle, every flabby roll and bulbous angle, everything that used to be firm that sagged, everything that used to be flat that bulged. The way that Samara’s angular face had a meaty jowl to it. The way that Miranda’s shorts were beginning to rip apart. How the Asari’s hoody didn’t quite cover her apron belly.

When the door opened it was a mercy, even though the two had to traverse every fat girl’s worst enemy: stairs. They got to the bottom with only a minimum of sweating and just three or four seams popping. Samara’s bra was hanging by a thread and Miranda lost one of the lower buttons as her stomach violently bounced when she missed a step by the time they reached the bottom.

Tali and Grunt were waiting at the bottom, the Quarian waiting with arms full of tools until she saw the two blimps in front of her.

‘What the hell happened to you two?’ the still slim alien asked, eyes widening inside her suit.

‘I dunno, they look pretty good,’ Grunt grunted, the blue eyed Krogan looking the two obese women up and down, ‘all healthy and wide.’

‘Minor medical issue, there’s already a cure on the way,’ Miranda tried to reassure her, ‘it might have happened to Jack. So we’re here to…’

See how a hundred pounds looks on that bitchy biotic.

‘Check on her,’ she finished.

‘By all means check, the crazy’s put some sort of biotic seal on the door,’ the Quarian finished.

Together the two weakened biotics got the door open to find…
125312112123.title: "Maybe we should check what's up with J...

choices: Samara ponders on her beliefs as her body balloons.
Samara tries to make peace between Miranda and Jack.
Samara learns she isn't just growing fat?
1253121121232.content:
It was darkened in the room, as per usual, so the two had to delve deeper to get a look around, bumping their engorged bellies into the walls when they got too close. Miranda led the charge inside, eagerly looking for a hint of adipose or cellulite on her bitchy biotic rival, only to find...

"Oh. My. God."

Samara and Miranda turned sharply around, to the figure covered in shadows leaning against the wall. Stepping forward into the glow of the reactors, Lawson felt her heart flutter in anticipation, and with baited breath watched as Jack strode forward...

...looking completely normal. Granted it may have been hard to tell, since she was wearing a jacket from the infiltration mission Shepard sent her on for the last few weeks, but it was clear under the garment that she seemed to be as light as ever. Miranda experienced such a mood whiplash that it made her feel disoriented, while Samara merely looked confused.

"I thought you were in trouble?" she asked coolly. Jack didn't seem to care much about the Justicar however, refusing to take her eyes off of the Cerberus cheerleader. Slowly, gradually, a grin broke out on Jack's face, and she reached out and poked a finger into Miranda's protruding belly. Samara looked on with mild concern as she started shaking, her face contorting as though holding something back.

"You....you're really this fat?" Jack managed to squeak out. Miranda gave a very dire pause, reading the writing on the wall and resolving herself to what was about to come.

"...yes."

"...wow Miranda," Jack said, her voice cracking. "I didn't know y-you were...retaining butter-pffffttAHAHAHAHAAHAHAHAHA!"

Miranda turned fifty different shades of red in an instant as Jack burst into unashamed, uproarious laughter. Those on the upper decks probably could hear the wily test subject's howling, it was so loud. Samara winced as Jack doubled over, convulsed with a case of the giggles so hard that she wheezed every other second and banged her fists on the wall to calm herself down. The third-wheeling Justicar waited somewhat impatiently for the girl to calm down while Miranda looked particularly murderous at Jack's wild, rambunctious laughter.

"Ahahaha, hey Miranda I hear after Lazarus your buddies are gonna work on project Jonah, and you're gonna be the whale!"

"Jack..." Samara tried to intervene.

"No, wait I got more!" Jack insisted. "She used to be a whole Cerberus cheerleader squad but she ate the other members!"

"Jack..."

"So wait are you the perfect human specimen or perfect pig specimen, I can't remember!"

"Jack!"

"Way to push for human superiority tubby! No other species has a waistline that size!"

"JACK!"

Miranda intervened this time, losing her cool and shoving the skinny girl in the room against the wall. Jack collapsed onto the ground, still choking out laughter and not even angry at the attack.

"This is the....happiest day of my life," Jack gasped, stumbling back to her feet. "When I got back from that recon mission yesterday and heard the rumors...I just had to see it for myself!"

"So you called us down here feigning some emergency...just to see what I look like?" Miranda spat out, Jack's taunts of 'pig' 'whale' and 'tubby' still bouncing around in her head. She should have been angry and humiliated and she was certainly the latter, but...

"Yep! And I gotta say..." Jack said, jiggling a roll of Miranda's belly only for her. "Totally worth it!"

"Stop that!" Miranda snapped, slapping her handsy rival's hand away, but not before the feeling of being groped like that caused her to blush, just a little bit.

"It's rather irresponsible of you to rope me and Grunt into this little prank of yours," Samara said, a hint of a scold in her voice that even Jack seemed to quail beneath, if only slightly.

"Well, no one said anything about you!" Jack said defensively. "I only-"

There was a loud metallic clang, and all three girls turned to look at the entrance, where Tali had smacked a tool into the metal piping to get their attention. Behind her, Grunt loomed like a bodyguard, a cross expression across his craggy face.

"There, now not to be rude..." Tali said, clearly irritable. "But can you PLEASE continue this elsewhere? I need to fix the transition valves before the whole system cooks off and we all die in the cold vacuum of space."

---

"So would anyone care to explain why everyone thought a hyena got loose in the engine corridor?"

Yuki Shepard stood at the center of the briefing room, looking over the three troublemakers, two of which struggled to fit their hips in the chairs. Miranda looked equal parts mortified and murderous, Jack had her feet up on the table and looked rather proud of herself, and Samara just looked as stoic as ever as she methodically went over what happened. Since Miranda was involved and Jacob wasn't on hand to supervise the meeting as Cerberus wanted them to, Kelly Chambers stood in awkwardly, aiming sideways glances at Samara's exposed flanks.

"And this is all true?" Shepard asked of the other two.

"Yes," Miranda said quietly.

"Pretty much how it started, yup," Jack recounted. "So when you want a three man squad on missions, is Miranda going to count as two people now?"

"You little-" Miranda started, trying to extract herself from the chair.

"Knock it off Jack, and Miranda, calm down!" Shepard ordered. "Neither of you are helping this situation. Now, have you two seen Mordin or Chakwas about this swelling of yours?"

"Yes, they're uncertain as to the causes of this," Samara continued. "Though Chakwas pointed out that it seems to interfere with nanites via biotic fields, at least in Miranda's case."

"Sounds like a biotics related issue, then," Yuki considered. "Until we know what's going on, I don't want to take any risks. When did this start happening?"

"A few weeks ago, after you and I went on that Blue Suns hunt with Grunt," Miranda recalled.

"And Jacob and Thane are still on assignment?" Yuki asked Kelly.

"We were planning on heading past Corang to retrieve them," Kelly recounted.

"Send them a message and a shuttle, we're quarantining our biotics until we find out what's going on, so they're on leave," Yuki ordered.

"Should we send Grunt with them?"

Shepard pondered this. "He's been here the whole time and nothing's happened to him, most likely he's resistant to whatever is causing the bloating. Plus we need him on missions if we're down at least five people."

"Five?" Kelly asked.

"Yes, them, and these three," Shepard said, gesturing towards the girls. The odd one out of the triplet immediately sat up, putting her feet back on the ground.

"Maybe my hearing's going because I think I just heard that you were bottling me up here, Shepard," Jack said coldly.

"We are, we can't risk you leaving and infecting someone with whatever this is," Shepard explained.

"Bullshit, you can't keep me here, I'm not infected!" Jack got out of her chair.

"Then why are you wearing that jacket?"

Jack's angry expression was betrayed by the color draining from her face. Miranda immediately looked up from the love handle she was squeezing at her rival's sudden silence.

"I...I haven't gotten the chance to take it off," Jack insisted. "Why the fuck do you care anyway?"

"It's been a few days hasn't it?" Miranda interrupted, her pompous smile starting to emerge. "You should take that off, air out a bit..."

Jack flipped the bird in Miranda's direction and tried to make her escape, only to bump right into Grunt, seemingly achieving the impossible by coming in silently.

"Trying to make an idiot out of me?" Grunt growled. "With your false alarm?"

"Grunt...ehehe...what's a good joke between friends?" Jack gave a friendly fist-bump to the krogan's shoulder, which Grunt responded to by grabbing her and and, with one swift movement, ripping the jacket off.

"NO!" Jack cried out, spinning around in a panic...as a prominent pot-belly swung into place, hanging over her straining waistband. There was a stunned silence that hung in the air, not unlike Jack's newly revealed paunch.

"Well...look who's retaining butter," Miranda grinned, feeling redeemed at last.

"Y-you!" Jack stuttered out, impotent rage boiling behind her eyes. "It's only a little flab, that I got...over a day or two..."

"Quarantine, all of you," Shepard demanded. "We'll get this sorted out soon enough. Until then, no more pranks or trouble-making, understood?"

Jack glumly nodded her head, followed by Miranda doing the same, far more cheerily. As the discussion broke up and Samara reported to the medical bay with Jack and Miranda in tow, she prayed for a speedy end to this as well. The sooner this incident...and this weight...was behind her, the sooner she could return to her duties and go back to ignoring the feud between the humans.

And as days rolled into weeks, that speedy end was nowhere in sight, but in the interim...
1253121121232.title: Gotcha!

choices: Shepard arrives with the good news. They know what's causing the gain!
Kelly can't help herself: she pushed things further with Samara.
Hold it Halberd, what about our other two? How are Miranda and Jack coping?
12531211212321.content:
Shepard picked at her food in the mess hall, leaning her head on her clenched fist. Finishing the taking out her frustrations on the lumpy mashed potatoes, she pushed her tray away with a nauseated expression.

"You're not going to be able to fight the Collectors on an empty stomach."

"Yeah, you need your fruits and veggies."

Yuki looked up as Garrus and Kasumi sat down across from the commander with their own meals, both of them looking rather concerned. Or at least Garrus was, the thief was always a little hard to read at times.

"I'm surprised you two can eat knowing what's going on," Shepard grumbled.

"Well, with how much of the slack I'm picking up I sort of need the extra calories," Garrus joked, chuckling a bit. "Not that I mind of course, I uh, understand that it can't be helped, but-" There was an awkward pause before Garrus decided to turn focus to his food for a moment.

"I'm just glad it's not effecting me, I can't imagine I'd make a very good sumo wrestler," Kasumi teased. "It has something to do with biotics, right?"

"Pretty much the only think we know at this point," Shepard confirmed. "I have both doctors working overtime to figure this out and they still aren't sure what's going on. Mordin says this might be connected to some Asari cult but that's tenuous at best."

"You think it could be Cerberus connected?" Garrus suggested. "Outside of biotics that's the only real connection the victims have."

"Samara isn't affiliated with the group," Kasumi pointed out.

"Maybe she caught it from Miranda?" Garrus offered up.

"It's not a bad idea but I hit a dead end there," Shepard said, drumming her fingers on the table. "Jacob doesn't have any inkling of what this could be-"

"You've been talking to Jacob?" Kasumi interrupted excitedly.

"-and the Illusive Man claimed he doesn't know what this is either," Shepard continued on unabated.

"And you trust him on that?" Garrus said coolly.

"No but I know he wouldn't have a good reason to sabotage the mission he brought me back from the dead to finish," Shepard pointed out. "So we're stuck cooling our heels until Chakwas or Mordin can untangle this whole thing, and if they can't figure it out by now, then..."

"Hey, don't lose hope yet," the Turian said kindly. "If there's one thing C-Sec taught me, it's that you never know when and where a breakthrough might come."

"Shepard!"

The whole table jumped in their seats at the sudden intrusion. Kasumi looked up and visibly shrank under the steely Krogan gaze of Grunt. She didn't really like being around such a big and imposing figure, but it wasn't normally an issue since he usually stayed below deck, until now at least.

"Something bugging you big guy?" Shepard asked.

"Yeah," Grunt grunted, looking off to the side slightly. "I...I think I may know what is going on with the Justicar and the two angry humans."

-----

Samara would have been the first to admit that she was sometimes challenged on her beliefs. Oftentimes the wilder, younger Samara waited in the wings to tempt her, encourage her to stray from her code, indulge in vices, to turn away from the life she chose when times were most difficult. Her faith and determination to bring her daughter to justice were enough to help her hold on, and even after hundred of years her resolve never wavered because of this.

Of all the things to test her resolve, however...why did it have to be this that was the hardest to deal with?

A knock on the door disturbed her meditation.

"Samara! I have your dinner for you."

Samara had given up on her attempts to fast, knowing that her food consumption wasn't to blame. She spent days without food and it hadn't slowed down her growth. If anything, it had gotten faster, and her size had started to become...an inconvenience.

"I'll be...huff...right there..."

She stared down at her enormous thighs and thick calves splayed out in front of her, swallowing up her bare knees. One of the many things hampering her meditations had been her legs had grown so thick and heavy that she couldn't even fold them anymore. Sighing, she rolled forward heavily, and arduously got to her feet, flinching as the rolls of fat surrounding her flopped down. Wiping her brow from the effort of standing up (ugh), she started waddling towards the door, trying to move slowly enough that her blubber didn't jostle too much.

Quarantine had been a blessing in disguise for Samara. It was hard to be taken out of the action, sure, but she wasn't prepared for how exhausting carrying all this weight was. It had been manageable even up to the point where Jack had been discovered, but with every passing day she could feel herself getting slower and slower, her strength buckling under the weight of her....well, weight. The Justicar tried to do some minor exercises to keep up her stamina and carry the excess fat, but by the time her weight had doubled she found even that was getting harder to do. She still tried, managing to get out a pushup or at least pace vigorously once in a while, dreading what would happen if she gave up, and what she would be reduced to.

And by the goddess there was the hunger. It was hard to gauge since she had been deliberately fasting, but Samara wasn't prepared for the gnawing hunger from her growing body. Resuming eating helped, but again as she got bigger, it got harder to resist the temptation for more. She couldn't stop herself from eating quickly or just a little messily, and when she ran out it was an immense struggle to try and ignore her desire for more. She made a vow, and her mission wasn't finished. Samara couldn't be reduced to a blue blob guzzling down the fattiest foods possible, even as she felt the pangs of temptation and vice nipping at her heals when she finished her modest meals or struggled to move quickly.

The tragedy of it all was even as she held on, she was still getting huge. Unable to fit into anything but a sports bra and panties donated by a "secret admirer" (ugh...another embarrassing temptation), Samara was indisputably obese, waddling around on tree trunk thighs hiding behind a drooping multi-rolled belly in her attempts to try and remain mobile. She could feel her elephantine rear swaying back and forth, a chair crusher that raised her a few inches higher off the ground when she sat. Samara could even feel that her fingers were starting to lose some dexterity because her hands were getting so thick and padded, leading up to biceps bigger then her own head for all the wrong reasons. And her breasts...well, just another thing to sabotage her attempts to hold true to her vows. She didn't really know what lettering they were anymore, just that they were even bigger then her biceps and, when they didn't sag over her belly fat, were bouncing around in her face, much to the delight of the crew. Again, thank goodness for the quarantine.

Alas, not all the attention could be avoided, and as the door slid open, putting her full weight on glorious display, Samara found herself face to face with Kelly Chambers, "helping" to deliver her meal. She may be thick but she wasn't dense; the Justicar knew exactly why Chambers volunteered for this task. Her excited breathing, darting eyes, and even the way she gripped the food tray told the whole picture.

"I got your food for ya, Samara!" Kelly said excitedly with a hint of obedience. "Just let me know when you're ready for dinner!"

"Yes...thanks..." Samara said, glumly staring at her meal. It seemed this was all she really had to look forward to now, really. All her vows, her mission to stop her daughter and save the galaxy from the Collectors...they were all falling apart around her, and it wasn't even her fault. Part of her still had hope this could be fixed, and that was the only thing that kept her going. But it didn't stop the gnawing hurt feeling inside of her over all of this.

Well...there was one way she could try to fight that feeling.

"...Kelly?"

"Y-yes Samara?" the yeoman said, trying to hide her happiness.

"Could...could you bring me a second meal please..." the Justicar asked weakly. "Maybe...just two from now on..." She turned away, pretending not to notice the shuddering gasp Kelly let out.

What a disaster.

125312112123211.content:
Fighting that gnawing feeling by gnawing on a second steak, Samara was so laser focused on devouring this slab of meat the humans were so fond of that she almost missed the knock on the door.

"O-one moment," Samara grunted, setting down the dish and getting unsteadily to her feet. Quickly wiping away the smattering of drool and steak drippings collected on her lips, she waddled over to the door and opened it. No doubt Kelly was still attempting to dote on her, getting another view of this loathsome belly.

"Kelly, I don't need-" the Justicar began, but was cut off at the sight of three people crowded into the hall, Shepard leading from the front. She looked particularly triumphant while Mordin looked rather pleased with himself, both contrasting Grunt taking up the rear who seemed to be averting his eyes.

"Sh-shepard?"

"Samara, excellent news!" Shepard announced as she barged into the room when Samara waddled aside. "We think we know why you're blowing up like Violet Beauregard!"

This was met with blank stares by the three aliens who never heard of Willy Wonka.

"Er, we know why you're getting bigger!" Shepard restated, not losing her stride.

Samara felt a surge of hope that warmed every inch of her at this news. "You do?!"

"Yeah," Grunt mumbled from the back. "You're getting flabby 'cause of me. I'm screwin' with your biotics or something."

This just left the blubbery Justicar confused again.

"You know how the Blue Suns had that ammunition that mucked around with biotics?" Shepard reminded her. "Well, Grunt got a couple hits of those things and it screwed around with his genetics a bit."

"But you're not a biotic, are you?" Samara asked Grunt, who roughly shook his head no.

"But I was made to fight alongside 'em," Grunt said. "Okeer programmed a lot of fail-safes into me that would keep me fighting the closer I got to death. One of which turned me into a big biotic battery that could power up biotics fighting alongside me."

"That's horrible..."

Grunt shrugged. "It's what I am. Came in handy against the Thresher Maw."

"With that knowledge and Grunt's recent health complaints, reasonable to assume that the collection of adipose is a result of damage from the biotic negating weaponry employed by the Blue Suns," Mordin rattled off, stroking his chin. "And because none of the afflicted crew members are themselves Krogran, safe to assume that this unfortunate building up of fatty tissue is unintended side effect."

Samara could hardly believe it. In all her centuries of life, it was the most absurd thing she had ever heard of. Fattened up by her biotics. She'd heard of plenty of strange interactions all matters of life had in relation to biotic and element zero, but she'd never experienced anything quite like this.

"So, I just need to get away from Grunt and I will recover?" Samara asked.

"No," Grunt said bluntly. "The effects of my biotic battery were made to stick around, in case I fell behind or had to split with a team. The effects will keep happening indefinitely."

"But that doesn't meant permanently!" Shepard reassured the Justicar when her eyes widened in shock. "Chakwas and Mordin are already working on a fix for this, and now that we know Grunt is the culprit we can quarantine him so the effects don't spread."

Grunt didn't look particularly happy about this, but he begrudgingly nodded along.

"Well hopefully it means we can reach the end of this debacle," Samara concluded, patting her taut stomach. "I was worried I would lose my ability to walk before you figured out what was wrong."

"No certain timeframe on cure," Mordin pointed out thoughtfully. "Entirely within the realm of possibility that affected subjects would be rendered immobile by the time of cure deployment."

Samara turned slightly paler at that explanation.

"Just in case though, we do want to set you, Miranda, and Jack somewhere comfortable until this gets fixed," Shepard said hurriedly.
125312112123211.title: Good News Everyone!

1253121121232113.content:
Lajhan was one of the first worlds the Hanar ever colonized, yet for most of its history it remained largely undeveloped. A rich cache of Enkindler holy relics necessitated the moon's colonization; however, its habitability for the aquatic race was sub-prime. Though the surface was ninety percent water like their home world, regions where the water was deep enough for proper comfortable habitation were sparse. Even with its religious significance, obstructing features like coral atolls, barrier reefs, mangrove forests, and archipelagos of volcanic islands with vast continental shelves, all teaming with exotic aquatic life, cramped the already small world and made it undesirable. The planet even had an almost entirely cyclical orbit, which combined with a balanced axial tilt evenly heated the globe, creating a constant tropical climate and no polar ice caps to melt to deepen the water. As time went on the cost of maintaining permanent settlements for research and worship grew, becoming a noticeable drain on resource. It was a real possibility the colony would have needed to be abandoned, left only to the truly devout and the Hanar too poor to relocate some place nicer, if the other species of the galaxy hadn’t begun to take note of it.

Asari, Salarians, and later Humans found the environment to surprisingly agreeable, with phrases like “tropical paradise”, “idyllic islands” and later “the bomb” being thrown around to describe it, much to the confusion of the Hanar. Even the Drell found the bleak world more agreeable to their physiology than lush Khaje. Seeing an opportunity to offload some strain the colony put on them, the Illuminated Primacy entered talks with each of the interested parties to negotiate partial terrestrial settlement. To one degree or another, they all agreed to pay a price to build ‘luxury resorts’ on sections of the barren lands and shallow, inhospitable waters, on the condition that they did not breach any holy sites in the oceanic trenches. In every case, all parties involved walked (or in the case of the Hanar, floated) away thinking they had scammed the other.

Now no longer the problem child of Hanar colonies, Lejhan has since became the most popular resort world with three of the four Council species. Even the lower-end resorts require reservations eight months in advance, and only the most affluent and influential of individuals being able to get into the most luxurious of them. Yet somehow Shepard, a woman the majority of the galaxy thought was dead, was able to get her three squad mates an entire island all to themselves. It was perfect for their just-in-case quarantine, with no other people their… condition… could spread to for miles in any direction, without depriving them of any modern comforts.

“I’m still not entirely clear on how you acquired the funds to provide us such lavish accommodations…” Samara questioned Yuki as the pair entered what was to be her room for the length of their stay. It wasn’t that she didn’t appreciate it, she only feared they money to pay for their stay in the lonely beachfront mansion was coming from a source that would conflict with the Code. If it did, well… Samara really hoped it didn’t, for Shepard’s sake.

Shepard grunted as she set down the Justicar’s bags at the foot of her bed; they were shockingly heavy considering her austere lifestyle. The bed was an extra wide one, roomy even compared the Spectre’s own back on the Normandy, likely big enough for two Krogan to share without needing to spoon. Even so, Samara would take up more than half of it by herself, and at her current rate of growth she may very well fill two thirds of it in a matter of months. “Let’s just say I’m really good at Quasar.” Yuki joked, and Samara shot her a dirty look. Probably because of the implication that she had a gambling addiction, or more likely used her tech skills to hack the game machines. Either way, she quickly let made the truth clear. “Cerberus always brags about their virtually unlimited resources, so I figured they wouldn’t mind me tapping into it to fund your recovery time.”

“I doubt Cerberus would be happy if they knew their resources were going towards this.” Samara sat her red-clad blue behind down on the bed wincing as she felt the metal frame bend under her weight. She had yet to meet a scale that could withstand her crushing weight, but if she had to venture a guess, she’d place herself unnervingly close to half ton. It was only though focusing her biotics that she could still get around under her own power in any sense. That’s why she required Yuki to carry her bags for her, not because she was lazy. Definitely not that.

Yuki flung open the blinds of the floor-to-ceiling window, and placed her hands on her trim hips as she drank in the beauty of the sparkling clear blue water washing over the pristine white sand. “An island paradise, no chance of this spreading, and I piss of some xenophobic terrorists? Sounds like a perfect plan to me.”

There was a loud crash from down the hall, followed by yelling, and Shepard sighed. Almost perfect.

“If you hip-check me one more time I’ll shove my boot so far up you monster ass you’ll taste leather!” Jack roared with fury, pudgy fists clenched as a blue aura of pure biotic rage swelled around her.

Miranda scoffed, her butterball cheeks dimpling as she smirked smugly. “As though you could even raise your tree-trunk legs high enough to kick my shin!”

While she was once far behind the other two biotic babes, she was quickly catching up, and she didn’t like that fact being pointed out. “You bloated, saggy slut! I’m gonna—!”

“ENOUGH!” Both Miranda and Jack froze in place just as they were in motion to slug it out. Slowly, they turned their cherubic heads to face the intimidating presence of their Commander standing at the end of the hall. “I am so sick of having to pry you two apart every two minutes! It’s obvious I can’t just leave you two here unsupervised!”

Despite the situation that brought them there, both of the agitated women were actually looking forward to the stay at luxury resort.

“No, wait! We can get along!” Jack insisted.

Yuki crossed her arms and shook her head like a disappointed parent, with Jack and Miranda feeling all the shame a misbehaving child would. “No, I’ve already made up my mind and got you a babysitter…”

Yuki was right. Samara needed to escape from this, untether herself from her worries and anxieties, if only for a moment. Yuki would fix this, after all. She trusted her enough to know that. So that's what Samara did; no more meditations on her devotions and duties, no more adhering to the code. She wasn't about to nose-dive into hedonism, like SOME were, but she allowed herself just a moment's respite from her old life.

And a moment's respite from centuries past...how could you ever put that into words?

She ate well, she slept in, she allowed idleness, she even played some games Tali had showed her with cards, a fascinating game of chance and trickery. Her favorite thing to do was to just go out onto the shore and take in the scenery. It was, after all, a beautiful planet.

Samara sighed as she stepped into the wet sand, her tubby toes sinking several inches in. Closing her eyes, she felt the tide flow against her fat calves draping over her ankles, the water tickling the bottom roll of her belly as it dipped into the sea. The feeling was unnerving the first time, but she quickly got used to it touching the ground. Perhaps when all this was behind her, and when her oaths were fulfilled, she would come back here again.

It'd be nice to walk along the shore without tiring so quickly, for starters.

Panting and sweating, the blob of a Justicar waddled back towards the beach, stepping from sand to wooden planks that creaked ominously underfoot. choices: “I love you.” Jane is not directly responsible for Samantha’s weight gain.
“I’ve been fattening you up…” Jane is directly responsible for Sam’s weight gain
1353311.content:
The two were dripping wet, both from the shower, as well as their sweat. Despite this, Samantha and Jane fell back onto what they both now considered to be their bed, soaking the blankets and sheets. “Bloody hell…that was…fantastic!” Samantha managed to say between labored breaths, her stomach rising and falling with each one. It was somewhat softer these days, even for non-combat personnel. Even when she sucked it in as much as she could, her tummy still poked out a tiny bit. Samantha would always put on a little relationship weight whenever she got together with a new girl, but never this much.

“Hell yeah it was, but I think it’s safe to say we cannot shower together without fucking.” Jane replied with an airy laugh. She had no problem breathing, even after a rigorous session of love making. Her abs were still rock hard, muscles still toned, and ass still tight, yet Jane hadn’t gone on a field mission in nearly month. It was even more surprising considering how much snacking they did during their movie dates…or was that just her?

Samantha briefly contemplated visiting the gym later that day like Jane would sometimes do, but was distracted by Shepard stretching, flexing her strong muscles. Holy shit she’s hot… Samantha thought, biting down on her bottom lip as she stared at Jane’s six pack. It wasn’t a new realization by any means, but the raw sex appeal the redhead possessed still caught her off guard on a regular basis. How did I ever get some as amazing as her?

Rolling over so that she was on her side and facing Sam, Jane smiles sweetly, and places a hand on her girlfriend’s belly. “So…” She begins a bit nervously, her smile fading. “We’ve been dating for a while now, but I’m not sure if…I mean think you’re really great and all, I just…shit I’m bad at this…”

Dread flooded Samantha’s body as she feared the worst. “A-are…are you breaking up with me?” She felt like her heart was about to break into a hundred pieces. With dating, Samantha knew you are either going to be together forever or break up. While she wasn’t ready for marriage or anything even half as big as that, not a single part of her wanted to ever break up with Jane. Is this because I put on weight?!

The way Jane’s eyes widened in surprise showed that she didn’t, either. “What? No! I would never—I’m not breaking up with you, Sam!” Jane stops to take a deep breath to calm herself. “I’m trying to tell you that I…”
1353311.title: Warm showers aren’t the only thing she’s ge...

choices: “Go see a bad movie?” Shepard and Samantha have a romantic date.
“Go get some lunch?” The couple get something to eat in the mess.
13533111.content:
It was obvious the admission did not come easy to Shepard, and the reason why was clear to Samantha. The poor Commander had her heart broken in more ways than one, beginning when she had to sacrifice her first love Kaidan Alenko on Virmire. In the aftermath of his death, Jane found comfort in the arms of the Prothean expert Liara T’soni. The two grew closer as time went on, with their friendship eventually blossoming into a relationship that ended when Shepard was killed by Collectors. While Shepard’s final thoughts were of Liara, the young Asari moved on, and when Shepard returned, the new information broker was cold and distant. During the suicide mission against the Collector’s she fell in love again, this time with Jacob Taylor, who started a relationship with another woman in the short few months they were apart after the mission’s success. Now, Shepard was offering up her battered heart once again, still believing that one day it will be treated the way it deserves, and Samantha would be damned if she would be the one to ruin that hope for her.

Placing a hand on Jane’s face the comms specialist cupped her lover’s freckled cheek and looked into her green eyes. It was an honor to be the object of the great Commander Shepard’s affection; an honor she was all too happy to accept, “It means so much to hear those words from you, Jane. I love you, too, and I promise to act like it.”

The way her words caused Jane’s expression light up made Samantha’s heart swell. The goofy, elated smile that spread across the redhead’s face was soon replaced by a bashful one, accompanied by a faint blush; it was so cute when she was embarrassed. “You’re too good for me, Sam. I would have been happy with a simple thank you, but you’re just too sweet for that, aren’t you? Well, I can be sweet, too.” Jane punctuated her statement by wrapping her muscular arms around her lover softened waist to bring her closer, then placed a tender kiss upon Traynor’s lips.

Samantha happily returned the kiss, nestling her plush body into that of her hard lover. The kiss lasted nearly two minutes before their lips parted; it was not from a lack of desire to continue that they pulled away, but from a need to fill their lungs with air. Still, they held their damp bodies close together, staring deep into each other’s eyes.

Jane intertwined her finger’s with Samantha’s own. “So, now that I’m done embarrassing myself over what normal people have no problem with, how about we…”
13533111.title: “I love you.” Jane is not directly responsi...

choices: Ashley’s butt while she towls off as she leaves Life Support.
The smell of food coming from the Mess.
1353312.content:
With an annoyed groan Samatha tossed herself into her bunk. She’d just gotten a message from her mother informing her that her old roommate from uni had gotten married, and it left her feeling rather envious. lt wasn’t that she particularly wanted to get married; she had other, much higher aspirations than just finding a wife. It was the fact that she was two years younger than her and had already found the person she wanted to spend the rest of her life with, whereas Sam hadn’t even had a date in months that was getting to her. It had been even longer since she had done… other things.

“Who’d want to date a porker like me, anyway?” She asked herself glumly, her hands placed on either side of her pudgy belly.

Samantha was probably the only person in the galaxy who put on weight because she wasn’t in a relationship. Without constantly feeling like she had to impress someone, she would unintentionally let her healthy eating habits slip. Over her last three months of living the single life, she’d put on at least twenty pounds, and that was when she used to walk to work every day. Now that she was on the Normandy, her daily commute was less than twenty paces, and she had put on another two pounds in the weeks she’d been part of its crew. I am going to absolutely blimp if I don’t stop eating so much junk. Who knew a military vessel had such a… hearty food supply. Samantha thought to herself.

It felt like was always smacking on something. In fact, it was in that moment that she realized she was once again eating something; this time it being on a bag of crisps. The realization came too late to stop herself, as she chewed the the last few crisps. Angry with herself, Samantha balled up the bag and tossed it into a waste receptacle before hoisting herself up out of her bunk. If she was going to be caught up in her own self-loathing, Samantha figured she may as well be doing it at the gym. The Normandy’s gym was really only a punching bag, treadmill, dumbbells, and a few other things Ashley had set up in Life Support.

However, before she had even made it the short distance to the room, the pudgy Comms. Specialist became diffracted by…

13533221.content:
(now then.)

Tali'Zorah vas Normandy sat aboard the Normandy, working at a station in Engineering. She was busy running an analysis of her Envirosuit with her omnitool, checking its integrity and the condition of the seals and filtration systems. For some reason the suit was beginning to feel uncomfortable. It was strangely snug around her hips and buttocks, and other areas were beginning to feel a bit tight as well, though to a lesser extent. She was certain there was some error in the suit itself, perhaps a false puncture warning causing it to clamp down in areas it believed were exposed to bacteria, or perhaps air filtration was locking up, creating a vacuum in certain parts of her suit. There was no way that it was something to do with her fitting in the suit. How would that even happen? She'd only been able to have snacks that she triple-filtered, and only Dextro-amino snacks. Turians didn't have much in the way of a racial sweet tooth, so it was rare to find Dextro chocolate. She couldn't have had so much it would affect her suit.


The reality was much more sensible, however. She was indeed growing out of her suit, though she didn't realize it. In fact, she was..

choices: Xen reprograms Geth to serve the growing Quarians.
Raan oversees the southern continent become the richest farmland.
135332221.content: With the Geth’s help, the Quarians were not just surviving, but for the first time in nearly three hundred years, were now thriving. It was only a manner of months before the Quarians were living out of their suits, and eating food that had not gone through vigorous sterilization. At first ships were being dismantled and repurposed to suit their need, but it wasn’t long before homes, farms, schools, and more were popping up all over the surface of Rannoch. No Quarian alive could remember a time when resources were so abundant. So much so, that they had no idea what to do with it all. Normally they would store away any surplus of supplies in case rations ever became scarce later in time, however, with the Geth aiding them, and an entire planet at their disposal, there was no need to; whatever they lost could easily be replaced now. Thus the “Quarian Age of Indulgence” had begun.
135332221.title: Vas Rannoch

choices: 2 months later: Changes from the view of a flabby female
1353322211.content:
((Note: Originally by fauxidentite, I just did some minor editing, and added no content.))

          Nearly 3 Earth months after the Geth began helping the Quarians re-habilitate Rannoch, the fruits of the two races' combined efforts began to show themselves. Quarians were finally able to leave their suits safely for extended periods of time. New agricultural settlements were established on Rannoch itself, with several crops already fit for harvesting. Many of the buildings and ships were re-purposed for living quarters, storage facilities, and other essential establishments. With the two races working in unison, tensions eased a fair bit. It became more apparent to each race that the Geth truly did not wish to continue conflicts with the Quarians, and (most of) the Quarians were willing to let the Geth operate without fear of sudden termination. Things were looking up for the two peoples.

         After 6 months, it was apparent that where there was once fruits of labor to show for progress, there was now entire orchards to display. While the number of resources and facilities for the Quarians had expanded almost exponentially, there was not enough of a population growth to consume it all. As a result, there was much in the way of excess food and materials for the Quarians. Relationships between the two "races" had improved to a point where one could easily call it "friendship". Small settlements were now almost-self-sufficient large colonies. Most Quarians were able to live outside of their suits safely, with only the weakest, most frail, or the very young needing to stay in their suits. Many Quarians became tailors, to craft new, more breathable clothing (some in the latest Galactic styles, albeit in Quarian sizes) for those who never wanted to stay in those suits again. Which was a relief for some, as some of the new Quarian "re-settlers" were finding their environmental suits a fair bit too snug. With the excess of food and resources now available to the race who lived on strict portion controls for the past several centuries, some of the Quarians were starting to put on a little weight. Some had their suits simply re-fitted for them, as they felt more comfortable in them after wearing them for so long, whereas others had the tailors make larger clothing for them.

         Admiral Daro'Xen vas Moreh was aware of the changes around her, and as the leader of one of the larger settlements on Rannoch, needed to act on these changes. Xen was always a supporter of taking back Rannoch, as she firmly believed in keeping the Geth safe so as to return them to their proper place: serving their Quarian masters, mostly so she could experiment on the Geth and learn more about their AI hive mind. As both races were working more cooperatively, there would be no way to establish a Master/Servant society without causing another conflict. Xen figured that if the geth had a reason to believe that the Quarians depended on them, that the Geth would do everything in their power to help out. She needed to make the quarian race appear helpless.

         It was apparent that as long as there was a massive growth in food production (as Admiral Shala'Raan vas Tonbay was in charge of what was currently the most productive and promising farmland, taking up a fair portion of the southern Continent), there was going to be excess, and as long as there was a robotic work force that was able to handle most of the labor, there was going to be a fair portion of the population that lived without a great deal of physical activity. This would undoubtedly result in a lazier and more gluttonous society. Or, to put it even more simply: the people were going to get fatter. Eventually, they were going to need assistance getting from place to place as their body fat would encumber them too much. Xen knew that if she could convince the Geth that these tubs of blubber needed help from the one race that could give them support, the Geth would be inclined to help, possibly allowing her to modify certain units. If she told the geth that she would allow the production of more geth units to help her people, they might "appreciate" that (as much as an AI could, at least). She had already started blueprints on geth-tech-based mobile platforms for the hopelessly immobile, as well as mobility-assisting powersuits that clung to its flabby host... the possibilities were endless..

         (Choice 1 will take place 2 months after this, with half the population in varying states of obesity, the rest being somewhat overweight or otherwise as slim as they always were. Will focus on Daro'Xen as she continues her plan, with possible side effects to herself)

         (Choice 2 will take place 2 months after this, with half the population in varying states of obesity, the rest being somewhat overweight or otherwise as slim as they always were. Will focus on a random Quarian female, who's enjoying a more abundant society, but (maybe?) not enjoying such an abundant waist-line)
1353322211.title: Xen reprograms Geth to serve the growing Quarians.

choices: One Month Later: A Plumping Populace
13533222111.content:
2 Months Later...

         "As you can no doubt see, our people have been experiencing certain changes in response to the new standards of living," explained Admiral Daro'Xen, who strode alongside an "administrative" geth unit. The two were making their way across a catwalk that led to Xen's office. "Affirmative, the changes are quite evident. They are showing lowered stress levels, positive internal chemical reactions to simulated out-of-suit environments," answered the Admin geth. The physical unit was a geth "grunt soldier" who was repainted green and repurposed to be connected to the "administrative functions" of the geth collective. Such units were painted green as an indicator of what function they had access to. It made dealing with which geth to correspond to when you wanted a specific job done or question answered much easier, especially when trying to rebuild a society.

         "Yes, but I was referring to a much more obvious, outward change," replied Xen, who gestured at the Quarians below the catwalk. It was readily apparent that the Quarians below had changed quite a bit. There were a great variety of shapes and sizes on the once-nomadic populace, with only one aspect in common amongst all of them: they were overweight. A group of women were casually strolling and chatting about what they had read on their extranet feeds, with their chunky buttocks bouncing along with their steps. One slightly chubby male, donning a green business suit, was checking the settings on his omni-tool, occasionally scratching his slightly-rounded midriff. One female was absolutely enormous, a gelatinous pear-shaped woman clad in a straining pink bodysuit that had obviously been remade and refitted several times prior, whose hips were almost as wide as two pre-settlement quarians.

         "I'm referring to the fact that our people are gaining weight at a rapid pace," stated Xen. The Admin Geth gazed at the populace below for a moment. "They are retaining more sustenance than they use, correct. But wouldn't this be remedied by fitness routines or 'dieting'?" queried Admin.

         "They would rebound back to their higher weights after they had spent so much extra energy losing weight. It was a very common problem for Humans before the discovered the Relays, and there's no 'one easy trick' to fix that." she replied.

         "What about the implants that humans have used to remedy that issue?"

         "Those are designed to work with amino-acid based species, and quarians are dextro-based, so it would be ineffective at best, and deadly at worst."

         "What do the Turians use, then? They are also Dextro-based."

         "They don't. Their metabolism is comparitively higher than ours, so that problem is very rare. Quarians have been consuming smaller rations overall, so our metabolic systems are not used to such an upsurge in consumption."

         "What if we were to produce an implant that would comply with Dextro-based life forms based on the blueprints for the original Human device?"

         "Because some of the Quarians are undergoing enough chemical changes as is just rehabilitating ourselves out of our suits, and we shouldn't be introducing more changes at such an... unstable time." Xen was fully prepared for many such volleys of questions and inquiries on the subject at hand. She was intent on her goals, and was determined to have the two races proceed with one solution in mind.

         "What then should we do? An excess of adipose tissue will eventually cause severe health problems," explained the Admin. "It even appears to have slightly affected you," he continued, gesturing to Xen's slightly thicker form.

         "W-well, I do have one idea," Xen hastily replied, taken aback at the Admin's observation. She was sure it wasn't that much, but.. "We should wait until we start development on the implant, at least until the entire population has a relatively uniform amount of stability in their chemical makeup. But in the meantime, some of our more... encumbered members of society do need some physical help moving around."

         She gestured at the portly pink-clad pear below. "That would be Rilo'Nos vas Lizorn, who oversees the schools in this settlement. She plays an enormous administrative role in ensuring that our children have an education, and is an extremely vital asset to our functioning society. However, she is quite obese, and it's very likely she'll get fatter." It seemed extremely likely, as Rilo was sucking down several nutrient paste sacks in rapid fire succession, one after the other. "She's already having difficulty walking." This was also true, as Rilo was waddling at a slower pace than almost everyone around her. "She's going to need help getting to work if she gets any bigger, because society needs her."

         "Then you need the geth to build mobile support platforms for those in the populace who are too large to walk on their own?" asked the Admin. "Yes," replied Xen, grinning on the inside, surprised that the Geth was catching on so quickly. "We should produce a modified version of the bodysuit that has a reinforced 'skeleton' with braces to attach to the limbs and assist the wearer's mobility." Xen's love of technological tinkering was showing, as she was getting more and more excited. "Or just chairs that the far larger users could sit in, probably could also attach to their bodysuits to deal with the excretionary issues, most likely these chairs will need limbs to actually move as having them hover constantly would require too much fuel. We would probably need to utilize geth framework as a base for the different models of walkers, as security bots are far too frail--"

         "--One Moment, How large of a load are you expecting these geth units to carry?" asked the Admin.

         Xen looked down at Rilo again, who had now stopped waddling to take another breather. One bingo-winged arm was propped up against a wall while the other lay slack at her side, her pudgy fist still clenching a nutrient-paste tube. Rilo wasn't just obese, she was obviously out-of-shape as well, with her daily commute not even coming close to being enough exercise to burn those calories (as it was her ONLY sources of exercise, being a desk-bound Administrator). The commute was slowly becoming more strenuous for her as she slowly grew bigger almost every day. It was obvious that the pink glutton was only going to get fatter, and was going to need some help (and some new clothes) in the future.

         Xen glanced back at the Admin Geth and answered very matter-of-factly: "We need carriers to carry as large a load as necessary. As large and as heavy as we might be."

(Option one details the start of production of the mobile carriers (which may include mobile chairs, literal platforms, etc.) and the modified bodysuits, with Xen Overseeing production and getting access to the Geth Framework to actually help make the platforms. Takes place one month later)

(Option two has the events of option one occurring in the background, and the focus is on one of the many female Quarians that have chubbed up. Also takes place one month later.)
13533222111.title: 2 months later: Daro'Xen plan continues..

135332221112.content:
Ari'Kaddi vas Iktomi frowned at the order list displayed on her omni-tool. There were 50 more orders for the omni-suits today than there were yesterday, and the entire facility was already being pushed to its limits to fill what orders they already had. "Unbelievable!" Adri exclaimed, "We can't keep this up or else we're going to be back-logged again!"

         Ari was the Overseer for the Settlement's tailoring facility, and thanks to Daro'Xen's machinations and overabundance of natural resources, was always swamped with work. With the entire populace growing fatter an exponential rate, orders for new clothes would come flooding in. Normally, this would not be too much of a problem, as the very steady income allowed the tailoring facility to also expand to meet demand, but at this point, the Quarians were outgrowing their clothes at a much faster rate! This of course exasperated Ari to no end. "Why can't we get those dietary implants developed yet? I need to see Admiral Xen, this is too much!"
         Ari herself was not terribly overweight, as her job required her to constantly traverse her facility at all times to make sure the orders were being met. Clad in a pale green bodysuit, she had a moderate fluffy coating on her once-spindly body, just a noticeable layer of fat but nothing drastic. Her workers on the other hand were a fair bit chubbier, as they were usually stationary at their workstations, fusing the mechanical portions of the suits at their work tables.

         Ari grumbled and sent the updated order list to her workers via her omni-tool. She then sent another notification via the workplace comms channel stating that she was going to be out for a bit, but that they should all work on their orders as normal. She strode off towards the facility's exit, glancing at the workers around her. She never really took much time to stop and observe everything around her without a sense of urgency, so she never noticed certain things, like plush bellies pressed up against the work tables, broadened hips squeezing out of the confines of the much-suffering chairs, arm-fat pooling on the tables or the trash bins that were often overflowing with empty paste packets and tubes of varying flavors and sizes. She just shook her head, disappointed that the ones who were under such a heavy workload couldn't see that they were exacerbating the problem.
Ari left the tailoring facility, managing a brisk stride as she made her way towards the Administrative building. The Settlement (now known as Lakti) was bustling with more busy Quarians (mostly those working as couriers for supplies distribution amongst the different buildings) of vastly varied shapes and sizes. Very few had remained as thin as they were when they arrived on Rannoch, but a few had gone unbelievably overboard when it came to satiating their hunger. These Quarians would have had a significant amount of difficulty with just walking, had it not been for the "assistive technology" (courtesy of Geth technology) that helped carry their tremendous bulk.

         Ari recognized one of the massive Quarians as Lesi'Nedal vas Iktor, an acquaintance of hers from the same ship. Lesi worked as a supply manager for incoming ships, a very important, yet still sedentary, job. She used to be known as one of the best Dancers on her ship while they were all part of the Migrant Fleet, but it was very obvious that she hadn't danced in a while, nor would she be able to. Propped up on a 3 ft wide seat was an enormously obese Quarian in a mustard-yellow body-suit, her ass and hip fat spreading over the seat, dangerously close to the edges. The back of her suit was visibly attached to the chair, which walked with 4 legs resembling smaller versions of a Geth Colossi's legs. With a massive belly that sagged a little bit past her knees while she was sitting, it was obvious as to why Lesi couldn't really walk anymore. Lesi craned her fat-swaddled neck towards Ari, and upon recognizing her, started waving her arm, swinging her head-sized bingo wing back and forth.

         Fiddling with her omni-tool, Lesi turned her chair towards Ari and the machine started walking towards the stressed Tailor. "Ari! It's good to see you! Are you busy?" Ari stopped for a moment, responding "Yes, actually. I need to speak with our wise Admiral" before resuming her brisk pace. Lesi pressed a few buttons on her omni-tool again and the chair started walking alongside Ari, matching her pace, as the increased speed caused the yellow blob to bounce and wobble in her seat. "You too? I need to see Xen about the increased amount of nutrient shipments we've been receiving, since we're currently doing well with our own food supply as is, and it just seems like a waste of money to have them come in the first place!" Ari looked around at the other Quarians, saddlebags jiggling, tummies bouncing as they waddled about (for the ones who could walk, that is), some guzzling nutrient paste, and one particularly enormous Female Quarian cursing loudly as one of the legs on her moblility chair had completely collapsed, causing the pink-clad mound of fat to fall over on the ground, immobilised by her blubber. "Maybe she's predicting demand, after all" Ari motioned towards the immobilised screaming pink whale on the ground "nobody's really getting any thinner."

(Option one has them both reaching the office of Daro'Xen,and when they see her, she is the same weight.)

(Option two has them both reaching the office of Daro'Xen,and when they see her, she has gained a bit of weight.)
135332221112.title: One Month Later: A Plumping Populace

1421.content:
In a poorly lit room Morinth regained consciousness after being out for several hours. Her mind was hazy, and she could not recall much; the last thing she could remember was seducing a rather enticing redhead woman, before being interrupted by—“Mother!” She grimaced; of course she would have had to come along just as she was about to consume her most appetizing prey in centuries. After attempting to get on to her feet, she found her arms chained to the walls, preventing her from getting up from her seated position on the floor, and she was too drained for her biotics to be of any help.

Unable to do anything else, Morinth tried to remember any other details that could provide clues as to how she survived her conflict with Samara, and where she was now. She had called out to Shepard for help before she blacked out, perhaps she intervened before Samara could deliver the finishing blow. The clicking of heels approaching where she was being held let her know that she may soon find out exactly what had happened, and she was right. The lights came on, and Samara strutted in.

“I knew you wanted me dead, but I never imagined you’d be cruel enough to torture me before killing me. Are Justiciars permitted to torture, or are you going to stray from your precious code just for me?” Morinth said with disgust, as though she hadn’t done the same to her own enemies.

Samara looked down and shook her head. She would not allow herself to be rattled by Morinth’s taunting. “I never wanted you dead, Morinth. I only wanted you to stop killing, and thought ending your life would be the only way to spare others, and would have had Shepard not stopped me. At first I was furious, but she convinced me of another way.”

Morinth scoffed. “No prison or monastery can hold me.”

“We have no intention of sending you to either.” Samara began to pace back and forth through the room, as though she still wasn’t sure if her and Shepard’s plan would work. “I am pledged to Shepard to complete a mission of great importance. One that may very well decide the fate of the entire galaxy, and we need as much help as we can possibly get, and you are without a doubt an extremely powerful biotic.”

A twisted smirk formed on Morinth’s face. “Oh, I get it. I help you with your big important mission, and so long as I behave myself, I get to live and go free? Justiciar’s promise?” Samara gave her a solemn nod as an answer. This was certainly one of the best deals that Morinth had made for freedom, but they certainly weren’t just going to let a murderous Ardat Yakshi go free… “So, what’s the catch?” Morinth asks, slanting her eyes.

This time it was Samara’s turn to smile; this was her favorite part of the plan. It was a small smirk that grew on Samara’s face, which made it all the more unnerving for Morinth. “Throughout your time with us you will fattened up. Most everyone in the ships crew will pitch in in some way or another to make sure you grow. By missions end, you will be so fat you will hardly recognize yourself, and do you know what happens to Asari who grow too obese…?” Samara leaned in to whisper it in Morinth’s ear. “They lose the ability to meld.”

Morinth’s jaw dropped as her mother took a step back, and she realized the implications. “And if I can’t meld…”

“You will no longer be a danger to any of your mates.” Samara finished for her. “You will grow weak and harmless, but you will have atoned for your past crimes and be free. Do we have a deal?”

However, it is usually several hundred more, and with Morinth’s unusual condition and exemplary powers, she will likely be able to maintain the ability for much, much longer… though, at the rate of which she is gaining, maybe not.” Even in the highly unlikely event that Morinth did lose her ability to meld at a much lower weight than she anticipated, Samara wouldn’t be satisfied until her psychopathic daughter was reduced to a quivering blob of fat that had significant trouble standing. And breathing. It was far better than she deserved.

So, I’mma go masturbate.” She said bluntly and without shame. The Commander often spoke her mind without censor, even when inappropriate, and usually delivered casually. Without another word, she turned on her heel and walked off toward her quarters. “Who knew fat bitches gave me such raging lady boners…” Samara could hear Jane comment to herself as she left, though she wished she hadn’t.

Everyone involved in the concoction of the plan thought that her increasing weight would repel potential victims, but it only seemed to make her more alluring. Perhaps it was simply a part of the nature of an Ardat-Yakshi. No matter what, maybe they somehow maintained their attractiveness in the eyes of others.
