As the so called suicide mission came closer it become more evident to all involved that it was exactly that. It felt as though with each passing day there was another report of a Human colony being attacked, further impressing upon everyone the importance that they not fail, but also sowed a dread that defeating the ever growing threat of the Collectors was impossible. Success would require the absolute best out of everyone involved. The stress was starting to get to the entire crew. Shepard’s behavior was becoming increasingly erratic and unpredictable, Miranda and Jack were always at each other’s throats, and Tali was one jump scare away from putting another hole in Legion. The only one unaffected by it all was Morinth. No matter what, the Ardat Yakshi continued stuffing her face. No matter what horrors she encountered on missions, no matter the atrocities the Collectors committed, no matter how inevitable their deaths seemed, she would always saunter back onto the ship, into the mess hall, and slide right back into the endless feast her life had become. And it infuriated Samara to no end.

This was the plan, and it was going smoothly. Even as she soared past a quarter ton of decadent, self-indulgent blubber, Morinth’s abilities in battle were not hampered, and had saved the day on more than one occasion. She was an asset to the mission, and a danger to no one, just like they wanted, but the Justicar was having serious doubts that it was worth having to suffer her daughter’s unending arrogance. She had be beaten, put into a corner, yet a smug grin never left Morinth’s face. Only custom ordered clothes had any hope of keeping her covered, and even then she was growing so fast she would outgrow any nee outfits in a week, leading to her spending most days half naked, tempting everyone with her acres of exposed, supple flesh. It was clear to all now that Morinth did not see this forced expansion of her figure as a punishment, but yet another outlet for her to indulge her hedonism.

After two hours of ceaseless gorging, Morinth had finally retreated into the private quarters. Not because she was full, no, she had more food in her quarters, and even carried an armful of greasy delights to keep her sated during the short walk there. No, she went to her quarters to continue eating while indulging in other pleasures of the flesh she was forbidden from doing in public. It seemed that while Morinth’s figure grew, so too did her hunger, not just for food, but for all carnal delights. She was becoming so insatiable that special accommodations needed to be give to sate Ardat Yakshi’s appetites for fear she might lose control of herself and pounce on some helpless member of the crew. She was given any manner of illegal substance she desired to abuse, and she went through sex bots as quick as she did clothes. All lf this bankrolled by the Commander’s mission funds. Samara couldn’t shake the feeling that it wasn’t her daughter that was trapped, but rather the entire crew that was being held hosting by Morinth’s capricious whims.

Meditation no longer did anything to quiet Samara’s rage. The Code taught her how to keep control over her emotions, but Morinth was becoming a living, jiggling monument to everything the Code was opposed to. Soulless self gratification, mind dulled by pleasure, a weak body bloated by indulgence, Morinth was a living embodiment of all these sins and more. If it had humiliated her, put her in her place and kept her harmless, she could have tolerated it, but the Justicar had finally convinced herself that she had made a grave mistake in sparing her daughter, and there was only one way to rectify it. She grabbed her pistol and marched to Morinth’s room, intent on doing what she should have done when they had her cornered on Omega. It would be much easier, now that the Ardat Yakshi was so bloated she couldn’t summon much energy without that special pill Mordin had created.

When Samara reached the door of Morinth’s private quarters she found it locked from the inside, but that no obstacle for someone with biotics as refined and well tuned as her own. With only minimal effort, the Justicar was able to move the mechanisms in the doors and forced all the pieces open, allowing her to enter and confront her daughter for a final time. What she saw inside took her entirely off guard, leaving her frozen in shock. She knew Morinth had fallen into a life of debauchery and excess, but she had never seen the full extent of it for herself.

Morinth was laid on her belly atop her bed, a sex bot crushed beneath her girth and her round face buried into a pile of food in front of her, eating like pig at a trough. And what a big she was. Six hundred pounds of excess flesh were piled up on her body. Her double belly had become a triple, and the lowest tier would hang to her knees if she were to stand. Her back was a series of thick folds that stacked up on the shelf of her backside, which itself had become like two two moons, cratered with dimples of cellulite. Two heavy chins hung underneath the one she was born with, and they jiggled along with comically round cheeks when she pulled her face out of the pile of food to look up in surprise at her mother. She saw the gun and panicked. Desperately she tried to prop herself up, to scramble onto her hands and knees, but rings of fat around her thighs, thick as tiers, and the pillows of fat that hung from her upper coupled with the sheer size of her overfed gut kept her immobilized in ber current position. When she failed to move in any meaningful way, she tried to call om her biotics, but the narcotics in her system prevented her from manifesting the power in a manner she could use to defend herself, only managing to create some blue sparks of of energy that sent ripples through her oceans of azure adipose. She was entirely defenseless.

Samara saw her daughter in this pitiful state, entirely naked, covered in stains, and the Justicar could only feel one thing…

145131.content:
(And I goofed up and left Choice 3 open, doh. Well here's a proper story for you anyway, enjoy!)

All things considered, rebuilding Omega had been the easy part. Sure Shepard wouldn't let her keep Petrovsky's skull for display purposes, but after the initial fighting, it was remarkably easy to keep things under her thumb when human extremists and giant robot squids were flying around the galaxy. If she closed her eyes, she could almost pretend it was like the old times again, where her word was law and every able body on the asteroid bowed down to lick her boots.

Then the war ended, and the troubles began. She reorganized what was left of the Blue Suns, Blood Pack, and Eclipse into her own defense force to keep the rabble in line, but even united they were shadows of their former selves. Her criminal network was running strong, helped along by the frantic chaos of the Reaper conflicts, but that drew the attention of new criminal elements, old soldiers coming back from the war with connections and the money to start their own competing enterprises, new mercenary bands fresh from cutting their teeth on the Reapers and eager to make some money, and even some human corporations tainted by being on the wrong side of the war and looking to the back alleys to remain afloat.

Omega may have been back in business again, but if she wanted it to remain that way, she needed to remind everyone what the first law of Omega was.

That being said, while things were dire, new times allowed for new opportunities. Aria had the good fortune to be on the winning side of the conflict, and thanks to the spin given by a few pliable journalists, she enjoyed a lot of good will where she didn't have it before. No longer regarded as merely a den of corruption and vice, which in fairness was an entirely accurate portrayal, Omega quickly became home to refugees and resistance fighters of all shades, willing to fill the ranks of her mercenary army to protect their new lives here on Omega, and she could finally establish honest financial ties with a few willing corporations, establishing a financial lifeline she could use to engage with businesses and even some governments who wouldn't have given her anything but a bombing run before now. All of which kept her afloat and a step ahead, but it was a step too close for her comfort. Aria needed an ace in the hole, a faction she could control safely but would be powerful enough to protect her interests.

She found her ace in the Sisters of Rasvun.

Emerging during the Reaper conflict thanks to slackening government oversight, the Sisters of Rasvun rejected the passivity and patience of traditional Asari culture and encouraged assertive action, living in the moment and enjoying life to its fullest. It became appealing in a time when life could be cut short at any moment, but after the war the Sisters of Rasvun found their ideologies banned and they were sent packing in search of a new home. In a sense, they were exactly what Aria needed. For starters, they were perfectly fine with less then illegal activity (laws were restrictive of living in the moment), they didn't really want any power of their own, just a place where they could bed down, and perhaps most importantly of all, they were regarded as very powerful biotics, attributing their powerful biotic energies to their embrace of passion and spontaneity giving them greater energy to use such abilities. Whatever the reason, they were exactly what Aria needed; a powerful army that she could lean on for support and would fight tooth and nail to keep the status quo.

And fight they did; after one scuffle with some renegade Talons ended in a crushing loss for the invading mercs, no one had tried to come knocking for the last few months. Lounging in her favorite spot overlooking the newly rebuilt Afterlife, it seemed like things were, at last, back to normal.

Well, mostly normal. Even if the Sisters of Rasvun weren't openly preachy, you could see the effects that their encouragement of hedonistic life-seizing was having on the populace of Omega.

Looking out on the dance floor, you couldn't see a lot of Asari that didn't have a belly on them. A few seemed reasonably ashamed at such hefty weights on their midsection, but most seemed pleased by their extra pounds, dancing frantically to show off how their guts jiggled and swayed to the music. Others had more then just a belly; the Asari working the bar was twice as wide as she had been before the Sisters showed up, visibly panting and sweating from lugging an extra hundred pounds of herself around to serve customers. Despite slowing down, her tip jar was already overflowing despite the day not being over yet.

That wasn't an anomaly either, the people of Omega, or at least the ones who came to Afterlife, were pretty receptive of the new belief spreading along with the added adipose. Interspecies eating contests became so popular that a gambling ring had sprung up around it, several of the non-Asari patrons were putting on weight thanks to the new beliefs, and many Krogans were pleased to find dance partners closer to their size, or partners in a more carnal sense. Aria even had some of the dancers on the center stage plump up to appeal to the new patrons, though reinforcing the stage after a huge dancer with too much sand her hourglass, so to say, tripped and nearly collapsed the whole center ring.

Despite these little headaches, business was still booming on Omega, and with the powerful biotics under her thumb, no one was coming along to shake things up. Say what you will about the Sisters of Rasvun and their beliefs; they knew not to fuck with Aria.

The doors to her private room opened behind her as she looked out onto the crowd below. Her guards escorted in a waddling Asari female in a long blue dress, a pendant hanging around her thick neck and nearly dipping into her meaty cleavage that would make any man or woman drool. In contrast to the straight and narrow guards flanking her, the Asari was quite round, three hundred or so pounds stuffed into a tight dress that threatened to emerge at any moment, with a great round face perched on top of a shelf of neck fat. Openly eating a large sandwich in front of her, the obese Asari stifled a burp as she lumbered to a stop.

"Sister Aanyo Arteri," Aria said absently as she pondered some future adjustments to the club. Even with her back turned she recognized the distinctive sound of the high-ranking Sister's favorite food. "What brings you here?"

Sister Arteri bowed politely, her dress audibly stretching as her blubber strained against the fabric, and said,

Choice 1: "It's the other Sisters...they're concerned that you're not truly supportive of our beliefs," she says warily, not fully trusting Aria herself. (Skinny Aria)

Choice 2: "I merely wanted to see your progress as one of one of our newer converts, ma'am," she says brightly. (Fat Aria)

Choice 3: "I wanted to personally thank you," she says reverently. "For all the persecution we endured, you've been an example to us all through your devotion." (Huge Aria)

1451311.content:
"It's the other Sisters...they're..."

"I take it by your hesitation, the other Sister's aren't happy with something," Aria deduced, turning on her heel to face Arteri, her thin, shapely form silhouetted against the neon lighting from the club floor outside. "You want a drink to go with that?"

"Hrm?" Arteri asked, licking the sauces from her fingers after finishing off her sandwich. "Oh...well, if you're offering..."

Aria snapped her fingers and within seconds another Asari, skinnier then Sister Arteri but quite heavy compared to her boss, waddled up with two drinks on a tray. Aria plucked the elaborate, expensive cocktail up for herself while Arteri took the carb-heavy ale for herself, sipping it with a content expression. Being the Asari that the ruler of Omega turned to for information on the Sisters certainly had its perks.

"So, the Sisters..." Aria continued, lowering herself onto the sofa and putting her feet up on the center table. Arteria's sip had turned into a gulp by the time Aria sat down, so the thinner Asari waited until the other lowered the glass with a light belch.

"Yes...well, there's some discontent among the leaders about our being here," Arteri tried to explain.

"What do you even call your leaders anyway?" a Batarian skulking off to the side interjected. "Big Sisters?"

"Kindly keep the comments to yourself, Cralo," Aria coolly replied, giving him a look that could burn through steel if it needed to. Cralo, not willing to be cowed, simply shrugged, stepping back into position in the wings without another sound. Aria inwardly groaned; the ex-Talon commando was a handy trophy to have around, but his tendency to snipe back at her was a constant frustration. It almost made her miss having the Patriarch around. "So, is there some moralizer or dissident your leaders are having trouble with? I'd hate for them to be unhappy."

Arteri swayed on her feet ponderously. "Well...the problem they have is with you."

Despite the pulsing club beat outside, you could hear a pin drop in the lofty room as Aria frowned in a puzzled sort of way.

"Care to elaborate?" Aria asked delicately.

"Well...some of the leaders are worried about your...erm..." Arteri stumbled across her words, intimidated by the icy glare leveled at her. "They're talking about...leaving before you can turn on us."

Aria sighed, rubbing the bridge of her nose in frustration. "This again?"

"Please, Miss T'Loak, you have to at least consider-"

"Look, I get that I'm a bitch sometimes, but that doesn't mean I'm going to just throw your asses out into the void of space when the going gets tough," Aria barrelled on. "I mean, yeah that's absolutely something I do to the occasional nuisance, but I'm not planning on turning you all over to the space police."

"That's what a lot of them say," Arteri muttered sadly.

"Excuse me?" Aria snapped, leaning up from the sofa.

"Nothing..."

"Good, then finish your drink and go. Tell your leaders that they're being too goddamned paranoid. But say it...diplomatically, okay?"

"Whatever you say," Arteri muttered, barely hiding her frustration as she waddled off, her shapely rear bouncing and pitching in time with the steps. As the door slid shut, Aria leaned her head back in frustration.

"How many times do I need to tell them this?" Aria groaned.

"Maybe you should pinky-swear that you won't throw them out this time," Cralo suggested, breaking his silence. Aria stared at the Batarian in confusion. "Human expression I picked up somewhere, means-"

"Unless defining backwater humanoid slang is going to solve the problem I really do NOT care," Aria snapped. "I...I don't understand these people. I've given them shelter, a place to practice their beliefs, way too much goddamned food. Why are they still too scared to stay around? Don't they know I need them as much as they need me?"

"Have you considered you may be thinking about this incorrectly?" Cralo asked.

"How could I? It's simple fact, my position is more stable with the Sisters around, the Sisters have a life and their freedom with me around. It's mutually beneficial."

"Sure, maybe from where you're sitting. But these people have spent the better part of the last decade getting jerked around by people who said they would shelter and protect them. When you're in that kind of situation, you learn not to take the powerful at their word," Cralo pointed out.

"I gave them a home!" Aria insisted.

"And you can take it away at any time," Cralo countered. "Sure you know you won't, but what makes you think they know you won't?" The powerful leader of Omega froze, then visibly deflated at this point, admitting defeat with a scoff and a glance in the other direction, tossing her empty cocktail glass aside. She would sooner die before saying it aloud, but her new pet made a rather excellent point.

"What you need to do is show that you actually care about their beliefs. Not just saying you care, but showing it. Which means...well..." Cralo puffed out his cheeks and placed a hand on his stomach, moving it farther and farther away.

Aria looked particularly murderous at the very idea. "You...you're suggesting I get FAT?"

"Just a suggestion," Cralo reminded her, holding his hands up defensively. "You'd make the Sisters happy and they'll stick around thinking you care about their beliefs enough to put on some weight. I can't imagine it would be difficult, since hedonism seems to come rather naturally to you."

"Why didn't I have you vaporized?" Aria said venomously.

"Is that you're way of admitting I'm right?" Cralo smirked, knowing full well that it absolutely was.

"Even assuming that I was going to do this," Aria continued, patting her flat stomach apprehensively as she wondered what it would be like carrying a bulge there. "How would I even go about it?"

"Well, the obvious answer is gorging yourself," the Batarian pointed out. "You definitely have the resources for it."

"If my position with them is precarious though, getting pounds the natural way might take too much time..." Aria realized. "I could just go to the Sisters directly and ask them to assist with this. I'm sure they wouldn't mind, and that way they'll know I care enough about them to help."

"Or you could use a chemical solution," Cralo suggested. "I happen to know a few appetite enhancers and metabolism suppressants that are on the market. And no, you don't want to know how I know that."

"I kind of do now," Aria admitted with a sly grin. "In any case, given the options...
1451311.title: A Question of Trust

choices: "Yes, that's exactly how it works, enjoy yourselves!"

"Actually, I have another option for you to consider..."
14513113.content:
"You need us to what?"

"I think I was pretty clear the first time," Aria said, pacing over to her sofa and setting herself down delicately. "You two need to start porking up. Two hundred each, at least."

The two dancers Aria pulled into her sanctum stared at her like a second head sprouted from her neck. The smaller, more timid one of the pair was too busy flushing a deep purple to speak, but her older companion wasn't so shy.

"You can't be serious! How are we supposed to dance if we're the size of a blimp?" she shouted, taking a step towards her and prompting the Krogans standing guard stepped forward as well, openly brandishing their weapons as a warning to stand back. Lips pursed, the older dancer tempered herself but kept going. "Zelyxea's such a lardass she broke the stage the other week and half of the girls are heading towards her size because of those 'Sisters'," she sneered, putting as much venom into that last word as she could.

"And more people are coming to watch them dance then you," Aria reminded them. "So if you're not going to bulk up, you're not going on that stage. There's the door, goodbye." The angrier dancer stood her ground, while her friend made eye movements towards said door but didn't move either. "Then we're in agreement. Put on some pounds, or you're done."

"I want four times my usual cut. Same for Cearisa here," the dancer demanded, jerking a thumb towards her more timid partner. Aria steepled her fingers in front of her mouth to hide her slight smile. She liked this one's spunk, maybe she'd put her in a more useful position later.

"One and a half," Aria replied.

"Three."

"Two, and you get one free meal every day." The food was practically pocket change, cheap negotiating trick but it works.

The two dancers looked at one another before the older one looked back. "Deal." The younger girl, Cearisa, looked relieved as a guard escorted the two away, presumably to the nearest eatery. Letting out a soft sigh, Aria let her head lean backwards, feeling the pulse of the dance beats through the window behind her. Time seemed to slip away somewhat before a guard made an announcement.

"Boss, the Batarian's back," a surly-looking Turian reported. "Brought someone with him, too."

Aria sat up eagerly as Cralo strode confidently into the room, a half-step ahead of...a Salarian female? Very interesting, Aria thought as she watched her look around curiously, lowering her hood as she stepped through the door.

"Interesting crowd," she smirked at Cralo when they exited the audio haze of the club. "So what's the gig, I'm fattening up some pervert's dancers for him?" Aria frowned, clearing her throat to get her attention. The Salarian turned sharply to face her, only for her expression to soften considerably as she let out a soft little 'oh!'.

"You're not fattening them up, they're good at making hogs out of themselves," Aria said, turning to the lone human among her security staff. "That's the term, right?"

"Uh..." he said, looking confused.

"Ugh, just get out. All of you. This is a private matter."

A few of the guards exchanged knowing smirks, but vacated the room without a word, leaving Aria alone with the frail looking Salarian and that skulking Batarian.

"She's the one you're fattening up," Cralo said, gesturing to his superior. "This is Orlani, by the way. Good kid, put my heart back together after it got blasted into bits by a lucky shot."

Aria raised an eyebrow. "And you're out here doing...well, this?"

"You try finding steady, honest work when your species thinks you belong in a box for your entire life," Orlani sneered. "Besides, most criminal lowlifes will pay out the nose for someone with my skills...no offense..."

"None taken," Aria and Cralo said together.

"...especially when it involves indulging in their 'kinks' as it were," Orlani said, unhooking the satchel from around her shoulder. "For your situation, though..." Aria looked on, expecting her to pull out a bottle of pills but instead began untangling a plasticine tube from a palm-sized device. "Hold your arm out."

"Excuse me?"

"Hold your arm out, unless you don't need me after all!" Orlani snapped. Aria, frowning, complied, letting the Salarian wrap the device around her wrist. "Anyway, it seems the excess weight is a means to an end, so I wanted to give you an easy way to get rid of it. This device administers a special drug that rapidly, and temporarily, multiplies adipose tissue, letting you live a couple hours a dose as a fat girl."

"Interest-urgh!" Aria winced as the rogue Salarian doctor stabbed part of the tubing into her wrist. "And it's safe to use?"

The Salarian offered a rare smile. "Perfectly."

---

Five minutes earlier

---

Orlani frowned, feeling very much out of place at the bar of this seedy club. Checking the time on her omnitool, something warm and blubbery bumped into her.

"Oh, sorry," the young Asari giggled, tugging her shirt over her obese belly and continuing to dance with her friends. Orlani sneered and returned to her drink.

"Need a...huff...refill?" the bartender asked, out of breath from the small walk up to Orlani.

"No, thank you," Orlani replied slowly, eying the bartender's flabby belly trying to swallow up her end of the bar. "Just let Cralo know I'm here." She winced as another obese patron, this one a pear-shaped human doing her damnedest to split her hot shorts wide open, danced right into her again.

"O-okay..." the bartender said, looking distressed at the idea of climbing up the stares to the VIP area over the dance floor. Orlani would roll her eyes if Salarians were capable of such a gesture; no wonder Cralo had contacted her for a job like this, she thought bitterly. It felt like all she catered to nowadays was niche fetishes, and she was even starting to miss good old fashioned backalley surgery. Sure the pay was good, but you try creating a product that caters to sexual desires when you have no capability for sexual attraction for days on end. It's all fun for them and nothing captivating or engaging for you.

Something bumped into the back of her arm again. "My sister, a word..."

"Would you watch where you're going?" she snapped, tired of getting bumped into all the time and expecting to see some airhead fatty but instead found herself speaking to an Asari not in flashy new fashions but in a long robe, ornately designed. A yellow smudge on her chin suggested she'd recently been eating, and the paunch visible against her chest indicated she ate well.

"You're here to help her put on weight?" the sister asked, taking her hand.

"Why are you...get off! That's confidential!" Orlani lied, snapping her hand away. "What do you care about it anyway?"

"I'm just here to tell you two things," she whispered. "Make her huge. Triple what she's paying you."

Triple? Triple the already hefty pricetag this Aria chick demanded of her? Sorely tempting, Orlani thought as she glanced towards the returning figure of the obese bartender.

"How much are we talking about, exactly?" she said turning back to the stranger, only to find her gone,

"Huh?" the bartender said sluggishly as she squeezed herself back behind the bar.

"Nothing," Orlani said quickly. "Where's Cralo?"

"He'll be down in a bit," the bartender said. "Sure you don't want anything else? Drink, dessert?"

Dessert, in a dance club? "No, I'm fine..." she said, thinking about that small little offer she just got. Triple her pay.

---

"Perfectly," Orlani said, looking at Aria fiddle with the device and fit it more snugly on her arm. By the way she was roughhousing the casing, she clearly wasn't used to fragile tech like this.

"So, how does this work?" she asked, getting a hold of the largest black knob on the device. "Is this like a variable setting of some sort?" In a split second, Orlani thought about how not being careful with that knob would break the machine, and no doubt give her mysterious benefactor exactly what they wanted, and said...
14513113.title: The Science of Super-Sizing

...or make you permanently and steadily gain weight...

145131131.content:
"Yes, that's exactly how it works, enjoy yourselves!"

Aria looked over at the Salarian, eyes narrowing. "What's that supposed to-"

*snap*

"-mean?" Aria finished as the tiny black dial crumpled and popped off the device, bouncing underneath her beloved sofa.

"Ah...that'd be the regulator..." Orlani recounted, taking a step back as her little invention began to hum and pulse, the miniaturized pumps beginning their work.

"Regulating? But what's it-" Aria's eyes widened, and she started to frantically tug at the tubing embedded in her wrist. She winced in pain as the micro-hooks kept the tubing attached long enough for the serum in the apparatus to start pumping into her. With a scream of pain, she ripped the tubes out full force, streaking her own blood across the carpet and crunched the device in her free hand with a show of biotic force.

"I thought the pump on that was a little strong," the Salarian said delicately, still slipping slowly away. "Looks like you got the full dosage. Hmmm." Realizing she was trying to escape, an enraged Aria leapt towards Orlani and lifted her up by the collar, unbridled fury contorting her face.

"Who the fuck do you think I am?!?" Aria shouted, shaking her violently. "Do you think you can kill the queen of Omega that fucking easy, bitch?"

"Bit slow to kick in," Orlani said idly, eerily calm despite being lifted into the air by a deranged biotic.

"What's slow to kick in...aaagh!" Aria dropped the Salarian, clutching at her stomach in pain. Her breathing shortened, and when she looked at Orlani picking herself up, there was a distinct note of fear on the queen of Omega's paling face. "What...what did you do?"

"More or less what you wanted," Orlani said. "No refunds! Cralo, might want to get out of here....may get messy."

"Don't you....aggh!" Aria was bent double as her stomach twisted itself into knots, breaking out in a cold sweat and feeling a tingling sensation spreading through her extremities. Cralo blinked his four eyes, then without a word followed Orlani out the door. "Bastard," Aria hissed, breaking out in a cold sweat as she started to feel...strange.

Orlani slipped out of Cralo's line of sight as they ran out of the loft, dodging through the crowd of patrons and dipping behind a chubby Asari getting grinded on. Out of the corner of her eye, she saw the same woman who approached her with the request, smiling as her companion, bedecked in similar looking robes, opened up her omnitool.

As she made her way out of the building to the relative safety of the walkways, the distinctive electric blip from her own system, signalling a deposit was made, was the sweetest sound in the world to her. And all she had to do was drug some alpha-bitch with an experimental chemical for some weird chubby chasing cultists. Easiest thirty thousand creds she'd ever made, and probably the only use she'd ever get out of that chemical that the Asari injected into herself. The stuff was niche and too specialized to use, boosting your weight significantly and temporarily in small doses, but the whole batch?

15312.content:
“You don’t have to eat it.”

“No, I want to! Seriously! It looks delicious!”

“It must, since you’ve just been looking at it for the last three minutes.”

It was date night for Sara Ryder and her girlfriend Vetra Nyx. The Turian had somehow managed to acquire all the ingredients necessary to prepare the Earth dish known as meatloaf, and prepared nice romantic dinner for them to share in the Pathfinder’s spacious (and more importantly private) quarters.

“Yup! I’m eating with my eyes before I eat with my mouth.” Maybe it was a trick of the lighting created by the candles in the middle of the small round table they were sat at, but Sara was pretty sure the meatloaf was orange, which, last she checked, was not the color it was supposed to be. With a shaky Sara gripped her fork and cautiously speared a chunk of the loaf. She raised the fork up to her mouth and put the meat on her tongue after a moment of hesitation. “Mmm… so yummy and… crunchy…” Awful as it tasted, the young brunette couldn’t bring herself to spit it out for fear of hurting her beloved spiky girlfriend’s feelings, and her body refused to swallow it, so it just stated on her tongue as she winced and chewed it into a gooey paste.

When their relationship began about three months ago, Sara was surprised how easily Vetra adapted to having a Human lover. The much taller woman seemed to just instinctually know how to make things work, while Sara expected they would both need to do a little research before they got into the swing of things. Unfortunately, there was one thing that didn’t come naturally to Vetra, nor did researching help her any, and that one thing was cooking food suitable for Human consumption. It wasn’t her fault, really. How could she make good food when she couldn’t taste test it without making herself sick?

Vetra found it hard to watch as her short Human lover struggled with the first bite of the meal she had made. Even if the faces Sara was making were cute, Vetra didn’t like that they were ones of disgust caused by her terrible cooking. “Ryder, spit that out before you choke on it.”

Vetra sounded more tired and disappointed than upset, so the Pathfinder listened, lifting a napkin up to her mouth and spitting out the rancid meat. Once it was out the taste still lingered, so she tried to wash it down with some of her wine, and when that didn’t work she scrubbed her tongue with another napkin. “Vetra, I love you, but that was terrible. You are just the worst at this.” Ryder said once she finally got the bitter taste out of her mouth.

“Yeah. I know you Humans have the saying practice makes perfect, but I think at this rate my practice is going to give you food poisoning.” It was meant as a joke, but the couple knew it was way too close to truth for their liking. “So much for romantic dinners…”

As bad as that meatloaf was, and it was bad, it didn’t make Sara feel nearly as sick as seeing Vetra looking so dejected did; like watching someone kick a puppy. “Don’t say that, babe. We can still have romantic meals.”

Vetra pulled her face out of her hands and looked up at Sarah with sad eyes. “We can? How?”

153122.content:
When it comes to traveling through space the weight of a vessel is the most limiting factor. So when the Andromeda Initiative was packing for the trip across dark space, things like silverware and tablecloths weren’t on the list of bare essentials they could bring along. As a result, the closest thing to a fancy restaurant the colonists from the Milky Way could establish were bars on the Nexus. That left Sara and Vetra with very few places to have a romantic night out, and they were forced to look for a less conventional venue. When the Tempest landed on Kadara and Ryder told Vetra to get dressed up, the smuggler was understandably skeptical.

The doors of the restaurant slid open, and Vetra’s fears were confirmed. “Ryder, I don’t think either of us should eat anything here…” Whatever the Angara used the building for before the Outcasts took over, it had since been converted a restaurant in the loosest sense of the word; one that didn’t look any cleaner than the rest of the port. Admittedly, the candles on each table were still a nice touch.

Despite how the place looked, Sara was still cautiously optimistic. “Hey, nothing ventured, nothing gained.” Ryder hooked her arm around that of her much taller girlfriend and walked inside.

“Do Humans have a saying for every bad idea they try to talk people into?”

“Pretty much.”

The couple were definitely the best dressed people in the seedy establishment, not that the other patrons had set a very high bar. Sara had hung up her well worn official Andromeda Initiative sweatpants and hoodie in favor of a stylish leather jacket and pants bearing the same blue and white color scheme, while Vetra wore a simple asymmetrical Turian dress that was just a tad darker than navy blue in color, with touches of purple flair here and there.

“This is the first time in my life I’ve ever felt overdressed.” If Turians could blush Vetra would certainly be doing it now. Instead she just felt an uncomfortable fluttering in her stomach. A distracting heat in her shoulders, chest and arms. Embarrassment was not an emotion she encountered often in her old life as a smuggler, and she would much rather be doing just about anything else if it meant she didn’t have to deal with these unfamiliar sensations. But Sara looked happy, and that was more important than her own comfort.

“Oh, shut up. You look awesome.”

The couple sat down together at a table for two by a window that had an unobstructed view of an untouched stretch of Kadara’s surface, the glistening pools of recently purified water reflect a rainbow of vivid colors from the setting sun’s light. Leave it to the Pathfinder to find just about the only romantic view in the whole Cluster. Now it was just a question of whether or not the food was edible.

“Wow, this beautiful.”

Vetra’s awe over the beautiful landscape was cut short, however, when a decidedly grumpy looking Salarian cleared his (or her, it was hard to tell until they said something) throat and placed a single hand made menu on the table. He obviously didn’t think he was going to cross the void between galaxies to become a waiter when he signed up for the Initiative. Before anyone said a word the Salarian left Sara and Vetra to look at the menu while he went to bus a different table.

The menu was a single page of laminated paper with minimal flare. On one side were the levo dishes, and on the other were the dextro ones. The selection wasn’t great, but of the few options presented they all at least sounded appetizing. In the end they both ordered comparable meals of a large cut of grilled seasoned meat and diced collard greens. The Salarian further proved his distaste for his current state of employment by taking his sweet time to serve them, but when the dishes were finally placed in front of them the couple weren’t immediately repulsed. There were no strange colors, it wasn’t over or under cooked, and most importantly it wasn’t still moving.

Ryder took the first bite, cutting off a small slice, cautiously placing it on her tongue. When Vetra saw her girlfriend’s eyes light up, followed by the small busty brunette tucking into her meal with great zeal, the Turian had to try it herself.
